story:
Inspiring the world through painting has been our mission since we began Apple Pie Painting, 3 short years ago. What began as a simple idea to bring mobile painting parties to people across Kansas City, has evolved into countless memories, laughter, and creativity, with over 15,000 happy customers. We now set forth on our greatest journey yet, and one that will expand our vision across the globe. With this launch of our new and exciting In-Home Painting Party Kits, we can now extend the smiles, laughter, and confidence to everyone, as we have done right here in our own community. With your support, you can provide us with the fuel that will further ignite our fire and passion, as we inspire creativity on a global scale.

 

                                                   

 

It was shortly after our first year of business, having launched our mobile painting party concept in our hometown of Kansas City, that we began to see the initial success of the concept take hold. We were truly seeing the amount of lives we were touching. That's when April and I asked ourselves, after seeing this, “What kind of impact could we have, if given the opportunity to inspire people everywhere, and take our painting party concept to a much larger scale”? For us, this was our “Ah Ha!” moment, and when our greater vision became all too clear. With that vision, we are now on our way to becoming America’s #1 mobile painting party experience, and are ready to create an even more intimate and inspiring, one-of a-kind creative activity, brought direct to you, in the comfort of your own home.

 

It was also around this time that we received a package in the mail from a foundation in Oregon, called The Dreaming Zebra, that we had begun shipping our used art supplies and brushes to a few months earlier. What we found when we opened that package had both of us in tears of gratitude and joy. Inside this package was a tiny little canvas, with our original company logo painted on it. In addition, there was a card addressed to April and I, from a group of young children in Africa, that had written to us, to say how grateful they were to have received the donation of brushes, and how happy they felt, now having the ability to paint and create art.

 

                                                

 

To date, this has been our proudest moment, having never realized that such a small effort, in donating used paint brushes could mean so much to someone. For the children that receive our brushes, it could mean the difference between living their dreams, versus never having realized them at all; and that’s one of the greatest things about art. It has the ability to inspire us all, in addition, it can even be the escape for some, of the harsh and horrible realities of life; having known first hand from friends, how art has saved them from a life of drugs, physical/sexual abuse, and even death. As we continued to work with The Dreaming Zebra Foundation, we realized the important impact our company was providing, and the significant role we played, in the lives of children across the world. Your support, and funds for our campaign will allow us to do just that!

 

Now, after much planning and hard work, we are finally ready to launch our newest product line of in-home painting kits called 1 Million Brushes. Our painting kits are designed for people of all ages and abilities, as our kits allow for this painting party experience to be shipped directly to the customer’s door, for everyone to enjoy. You can now create your very own masterpiece in the comfort of your own home, with friends, family, or even by yourself. Our kits can be ordered to include an instructional DVD, or just a downloadable link, and are shipped direct to you, for an amazing experience! 

Our First 6 Painting Options To Choose From

 

Your can order your full kit as a "Deluxe Kit" including a table top easel and apron, or the "Classic Kit" with everything you need to create a masterpiece! 

 

With this initial launch, we are offering 5 different HD videos that walk you or your entire group, step by step through the fun and entertaining recreation of the painting; just as you would experience at one of our mobile painting parties. In addition to the joy you’ll have in seeing your creativity come to life, you can also feel a sense of pride knowing that while you’re painting your masterpiece, a child somewhere, is also sharing in the same joy, with the help of the brushes we will donate from each kit purchase or donation received. April and I are fortunate and blessed to have found a way of giving back through our 1 Million Brushes Campaign, and to also have the opportunity to help inspire the world!

 

 

The initial goal of our campaign is to raise a minimum of $35,000. This amount will allow us to add at least 12 additional videos to our current offering, in addition to helping us streamline our processes, expand production capabilities, and lower our costs, as we create a more affordable product, that will in turn, be available to everyone across the worldwide. With your generous and heartfelt contributions, you will allow us the opportunity to further inspire people around the world through the power of art.

 

The following 7 items below outline our current financial needs in order to bring our painting kits to market on an accelerated schedule. With your valued donations, we can execute our plan accordingly, and make #1MillionBrushes a reality!

 
  1. The production of 12 new instructional painting videos, with the next 6 launching in February of 2018.
  2. We will determine our options on adding the ability for multiple languages on all of our videos, in order to reach new markets around the world, as we expand our inspiration further.
  3. Lowering our costs of supplies is a must! We are already in negotiations with multiple manufacturers and supplies that can offer us significant savings, and with better quality products. However in order to achieve this, we must begin order in bulk of at least (1000+ at a time).
  4. Hiring staff that is dedicated to our vision, passion, and dream, will be a necessity.
  5. Upgraded facilities will be needed, as we are quickly running out of space in our current location. The need for a warehouse to assemble and fulfill orders, in addition to housing inventory, as well as offices for our corporate staff will be a must as we grow.
  6. Expanding and upgrading our current e-commerce platform will be necessary, in order to be capable of handling our increasing kit orders, and monthly subscription packages, in addition to our eventual line of merchandise.
  7. Marketing our vision on a national and global scale will require a much larger budget than we currently using in our local market. If we plan to keep up with the ever changing global marketplace, and our competition, we will need to increase our budget, in addition to adding a valuable customer loyalty and rewards program.
  8.  

 

Because we are offering a product that has already been designed, and is ready for shipment in December, we can offer Perks that give back right away, and just in time for Christmas! In order for us to reach our goal of $35,000, we realize that we will need the help and contributions of our entire community. We understand that some of you have the means to contribute more, there are many others that may be limited on their means, especially during the holidays. However, if you are still passionate about helping us reach our goal, we’ve made it easy to donate.

We designed a tiered contribution plan that can fit most everyone’s financial situations, and still allow for everyone to contribute and receive a perk, while still making a difference. Remember, regardless of the level of donation you make, with every single contribution, a new set of paint brushes will be donated to our cause, as we begin our push towards #1MillionBrushes! Check out our perks below!

 

$5 USD-    Supporter   

 

Love what we're doing and just want to help contribute to our cause? With your support, you will receive a thank you letter from April and Joey, in addition to a donation of 1 set of 5 new paint brushes to help inspire children around the world. We'll also keep you posted on any exciting news, and on our progress towards #1MillionBrushes!

 

$15 USD-   Aspiring Artists  

                              

 

You’re obviously in the mood to paint, and we’re happy to let you dip your toes in the water! With your support, you’ll receive 1 downloadable painting video to paint along to, in addition to a thank you letter from April and Joey. We’ll also donate 1 set of 5 new paint brushes to help inspire children around the world, as we keep you posted on any exciting news, and on our progress towards #1MillionBrushes!

 

$20 USD-   Honorary Artist

                                

 

We see you’re excited about what we’re doing, and you must have some memorabilia to commemorate our new campaign! With your support, you'll receive a Logo’d Painters Apron, a thank you letter from April & Joey, along with 1 donation made of 5 new paint brushes to inspire children around the world. We'll also keep you posted on any exciting news, and on our progress towards #1MillionBrushes!

 

$30 USD- Warhol’s Got Nothing On You   

                             

 

An artistic trend setter for sure, you need only images to create your visions! With your support, you’ll receive all 5 downloadable painting videos to paint along to, along with a thank you letter from April and Joey, and a donation of 5 sets of 5 new paint brushes to help inspire children around the world. We’ll also keep you posted on any updates and on our progress towards reaching #1MillionBrushes!

 

$35 USD- The Impressionist

                                   

 

You’re creativity is as free as the wind, and not held back by traditional constraints! With your support, we’ll send you 1 Classic Painting Kit & along with downloadable video link, in addition to a thank you letter from April and Joey. We’ll also donate 5 new paint brushes to inspire children around the world, as we keep you updated on any news and on our progress towards #1MillionBrushes!

 

$50 USD- You’re A Picasso

 

You’re talents are no surprise to us, and we knew it all along! With your support, we’ll send you 1 Deluxe Painting Kit, and the downloadable video link, a table top easel and logo’d apron, in addition to a thank you letter from April and Joey. We’ll be sure to donate 1 set of 5 new paint brushes to inspire children around the world, as we keep you updated on our latest news and on our progress towards #1MillionBrushes!

 

$100 USD- A True Van Gogh

                                   

 

The world will remember you and your talents, so don’t let them go to waste! With your support, we’ll send you 1 Deluxe Painting Kit, 1 additional video, and painting kit, along with the downloadable video links to each painting, a table top easel and logo’d apron. In addition, you’ll receive a thank you letter from April and Joey, and 2 donations made of 5 new paint brushes. We'll also keep you updated on our latest news and on our progress towards #1MillionBrushes! As an added bonus gift, you will also receive our secret perk; an additional unreleased painting of “Spring Is In The Air”, that we have titled “Michelangelo's Secret Painting”, complete with the instructional DVD and downloadable link, along with all the supplies necessary to recreate this masterpiece.

 

$200 USD- Worthy Of The Louvre

                                    

 

There is no artist greater in the world, and we can’t wait to see the inspiration you bring to us! With your support, we’ll send you all 5 painting kits, including 1 Deluxe Kit, the downloadable links to all 5 videos,1 tabletop easel, 1 logo’d apron, and a thank you letter from April and Joey. We’ll also be donating 5 sets of new paint brushes to children around the world,as we keep you updated on our latest news and progress to reach #1MillionBrushes. As an added bonus gift, you will also receive our secret perk; an additional unreleased painting of “Spring Is In The Air”, that we have titled “Michelangelo's Secret Painting”, complete with the instructional DVD and downloadable link, along with all the supplies necessary to recreate this masterpiece.

 

 

By supporting our campaign, and believing in our vision, your donations will allow us to impact the world on a level that April and I had once only dreamed. The #1MillionBrushes campaign, with your support, helps us to create a fun and entertaining product that we believe is truly capable of inspiring people around the world, while making a significant social impact, and an inspirational footprint that could eventually inspire the next Van Gogh, or Picasso, or perhaps the next Elon Musk or Steve Jobs.

 

The ability to explore one’s creativity is the driving force of innovation, and our painting kits, can be that catalyst for the next generation of great innovators and dreamers! (Link to a blog about the benefits of art)

 

Believe us when we say we will make this vision a reality. If you’re skeptical, and wondering how we will achieve these goals, then allow us to answer any questions you may have, as April and I have been proving ourselves time and time again, since first creating our business. I can assure you that when it comes to achieving our goals, we are those people that you do not want to tell us, “It can’t be done”. As Steve Jobs once said, “The people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do”! Our background and accomplishments with Apple Pie Painting are numerous, being that we have only been in business for 3 years. Please allow us to provide credibility as to our resolve, and to our track record of reaching our goals and achieving success.

 

Having launched our company, in the fall of 2014, we started with little more than a dream and our determination. While living in a 2 bedroom apartment, with 2 young children, and only enough painting supplies to handle 1 painting party of no more than 20 painters at once, we have come quite a long way since then. We even produced our first few prototype painting videos in our dining room, which also served as our warehouse, and our recording studio. With the help of a couple white sheets stapled to the wall, serving as the backdrop, and a few $5 can lights from the local hardware store, we began our journey.

 

3 years later, we can only look back and appreciate our humble beginnings. With a bootstraped budget, and everyone telling us we couldn’t do what we said we would do, we can now laugh a little at ourselves, where we started from, and all the fun we’ve had to this point on our journey. From the countless tears, a lot of wins, and plenty of setbacks along the way, as most entrepreneurs know, April and I have persevered. Having never given up on our relentless desire to see our dreams become a reality. With now over 15,000 satisfied and inspired customers, we are doing what most said could not be done.

 

While we are making a huge impact in our region, and our business is growing, we realize that we could never take the dream of 1 Million Brushes to the levels we have always dreamed of with the current revenues we have. Even with our recent success, it takes more than a couple thousand dollars to make this become a reality. We’ve realized that the only way we can create this vision of 1 Million Brushes is with a substantial upfront investment, in order to take the market by storm!

 

With that being said, please allow us to prove to you that we are the right people for this job, as we reveal our list of our accomplishments and successes that we’ve achieved. We take great pride in each of them, but are also humbled in knowing,  that if we ever let our guard down, there will always be someone right behind us, ready to take it all away. We live by the words of Mark Cuban, “Work like there is someone working 24 hours a day to take it away from you.”

 

Being a local, home grown company, our achievements and accolades help us to validate that what we are doing is right, and that what we provide to our customers is valuable. In a market surrounded by national competitors, and a lot of marketing dollars, always trying to take us down, we have pushed forward to become the best painting party company in all of Kansas City, and the largest one of it’s kind in the entire Midwest. With over 14,000 followers on social media, we have quickly become the most popular mobile painting party experience in America!

 

 

Fox 4 Kansas City Morning Show- July 2015 

Think Bigger Business Podcast- April 2017 http://www.blogtalkradio.com/smartcompaniesthinkingbigger/2017/04/28/apple-pie-painting-hits-a-sweet-spot-in-kansas-city-with-april-kramer

Beta Blox Inncubator Program Graduate- June 2016 http://www.startlandnews.com/2016/06/meet-betablox-startups-ahead-demo-day/

Fox 4 Interview For Orlando United- June 2016 http://fox4kc.com/2016/06/19/kc-cares-uses-art-to-express-support-raise-money-for-orlando-victims/

Thinking Bigger Business Magazine- Feb. 2017 http://ithinkbigger.com/apple-pie-painting-hits-a-sweet-spot-in-kansas-city-with-april-kramer/

ScaleUpKC/Ewing Kauffman Foundation Graduate-2017 https://www.bizjournals.com/kansascity/news/2017/06/07/scaleup-kansas-city-2017-class.html

Pitch Magazine’s Best Of Kansas City- Oct. 2017 http://local.pitch.com/publication/best-of-kansas-city/2017/arts-and-entertainment/best-painting-parties

Yelp- https://youtu.be/W98JnKB-tx0


Oh, and by the way, we were also newly married (by Elvis)- Dec. 2015 https://youtu.be/PPvRaiQlkRA

 

 

 

We will be initially launching our #1MillionBrushes campaign via IndieGogo, and we ask that all interested parties please support and invest in our mission, and please share in our vision to help us spread awareness of this exciting new product to the world, in addition to potential investors who would want to help us reach our goal of donating 1 Million Brushes to children around the world.

Please SHARE this campaign directly by email, social media, blogs, and with the IndieGogo’s sharing tools.

Our SUCCESS greatly depends on YOU!

Thank you from all of us here at Apple Pie Painting and 1 Million Brushes!

*NOTE: All Thank You Packages and Kit Shipments, will not be available for delivery until December 15th, 2017. After a donation is made, please allow us 3-5 business days to confirm your order details, as we will contact you to confirm your product preferences, shipping details, etc. Confirmation emails will also be sent to keep you informed of our progress and anticipated delivery dates. All items include FREE GROUND SHIPPING and handling in the US and Canada, with an additional $20 option to send internationally. All brush donations will be shipped in intervals of 1,000+. We will keep you up to date on our donations goal of #1MillionBrushes.

Inspiring the world through painting has been our mission since we began Apple Pie Painting, 3 short years ago. What began as a simple idea to bring mobile painting parties to people across Kansas City, has evolved into countless memories, laughter, and creativity, with over 15,000 happy customers. We now set forth on our greatest journey yet, and one that will expand our vision across the globe. With this launch of our new and exciting In-Home Painting Party Kits, we can now extend the smiles, laughter, and confidence to everyone, as we have done right here in our own community. With your support, you can provide us with the fuel that will further ignite our fire and passion, as we inspire creativity on a global scale.
 
                                                   
 
It was shortly after our first year of business, having launched our mobile painting party concept in our hometown of Kansas City, that we began to see the initial success of the concept take hold. We were truly seeing the amount of lives we were touching. That's when April and I asked ourselves, after seeing this, “What kind of impact could we have, if given the opportunity to inspire people everywhere, and take our painting party concept to a much larger scale”? For us, this was our “Ah Ha!” moment, and when our greater vision became all too clear. With that vision, we are now on our way to becoming America’s #1 mobile painting party experience, and are ready to create an even more intimate and inspiring, one-of a-kind creative activity, brought direct to you, in the comfort of your own home.
 
It was also around this time that we received a package in the mail from a foundation in Oregon, called The Dreaming Zebra, that we had begun shipping our used art supplies and brushes to a few months earlier. What we found when we opened that package had both of us in tears of gratitude and joy. Inside this package was a tiny little canvas, with our original company logo painted on it. In addition, there was a card addressed to April and I, from a group of young children in Africa, that had written to us, to say how grateful they were to have received the donation of brushes, and how happy they felt, now having the ability to paint and create art.
 
                                                
 
To date, this has been our proudest moment, having never realized that such a small effort, in donating used paint brushes could mean so much to someone. For the children that receive our brushes, it could mean the difference between living their dreams, versus never having realized them at all; and that’s one of the greatest things about art. It has the ability to inspire us all, in addition, it can even be the escape for some, of the harsh and horrible realities of life; having known first hand from friends, how art has saved them from a life of drugs, physical/sexual abuse, and even death. As we continued to work with The Dreaming Zebra Foundation, we realized the important impact our company was providing, and the significant role we played, in the lives of children across the world. Your support, and funds for our campaign will allow us to do just that!
 
Now, after much planning and hard work, we are finally ready to launch our newest product line of in-home painting kits called 1 Million Brushes. Our painting kits are designed for people of all ages and abilities, as our kits allow for this painting party experience to be shipped directly to the customer’s door, for everyone to enjoy. You can now create your very own masterpiece in the comfort of your own home, with friends, family, or even by yourself. Our kits can be ordered to include an instructional DVD, or just a downloadable link, and are shipped direct to you, for an amazing experience! 
Our First 6 Painting Options To Choose From


 
Your can order your full kit as a "Deluxe Kit" including a table top easel and apron, or the "Classic Kit" with everything you need to create a masterpiece! 
 

With this initial launch, we are offering 5 different HD videos that walk you or your entire group, step by step through the fun and entertaining recreation of the painting; just as you would experience at one of our mobile painting parties. In addition to the joy you’ll have in seeing your creativity come to life, you can also feel a sense of pride knowing that while you’re painting your masterpiece, a child somewhere, is also sharing in the same joy, with the help of the brushes we will donate from each kit purchase or donation received. April and I are fortunate and blessed to have found a way of giving back through our 1 Million Brushes Campaign, and to also have the opportunity to help inspire the world!
 


 
The initial goal of our campaign is to raise a minimum of $35,000. This amount will allow us to add at least 12 additional videos to our current offering, in addition to helping us streamline our processes, expand production capabilities, and lower our costs, as we create a more affordable product, that will in turn, be available to everyone across the worldwide. With your generous and heartfelt contributions, you will allow us the opportunity to further inspire people around the world through the power of art.
 
The following 7 items below outline our current financial needs in order to bring our painting kits to market on an accelerated schedule. With your valued donations, we can execute our plan accordingly, and make #1MillionBrushes a reality! 
The production of 12 new instructional painting videos, with the next 6 launching in February of 2018.
We will determine our options on adding the ability for multiple languages on all of our videos, in order to reach new markets around the world, as we expand our inspiration further.

Lowering our costs of supplies is a must! We are already in negotiations with multiple manufacturers and supplies that can offer us significant savings, and with better quality products. However in order to achieve this, we must begin order in bulk of at least (1000+ at a time).

Hiring staff that is dedicated to our vision, passion, and dream, will be a necessity.

Upgraded facilities will be needed, as we are quickly running out of space in our current location. The need for a warehouse to assemble and fulfill orders, in addition to housing inventory, as well as offices for our corporate staff will be a must as we grow.

Expanding and upgrading our current e-commerce platform will be necessary, in order to be capable of handling our increasing kit orders, and monthly subscription packages, in addition to our eventual line of merchandise.

Marketing our vision on a national and global scale will require a much larger budget than we currently using in our local market. We live by the words of Mark Cuban, “Work like there is someone working 24 hours a day to take it away from you.” Being a local, home grown company, our achievements and accolades help us to validate that what we are doing is right, and that what we provide to our customers is valuable. In a market surrounded by national competitors, and a lot of marketing dollars, always trying to take us down, we have pushed forward to become the best painting party company in all of Kansas City, and the largest one of it’s kind in the entire Midwest. With over 14,000 followers on social media, we have quickly become the most popular mobile painting party experience in America!
 

 
Fox 4 Kansas City Morning Show- July 2015 
Think Bigger Business Podcast- April 2017 http://www.blogtalkradio.com/smartcompaniesthinkingbigger/2017/04/28/apple-pie-painting-hits-a-sweet-spot-in-kansas-city-with-april-kramer
Beta Blox Inncubator Program Graduate- June 2016 http://www.startlandnews.com/2016/06/meet-betablox-startups-ahead-demo-day/
Fox 4 Interview For Orlando United- June 2016 http://fox4kc.com/2016/06/19/kc-cares-uses-art-to-express-support-raise-money-for-orlando-victims/
Thinking Bigger Business Magazine- Feb. 2017 http://ithinkbigger.com/apple-pie-painting-hits-a-sweet-spot-in-kansas-city-with-april-kramer/
ScaleUpKC/Ewing Kauffman Foundation Graduate-2017 https://www.bizjournals.com/kansascity/news/2017/06/07/scaleup-kansas-city-2017-class.html
Pitch Magazine’s Best Of Kansas City- Oct. 2017 http://local.pitch.com/publication/best-of-kansas-city/2017/arts-and-entertainment/best-painting-parties
Yelp- https://youtu.be/W98JnKB-tx0
Oh, and by the way, we were also newly married (by Elvis)- Dec. 2015 https://youtu.be/PPvRaiQlkRA
 


 

 
We will be initially launching our #1MillionBrushes campaign via IndieGogo, and we ask that all interested parties please support and invest in our mission, and please share in our vision to help us spread awareness of this exciting new product to the world, in addition to potential investors who would want to help us reach our goal of donating 1 Million Brushes to children around the world.
Please SHARE this campaign directly by email, social media, blogs, and with the IndieGogo’s sharing tools.
Our SUCCESS greatly depends on YOU!
Thank you from all of us here at Apple Pie Painting and 1 Million Brushes!
*NOTE: All Thank You Packages and Kit Shipments, will not be available for delivery until December 15th, 2017. After a donation is made, please allow us 3-5 business days to confirm your order details, as we will contact you to confirm your product preferences, shipping details, etc. Confirmation emails will also be sent to keep you informed of our progress and anticipated delivery dates. All items include FREE GROUND SHIPPING and handling in the US and Canada, with an additional $20 option to send internationally. All brush donations will be shipped in intervals of 1,000+. We will keep you up to date on our donations goal of #1MillionBrushes.

story:
++++ für die DEUTSCHE VERSION bitte ganz nach unten scrollen! ++++++

 

MINISUTRA is designed and layouted ready to print and the only thing that’s missing now is the funding of the printing costs of a small edition. I‘ve put together a bunch of some exclusive packs for you to purchase with books, limited edition art prints and original artworks which are all  – only here, only now! – offered at a special price. 
Every single purchase you make will help me publish MINISUTRA. With your love and support, this book will come to life! 
In the meantime, you can enjoy this year's kamasutra advent calendar here: https://www.facebook.com/biancatsh/

And to learn more about me and my work, visit my website: 
https://www.biancatschaikner.com

Thank you so much and may the gods of love bless you ;-)

 

Questions? Here we go! 

 

"Kamasutra advent calendar"? How did you get this idea?

I'm not entirely sure where it came from but I got the idea last year, anticipating my third journey to India (a country I love very much), where I was going to celebrate christmas. Every day, I shared a new miniature watercolor painting depicting a more or less loosely interpreted ;-) kamasutra position on facebook. The discussions and comments under each post were hilarious, and it was great fun.
During this time, I was asked many times to publish these drawings as a book – so one year later, it’s finally becoming true! 

 

So what is actually in this book?

A big, colorful, and at times queer circus of sex and fun. That means, 32 funny sex positions you may or may not want to try at home. 
You think you are experienced? Get ready to learn about sex positions like you’ve never seen them! Have you ever heard about the “jealous frog position” or the “love orchestra”? Do you know the best sex positions for cake lovers, flight attendants and fortune tellers? No? Then you definitely need this book! 

 

What will the book look like?

MINISUTRA will be printed in the discreet format of 10x12cm and will have will have 64 pages  – containing 32 colorful watercolor paintings and their descriptions. The book is made with love and will be printed and bound in the highest quality in an edition of 700 copies. 

 

So what is the kamasutra, actually?

The kamasutra is an ancient Indian text about the art of love, kama meaning love and sutra meaning thread. More famous than the text itself are the depictions of sex positions  based on it. Minisutra is inspired by this classical, precolonial indian erotic culture, which is – compared to our sterile, commercialized and often misogynist mainstream sexual culture – manifold, vivid, sensual, relaxed and playful. MINISUTRA is a celebration of love and life! 

 

Why should I support this project? 

Art and picture books are generally works of love that involve a lot of unpaid work, with none to very little profit for both the artist and the publisher, and depend on financial support. This is also the case of MINISUTRA, just as it was for my last books SAVARI and La Cocina de America Latina  :-) With your purchase of a book and/or some artwork, you will make a precious little art book, produced in the highest quality, come true! 

 

So what can I do to help this book become true? 

I’d be so happy if you shared my crowdfunding project  on your social media – and if you find any pack you like and supported my project with a purchase, that would delight me even more! 

 

What are my benefits? 

This is your unique opportunity to get the book for a reduced prize of 11 Euros (it will be sold for 12.50 Euros in shops). You will get a signed (and if you wish, dedicated) copy of the book, including free domestic shipping and reduced international shipping. 

This is also your chance to purchase limited edition art prints (art lovers packs), original art (collectors packs) and even commission a erotic painting of your choice (muse pack) – everything offered at a special price!  
You find everything in the perks section to the right of this page. 

 

Where will the funds go? 

The funds will cover the printing, packaging and shipping costs of the book and the art prints. 5% of the funds will go to this platform, 10 % VAT and money processing fees. 

If we get more funding than expected, we will print a bigger edition. 

 

What will happen to my money if the project won't be sucessful?

In the unlikely event that the book won't be printed, you will of course get a full refund of your money. If you ordered artwork, you will still receive it. 

 

Who will print the book? 

The book will be printed and published by the small Western Austrian publishing house Bucher Verlag which has published my last book SAVARI and has received prizes for its extremely beautiful and highest quality artist editions. 

 

When will I get my book and/or artworks? 

You should receive the book and artworks by march 2018.

 

MINISUTRA auf gut deutsch: 

MINISUTRA ist druckfertig! Alles, was jetzt noch fehlt, ist eine Finanzierung der Druckkosten einer kleinen Auflage. Ich habe ein paar exklusive Packs für euch zusammengestellt – mit Büchern, Kunstdrucken in limitierter Edition und originalen Aquarellzeichnungen die es – nur hier und jetzt! – zu einem ganz speziellen Preis gibt. Jedes einzelne Buch, dass ihr kauft, hilft mir, MINISUTRA zu veröffentlichen! Mit eurer Unterstützung wird das Projekt realisiert! 

In der Zwischenzeit könnt ihr dem neuen Kamasutra–Adventkalender hier folgen: https://www.facebook.com/biancatsh/

Wenn ihr mehr über mich und meine Arbeit erfahren wollt, könnt ihr mich hier besuchen: https://www.biancatschaikner.com

1000 Dank, und mögen euch die Götter der Liebe segnen ;-) 

 

 

Fragen? Hier gibt es Antworten auf alles! 

 

“Kamasutra-Adventkalender? Wie bist du denn auf sowas gekommen? 

Ich bin mir nicht ganz sicher, woher die Idee genau kam, aber sie enstand letzten Dezember, als ich mich darauf freute, Weihnachten in Indien (einem meiner Lieblingsländer) zu verbringen. Jeden Tag teilte ich eine kleines Bild mit einer mehr oder weniger ;-) vom Kamasutra inspirierte Sexstellung. Es wurde ein ziemlich lustiger Advent, die Diskussionen unter den Posts waren herrlich, und während dieser Zeit wurde ich öfters gefragt, ob ich die Bilder nicht als Buch veröffentlichen möchte. Nun, ein Jahr später, ist es soweit!  

 

Was ist eigentlich genau in MINISUTRA?

Ein lustiger, bunter, und manchmal queerer Sexzirkus. Das heißt: 32 Sexstellungen, von denen du dich inspirieren lassen kannst – oder dich vielleicht doch lieber nur davon unterhalten lässt. Schonmal von der “eifersüchtiger Frosch-Stellung” oder vom “Liebesorchester” gehört? Kennst du die beste Sexstellung für Naschkatzen, Stewardessen und Wahrsager? Nein? Dann brauchst du MINISUTRA! :-D

 

Wie wird das Buch aussehen?

MINISUTRA wird im diskreten Format von 10x12 cm gedruckt werden. Es wird aus 64 Seiten bestehen, das heißt, es wird 32 Bilder geben – plus Kurzbeschreibung. Es wird eine hochwertig gedruckte Auflage von 700 Stück geben. 

 

 

 

Was ist das Kamasutra eigentlich?

Das Kamasutra ist ein antiker indischer Text über die Kunst des Liebens. Kama bedeutet Liebe, und Sutra heißt Faden. Berühmter als der Text sind allerdings die Darstellungen von Sexpositionen, die auf dem Text basieren. MINISUTRA ist inspiriert von diesem Geist der klassischen, präkolonialen erotischen Kultur  Indiens, die, im Gegensatz zu unserer sterilen, kommerzialisierten und oft misogynen Mainstream–Erotik, verspielt, vielseitig, lebendig, sinnlich und entspannt ist. 

 

Warum soll ich dieses Projekt unterstützen? 

Kunstbücher und Bilderbücher sind im allgemeinen Liebhaberwerke, in denen viel unbezahlte Arbeit drinsteckt, die wenig oder keinen Profit sowohl für die Künstlerin als auch den Verleger abwerfen und deren Realisierung von finanzieller Förderung abhängig sind. Das trifft auf MINISUTRA zu, genauso wie es auf meine vorigen Bücher SAVARI und La Cocina de America Latina zutraf. Mit dem Kauf eines Buches oder eines Kunstwerkes ermöglicht ihr die Veröffentlichung eines hochwertigen Kunstbuch!  

 

Was kann ich tun, um MINISUTRA zu unterstützen? 

Ich würde mich sehr freuen, wenn ihr mein Crowdfunding-Projekt für MINISUTRA teilen würdet – und wenn ihr ein Buch bestellt oder einen Druck oder ein Original kauft, dann freue ich mich natürlich doppelt! 

 

Was kriege ich dafür? 

Nur bei dieser Crowdfunding-Aktion gibt es die einmalige Gegenheit, das Buch signiert zu einem reduzierten Preis von 11 Euro zu erwerben (danach wird es 12.5 Euro kosten). Gratis Versand ist inkludiert, auf Wunsch gibt es auch eine Widmung. 
Außerdem gibt es hier – und nur hier! die Möglichkeit, limitierte Kunstdrucke und originale Malereien zu kaufen – ebenfalls zu einem speziellen Preis. Und, ganz was Feines: Ihr könnt eine speziell für euch gemachte erotische Zeichung mit eurer Lieblingsstellung in Auftrag geben! 

 

Wohin wird das Geld gehen? 

Die Einnahmen werden für Druckkosten, Verpackung, Versandkosten und die Kunstdrucke verwendet. Von den Einnahmen werden 5% an Indiegogo gehen, 10 Mwst. werden abgezogen und die Gebühren für Geldtransfers mit Kreditkarte ebenfalls. 

Wenn wir mehr Geld bekommen, als erwartet, werden wir eine größere Edition drucken.

 

Was passiert mit meinem Geld, wenn das Projekt nicht erfolgreich ist?

In dem unwahrscheinlichen Fall, dass das Buch nicht gedruckt wird, wird der Kaufpreis vollständig zurückerstattet. Wenn du Kunstwerke gekauft hast, wirst du diese trotzdem bekommen. 

 

Wer wird das Buch drucken? 

Das Buch wird vom österreichischen Bucher Verlag gedruckt und veröffentlicht. Der Bucher Verlag ein kleiner, feiner Kunstbuchverlag, der letztes Jahr mein Buch SAVARI veröffentlicht hat und  zahlreiche Preise für seine schönen und hochwertigen Bücher gewonnen hat. 

 

Wann werde ich mein Buch bzw. meine Kunstwerke bekommen? 

Das Buch und die Kunstwerke werden voraussichtlich bis März 2018 geliefert.

story:
• I am an emerging Gatineau–Ottawa based artist who works primarily in photography, and I am interested in contemporary femininity symbols
  • I like to be disruptive! I use different methods to create photographs, such as scanning, digital manipulation, image appropriation, experimental darkroom techniques, etc. I want to push the boundaries of what makes a photographic image
  • I like to subvert! My methods question the imbued cultural meaning of images and propose a feminist reading of abstraction
  • I use alternative photographic techniques that reference screen-printing, cyanotype, painting, and digital layering
  • I have been working with large format printing because it is a way to provoke a visual and emotional impact. Also, it references the human body in space & time.

2017 was an important year for me. I participated in two significant group exhibitions: one at Karsh-Masson Gallery (Ottawa, ON.), and  the other one at Galerie L’Imagier (Gatineau, QC). In addition, I had a solo exhibition at PDA Projects (Ottawa, On.) in February 2017. It was a busy year that helped me understand how viewers can interact with my artistic practice.

AM Dumouchel, Moments of energy between lethargy and thrills, polaroid, GIFs and scannography printed on matte paper, variable dimensions, PDA-PROJECTS (Ottawa), 2017

I want to push the physical boundaries of my practice. At VSC I will: 

  • Expand the physical limitations of my medium into three dimensional forms
  • Experiment with printing materials within the scope of digital photography
  • Combine these experiments into performative sculptural installations
  • The starting point of these experiments are photographs from a on-going serie I began in 2016 : Moments of energy between lethargy and thrills.

Time for research at VSC is a once in a lifetime opportunity. I will have the chance, and freedom, to work in new ways while interacting and exchanging ideas with like minded peers.

I hope to raise $5000 CDN. 

Here is how the money will be spent:

  • Fees ($3000)
  • Printing fees (paper, ink, technicians assistance) and other materials ($800)
  • Personal expenses, phone and traveling costs in the area ($500)
  • Transportation and equipment shipping ($500)

The residency fee is about $4300. I am grateful to have been awarded an artistic grant from VSC. This grant will pay for a portion of my residency ($1350).

Your additional funding will help me realize this residency's full potential.

With your help, I am excited to embark on this adventure and will keep you up to date with the latest news through blog posts, emails, and images!  

Any amount donated will help me obtain this dream residency and will be greatly appreciated! If you wish to help but you cannot make a donation, simply share this campaign or my website with your social network! 

Here are some recent activities and interests that will influence my upcoming residency at VSC:

  •  I want to turn my photographs into sculptures and installations
  • Photography as a defining way to question individual human experience and our relationships to others within our world that is mediated by screens
  • My deep love for subverting the banality of the everyday that I find in post-punk poetry
  • Finding inspiration in «autofiction» literature
  • Continuing to experiment with media that challenges traditional techniques.  

Left : Michael Morris, Rome Letter, acrylic on canvas, with mirror and plexiglas, 148.3 x 326.9 cm, 1968. Right: Marcel Barbeau, Retina don't bug me, acrylic on canvas, 121.9 cm x 121.9cm, 1966.

  • 1960's Québec neo-plasticiens, geometric abstraction and Op Art. I want to both make an homage to these movements and bring a feminist perspective to them
  • Considering the unique visuals of other geographical places I have visited and how they help me consider new perspectives.

Left : My friend and I enjoying the «trompe-l'oeil» ceiling of Chiesa di Sant'Ignazio di Loyola in Rome (Andrea Pozzo, 1694). Right : Me on Road 15, Nevada, USA, posing with Seven Magic Mountains (Ugo Rondinone, 2016.)

  • Since 2013, I have sat on the board of the Centre de production DAïMöN in Gatineau, Qc. It is important for me to get involved in my community
  • Since 2015 I have taughtphotography as a sessional professor at the University of Ottawa
  • I hold a Master's degree in Fine Arts (University of Ottawa, 2014.)
  • I was awarded the Michel Goulet prize for excellence for the Master's of Fine Arts thesis
  • I was awarded Conseil des Arts et Lettres du Québec and Canada Arts Council grants 
  • My work is represented by PDA Projects.
     

AM Dumouchel, installation view of Flesh And Stones  in the exhibition CONTINUUM at the Karsh-Masson Gallery, digital collages and scannography printed on plexiglass, 80 x 20 inches,  September 2017.

 

Thank you for taking the time to read about my campaign & for helping me make my residency possible!

- Anne-Marie Dumouchel
story_txt:
I am an emerging Gatineau–Ottawa based artist who works primarily in photography, and I am interested in contemporary femininity symbols
I like to be disruptive! I use different methods to create photographs, such as scanning, digital manipulation, image appropriation, experimental darkroom techniques, etc. I want to push the boundaries of what makes a photographic image
I like to subvert! My methods question the imbued cultural meaning of images and propose a feminist reading of abstraction
I use alternative photographic techniques that reference screen-printing, cyanotype, painting, and digital layering
I have been working with large format printing because it is a way to provoke a visual and emotional impact. Also, it references the human body in space & time.
2017 was an important year for me. I participated in two significant group exhibitions: one at Karsh-Masson Gallery (Ottawa, ON.), and  the other one at Galerie L’Imagier (Gatineau, QC). In addition, I had a solo exhibition at PDA Projects (Ottawa, On.) in February 2017. It was a busy year that helped me understand how viewers can interact with my artistic practice.AM Dumouchel, Moments of energy between lethargy and thrills, polaroid, GIFs and scannography printed on matte paper, variable dimensions, PDA-PROJECTS (Ottawa), 2017I want to push the physical boundaries of my practice. At VSC I will: 
Expand the physical limitations of my medium into three dimensional forms
Experiment with printing materials within the scope of digital photography
Combine these experiments into performative sculptural installations
The starting point of these experiments are photographs from a on-going serie I began in 2016 : Moments of energy between lethargy and thrills.

Time for research at VSC is a once in a lifetime opportunity. I will have the chance, and freedom, to work in new ways while interacting and exchanging ideas with like minded peers.I hope to raise $5000 CDN. Here is how the money will be spent:
Fees ($3000)
Printing fees (paper, ink, technicians assistance) and other materials ($800)
Personal expenses, phone and traveling costs in the area ($500)
Transportation and equipment shipping ($500)
The residency fee is about $4300. I am grateful to have been awarded an artistic grant from VSC. This grant will pay for a portion of my residency ($1350).Your additional funding will help me realize this residency's full potential.With your help, I am excited to embark on this adventure and will keep you up to date with the latest news through blog posts, emails, and images!  Any amount donated will help me obtain this dream residency and will be greatly appreciated! If you wish to help but you cannot make a donation, simply share this campaign or my website with your social network! Here are some recent activities and interests that will influence my upcoming residency at VSC:
 I want to turn my photographs into sculptures and installations
Photography as a defining way to question individual human experience and our relationships to others within our world that is mediated by screens
My deep love for subverting the banality of the everyday that I find in post-punk poetry
Finding inspiration in «autofiction» literature
Continuing to experiment with media that challenges traditional techniques.  
Left : Michael Morris, Rome Letter, acrylic on canvas, with mirror and plexiglas, 148.3 x 326.9 cm, 1968. Right: Marcel Barbeau, Retina don't bug me, acrylic on canvas, 121.9 cm x 121.9cm, 1966.
1960's Québec neo-plasticiens, geometric abstraction and Op Art. I want to both make an homage to these movements and bring a feminist perspective to them
Considering the unique visuals of other geographical places I have visited and how they help me consider new perspectives.
Left : My friend and I enjoying the «trompe-l'oeil» ceiling of Chiesa di Sant'Ignazio di Loyola in Rome (Andrea Pozzo, 1694). Right : Me on Road 15, Nevada, USA, posing with Seven Magic Mountains (Ugo Rondinone, 2016.)
Since 2013, I have sat on the board of the Centre de production DAïMöN in Gatineau, Qc. It is important for me to get involved in my community
Since 2015 I have taughtphotography as a sessional professor at the University of Ottawa
I hold a Master's degree in Fine Arts (University of Ottawa, 2014.)
I was awarded the Michel Goulet prize for excellence for the Master's of Fine Arts thesis
I was awarded Conseil des Arts et Lettres du Québec and Canada Arts Council grants 
My work is represented by PDA Projects. 
AM Dumouchel, installation view of Flesh And Stones  in the exhibition CONTINUUM at the Karsh-Masson Gallery, digital collages and scannography printed on plexiglass, 80 x 20 inches,  September 2017. Thank you for taking the time to read about my campaign & for helping me make my residency possible!- Anne-Marie Dumouchel

story:
Summary:

Classic traditional artwork by local artisans in most parts of the world are often overlooked and underrated. These exceptionally skilled craftspeople create admirable pieces of handicrafts, such as  paintings, figurines, pottery, terracotta, and earthenwares, etc. There are also some who create home decor essentials like pillow covers, bed sheets, carpets and other hand loom items, mostly passed on to them by their ancestral families or maybe even tumbled serendipitously.

Maqsood  does pottery to support his and his family's living. Maqsood has no formal training of pottery. The art of pottery  is passed from generations to generations.

 

Some of Maqsood's work

These gifted craftsmen and women are really good at their jobs, however, they are unappreciated and inadequately compensated for their work. These artisans face numerous challenges to make a sustainable living because of their low incomes. Some of their children fail to get a good education as a consequence of their living conditions. These crafters are often exploited by third party agents or buyers in terms of getting the actual value of their work. While barely making a living, their ingenuous lifestyle keeps them working on their craftwork with delight.

Devi, A ceremic artist from a remote village in northern India

Some of Devi's ceremic work

We at "Suleet believe that their work holds more worth than they really get. Suleet is a more of an outreach initiative to raise the living conditions of these artisans by providing them with steady jobs and better pay.

Heena,A rug maker from a remote village in Bangladesh

Suleet will be inclined towards the cause of bettering the lives of the craftspeople and building a community where their work is well-perceived and recognized on a global scale.

The campaign:

 Suleet, is mostly about a retail platform, to employ such artisans directly, without having them to connect with any sort of agents or third-party buyers. Suleet will be selling these art pieces and paying the substantial portion of the profit to its creator, eliminating the incomes of these third-party buyers. That will not only create more value for their work but also, enhance their lifestyle and help raise their families in a much more adequate way.

The Impact:

This campaign's social cause will be serving these purposes -

1. Locals craftsmen across the globe will get trained, employed and paid with the substantial part of the profits. This will support their cause of living a comfortable lifestyle for their families in a suitable environment.

2. As our campaign grows, developing an advanced community will be one of our vital goals. We will be contributing towards providing better education to the craftsmen and their families, in the future.

3. The website will have the pictures and the background stories of the artificers at each product's page. They will be the spotlight of the project, receiving their much-deserved recognition and fame.

4. A specialized skill training provided to the next generation craftspeople and their families that would consequently be helping us preserve these dying form of traditional handicrafts-art.

 

Risks & Challenges:

Quality is one factoring hurdle that we would be facing because of the kind of staple products that will be used for making the handicrafts. We will be ensuring the craftsmen use grade-A or fine products for their work and we will be creating frequent quality checkpoints to make sure that the quality stands uncompromised.

The second factor would be potential novice level work. Although most of these artificers are talented and really good at their work, some of them may be amateur and inexperienced, especially while starting out. We will be rendering training and workshops for them to advance their capabilities based on their interests and skills.Our goal is to ensure that the artisans are given the full opportunity to learn techniques that are commonly available to the rest of the world.

What We Need:

We have estimated that we would entail a total of $80,000 as startup funds. This would cover the present product development costs as well as finances to undergo the initial operations for 6 months. These costs break-down include -

  • $10,000- Includes the cost to design and develop of Suleet ecommerce portal, server cost for first 6 months and cost to implement analytics, CRM system, product information management (PIM) system and omni-channel approach to provide you an integrated shopping experience.
  • $40,000- Includes cost to purchase products from artisans around the globe, setup training program and provide them top quality materials for first 6 months
  • $20,000- Includes cost to setup and optimize supply chain, customer support and  warehouse for first 6 months.
  • $10,000- Includes cost to run marketing campaigns for first 6 months. Our data-driven marketing mix will mainly include digital channels such as social media, search engine marketing and email marketing. We will continuously measure the return on investment (ROI) and other revenue and engagement metrics to find the best channel mix for Suleet.

Meeting our goal of $80,000 would qualify Suleet to commence operations and start developing an optimistic influence. We are in need of a startup capital, so your benevolent donations are indispensable for getting Suleet up and running!

How can you help?

  • Donate. Every donation we collect is vital to help Suleet support disadvantaged artisans across the globe. Whether it’s a regular gift or a one-off donation you can help make a difference in someone’s life.
  • Get a perk. Perks are a staple of fundraising efforts. To recognize your commitment to going above and beyond, we have put together some rewards based on the amount donated.
  • Advice and support us. If you are specialized in any area, you think that helps us (marketing, Supply Chain, Import/Export, Finance) write us and we will be more than welcome to start a rapport and ponder opportunities!
  • Connect and share. Your support is vital to help us reach more communities. We need more caring people like you! Be a change maker for our social media! Follow us and share our mission and our projects on social media.More people will know about the projects, more people will have the opportunity to transform their lives.

Everything you do makes a difference. Your support has a ripple effect. It aids GROWTH as an Organization, the individuals we work for, their respective families, their communities, and it helps you. It is preposterous to make others feel good without feeling good yourself.

Your support helps many who need it. Keep Going, Keep Growing and Never Give Up!

Meet the team:

Upendra Srivastava

A social entrepreneur and IT professional with over a decade experience leading technical projects. When I am not at work, I enjoy writing, blogging, photography, and traveling.  

I also put a great emphasis on giving back to the community. I've been involved in community housing projects, fundraising for non profit organizations, and assisting homeless people with reintegrating themselves into society.

Tanmayee Patnaik

A former IT associate and presently a social media influencer. I am a foodie at heart, love reading books, photography and traveling.

I absolutely love animals and sometimes, help out in animal shelters and animal adoption centers. I also get involved with local communities and help out with donations at the food banks.

Lloyd Kim

A digital expert and product manager thriving in digital space. I like to stay surrounded by people who represent my weaknesses so I can build on them.

On my free time, I take part in Community Outreach programs such as after-school tutoring for elementary and middle school children. I am also a mentor for children assisting them with college applications and reach career goals.

story:
This photo exhibition will feature a collection of different photos from various parts of Belfast. The goal is to highlight the creativity and talent of local artists and painters. It will also serve as a guide if you are interested in seeing the artwork in person. At first when I started working on this project I did contemplate the idea of excluding all political art, graffiti and murals related to the paramilitaries but they are a huge part of what makes the streets of Belfast unique whether you like it or not.

The reason why I am taking this project to Indiegogo is because it is very hard to get a exposure in a niche subject like this. Crowdfunding is therefor a viable solution and with Indiegogo I can get some needed help and the funding required to get this exhibition project started. 

Prints

If you are interested in getting prints as a perk you can choose among the selected photos below. If you have any special requirements as If you want a photo cropped or that you want a print in color instead of black and white or vice versa that can certainly be arranged.

story:
Thank you for taking the time to read this proposal. This research and exhibition is of great importance to myself and the communities I hope to impact!

My name is Evan Hall. I am currently developing my senior thesis for an exhibition, set to take place this fall at The Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art in New York City. As a fine artist working through historical themes of the human body, displacement, and spirituality, I long to understand and complicate "Black" identity in 2017. 

Photograph by: Jekesai Njikizana​

History is fragmented, interpreted, re-interpreted, and ultimately skewed—exponentially distancing itself from truth. Somehow, conventional historical narratives are considered sufficient without question.  The mere act of recording history immortalizes specific events while simultaneously erasing others. Because of this phenomena, many of the groups classified as “other,” including my own, have lost hope for recovering an ancestral identity void of parasitism and predetermination by American historians. Being told repeatedly of my ancestry’s genesis in slavery forced me to search beyond the threshold of captivity, discovering that all was not lost in transport. As I journey through geographical research, charting remnants of the trans-atlantic slave trade, past the Horn of Africa, and upwards toward the crucifix of mankind’s history, I seek to recover a deeper and exponentially darker history that takes us to the time of Christ.

In 1993, British historian and educator, Tudor Parfitt, conducted a series of expeditions into Southern Zimbabwe. Within a tribe called the Lemba, Parfitt found the highest concentration of Semitic genes within any population group in the world. 65% of Lemba males tested positive for what researchers have coined the Cohen Modal Haplotype, a marker on the Y-chromosome that, in antiquity, qualified descendants of Aaron, brother of Moses, to be priests. In Jewish tradition, the priestly class, also known as Kohanim, hold ceremonial and religious responsibilities such as Torah readings and sacrificial offerings. The Lemba tell of their emigration from Israel, through Yemen and into East Africa, approximately 2,500 years ago--ultimately residing in Southern Zimbabwe. Distanced from the looming hand of the West, the Lemba’s ancient customs have been preserved for thousands of years. The Lemba hold a key to understanding the diaspora of the Ancient Israelites and the complex racial and religious relationships between Africa and the West.

What components of our identities are inherited or rebuked as we wrestle between regional, national, and ethnic identities? How do shifting political borders impact the genealogical network of social groups? The Lemba, as a people who claim to be unchanged by their migration, demonstrate an ethnic identity that supersedes a national identity. Rooted in their ancient history, The Lemba contrast the restless and disconcerted sense of identity found in America.

My proposed journey to Zimbabwe is the culmination of questions regarding my personal identity and the history of my people, not only in terms of ethnicity but also faith. The rich culture of The Lemba and the history of Zimbabwe will allow me to understand myself within the narrative of a broader and more inclusive humanity. As a conduit of content, I will absorb the cultural landscape and respond through photographs and film that bring their ancient customs into a contemporary dialogue. I will conduct interviews that seek to uncover a disparity or perhaps likeness in race, gender, and religious thinking. Reflective writing and Zimbabwean documents, found throughout my travels to organizations such as the The Lemba Cultural Association, will congeal in the form of a book, utilizing a shared language to juxtapose the Lemba and my American experience. Showcasing in New York City this coming November, I will present the work produced in Zimbabwe to a public audience in the form of a solo exhibition. Opposed to simply retelling the narrative of The Lemba, my work will draw from and incorporate their stories and seek to push on towards a dialogue regarding the dissolution of history, falsified origins, cultural preservation, and race theory. 

Photograph by: William Rasdell

My expedition to Zimbabwe is scheduled tentatively for June 2017, with travel and research expenses adding up to $10,000. If this project piques your interest, please consider funding some portion that would enable me to investigate and begin this new dialogue. Even small contributions help immensely. Alternately, if you know of anyone who might benefit personally from this project or be interested in helping make it possible, please put us in touch.

I hope I was able to convey the gravity of this research, not only for myself but for the myriad of groups affected by this information: Christians, Jews, African-Americans, Africans, and all “othered” global communities. I hope you will join me as I seek to recover an ancient history that informs and complicates the constructed cultural, religious, and ethnic identities of the contemporary Western body. Thank you!

story:
The Unicorn Advice Booth and The Yurticorn

We at Camp Unicorner are creating a new installation for our camp frontage, The Unicorn Advice Booth!  The advice booth will feature a changeable chalkboard sign so that the booth can be anything we dream it to be - kissing booth?  Lemonade stand?  Bar?  Puppet theatre?  Gifting station?  Opportunities for fun and shenanigans are limitless!  The booth will be colorful and fun while offering shade and seating, and it will be lit for night time use so any time of day passersby can stop and play!

We are also working to enhance, upgrade, and stock up our Yurticorn unicorn lounge!  The Yurticorn is a hexayurt full of fluffy unicorns and magical creatures, and also features a free library and coloring corner!  It's a great place to relax, nap, have pillow fights, meditate, and comfort your inner child!  This will be the Yurticorn's third year on the playa and it gets more magical every year!  With your help we can make it more colorful, more comfy, and more fun with more coloring books, colored pencils, fantasy and kids books, tacky unicorn art, and tons of gifts!

It brings us immense pleasure to share our colorful positivity with others. Burners of all ages light up when they see the magical installations we've created for everyone's fun and enjoyment! 

Supplies Needed:

3 sheets of 1/2" plywood - $75

Primer and paint - several gallons, many colors! - $350

Paint brushes, rollers, pans, etc. - $100

Chalkboard paint and liquid chalk markers - $30

80 feet of 2x4" lumber - $60

8 feet of 2x12" lumber - $20

4 barstools - $80

Solar LED lights - $100 

Rebar and hardware (screws, etc.) - $50

Curtains and rods - $100

Coloring books and colored pencils - $20

Fantasy novels and children's books - $50

Bolts of fabric - $200

Hexayurt (bi-filament) tape - $100

Carpets and ground cover - $100

MORE unicorns, pillows, and mats! - $200

If we don't reach our funding goal, never fear!  The Unicorn Advice Booth will happen regardless - we will prioritize building materials first and fun additions later, so that our ultimate goal of increasing our interactivity is achieved.  We work year-round to create and upgrade our installations so they are always getting better.

ALL FUNDING from this campaign will go toward creation and enhancement of The Unicorn Advice Booth and The Yurticorn!

Our Gifts to You:

Both the Unicorn Advice Booth and the Yurticorn are open 24-hours a day so they are always available for interactivity and fun!  The Unicorner also offers many fun gifts during Burning Man, like books, bookmarks, unicorn friends, buttons, pins, and more!

There are many awesome perks that we have created for our friends and contributors!  These include high quality vinyl stickers and buttons of our fabulous camp logo, really cool party glasses glittered by your favorite unicorns, and especially the limited-edition hard-enamel collector's pins that are super sweet and glow in the dark!!

The Impact

We work hard and we play hard in order to bring joy to people who visit the Yurticorn and Unicorn Advice Booth at Burning Man and events like SF Decompression. We are so excited to create a new interactive experience that offers opportunities for fun and imagination.  When we first created the Yurticorn, we had no idea how positive the effect would be, but we've gotten so much great feedback about the space we've created that we are motivated to create more, do more, and give back to our wonderful community as much as we can!  Thank you for helping us meet our goals and realize our dreams!

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is funding, which is why we've created this fundraiser!  We are a creative and motivated group of carpenters, artists, and art lovers, but we are a small camp of friends and families with limited income.  We put so much effort, time, and money into our installations and with community support we can go that much further and create so much more!!  For instance, last year we built PlayaTech love seats, pews & bleachers in order to increase our camp's comfort for visitors, so we're confident that we will be able to build an Advice Booth for everyone to play with! 

 Other ways you can help:

There are plenty of ways to help us achieve our goals. If you could help spread the word about our Indiegogo campaign using the links to your social media, we'd be forever grateful!! Please find us on our public Facebook page, "Unicorner - Fun and Shenanigans!".  We post updates and camp info there, so you can find us on the playa and come say hi!  We'd love to meet you!

 

Thanks so much for supporting our creative efforts and helping us increase the interactivity of our camp!!  We are blessed to have such great contributors!!
story_txt:
The Unicorn Advice Booth and The Yurticorn
We at Camp Unicorner are creating a new installation for our camp frontage, The Unicorn Advice Booth!  The advice booth will feature a changeable chalkboard sign so that the booth can be anything we dream it to be - kissing booth?  Lemonade stand?  Bar?  Puppet theatre?  Gifting station?  Opportunities for fun and shenanigans are limitless!  The booth will be colorful and fun while offering shade and seating, and it will be lit for night time use so any time of day passersby can stop and play!
We are also working to enhance, upgrade, and stock up our Yurticorn unicorn lounge!  The Yurticorn is a hexayurt full of fluffy unicorns and magical creatures, and also features a free library and coloring corner!  It's a great place to relax, nap, have pillow fights, meditate, and comfort your inner child!  This will be the Yurticorn's third year on the playa and it gets more magical every year!  With your help we can make it more colorful, more comfy, and more fun with more coloring books, colored pencils, fantasy and kids books, tacky unicorn art, and tons of gifts!
It brings us immense pleasure to share our colorful positivity with others. Burners of all ages light up when they see the magical installations we've created for everyone's fun and enjoyment! 
Supplies Needed:
3 sheets of 1/2" plywood - $75
Primer and paint - several gallons, many colors! - $350
Paint brushes, rollers, pans, etc. - $100
Chalkboard paint and liquid chalk markers - $30
80 feet of 2x4" lumber - $60
8 feet of 2x12" lumber - $20
4 barstools - $80
Solar LED lights - $100 
Rebar and hardware (screws, etc.) - $50
Curtains and rods - $100
Coloring books and colored pencils - $20
Fantasy novels and children's books - $50
Bolts of fabric - $200
Hexayurt (bi-filament) tape - $100
Carpets and ground cover - $100
MORE unicorns, pillows, and mats! - $200
If we don't reach our funding goal, never fear!  The Unicorn Advice Booth will happen regardless - we will prioritize building materials first and fun additions later, so that our ultimate goal of increasing our interactivity is achieved.  We work year-round to create and upgrade our installations so they are always getting better.
ALL FUNDING from this campaign will go toward creation and enhancement of The Unicorn Advice Booth and The Yurticorn!
Our Gifts to You:
Both the Unicorn Advice Booth and the Yurticorn are open 24-hours a day so they are always available for interactivity and fun!  The Unicorner also offers many fun gifts during Burning Man, like books, bookmarks, unicorn friends, buttons, pins, and more!
There are many awesome perks that we have created for our friends and contributors!  These include high quality vinyl stickers and buttons of our fabulous camp logo, really cool party glasses glittered by your favorite unicorns, and especially the limited-edition hard-enamel collector's pins that are super sweet and glow in the dark!!
The Impact
We work hard and we play hard in order to bring joy to people who visit the Yurticorn and Unicorn Advice Booth at Burning Man and events like SF Decompression. We are so excited to create a new interactive experience that offers opportunities for fun and imagination.  When we first created the Yurticorn, we had no idea how positive the effect would be, but we've gotten so much great feedback about the space we've created that we are motivated to create more, do more, and give back to our wonderful community as much as we can!  Thank you for helping us meet our goals and realize our dreams!
Risks & Challenges
Our biggest challenge is funding, which is why we've created this fundraiser!  We are a creative and motivated group of carpenters, artists, and art lovers, but we are a small camp of friends and families with limited income.  We put so much effort, time, and money into our installations and with community support we can go that much further and create so much more!!  For instance, last year we built PlayaTech love seats, pews & bleachers in order to increase our camp's comfort for visitors, so we're confident that we will be able to build an Advice Booth for everyone to play with! 
 Other ways you can help:
There are plenty of ways to help us achieve our goals. If you could help spread the word about our Indiegogo campaign using the links to your social media, we'd be forever grateful!! Please find us on our public Facebook page, "Unicorner - Fun and Shenanigans!".  We post updates and camp info there, so you can find us on the playa and come say hi!  We'd love to meet you!
 
Thanks so much for supporting our creative efforts and helping us increase the interactivity of our camp!!  We are blessed to have such great contributors!!

story:
Historique

Il y a maintenant quelques années, j'ai réalisé que l'envie, le besoin de créer étaient plus forts que tout et la décision de plonger dans le vide, de me laisser guider par cette force, et d'y consacrer tout mon temps était la seule avenue viable pour moi.

De cette décision résultent des produits singuliers. Découlant de ma façon de disséquer les fonctions et de trouver l'inhabituel dans l'ordinaire. Mais ces objets ne sont pas nés d'une direction que je me force à suivre, c’est le fruit d'une vision qui m'habite, naturellement, depuis toujours.

Cette créativité nouvellement libérée devait par contre être domptée en même temps que les autres états d'esprit dont elle se nourrit; le bonheur de me donner enfin le droit de consacrer ma vie à ma passion, l'enthousiasme débordant, une confiance aveugle, tous ces états d'esprit m'ont donné de dures leçons.

Quoique la bête de la création en elle-même pourrait ne jamais être totalement domptée, l'homme qu'elle a aidé à s'épanouir peut maintenant affirmer en avoir compris le fonctionnement et ainsi déclarer en avoir le contrôle.

La créativité et la volonté ne sont pas les deux seuls ingrédients nécessaires à la réussite, mis à part la chance, le travail, l'organisation, l'acharnement, etc. L'ingrédient essentiel reste l'argent, cette notion de valeur qui nous nourrit, nous met un toit sur la tête et définit notre place dans la société, et il me manque terriblement, une conséquence directe de ces leçons encaissées.

 

Le produit

Dans les derniers mois, j'ai consacré de plus en plus de temps à réaliser un concept de mobilier qui me titillait l'esprit depuis longtemps.

Ayant à l'origine misé sur le Salon de l'Habitation pour faire découvrir son design, j'ai manqué de temps et n'ai pu y présenter ne serait-ce que le prototype.

Le temps passé à réaliser ce produit était par contre bien réel, et a créé un important manque à gagner.

Il m'est donc impératif de lever des fonds rapidement, sans quoi…

La conception du dit meuble étant terminée, le prototype ayant passé tous les tests de nature physique et mécanique haut la main, il ne reste qu'à l'introduire au monde et lui faire vivre son vrai test, celui de l'intérêt qu'il peut susciter.

Alors ce que je souhaite en premier lieu, c'est que vous partagiez et incitiez vos amis et vos proches à partager ce sociofinancement sur les réseaux sociaux, afin que le maximum possible de gens y soit sensibilisé. Et deuxièmement, que vous en parliez personnellement aux gens de votre entourage susceptibles de trouver un intérêt à posséder ce meuble.

 

L'offre

Un module de rangement, solidement assemblé et fabriqué de ciment et de bois, au prix de 450 $, soit un rabais de 25 % sur le prix de détail après lancement. Ce tarif est valable pour une production initiale de 12 unités, ce total devant être atteint dans un délai de 15 jours à compter du début de cette campagne, à la fin de cette offre, les modules seront offerts au prix de détail de 600 $ auprès de La Touche Locale.

Le prix de base est valable pour la version offrant un tiroir en merisier russe. Différents placages de bois peuvent être proposés avec supplément (sur les photos de présentation, le placage est du bois de zebrano), de même qu’il est possible d’envisager de colorer le ciment.

           

Conclusion

Je suis conscient que le prix demandé n'est pas accessible à tous, mais c’est un produit qui, à mon avis, trouvera son public auprès de gens cherchant une signature particulière à leur environnement, ou peut-être de compagnies qui doivent meubler une salle ou des bureaux. C’est pour cette raison que je vous demande de partager cette publication, afin qu’elle trouve écho auprès de son public.

Je vous remercie d’avance de m’avoir aidé en partageant cette publication ou en ayant fait vous-même une commande.

 

Cordialement,

Sylvain.

story:
Short Summary

Marnie Freeman is a talented artist who is know as the "Artist of Liberty®" because the subject matter she is passionate about reflects the founding values of our great nation.  The election of Donald J. Trump as the 45th president was historic at many levels. Many never thought he would ever even have a chance, but he tapped into a core of supports who came out in force to win the White House and start a new chapter in the American story.

During the campaign the supporters of Trump/Pence ticket were likened to a "basket of deplorables." This became a rallying cry for many who were on the fence with their support. These supporters prayed for candidate Trump and turned out in record numbers with a desire to "Make America Great Again" as One Nation Under God. Now, they want to send a resounding message to President Trump: "We are standing behind you."

For the first time Marnie Freeman is accepting a public commission to create a special painting that commemorates this historic election. Her painting is titled "March of the Deplorables". It will depict a line of supporters praying for and marching alongside President Trump and Vice President Pence on their journey to the White House. She will also include key figures who were instrumental in this historic victory such as Kellyanne Conway, Melania Trump, Ivanka Trump, Lt. General Flynn, Steve Bannon, Katrina Pierson and Karen Pence. Much like the campaign was targeted to giving a voice to the average American rather than the privileged few, this painting is being funded in the same way. By opening this up to the public more people can participate in this historic painting. The idea came from Lt. Colonel E. Ray Moore, a retired Army Chaplain. Colonel Moore asked Marnie to paint this to honor the men and women who made the 2016 victory happen. He felt that it should be "commissioned by the people."

Marnie plans to present this painting to President Trump and Vice President Pence when it is completed. She believes that it will be a cherished memento of what many believed was impossible.

Please check out the various ways you can participate in this amazing project.

 

More about Marnie

You can learn about other works of Marnie Freeman at MarnieFreeman.com.

story:
You know me! I'm your friendly gneighborhood Gnome. We're coming back to the same spot at Apogaea this year and making new stuff for your enjoyment! We decided we want more goodies in camp to share with everyone, so we're asking for your kind donations. To thank you, we will make you some super special gnomie swag to pick up when you come visit us at Apogaea. Collect them all and receive bonus items!

More donations = more swag!

We are featuring prizes based on such iconic gnomenclature images as:

  • 2017 Official Camp Theme -- When In Gnome
  • The G.N.O.M.E. Project
  • The Department of Gnome Works
  • Epic laser cut/etched Gnome items by Dust City Designs

What we're doing with your donations:

As much as we love underpants, no profits will be kept by Gnome artists. All donations will be invested in camp infrastructure, such as our brand new shaded bar, and giveaways in the form of more swag, fuel for tunes and heat, and other Gnome delights. If you have any questions, please direct them to our 2017 Gnome Steering Committee: Aaron Kshvsky, Stacey Lu, and Tater Zoid.
