story:
Hello! This is Lenny Schwartz from the Daydream Theatre Company! We are a Theatre Company out of RI. At the end of the month we will be taking the play BEN MINUS ZOE MINUS BEN from RI to New York City to the 2018 Planet Connections Theatre Festivity

We are just raising a few last minutes funds for production costs(lodging, parking, gas, and other stuff) 

It's not an easy thing to do but we are doing it hell or high water. We are going one way or another.

The perks are simple. For 20 dollars Lenny Schwartz(me) will write you a two page play. Whatever you like. If you don't know or aren't sure, Lenny(me will come up with something awesome)

For every ten dollars, Lenny(that guy) will write another page. For example, 30 dollars will get you three pages, 100 dollars will get you ten and so on and so forth.

Here's the cool part: If we get 25 people to donate, Lenny will gather some actors and invite you and a guest to actually see these plays performed in a stage reading...for free!

Let's see what happens and roll the dice!

story:
About us

Many of you already know us for our works in fantastic medieval bookbinding in an artisanal way, which we have been doing for six years now, working with national publishers such as Nosolorol and international as WhiteWolf, Modiphius, among many others. Of course many orders from private clients. And from our website, where you can see all our works and books for sale: 

www.elartesanodelrey.es

 

Jagoba Lekuona ILUSTRATOR

 Since he had use of reason he held a pencil in his hand.
                                Many professors shook their heads as if they had a fair monster before them to check how little they attended in class. But the small Jagoba, outraged by the rejection of the world towards the cartoonists, decided then to open the way to swipes, bites and more unpleasant things.

 

Necronomiconis Medievalis

What is the Necronomiconis Medievalis? It is a medieval edition written by a Spanish monk in the fourteenth century, collecting old writings in different languages. This arduous task that he carried out in secret, paid off when, after several years of research and work, he was able to create this great book.



This book was an idea that for years I had in mind, since there were several books on sale with the name of Necronomicon and that did not finish setting for a devoted follower of the H.P. Lovecraft (and other writers like August Derleth) and their mithos, like me. I needed something more, as a follower of this universe and player of the magnificent role-playing game "The call of cthulhu", which I recommend from my heart here.

My idea was to create a Necronomicon at the height of this universe and that the followers of Lovecraft can say, that this may be one of the best books that represent this universe, although that you will decide.
Both the medieval book of wooden covers and the pocket edition contain the same illustrations. These books are a collection of creatures and artifacts from the myths of the H.P.Lovecraft universe. Being able to use it as a bestiary in the role games. With more than 200 illustrations this book is indispensable if you like the worlds of Lovecraft. It does not contain readable text only symbols, spells and litanies in strange languages, never seen before. The setting that we have given has been of the ancient world, in some of the illustrations appear the 7 wonders of the ancient world and the legend says ... that just by seeing a specific page, you go crazy.
You have never seen anything like it, since this project has more than 8 months of work, not only the book, but all the Merchandising that comes with it. You can not lose this.

My goal as a bookbinder and thanks to Jagoba Lekuona is to create the ideal book, as we all imagine this type of book. As a role player, it is to have a book in which I can teach my players all this world and its creatures that inhabit it.

I inform you that the edition of this book is limited to 666 units (No more will be manufactured), with its certificate indicating its numbering and although the content is equal to all that are manufactured, none will be the same, granting in this way, that each piece is different. So the owner will have a unique piece, which is ultimately what it is about having something unique ... and special.


I explain briefly how is the book ...
After passing certain illustrations we make a prototype, (which are the photos you can see acontiniación). After printing in print (after seeing different papers and tests) the paper is aged with 3 layers of treatment, sheet by sheet.

The sheets are then stitched in A5 size booklets. After preparing the covers of the book in wood and aging them, the whole set is bound in an artisanal way with medieval techniques of the time.

The cover is decorated with different elements. This type of book, when done by hand, involves many hours of work.

As you know the Necronomiconis Medievalis (350 euros), its size is A5 (half folio). We have created it with this size because it is easier to transport, for the games. But we are also going to make it a little bigger A4 size (like a folio), so we have taken out the Necronomiconis Medievalis BIG (600 euros), obviously it takes more material and hours of work. It will be exactly like the one that appears in the photos, but bigger.

Unfortunately not everyone can afford to pay the cost of this great work, so we have created a paperback edition in soft cover so that no one is left without the "Necronomiconis Medievalis"
We have not been able to miss this opportunity to add a notebook (Necrocuadernomicón) on human skin and the role play of "The call of Cthulhu" 7ºEdition.

 

PACK

During all these months, we have communicated with our followers in different social networks and we have liked the idea that all items can be purchased individually. But the most interesting are the "Pack" we have created, with different price ranges so that everyone has access to them.
In these Pack you can find a group of products, which as a whole are cheaper than buying them individually.
We hope you enjoy them.

What can we find in these Pack?

POCKET BOOK

This pocket edition of the Necronomiconis Medievalis in softcover, is the cheapest option to get this great job for only 19 euros, although if you choose a PACK you get better price.
With a size of A5 approx. It is a paperback book with a number of pages to be determined, about 200 pages or more in full color.

 

Sealing wax

 

It is a seal for sealing letters and documents. With the emblem of the University of Miskatonic.
It has a price of 39 euros.

Investigator's card

We have designed 4 characters of researchers with their card from the University of Miskatonic, for which they work.

Ideal to play as characters. You can take a picture of yourself and put it on the illustration, even laminate them.

 

MINI CTHULHU

This ancient figurine represents an ancient Idol of God Cthulhu, apparently made of gold, with a size of 8 cm, has brought head of the professors of the University of Miskatonic in their study, since at the base of this, they are strange symbols that fail to decipher, possibly are the steps of some ancient ritual.

The die of 20 faces is for you to see the scale of the figure, the truth is that it is a pass, Sale for 9 euros.
 

Mini Ancients

 

Ancestral golden figure of 8 cm. That represents the old race of the Ancients. In its base is written the history of this race that reigned on the earth before man.

Sale for 9 euros the unit.

 

MINI shub niggurath

 

And this is the third figurine.

 

The 3 Gold Mini Idols for 19 euros.

 

Idol Cthulhu stone

 

This incredible figure in the form of Idol of God Cthulhu in stone has already arrived. With a size of 15 cm, it is great for setting games, decorating your Geek lair or giving a friend for his birthday. Hand painted.

We have created a certificate of authenticity from the prestigious Miskatonic University for each Idolo. It goes completely FREE in each IDOLO that you buy.

This stamp comes out for 35 euros, with a size of about 4 cm.

GIVEN OF 100

After different design and test its operation we managed to manufacture these 2 dice, between the two generate 1 die of 100 faces.

You can see the size they have compared to 1d20. These dice can be yours for 15 euros.

RPG "The Call of Cthulhu"

 

This recent 7th Edition is the last to leave. we find a beautiful leather binding, with the edges of the sheets in red, bookmarks, metal corners and a drawing that makes you lose your sanity on the cover. With an aged effect, this book clearly seems one of those that appear in the universe of H.P.Lovecraft, one of those cursed books. Includes certificate.

 

 

Sale for 249 euros.

Limited edition

 

 

This special and unique edition of 1 copy for everyone. This unique edition differs from the other in several things:

     Metallic medallion on the cover.
     Special decoration
     Signed by us
     Limited edition certificate.

The photos you can see is a prototype, as it will have much more decoration and special details.

Sale for 800 euros.

Artifact of the ancients

 

This ancient metallic artifact, which has not been able to discover its date of manufacture, is said to have come from the library of Atlantis, it was found in a cave in the Dead Sea. It is said that he has wandered through the history of humanity, in the hands of Carlo Magno, of Julio Cesar, in the library of Pergamum and Alexandria ...
Manufactured in two metal covers engraved and aged by the passage of the centuries. It is said that inside contains a cosmic blueprint and the history of mankind from the beginning, including ... the origin of man. This piece has been searched incessantly by different religions and treasure hunters. Only now ... it can be yours.
We will not put pictures of its interior, since ONLY it will be able to see the lucky ones that buy it, following like this with the legend of the "Artifact of the old ones"

Includes numbered certificate. Sale for 245 euros.

How long will it take to manufacture it?

 

The delivery time in this type of projects with so much work is a bit uncertain, but we hope to clarify a bit with this information:

     Jagoba Lekuona: you will have to draw the rest of the illustrations that are missing to make the books.
     DURATION: About 4 months. At this time, we will advance in the rest of the manufacturing of the different components of the project. We will start sending single orders.

     The artisan of the King: when we have the illustrations, we will pass it to the printer, to have the pocket book as soon as possible and start shipping. At this moment we will begin the manufacture of the Necronomiconis Medievalis.
     DURATION: Depending on the units that are ordered, it is a craft work, which is always worth waiting for.
story_txt:
About us
Many of you already know us for our works in fantastic medieval bookbinding in an artisanal way, which we have been doing for six years now, working with national publishers such as Nosolorol and international as WhiteWolf, Modiphius, among many others. Of course many orders from private clients. And from our website, where you can see all our works and books for sale: 
www.elartesanodelrey.es Jagoba Lekuona ILUSTRATOR
 Since he had use of reason he held a pencil in his hand.                                Many professors shook their heads as if they had a fair monster before them to check how little they attended in class. But the small Jagoba, outraged by the rejection of the world towards the cartoonists, decided then to open the way to swipes, bites and more unpleasant things.

 

Necronomiconis Medievalis
What is the Necronomiconis Medievalis? It is a medieval edition written by a Spanish monk in the fourteenth century, collecting old writings in different languages. This arduous task that he carried out in secret, paid off when, after several years of research and work, he was able to create this great book.

This book was an idea that for years I had in mind, since there were several books on sale with the name of Necronomicon and that did not finish setting for a devoted follower of the H.P. Lovecraft (and other writers like August Derleth) and their mithos, like me. I needed something more, as a follower of this universe and player of the magnificent role-playing game "The call of cthulhu", which I recommend from my heart here.
My idea was to create a Necronomicon at the height of this universe and that the followers of Lovecraft can say, that this may be one of the best books that represent this universe, although that you will decide.Both the medieval book of wooden covers and the pocket edition contain the same illustrations. These books are a collection of creatures and artifacts from the myths of the H.P.Lovecraft universe. Being able to use it as a bestiary in the role games. With more than 200 illustrations this book is indispensable if you like the worlds of Lovecraft. It does not contain readable text only symbols, spells and litanies in strange languages, never seen before. The setting that we have given has been of the ancient world, in some of the illustrations appear the 7 wonders of the ancient world and the legend says ... that just by seeing a specific page, you go crazy.You have never seen anything like it, since this project has more than 8 months of work, not only the book, but all the Merchandising that comes with it. You can not lose this.

My goal as a bookbinder and thanks to Jagoba Lekuona is to create the ideal book, as we all imagine this type of book. As a role player, it is to have a book in which I can teach my players all this world and its creatures that inhabit it.I inform you that the edition of this book is limited to 666 units (No more will be manufactured), with its certificate indicating its numbering and although the content is equal to all that are manufactured, none will be the same, granting in this way, that each piece is different. So the owner will have a unique piece, which is ultimately what it is about having something unique ... and special.

I explain briefly how is the book ...After passing certain illustrations we make a prototype, (which are the photos you can see acontiniación). After printing in print (after seeing different papers and tests) the paper is aged with 3 layers of treatment, sheet by sheet.




The sheets are then stitched in A5 size booklets. After preparing the covers of the book in wood and aging them, the whole set is bound in an artisanal way with medieval techniques of the time.












The cover is decorated with different elements. This type of book, when done by hand, involves many hours of work.

As you know the Necronomiconis Medievalis (350 euros), its size is A5 (half folio). We have created it with this size because it is easier to transport, for the games. But we are also going to make it a little bigger A4 size (like a folio), so we have taken out the Necronomiconis Medievalis BIG (600 euros), obviously it takes more material and hours of work. It will be exactly like the one that appears in the photos, but bigger.

Unfortunately not everyone can afford to pay the cost of this great work, so we have created a paperback edition in soft cover so that no one is left without the "Necronomiconis Medievalis"We have not been able to miss this opportunity to add a notebook (Necrocuadernomicón) on human skin and the role play of "The call of Cthulhu" 7ºEdition.
 
PACK
During all these months, we have communicated with our followers in different social networks and we have liked the idea that all items can be purchased individually. But the most interesting are the "Pack" we have created, with different price ranges so that everyone has access to them.In these Pack you can find a group of products, which as a whole are cheaper than buying them individually.We hope you enjoy them.What can we find in these Pack?
POCKET BOOKThis pocket edition of the Necronomiconis Medievalis in softcover, is the cheapest option to get this great job for only 19 euros, although if you choose a PACK you get better price.With a size of A5 approx. It is a paperback book with a number of pages to be determined, about 200 pages or more in full color.
 

Sealing wax





 
It is a seal for sealing letters and documents. With the emblem of the University of Miskatonic.It has a price of 39 euros.
Investigator's card

We have designed 4 characters of researchers with their card from the University of Miskatonic, for which they work.

Ideal to play as characters. You can take a picture of yourself and put it on the illustration, even laminate them.

 
MINI CTHULHUThis ancient figurine represents an ancient Idol of God Cthulhu, apparently made of gold, with a size of 8 cm, has brought head of the professors of the University of Miskatonic in their study, since at the base of this, they are strange symbols that fail to decipher, possibly are the steps of some ancient ritual.




The die of 20 faces is for you to see the scale of the figure, the truth is that it is a pass, Sale for 9 euros. 
Mini Ancients Ancestral golden figure of 8 cm. That represents the old race of the Ancients. In its base is written the history of this race that reigned on the earth before man.




Sale for 9 euros the unit.
 
MINI shub niggurath
 
And this is the third figurine.


 
The 3 Gold Mini Idols for 19 euros.

story:
Phase Magazine

Phase is a new London based magazine highlighting the work and talent of young emerging artists and writers. We will explore and connect arts, culture, music, photography, politics, poetry and cinema. Our platform intends to give visibility to up-and-coming, underground talents.

Phase reimagines the way we interact with culture. We believe that today, young creatives should not restrict themselves to one area of interest. Therefore, Phase enables these creatives to explore different possibilities, express their broad range of passions and benefit emerging artists.

The magazine will reflect London culture of musicians coexisting alongside writers. We will engage with the tradition of underground zine culture that challenges convention. Phase will be London’s monthly encounter with those composing this counterculture.

Phase is UK based but will create an ecosystem benefitting and connecting our readership to young artists and writers from around the world. 

Why?

We aim to create a link between a nostalgic idealisation of the past and an eagerness for reinventing contemporary culture.

We believe it is time to confront our generation's potential by resisting the idea that everything has already been made.

Phase will be accessible but intellectually engaging, politically opinionated and open to discourse.

Phase blends Britain's musical identity with the French emphasis on culture, art, and cinema.

As Phase grows, we hope to use the magazine as a tool to highlight the work of writers and artists who share our vision, and eventually tackling the issues we care most about, including the refugee crisis, environmental destruction, racism, homelessness, and social justice.

Who's behind it? 

Our team is made up of young creatives and writers. We understand our generation must shape the artistic landscape of the future. 

Anjali Larsen - Editor-in-Chief/Music Editor

Anjali is an independent journalist and film student from Paris. She has spent the last year living in London seeking and uncovering the city's most talented writers and artists. Now, her goal is to provide them with a platform that will enable them to express their talents uninhibited. 

Leo Peace - Co-Editor/Politics Editor

​

Annamaria Robles - Production Editor

Elinore Weil - Social Media Manager/Managing Editor

Elsa Chereau - Artistic director & Graphic designer

 

 

Jane Dabate - Poetry Editor

Garance Querleu - Arts Coordinator

Marianne Mignot-Ogliastri - Executive Editor

Oriane Picant - Photography and Cinema Editor

Reuben Strong - Cinema coordinator

 

 

 

We need your help 

We've already collected the articles and pieces from our various contributors, but we need financial backing to cover printing costs. 

Because we are young and are not yet established, we need the support of the creative community to get started.

The importance of print journalism

 We believe it is imperative to see this project in a physical form. While the internet provides a democratic space for creators, we are firmly committed to the concept of physicality.

We want our printed magazine to be a physical experience that will immerse the reader sensorially. 

Phase is directed towards London's youth, and will be affordable and accessible. 

We want Phase to play an important part in the resurrection of print journalism, and believe the physical aspect to play a crucial part to engage for the reader, whether in text or photography.

Our commitment to ecology and creative independence

We want to print on recycled paper and distribute in a way that is environmentally friendly. However, this comes at a cost. We won't seek funding from corporate interests who might limit our ability to realise this commitment. 

To avoid sacrificing the integrity of our content, and in order to write and create independently, we must also raise funds independently. That is why we have taken the decision not to include any advertising or product placement in our magazine.

This is why we have come to Indiegogo. We need your support to create without restrictions imposed by mainstream investors.

We understand the power of crowdfunding. Any contributors will help to put our ideas into action in a way that is ethical, sustainable and corresponds to our values and identity.

SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS

Follow and stay up to date on our progress : 

Instagram : @phasezine 

https://www.instagram.com/phasezine/

Facebook : Phase Magazine

https://www.facebook.com/phasezine/

Spotify: Phase Magazine

https://open.spotify.com/user/noyhvevtverxb90m1...

And our email: phasemagazine11@gmail.com

Don't hesitate to get in touch ! 

A big thank you from the Phase team <3

story:
About Us

The Sugar Creek Art Center leases working studio spaces to area artists. Our artists interact and collaborate to enhance and expand their work. We hold monthly gallery exhibits to connect with our rural community.

We have a gift shop to sell our artists' work and also have the facilities to host art classes for all ages.

The matching grant challenge from The Community Foundation of Boone County will allow us to recover from the challenges of the past year's pandemic. The Art Center was able to maintain full occupancy in our studios, but we were not able to host community events due to the limitations of COVID-19.

We have great expectations for the upcoming year with upcoming projects and community events that were placed on hold and need your help.

 

The Future for SCAC

Here's a few projects we hope to accomplish at The Art Center:

  • Open the third floor of the building for future studio space
  • Continued expansion with our resident caterer JC Cocina
  • Addition of a coffee shop within The Art Center

We also hope to host more community events and art classes.

 

The Impact

Your donations will allow us to expand our community outreach and help us make an impact in the Thorntown community. We anticipate a bright future for The Sugar Creek Art Center and hope to continue sharing the joy of art.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Stop in and visit us! The Art Center is open Thursday - Saturday from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. and our caterer JC Cocina also offers a carry-out menu throughout the week.

If you're interested in helping in other ways, we're always looking for volunteers. Contact Angie Moody for more information at (765) 336-2488.

We appreciate your help with spreading the word about The Sugar Creek Art Center!
story_txt:
About Us
The Sugar Creek Art Center leases working studio spaces to area artists. Our artists interact and collaborate to enhance and expand their work. We hold monthly gallery exhibits to connect with our rural community.
We have a gift shop to sell our artists' work and also have the facilities to host art classes for all ages.
The matching grant challenge from The Community Foundation of Boone County will allow us to recover from the challenges of the past year's pandemic. The Art Center was able to maintain full occupancy in our studios, but we were not able to host community events due to the limitations of COVID-19.
We have great expectations for the upcoming year with upcoming projects and community events that were placed on hold and need your help.
 

The Future for SCAC
Here's a few projects we hope to accomplish at The Art Center:

Open the third floor of the building for future studio space
Continued expansion with our resident caterer JC Cocina
Addition of a coffee shop within The Art Center

We also hope to host more community events and art classes.
 

The Impact
Your donations will allow us to expand our community outreach and help us make an impact in the Thorntown community. We anticipate a bright future for The Sugar Creek Art Center and hope to continue sharing the joy of art.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Stop in and visit us! The Art Center is open Thursday - Saturday from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. and our caterer JC Cocina also offers a carry-out menu throughout the week.
If you're interested in helping in other ways, we're always looking for volunteers. Contact Angie Moody for more information at (765) 336-2488.
We appreciate your help with spreading the word about The Sugar Creek Art Center!

story:
Vous trouverez la version française plus bas!


The craft exhibition Salon Région’Art de Rimouski was founded in 2012 by Créations Unika, a small local business that sells retail items and designs creative jewelry. The main goal was to offer an opportunity for local artisans of all trades to exhibit their quality handmade products and allow the population to discover our regional talent in a friendly environment. This is not only the perfect occasion for artists and artisans to display their craft, but also to meet other people with similar passions, where exceptional collaborations could ensue.

Given the success of the first three editions of the exhibition Région’Art, a fourth edition was simply inevitable and will take place in November of 2015.

Over the years, the exhibition enabled a total of 50 different artists of the Bas St-Laurent region to share their talent. Music, dolls, handmade soap, woodwork products and visual arts are some of the categories of crafts that are represented during the event.

Visitors are be able to feed their curiosity with a variety of interesting discoveries,  exclusive creations and original handmade products. Many could anticipate to even find precious gift ideas for the Christmas season!

That being said, the Salon Région’Art de Rimouski needs funding in order to purchase the necessary advertisement and be a true success. Furthermore, it will be held during 2 consecutive days this year, which will generate additional costs.

The local artists and artisans need this type of event, since there are only two other exhibitions, which restrict the kind of crafts that people can exhibit. I would like for this exhibition to become some kind of tradition for the regional folk, where they look forward to coming on a yearly basis to purchase original gifts or personal treats. 

_____________________________________________________________________________

Le salon Région’Art de Rimouski à été créé en 2012 par les Créations Unika, une petite entreprise individuelle Rimouskoise, qui oeuvre dans la vente au détail et dans la conception de bijoux de fantaisie, dans le but de donner la chance aux artisans du Bas St-Laurent, toute catégorie confondue, d’exposer leurs produits et de permettre à la population de découvrir les talents régionaux. Ce salon se veut l’occasion pour les artisans et artistes d’ici de montrer leur savoir-faire, mais aussi de se rencontrer et de faire naître des collaborations exceptionnelles entre eux. Le salon se dit être très familial et convivial tout en présentant des produits de qualité à saveur régionale.

Les trois premières éditions du Salon Région’Art de Rimouski ayant été couronné de succès, l’événement n’avait le choix que de revenir pour une quatrième année consécutive  et c'est en novembre 2015 que se déroulera la 4e édition.

À travers ses trois éditions, le Salon Région’Art de Rimouski a permis à 50 artistes de la région  du Bas St-Laurent d’exposer leurs talents. Musique, poupées d’art, savons artisanaux, produits d'ébénisterie et arts visuels sont quelques-uns des domaines représentés lors de l'événement.

De belles découvertes, beaucoup de choix et de produits exclusifs et originaux tous faits à la main qui seront satisfaire la curiosité des visiteurs qui oseront s’y aventurer… Beaucoup d’idées cadeaux en prévision du temps des fêtes!

Ceci dit, le salon doit «s'auto-financer», ce qui ne permet pas d'offrir la publicité nécessaire. De plus, le salon se déroulera sur 2 jours consécutifs cette année, ce qui engendrera des dépenses supplémentaires et l'admission doit rester gratuite! 

Les artistes et artisans locaux ont besoin de ce type d'événement car mise à part le salon des Métiers D'Art (pour les métiers d'art) et le marché des saveurs (pour les producteurs agro-alimentaires), il n'y a rien. Je veux que ce salon devienne une sorte de «rituel» pour les gens de la région, je veux que les gens se rappellent qu'à chaque année, ils peuvent également venir faire leurs emplettes au salon Région'Art!

story: Official Edison Ilan
story_txt: Official Edison Ilan

story:
What is this?

This is a very special and personal book.  Whoever opens it will find the joy of analyzing what they feel and see from the world, plus things to read, illustrations to see and also free space to both draw, write, paste little things...and anything you feel like including. 

The finality of this is for you to be able to share your book with both your future self and the people that surrounds you. If you're a traveller, someone with concerns and/or willing to discover and learn everyday, this is your sketchbook




 













What I need and what you get.

I need:

  • To finish the layout, corrections and have a professional supervising it. -Will show timeline planning below-.
  • Each book will be printed on special drawing paper (thin grain 150gr aprox watercolor paper) and 350gr recycled paper for covers -and full color- so that you will be able to draw and paint anywhere you want. For that I need the money to be able to print and distribute the book myself. Every 160 copies will cost me around 2.300EUR.
  • To work with the manufacturer to fill and package the orders.
  • To ship all your rewards.
  • To print canvases for rewards.
  • Some background to be able to live in the mean time, so that I can focus 100% on it and be able to finish everything in time.

For that you'll get:

  • I'll break it down further in the perks section, but if you contribute, varying amounts could net you original signed prints of a chosen part of the book, a spot for your name in the art book, a physical copy of the art book and more!











 instagram: @traeulb


What's more

When contributing to my project you will be able to experience something absolutely new everyday. 

If you're a fan of sketchbooks, Moleskine type of things, and of making something new everyday; imagine having your own illustrated and written one with your things in it too! 

Also, because each page has something that makes it unique and original, you'll always have something new to think about and that can maybe inspire you too.

All this illustrations and writings where developed while traveling around the world, so you'll find things from my time living in NYC for example, or also Miami, Wales, London, Spain, France and more.



TIMELINE


Last but not least

I'm aware things are not easy, and this is not an exception. 

I've been working hard and, most of all, loving this project. So if you help me bring it to life, i will very much appreciate it and give you some awesome rewards ;)

But if for whatever reason I didn't make it, I would find another way to bring it to life, like if finding another path around a labyrinth. 

Because I want to share this with you. I want you to be part of it. 

The reason why it was created.


If you like it but you can't help financially

No worries, there's always ways to help! 

Share this, spread it! 

Use sharing options and make it visible to your friends and family. 


And THANK YOU ALL AGAIN IN ADVANCE!


                               

For more artwork visit Blueart.

Instagram: @traeulb

story:
Hello from #Colchester3DCraft!

Hi! We are in our final year of our BA (Hons) Three-Dimensional Design & Craft at Colchester School of Art. Every year we take a stand at the best graduate design exhibition in the UK, NEW DESIGNERS in London. This is a fantastic opportunity to show our work to the largest possible audience and have a serious go at kickstarting our careers. Last year's graduates had a brilliant show and received not only lots of positive feedback and praise but also made sales and were chosen by nationally important galleries.


This year, there are more of us - 13 in total! - going to New Designers and our usual space is not sufficient to show everybody's work to its fullest potential. We have managed to negotiate some fantastic ADDITIONAL STAND SPACE, but we really need YOUR HELP to make this happen!

Craft and design are suffering major cutbacks at the moment, with more courses closing every year. We want to keep fighting this trend and show that our creativity is still thriving, as are our enthusiasm and will to succeed.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION, however small, WILL SHOW YOUR BELIEF that the UK can still produce EXCITING DESIGNERS whose work deserves to be seen in the best possible light.


What We Need & What You Get

In order to achieve our goal, we need to raise £2000, with every pound contributed going directly towards purchasing the extra stand space and paying for crowd-funding fees. In return for your kind help, we are offering what we do best: fantastic ONE-OFF ARTWORKS, LIMITED EDITION DESIGNS and CREATIVE WORKSHOPS where YOU can get the chance to enter our workshop world and learn a new skill!

No short term gains... Look how far your contribution will go!

The impact of your contribution goes beyond just helping us buy extra stand space this year. This fundraiser is a collaborative effort between final and second year students. The Year 2 gang are offering their energy, enthusiasm and talent and we in Year 3 are reciprocating through technical advice, mentoring and the teaching of valuable business skills to prepare them for next year's New Designers show and life after art school. 
Should you be so generous that we exceed our original fundraising goal, the extra money will go towards our Year 2 end-of-year show. Also, Year 2 is another group of 13 and achieving our goal will mean that they will be able to negotiate first refusal on both the original and extra New Designers stand space next year. 
WE ARE ALL WORKING TOGETHER TO MAKE SURE THE BENEFITS WE REAP THIS YEAR WILL STILL HAVE A LEGACY IN 2016!

Other Ways You Can Help

We are really hoping that a lot of you won't be able to resist the fabulous perks that we are offering! But we also know that not everyone will be able to make a financial contribution. The one thing that anybody can do is help us by spreading the word! Please share this campaign with family, friends and colleagues on social media, email and even by old-fashioned phone! THE MORE PEOPLE YOU TELL, THE MORE CHANCES YOU GIVE US TO SHINE AT NEW DESIGNERS!

story:
My name is Angela Kasalia and I was born and raised in Athens.

  For the past three years I’ve been living and working on the island of Syros,  the capital of the Cyclades Islands.  I’m a single parent of two beautiful children Konstantin, 12 years old and Marousa, 10 years old.

  My need to express my feelings, my emotions and my imagination drove me to start photography. During shoots I found myself living in another world, a world full of emotions and fantasy. It has become my obsession to express more and more of my inner self.  Photography is a whole new world for me, which I’m dying to explore!

  I have also become a member of the  Hellenic Photographic Society in Athens, of the Syros Photography Club and I have taken part in many collective exhibitions all over Greece. I have also had two personal exhibitions in Syros and in Mykonos. 

The concept behind my project “Cocoon”  is embarking on a lonely inner journey between light and dark, calling on transformation, rebirth, the rebirth of a woman and the unknown paths of  her soul, much like an unborn child that lives in the dark and waits impatiently to emerge into light and freedom… 

  My project “Cocoon” will be on exhibit in Athens and in Syros, under the custody of mr.Kyriakos Kokkos, the headquarter of the  Hellenic Photographic Society.    It will  consist of 25 stills, most of them b&w,  printed on canvas, accompanied by posters and a catalogue with the photos, including a short story written by Mrs. Pegy Stergiou, distinguished photographer and very good friend of mine and two reviews by Mr Manuel Diumenjo, photographer and film director and by Andonis Theocharis Kiouka, film director.

  In order to organize the two exhibitions the necessary funds are approximately 2.700,00 €, to cover the printing of the stills, (including Image optimization for CMYK and RGB colorspace, digital production, conversion, & beta testing) the accompanying catalogue and posters.The travel and stay expenses to and from Athens I prefer not to include.

Prices project:

for image optimization - 25 photos    250,00 €

for printing (in canvas) and framing  - 25 photos  1.250,00 €

for design and printing of the catalogue - 1.000 pcs  1.050,00 €

for design and printing of the posters - 100 pcs  150,00 €

Total:  2.700,00 €       

All contributors will receive, after the exhibitions, and full documentation the development of the exhibitions, including links to online press articles.

  • I would be grateful if you make some noise about my campaign and please don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
About this project


If you ever tried learning the human anatomy or attempting to do so, you will soon find out it’s not easy. You may have also spent a fortune on anatomy books and even watched hours of videos on the subject. Do you still find yourself not progressing ? Perhaps the frustration when you are unable to find any suitable anatomy reference at all? Art is hard, but it does not have to be!

Having spent a great deal of time in the gaming industry with a great passion for character art and as a lead artist at Ubisoft Singapore on AAA titles like Ghost Recon and Assassin Creed franchises has taught something...


Seasoned veterans will tell you the best way to learning anatomy is by cross referencing books with a reference model, a good reference model! To appreciate the human form further is to build the model yourself! The good news is this has been done for you. This model has been an accumulation of hundreds of hours of painstaking research and sculpting work. Started entirely from scratch and sculpted from inside out, each layer of muscles were carefully researched and sculpted separately. Important details like the origin and insertion points, volume and density of each muscles have been faithfully preserved.

Though the deeper muscles will never be visible, however this method yields a more accurate representation of how the final top muscles should naturally look. Fortunately all is not lost, the entire sculpting process has been documented on YouTube. Over 100 videos of the sculpting method, techniques and tools used are shared, starting from how I built the armature all the way to the final molding and casting process.


Benefits
All the expensive anatomy books in the world can’t paint a complete picture of the complexities of the human body. In fact, the most difficult aspect of learning anatomy is attempting to piece together a functional 3D mental image based on an array of 2D images typically available. Being able to hold and feel your subject in your hands decreases the learning curve tremendously.Visual depth and tactile 3D experience will always be better then just flat images. Being able to refer between a diagram and a physical model will make much better visual sense.

About this figure



  • Hand sculpted ( from inside out )
  • Male
  • 1:6 scale
  • Superficial muscle system
  • 12.5x4.5x4.5" / 32x11x11cm
  • 3.7 lbs /1.7kg
  • Polyresin
  • Painted in grey, beige
  • 6 detachable magnetic parts + 1 Free extra head
This has been a great collaborative effort with author, anatomist extraordinaire  Frederic Delavier, based on his Farnese Hercules écorché anatomical Illustration. Together, this amazing reference model has taken us 2 years to complete . Sculpted entirely by hand with no digital 3d printing assistance. 

 

Frederic Delavier is truly a gifted artist with an exceptional knowledge of human anatomy. He studied morphology and anatomy for five years at the prestigious cole des Beaux-Arts in Paris and studied dissection for three years at the Paris Facult de Medcine. The former editor in chief of the French magazine PowerMag, Delavier is currently a journalist for the French magazine Le Monde du Muscle and a contributor to several other muscle publications, including Men's Health Germany. Delavier won the French powerlifting title in 1988 and makes annual presentations on the sport applications of biomechanics at conferences in Switzerland. His teaching efforts have earned him the Grand Prix de Techniques et de Pdagogie Sportive. Delavier lives in Paris, France. His Strength Training Anatomy books has sold over 2 million copies and translated into many major languages. His involvement and input in creating this figure has been invaluable!


Who is this for
Ideal for study and reference purposes. Perfect for learning and teaching of all levels be it novice or expert. Great for anatomy study, reference for drawing, sculpting, 3D modeling and concept art work. If you are an artist (illustrator, comic, game, 3d modeler, sculptor, painter or just an enthusiast) this is for you!
 




Desktop Size :
Sits snugly on your home and office desktop. Small, convenient and portable. Perfect for all your personal and professional work.


Detachable Parts :
Hold each parts conveniently in your hands for close up study and reference from  all viewing angles.


Removable Magnetic Parts:
Each parts are connected with strong neodymium magnets.This allows quick, easy and secure attachments.

How you can help

As the current batch of this model is selling out fast at d-anatomystore and to create the complimenting Farnese Hercules Anatomical Wallchart poster for this campaign, I will require to look for facility to facilitate the next batch of production. This will significantly free up my time from doing it myself. With your fund, it will also help me with the production cost of this figure. I believe together we can get this cool figure into the hands of every deserving artist. I can't thank you enough in advance for joining me in this amazing journey!


What you get

Perks:

  • $0. If you can't contribute it does not mean you can't help. Help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign, by word of mouth, facebook, tweeter, instagram,etc.  Your help can make a difference!
  • $5 - Personalized Thank You! : A Personalized thank you through email .We thank you from the bottom of our hearts. Your contribution will help us achieve our goal.  You will get good karma :)

  • $25 - 3D VHAS ( for backers only) :

    ·  Downloadable 3D Virtual Human Anatomy Studio is a highly-detailed and accurate human anatomy reference application. In a rich, accessible 3D environment, 3DVHAS reveals both superficial and deep muscles, tendons, and bones. We will send you the registration key to unlock the Software..  Download DEMO 

         


  • $$50 - Poster + 3D VHAS ( for backers only) :

    ·  3D Virtual Human Anatomy Studio. Download DEMO

    ·  Anatomy wallchart poster personally signed by Frederic Delavier.  A2 size, 420x594mm / 16.5x23.4"

  • $110 - 8" Anatomical Reference Model Set ( for backers only) :

    ·  Smaller 8" écorché anatomical reference model. ( shows superficial, middle, deep muscles, bones and fascia)

    ·  DVD - the entire sculpting process video of this 8" figure. Indexed for easy viewing. Printable anatomy wallchart included inside.

    ·  Free shipping to all countries with standard shipping ( Not tracked & no replacement) or add US$37.00 for priority shipping ( Tracked and guaranteed)

        

        



  • $145 - Model + Poster  ( for backers only) :

    ·  Anatomy reference model (Grey).

    ·  Anatomy wallchart poster.  A2 size . 420x594mm / 16.5x23.4"

    ·  Free shipping to all countries with standard shipping ( Not tracked & no replacement) or add US$37.00 for priority shipping ( Tracked and guaranteed) 

  • $185 - Model + 3D VHAS + Poster + Tools ( for backers only) :

    ·  Anatomy reference model (Grey)

    ·  3D Virtual Human Anatomy Studio. Download DEMO

    ·  Anatomy wallchart poster personally signed by Frederic Delavier.  A2 size, 420x594mm / 16.5x23.4"

    ·  2 piece set Serrated Wire End Loop Tools + 3 piece set Metal Ball Stylus Tools)

    · Free shipping to all countries with standard shipping ( Not tracked & no replacement) or add US$37.00 for priority shipping ( Tracked and guaranteed)       

           

  • $350 - Everything! ( for backers only) :

    · 2 x Anatomy reference model (grey+beige)

    ·  Anatomy wallchart poster personally signed by Frederic Delavier.  A2 size, 420x594mm / 16.5x23.4"

    ·  3D Virtual Human Anatomy Studio. Download DEMO

    ·  5 piece set Serrated Wire End Loop Tools + 8 piece set Professional Metal Ball Stylus Tools)

    ·Free shipping to all countries with standard shipping ( Not tracked & no replacement) or add US$80.00 for priority shipping ( Tracked and guaranteed)
         

Shipping Details

We aim to ship the first Anatomical Model in March 2015. Please note that the delivery date is subject to change. In any event, we will keep you updated on the schedule in our update emails. 

All anatomical figures ships from China. We ship internationally to all countries. Perks price are inclusive of shipping fees. All anatomical models will be shipped by standard mail ( Not tracked & no replacement ), add US$37.00 to your pledge to be priority shipped  ( Tracked and guaranteed )

We will keep you updated frequently on the progress of the  project by email. Once we get close to the delivery date, we will ask you to confirm your shipping address and we will provide further instructions.


Risks and challenges

Most of the challenges have been faced already, but the most obvious ones left would be getting the funding for the project and then supplying the rewards as expected and on time. We're very confident that we can achieve this and we're looking forward to seeing the response to this project!


What happens if the funding goal is not reached?

I will need to use my personal savings to top up the balance. Which means all backers will still get what they have pledged.


Who am I

A passionate self taught artists who truly appreciates the human form and a strong advocate in the importance of anatomy knowledge. Loves to paint, sculpt and model.I hail from the tiny island of sunny Singapore.


Note : All software's offered in the perks should meet these Minimum System Requirements  :Win98, WinMe, Win2000, WinXP, Win7 ,Win 8 . DirectX8.1 and above installed Hardware : P II 300MHZ, 64MB RAM and all 3D accelerator cards.PC compatible.
story_txt:
About this project



If you ever tried learning the human anatomy or
attempting to do so, you will soon find out it’s not easy. 
You may have also spent a
fortune on anatomy books and even watched hours of videos on the 
subject. Do you still find yourself not progressing ? Perhaps the 
frustration when you are unable to find any suitable
anatomy reference at all? Art is hard, but it does not have to be!
Having spent a great deal of time in the gaming industry
with a great passion for character art and as a lead artist at Ubisoft Singapore on AAA titles like Ghost Recon and Assassin Creed franchises has taught something... 


Seasoned veterans will tell you the best way to learning anatomy
is by cross referencing books with a reference model, a good reference 
model! To appreciate the human form further is to build the model 
yourself! The good news
is this has been done for you. This model has been an accumulation of hundreds of 
hours of painstaking research and
sculpting work. Started entirely from scratch and 
sculpted from inside out, each layer of muscles were carefully researched and 
sculpted separately. Important details like the origin
and insertion points, volume and density of each muscles have been 
faithfully preserved.Though the deeper muscles will never
be visible, however this method yields a more accurate representation of how the final top muscles should naturally look. Fortunately all is not lost, the entire sculpting
process has been documented on YouTube. Over 100 videos of the sculpting method, techniques and tools used are shared, starting from how I built the armature
all the way to the final molding and casting process.
BenefitsAll the expensive anatomy books in the world can’t paint a complete 
picture of the complexities of the human body. In fact, the most 
difficult aspect of learning anatomy is attempting to piece together a 
functional 3D mental image based on an array of 2D images typically 
available. Being able to hold and feel your subject in your hands decreases the learning curve tremendously.Visual depth and tactile 3D experience will always be better then just flat images. Being able to refer between a diagram and a physical model will make much better visual sense. 
About this figure


Hand sculpted ( from inside out )
Male 

1:6 scale
Superficial muscle system

12.5x4.5x4.5" / 32x11x11cm


            3.7 lbs /1.7kg

            Polyresin 
Painted in grey, beige 

6 detachable magnetic parts + 1 Free extra head

This has been a great collaborative effort with author, anatomist extraordinaire  Frederic Delavier, based on his Farnese Hercules écorché anatomical Illustration. Together, this amazing reference model has taken us 2 years to complete . Sculpted entirely by hand with no digital 3d printing assistance.   
Frederic Delavier is truly a gifted artist with an exceptional
knowledge of human anatomy. He studied morphology and anatomy for five years at
the prestigious cole des Beaux-Arts in Paris and studied dissection for three
years at the Paris Facult de Medcine. The former editor in chief of the French
magazine PowerMag, Delavier is currently a journalist for the French magazine
Le Monde du Muscle and a contributor to several other muscle publications,
including Men's Health Germany. Delavier won the French powerlifting title in
1988 and makes annual presentations on the sport applications of biomechanics
at conferences in Switzerland. His teaching efforts have earned him the Grand
Prix de Techniques et de Pdagogie Sportive. Delavier lives in Paris, France. His Strength Training Anatomy books has sold over 2 million copies and translated into many major languages. His
involvement and input in creating this figure has been invaluable!

Who is this forIdeal for study and reference purposes. Perfect for 
learning and teaching  of all levels be it novice or expert. Great for anatomy study, reference
 for drawing,  sculpting, 3D modeling and concept art work. If you are an artist (illustrator, comic, game, 3d modeler, sculptor, painter or just an enthusiast) this is for you! Desktop Size :Sits snugly on your home and office desktop. Small, convenient and portable. Perfect for all your personal and professional work.

Detachable Parts :Hold each parts conveniently in your hands for close up study and reference from  all viewing angles. 

Removable Magnetic Parts:Each parts are connected with strong neodymium magnets.This allows quick, easy and secure attachments.

 

How you can help
As the current batch of this model is selling out fast at d-anatomystore and to create the complimenting Farnese Hercules Anatomical Wallchart poster for this campaign, I will require to look for facility to facilitate the next batch of production. This will significantly free up my time from doing it myself. With your fund, it will also help me with the production cost of this figure. I believe together we can get this cool figure into the hands of every deserving artist. I can't thank you enough in advance for joining me in this amazing journey!
What you get


Perks:


$0. If you can't contribute it does not mean you can't help. Help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign, by word of mouth, facebook, tweeter, instagram,etc.  Your help can make a difference!



$5 - Personalized Thank You! : A Personalized thank you through email .We thank you from the bottom of our hearts. Your contribution will help us achieve our goal.  You will get good karma :)

$25 - 3D VHAS ( for backers only) :


·  Downloadable 3D Virtual Human Anatomy Studio is a highly-detailed and accurate human anatomy reference application. In a rich, accessible 3D environment, 3DVHAS reveals both superficial and deep muscles, tendons, and bones. We will send you the registration key to unlock the Software..  Download DEMO 


          





$$50 - Poster + 3D VHAS ( for backers only) :


·  3D Virtual Human Anatomy Studio. Download DEMO
·  Anatomy wallchart poster personally signed by Frederic Delavier.  A2 size, 420x594mm / 16.5x23.4"





$110 - 8" Anatomical Reference Model Set  ( for backers only) :


·  Smaller 8" écorché  anatomical reference model. ( shows superficial, middle, deep muscles, bones and fascia)

·  DVD - the entire sculpting process video of this 8" figure. Indexed for easy viewing. Printable anatomy wallchart included inside.
· 
Free shipping to all countries with standard shipping ( Not tracked 
& no replacement) or add US$37.00 for priority shipping  ( Tracked 
and guaranteed)

story:
Brick x Brick: The TSL Sidewalk Renewal Project

The basics

+Time & Space Limited (known to locals as "TSL") is an alternative arts not-for-profit organization in the upstate city of Hudson, NY, where it focuses on using art and action to empower the community
+Last year, TSL took on a huge new project: to replace the battered sidewalk on its portion of Columbia Street, improving community access to the TSL building and neighborhood walkability overall
+Despite valiant lobbying efforts, TSL received no assistance from state, city, or other organizations for the renewal project, leaving the non-profit with a $30,000 bill

Now, TSL needs your help!


The sidewalk problem

"The Walkable City." "Upstate's Downtown." These are all phrases used by the city of Hudson in reference to its "wide, fully paved sidewalks."
What the city's not saying? Funding for those sidewalks is limited to what they consider "the length of the city's major streets." Read: the upscale, commercial areas that cater to visitors.
That means that other areas need to find their own way to create a walkable—or jog-able, stroller-able, or wheelchair-able—neighborhood.

TSL knows this problem all too well. Thanks to their location on the truck route, the sidewalks outside TSL have suffered from decades of commercial traffic and trucks that drive over and park upon the curb. This meant that, until last year, the sidewalk was essentially unwalkable—full of sinkholes, broken, and reduced to mud in some places.

This is problematic for a number of reasons:

+A sidewalk that is truly "wide" and "fully-paved" allows safe pedestrian access to the neighborhoods beyond Columbia Street for all community members, whether they're walking, pulling a cart, pushing a stroller, or operating a wheelchair.
+Walkability is one of the most important factors of a safe and efficient urban environment.
+A healthy sidewalk allows TSL's programming and space to truly be accessible to all, including differently abled community members.

TSL lobbied for months for grants, loans, or other financial assistance from New York State, the city of Hudson, or arts organizations, but there are no programs in place to support infrastructure improvements. This is a problem—because without a safe space, a non-profit organization cannot fulfill its mission of reaching all community members.

That's why TSL decided to take on the sidewalk renewal project without assistance—and with it, a $30,000 bill.

Now, TSL is looking to defray the cost of these community improvements by looking to the community—the community of Hudson, the community of New York State, the arts community, and the community of those who believe art and empowerment should be accessible to all.



Budget breakdown

TSL's budget is pretty simple.

+$30,000 will go directly toward paying for the sidewalk renewal project
+$3,500 will go toward Indiegogo and credit card processing fees
+$1,500 will go toward fulfilling rewards, including postage and printing

If TSL receives less than $35,000, all of the funding they do receive will still go toward the sidewalk bill, fees, and rewards. However, they will remain in debt to the sidewalk project, leaving them with a smaller budget for programming.

If TSL receives more than $35,000, the sidewalk will be paid off, and any additional funds will go toward additional programming! Hooray!

Time and Space Limited is a not-for-profit 501(c)(3) organization. All donations to TSL are tax deductible, and you'll get a receipt automatically upon donation.

As a reward for your donation, you'll will receive a personal thank you from the TSL team as well as memberships and invitations to an exclusive sidewalk launch event—see the sidebar for details.
You'll also know that you helped support a unique, dynamic, and important community resource that's open to all, in Hudson and beyond.


About TSL

TSL has been operating for over 40 years, more than 20 of them in Hudson, bringing art, theatre, music, film, and community forums to all and fostering dialogue across lines of race, ethnicity, gender, and class.

In one year (2010), TSL offered:

+Ongoing youth programs including college preparation and financial aid workshops, after-school tutoring, programs for young learners, and media arts workshops
+2 “Time to Talk” community forums
+2 “TimesTalks Live” literary evenings
+1 opera benefit with young opera singers
+2 original productions, including work with the TSL Youth Theater
+398 documentary, independent, and classic movie screenings
+4 CinemaLux screenings with filmmakers
+12 free outdoor summer movies at Pocket Park
+1 evening of Oscar-nominated shorts
+6 "Presenting Programs," including live music and dance performances and the Bread and Puppet Theatre
+6 National Theatre of London presentations
+5 “Best of the Met” summer operas
+32 “Met Opera: Live in HD” presentations
+10 community events, including the Big Barn BBQ, Chili & Cornbread at WinterWalk, the Annual Membership Brunch, the Peace March Potluck, the Memorial Day Yard Sale, and the Solstice Parade

Not only is TSL a beacon for change in upstate New York, they're also a model for the way that arts organizations nationally and globally can bridge community gaps and spark thought, dialogue, and action. Here's what a few awesome people had to say about TSL:

+"TSL is as good an example as I can think of for what an organic, self-organized social network of resistance needs as an institutional support framework... Hudson is very fortunate to have this oasis of humanity."
Marie Wilson, founder of The White House Project

+“Time & Space Limited is a labor of love, an idea machine, and a crossroads for art, community, and activism.”
Catskill Mountain Foundation

+“Time & Space Limited is a prime example of the importance of art in any community.”
Stan Goff, writer and activist

Risks and challenges?

The best part about this project is that there are virtually no risks—the sidewalk is already complete, and the community is already enjoying its benefit! However, funding this project will allow TSL to continue its important work in the Hudson community.


Spread the word!

If contribution is not currently feasible, there are other ways you can help.
+Follow TSL on Twitter and Tweet using #TSLpavestheway to join the conversation.
+Like TSL on Facebook and encourage your friends to do the same!
+Use the Indiegogo sharing buttons on this page to share this project via social media and e-mail.
+Check out TSL's campaign homepage for more information and sample Tweets!

Thank you for your time, and thank you for supporting the arts and community empowerment in Hudson and beyond.

story:
Contributions received @ Clayworks (in addition to indiegogo funds) = $29,430

Total (online & @Clayworks) = $33,615 (96%)


Baltimore Clayworks launches its celebratory campaign "$35,000 in 35 days" to help sustain the organization for another 35+ years - join the party!

It is with the support, guidance and accomplishments of all those that have been a part of Clayworks’ rich history that enable us now to reach new audiences, connect to new participants and partners, continue our quality programming and begin new initiatives that will ensure that Clayworks remains a leader in ceramics and community arts.

With our nationally and internationally recognized artists involved at Clayworks, we are able to offer quality clay instruction to those at our Mt. Washington campus and the surrounding communities in Baltimore city and county.

Clayworks is committed to making the arts accessible to those who otherwise would have limited or no access, bringing professional ceramic artists to Baltimore to work with youth and senior adults at our satellite studios, Jubilee Arts, Zeta Center for Active and Healthy Aging, Tuerk House and in other spaces in their own communities.

By partnering with organizations already imbedded in the life of the neighborhoods and developing art-making programs that meet the interests of the community, Baltimore Clayworks has successfully worked with broad and diverse groups of residents in Baltimore for over three decades.

This rings true with our Clay for All satellite studio and partner, Jubilee Arts, which is a program of Newborn Holistic Ministries. Clayworks has worked with Jubilee Arts for 6 years and provides clay programming throughout the year to a wide variety of ages and ability levels in the Sandtown–Winchester, Upton and surrounding communities on the west side of Baltimore City.

“An important part of community arts is that we are working to change the environment and culture of the people in Sandtown, [and other Baltimore neighborhoods] through clay. Dealing with the pros and cons of this under-served community and building relationships that are everlasting – we are part of the solution.” says Director of Community Engagement, Herb Massie

YOU can help make a difference as Clayworks moves into our 35th year.

Give Clayworks a birthday gift & get a gift in return!

Here are the giving levels & how each affects Clayworks throughout the year:

$5,000 = ½ year of programming at Clay For All! satellite studio, Tuerk House

$2,500= 12 weeks of community arts programming, such as Man Alive Lane Treatment Center, Zeta Center, Jubilee Arts, and more!

$1,000 = fellowship artist materials stipend for 10 months.

$750 = scholarship for 2 students to attend summer camp in Mt. Washington.

$500 = installation expenses for one 6 week exhibition.

$250 = a one day workshop for 12 people

$100 = firing for one 6-week session of programming

$75 = 1 day of an exhibition installer

$50= one instructor for a 1.5 hour class

$25 = clay for 12 students to make 1 project

$10 = 1 set of tools for off-site programming

MORE ABOUT CLAYWORKS

Baltimore Clayworks’ mission is to develop, promote and sustain an artist-centered community, which provides outstanding artistic, educational and collaborative programs in the ceramic arts.  Founded in 1980 by a group of nine community-minded ceramic artists, Baltimore Clayworks has developed a strong local and global reputation for artists’ development coupled with sustained community engagement. 

Each year Baltimore Clayworks serves over 15,000; has 12 artists in residence, 4 visiting artists and 20-25 exhibitions in our galleries in Mt. Washington. Clayworks has over 60 professional teaching artists and nearly 400 additional exhibiting artists throughout the year. Annually we teach over 1,500 students in our studios in Mt. Washington and over 2,000 students through our Community Arts programs.

ARTISTS' RESIDENCIES are at the heart of the organization; juried from national and international applicants, they are supported by superb studio facilities and community. Both visiting and resident artists have 24 hour access to workspaces, equipment, and electric and gas kilns housed in the studio facilities. In addition, Clayworks houses the region’s only public access wood firing kiln, a Japanese-style Noborigama 2-chambered kiln.

(Current solo exhibition by Sam Wallace, Resident Artist)

CERAMIC ART INSTRUCTION for all ages and skill levels are conceived of, planned, and taught by working artists in three well-equipped teaching studios on the Mt. Washington campus in the Studio Building. In 2014, there were over 1,500 student enrollments, of which over 300 were children.

“Community interest and engagement in our classrooms provides for a diverse student population with one shared interest – clay. Through clay the classroom becomes a wonderful place to connect with new friends and share in the creative process. Our classroom goal is to nurture a creative and welcoming environment in which the community can grow and thrive through the clay process.” says Education Coordinator, Matt Hyleck

EXHIBITIONS of ceramics are free and open to the public 7 days a week and showcase the wide range of artistic expression possible in clay– from functional pottery and figurative sculpture to installation and wall works. More than 20 individual and group exhibitions are presented annually showcasing over 400 artists.  Sales of artwork benefit exhibiting artists and the institution and are managed in the galleries and on-line store.

COMMUNITY ARTS provides accessible and affordable ceramics programming to youth, adults, senior adult and families in underserved communities, those with disabilities and those in addiction recovery across Baltimore City and County. Clayworks is the only arts organization in the region that has developed, funded, launched and operated satellite studio locations in inner city Baltimore. Since 2003, we have established Clay for All! Satellite studios, providing working studio/classrooms which offer artist-led activities in ceramics for the city’s underserved children and senior adults, primarily in Baltimore’s west side.

Please join us in continuing these efforts and creating more exciting initiatives in the coming year. We remain grateful for all of your support!
story_txt:
Contributions received @ Clayworks (in addition to indiegogo funds) = $29,430Total (online & @Clayworks) = $33,615 (96%)Baltimore
Clayworks launches its celebratory campaign "$35,000 in 35 days" to
help sustain the organization for another 35+ years - join the party!
It is with
the support, guidance and accomplishments of all those that have been a part of
Clayworks’ rich history that enable us now to reach new audiences, connect to
new participants and partners, continue our quality programming and begin new
initiatives that will ensure that Clayworks remains a leader in ceramics and
community arts. 
With our
nationally and internationally recognized artists involved at Clayworks, we are
able to offer quality clay instruction to those at our Mt. Washington campus
and the surrounding communities in Baltimore city and county.
Clayworks is
committed to making the arts accessible to those who otherwise would have
limited or no access, bringing professional ceramic artists to Baltimore to
work with youth and senior adults at our satellite studios, Jubilee Arts, Zeta
Center for Active and Healthy Aging, Tuerk House and in other spaces in their
own communities. By partnering with organizations already imbedded in the
life of the neighborhoods and developing art-making programs that meet the
interests of the community, Baltimore Clayworks has successfully worked with
broad and diverse groups of residents in Baltimore for over three decades.
This rings
true with our Clay for All satellite studio and partner, Jubilee Arts,
which is a program of Newborn Holistic Ministries. Clayworks has worked with
Jubilee Arts for 6 years and provides clay programming throughout the year to a
wide variety of ages and ability levels in the Sandtown–Winchester, Upton and
surrounding communities on the west side of Baltimore City.
“An
important part of community arts is that we are working to change the
environment and culture of the people in Sandtown, [and other Baltimore
neighborhoods] through clay. Dealing with the pros and cons of this
under-served community and building relationships that are everlasting – we are
part of the solution.” says
Director of Community Engagement, Herb Massie


YOU can help make a difference as Clayworks moves
into our 35th year. 
Give
Clayworks a birthday gift & get a gift in return!
Here are the
giving levels & how each affects Clayworks throughout the year:
$5,000 = ½ year of programming at Clay For
All! satellite studio, Tuerk House
$2,500= 12 weeks of community arts
programming, such as Man Alive Lane Treatment Center, Zeta Center, Jubilee
Arts, and more!
$1,000 = fellowship artist materials stipend
for 10 months. 
$750 = scholarship for 2 students to attend
summer camp in Mt. Washington.
$500 = installation expenses for one 6 week
exhibition.
$250 = a one day workshop for 12 people
$100 = firing for one 6-week session of
programming
$75 = 1 day of an exhibition installer
$50= one instructor for a 1.5 hour
class
$25 = clay for 12 students to make 1 project
$10 = 1 set of tools for off-site programming
MORE ABOUT
CLAYWORKS
Baltimore
Clayworks’ mission is to develop, promote and sustain an artist-centered
community, which provides outstanding artistic, educational and collaborative
programs in the ceramic arts.  Founded in 1980 by a group
of nine community-minded ceramic artists, Baltimore Clayworks has developed a
strong local and global reputation for artists’ development coupled with
sustained community engagement.  
Each year
Baltimore Clayworks serves over 15,000; has 12 artists in residence, 4 visiting
artists and 20-25 exhibitions in our galleries in Mt. Washington. Clayworks has
over 60 professional teaching artists and nearly 400 additional exhibiting
artists throughout the year. Annually we teach over 1,500 students in our
studios in Mt. Washington and over 2,000 students through our Community Arts
programs. 
ARTISTS' RESIDENCIES are at the
heart of the organization; juried from national and international applicants,
they are supported by superb studio facilities and community. Both visiting and
resident artists have 24 hour access to workspaces, equipment, and electric and
gas kilns housed in the studio facilities. In addition, Clayworks houses the
region’s only public access wood firing kiln, a Japanese-style Noborigama
2-chambered kiln. 
(Current solo exhibition by Sam Wallace, Resident Artist)
CERAMIC ART INSTRUCTION for all
ages and skill levels are conceived of, planned, and taught by working artists
in three well-equipped teaching studios on the Mt. Washington campus in the
Studio Building. In 2014, there were over 1,500 student enrollments, of which
over 300 were children.
“Community
interest and engagement in our classrooms provides for a diverse student
population with one shared interest – clay. Through clay the classroom becomes
a wonderful place to connect with new friends and share in the creative
process. Our classroom goal is to nurture a creative and welcoming environment
in which the community can grow and thrive through the clay process.” says Education Coordinator, Matt Hyleck
EXHIBITIONS of ceramics are free and open to the public 7
days a week and showcase the wide range of artistic expression possible in
clay– from functional pottery and figurative sculpture to installation and wall
works. More than 20 individual and group exhibitions are presented annually
showcasing over 400 artists.  Sales of artwork benefit exhibiting artists
and the institution and are managed in the galleries and on-line store.
COMMUNITY ARTS provides accessible and affordable
ceramics programming to youth, adults, senior adult and families in underserved
communities, those with disabilities and those in addiction recovery across
Baltimore City and County. Clayworks is the only arts organization in the
region that has developed, funded, launched and operated satellite studio
locations in inner city Baltimore. Since 2003, we have established Clay for
All! Satellite studios, providing working studio/classrooms which offer
artist-led activities in ceramics for the city’s underserved children and
senior adults, primarily in Baltimore’s west side. 
Please join
us in continuing these efforts and creating more exciting initiatives in the
coming year. We remain grateful for all of your support!

story:
Welcome to Our Bus Campaign! 

Hi, we are Alisa and Phil, a couple who recently purchased a 1990 Ward school bus with the vision to turn it into our first home, and embarking on a tour of the West Coast. Upon completing this mission, we intend to chase our dreams of travel, art, music, and exploration, and we want you to be a part of this process. How? By backing this project, we will give you something meaningful to us that we have created.

This is a movement we are starting in our lives- to bring beauty to life with our hands, connect with the people we've cared about but haven't had the freedom to spend time with, meet new faces and make long lasting friendships, inspire others to live simpler, live healthily...

So why use Indiegogo? Because its sole missions is to inspire and produce creativity, and this bus is the biggest and most important creative project so far in our lives. 

Our Goal:

  • Live a minimalist lifestyle through our independence and mindfulness. 
  • Have a vessel to take people with us as we explore what makes this country a great place to live. 
  • Enrich people's lives through our creative works. 
  • To make lasting positive environmental changes through aforesting.

The First Steps:

  • Get a bus - completed
  • Take out the seats, flooring, and rust - completed
  • Acquire materials, furniture, appliances, etc. - in progress
  • Do the work - in progress
  • Start the journey - need to do

The West Coast Tour:

When the bus is ready to go, the real journey will begin. Our first goal is to drive from our current residence in San Antonio, to the beautiful Northwest. Along the way we plan to hit some of the most popular cities, the most gorgeous natural wonders of the west, and hopefully find some secret local treasures along the way, most of which neither of us have ever experienced.

REWARDS!

Yes, rewards! Because let's face it, we all like to be rewarded for our good faith. And we're not just asking for free hand-outs here; we want to thank you in the most tangible and personal way we can.

We don't just want to send out mass thank you letters or video's to "everyone who helped make this possible". We want to send something to you personally, that you can keep with you, or something that we made with our hands. Something you can use.

Of course, the bigger the contribution, the better the reward. As you scroll down the awards column you will find ways to directly impact, and become a part of our experience.

 Where the Funds Will Go:

Thus far we've already acquired some needed materials to get the bus road ready, such as rust dissolver, primer, paint, new batteries, tools, plywood, a compact washing machine, and so on. We have also found much cheaper alternatives to the living necessities we have yet to invest in. Here is our list of what we still need:

  • Flooring: $100
  • Walls and ceiling: $200  
  • Furniture: $300
  • Plumbing and Electrical: $350 
  • Composting Toilet: $1000 
  • Stove: $50 

Stretch Goals:

For every stretch goal we accomplish, we will be able to upgrade our home with a necessary improvement that will make the bus more habitable, sustainable, and environmentally friendly.

  • Goal #1: Solar Panels: $1500
  • Goal #2: Veggie Oil Conversion: $2000

Risks and challenges

Naturally, with any sort of road trip, breakdowns are always possibilities. Before we take this bus ANYWHERE we will take it to a shop to get a full check-up, and will do so again half-way to Seattle. 
Should something go amiss between those check-points we will have insurance, and we will have an emergency fund to get us back on the road as quickly as possible. Much care and attention will be taken when making the bus fully ready for our cross country road trip.
