story:
Hello All,

Who am I, What do I do?

My name is Karen (Kaz).  I'm very driven by my creative ideas.                                      For the past 20 something years I have obsessed, created and sold original artworks. I can't help myself!  Paintings, sculptures and jewellery... just to name a few of my art addictions.

'This girl needs help you say",    'YES I do!'

What Happened?

All was good in the land of Kaz, until one day I had to quit my beloved job working with an old school Upholsterer, very sad.  I have neck and back issues which were severely aggravated by my labor intensive job.


My job search efforts have not unfolded a suitable job, one that caters for fluctuating pain levels. I need to sit or stand for short periods, mixing it up,   soooo.... guess what?  I intend to pursue my creative journey full time, making and selling jewellery, paintings and prints, quirky dolls, altered art, garden murals and holding art classes in my studio to pass on my knowledge. Self employment allows me to sit or stand as needed. I also commence studying Micro Business at the end of February.  Here is some more of the work I will be making:

The help that I'm seeking

Something cool will come your way too!

 I have a 6m x 5m shed which is HALF lined and insulated, potentially the perfect studio for any quirky artist. 

In order to make a living I need to finish lining my studio. I have virtually all of the materials ready to go. The only space I have to work at the moment is the corner of my dining table. A lot of my materials are still packed in the studio so they don't get dirty which makes them difficult to access... frustrating too!

The $1200 I am attempting to raise:

  1.   Is to pay a lovely builder man to finish lining the walls and ceiling- $500
  2.   To connect the power, the cables are run but not connected - $350
  3.   To purchase a cheap little second hand shed so I can remove all my tools and shed type things out of the studio space. $100

  4.   This amount also assists with materials for 'perks' and Indiegogo fees

If $500 is my total in contributions that would be fantastic too! I would have the walls and ceiling in the studio lined and just run a power cord from the house. Obviously I'd love to have the whole lot of work completed but I would still be up and running, which is my main aim.

Once upon a perfect day I would have completed the studio lining myself, I did the first half! The studio is too dirty and hot, with the Aussie climate, to use as is. I work a lot with fabric too so I need a clean space.

What you get...

I'm not asking for 'money for nothing'. What I'm essentially doing is Pre-selling my art and craft to fund the work on my studio so I can start working. I have chosen 'flexible funding' for this campaign, which means if my $1200 goal is not met I still  get to keep what you have contributed, and you will still receive the Perk that you have chosen. Any contribution would make an amazing difference to me and help towards getting me up and running in my business.

Here's where you come in. . . . 

$10 Perk

Huge massive thank you and 3 x 2-1/4" badges of your choice from my characters below 'Adventures of Pip and Todd', posted to you. These guys were originally painted onto rather tired 1970's paintings, I brightened them up :-)


$20 Perk

A Massive thank you AND a Set of three 4" x 6" prints of some of my characters from the 'Adventures of Pip and Todd', for you to frame. These guys were originally painted onto rather tired 1970's paintings, I brightened them up ;-)  You choose which set from below.

$35 Perk

A Whopping Big Thank You AND a Personalized 32mm round Stainless Steel or Brass necklace with a 16" chain. Your choice of up to 5 words hand stamped just for you. If you'd like more words let me know and I will see if I can fit them on.


$50 Perk

A Big Big Big Thank You AND an original 1850's Frozen Charlotte doll on a necklace. These dolls have recently been dug up in Germany at an old doll factory, part of their appeal is they are rustic and their arms are missing. Yours will look very similar to this photo.


$80 Perk

A Huge Big THANK YOU... AND A one-of original doll necklace fashioned from doll parts dating from 1890's with odd findings as limbs. Each will be SIMILAR to the photo but NOT IDENTICAL because I'm working with old material. The main body will look pretty much the same but the limbs may be old keys, clock hands or vintage earring parts.... but still very cool! Comes with a long chain.


$100 Perk

A Massive Huge Thank You AND a Personalized stamped spoon necklace. You can choose one of these sayings or your own saying or your kids names etc. I can't guarantee you will get the identical spoon design you have chosen cos these spoons are old but I WILL try to find one as similar as possible. PLUS An original Frozen Charlotte Doll from 1850's on a necklace. These dolls were recently found in Germany at an old doll factory. PLUS you can choose one of my prints pictured in the $20 perk But as an 8" x 11" print, for you to frame, just let me know which one :-)

AND

AND an 8" x 11" Print

$150 Perk

A Gigantic Huge Thank You AND A one-of original doll necklace fashioned from doll parts dating from 1890's with odd findings as limbs. Each will be SIMILAR to the photo but NOT IDENTICAL because I'm working with old material. The main body will look pretty much the same but the limbs may be old keys, clock hands or vintage earring parts.... but still very cool! Comes with a long chain. PLUS a Personalized stamped spoon necklace. You can choose one of these sayings or choose your own or your kids names, up to you. I can't guarantee you will get the identical spoon design you have chosen cos these spoons are old but I WILL try to find one as similar as possible. PLUS a set of Three 8" x 11" prints, you choose a set, for you to frame.

AND

AND a set of 8" x 11" prints x 3

$200 Perk

The BIGGEST HUGEST THANK YOU ... AND ... A great gift pack for family, friends or yourself! You get A one-of original doll necklace fashioned from doll parts dating from 1890's with odd findings as limbs. Each will be SIMILAR to the photo but NOT IDENTICAL because I'm working with old material. The main body will look pretty much the same but the limbs may be old keys, clock hands or vintage earring parts.... but still very cool! Comes with a long chain. PLUS Personalized stamped spoon necklace. You can choose one of these sayings or choose your own or your kids names, up to you. I can't guarantee you will get the identical spoon design you have chosen cos these spoons are old but I WILL try to find one as similar as possible. PLUS An original Frozen Charlotte Doll from 1850's on a necklace. These dolls were recently found in Germany at an old doll factory. PLUS a set of   three 4" x 6" prints, for you to frame. PLUS five 2-1/4" badges of your choice.  The prints and badges are from my original paintings 'Adventures of Pip and Todd'.

Risks and Challenges

Shipping

I will do everything in my power to deliver your Perks to you by the due date.
With my choice of 'Flexible Funding' for this Campaign I can start work straight away on your Perk. My only hold up may be if materials I order don't turn up quick enough although most deliveries in the past have been quite speedy. The majority of the materials I require are easily accessible to me. It will be a little challenging making my art without my studio, the little corner of my dining table will be very busy indeed lol.
I will be posting updates as the Campaign progresses to keep you in the loop.

Payments

Payments can be made using Paypal. Its quick and easy. This type of payment reaches me immediately so I can get started on your Perk straight away.

Other ways you could help - pretty please

I fully understand that not everyone is in the position to contribute money but you could truly help by sharing my cause. There are several share links up along the top left to make it easy. Facebook sharing would be extra amazingly helpful... please and thank you x


Some of my achievements

Brought up 3 fantastic children on my own - now adults. Renovated several homes over the years. Painted a few large public murals, another coming up. Ran an art gallery with local artists work. Participated in countless exhibitions, joint and solo. A member of Professional Artists Network in which part of my role was treasurer. I worked for an Upholsterer for 5 years. Owned a business making and marketing  baby slings that I designed - 5-1/2 years. Currently I supply artwork in 4 local Gallery/cafes... just the start!

I make my dreams come true. In my spare time I enjoy family and friends... art and some more art, of course!  I dream about the old wagon sitting in my garden that will one day become my garden shed, when its turned into a gypsy caravan yayyy!  I'm not into television or politics, but do however have a passion for..... Chocolate! YUM.        OH! And marionette puppets.

Thank you for reaching the bottom of the page... Well done you!

You can find me on my Jewel and the Gipsy Facebook page                                                  Please visit my facebook page

Website coming soon

You can find me on my Jewel and the Gipsy Facebook page                                                  Please visit my facebook page
Website coming soon

story:
Short Summary

  • Sasquatch Glass is the leading functional glass company, founded in June 2012 by experienced glass industry veterans.
  • Sasquatch Glass looks to expand into barware and decorative glass and needs to hire, increase production and marketing in order to complete this expansion.
  • With your contribution to the "I helped Sasquatch" campaign, you will be a part of funding glass industry history, the dawning of a great art company expanding its product line.

What We Need & What You Get

  • 2.5 year old award-winning Sasquatch Glass is seeking to raise $500,000 for hiring, production expansion and capital expenditures including office and warehousing facillities
  • With your contribution to this effort, Sasquatch Glass has created a range of Limited Edition momentos as a thank you for contributing.
  • If we don't reach entire goal, we will begin this quest anyway and find the balance of the fnding elsewhere, but we have done too much leg work and proven our model to not move forward with this strategy.

The Impact

  • Sasquatch Glass' "Be Legendary Baby" style ethos encourages people to be artistic, tasteful and responsible in their lifestyle product decisions. People take it to the next level in everything they do when Sasquatch Glass is involved.
  • We are a 2.5 year old company who has tripled sales in each of our first three years. Don't you want to be a part of contributing to that success in the future?
  • We are already a leader in the ancillary glass business and seek to expand our range of product offerings to include decorative glass and barware.

Risks & Challenges

A self-funded company to date, the founders invested the first $500,000 and have put their money where their mouth is.

  • Having figured out the glass business, our biggest risks involve hiring superstars who share our vision to be able to successfully carry it out.
  • Because we have already succeeded as an award-winning glass company, we are uniquely qualified and prepared for this expansion offering.
  • A former disciple of legendary sales master Chet Holmes, CEO excels at hiring superstars.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, make a purchase on sasquatchglass.com, @sasquatchglass on instagram, Sasquatch Glass on facebook.

story:
Welcome to the Cheesecake Calendar!

Hi! We are The Cheesecake Calendar! We are a queer, inclusive pin-up calendar designed BY and FOR queer people. We are creating this calendar because we feel that there is a lack of representative erotic and beauty photography directed towards us and the rest of our community. The idea of a calendar came from its iconography and our desire to infiltrate the mainstream and reclaim more symbols, while making something that people can comfortably hang on their walls. Also, we just wanted to bring you 12 pictures of hot babes! 

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to raise $4500, and that will cover everything needed for this project, from studio rentals and bridge fare to props and lighting equipment. It also includes the first printing of 200 calendars and shipping them anywhere in the world*. 

We're working both on location in the San Francisco Bay Area and in a rental studio, which will cost an estimated $600 for 12 hours of studio work, and renting various lighting equipment (strobes, batteries, softboxes, etc) for some of the location shoots. 

Due to the variety of shoots planned, props will vary considerably. We're planning on buying things like a deerstalker cap, a cat harness, Christmas socks, and makeup products. We will be buying pies and warm drinks for various shoots, as well a variety of gourds and squash and A LOT of baby wipes. 

Finally, the funding for the calendar itself. We are requesting funds to produce, print and ship exactly 215 calendars. We are using a family-owned printing company located in the southeastern USA for both the calendar itself all perk prints, and will be shipping everything manually from the Bay Area. We also plan on throwing a small party to launch the calendar some time in November. 

Now the fun stuff - PERKS. We know not everyone will be able to afford the $20 calendar, so we're added perks at a lower cost. For $5, you get a thank-you email from the founders, while for $10 you get a small print and thank-you letter sealed with a kiss. 

$20 is the base cost for us to produce a calendar, so that's how much we're asking.

For $50 you get a calendar signed by one of the models - for $75 you get a calendar signed by ALL of the models. 

We're planning on throwing a launch party in November - for $150, you'll be sent an invitation for two along with the autographed calendar. 

Finally, for $250, you'll be sent all of that - a calendar signed by everyone, a thank-you letter, a small print and two tickets to the launch party, AND you'll be given a donor thank you on all our social media and in the calendar itself!

If we don't reach our funding goal, priority one is making sure the shoots are completed. Second priority will be getting calendars to as many of our backers as we can. No matter what, we will be selling prints and calendars on Redbubble come December. 

* Due to the high cost of international shipping, we request that you add an additional $15 to your donation. 

The Intention

We and nearly everyone we know has felt at one time underrepresented and often as a result, unattractive. We want to change that. There is a huge range of what is considered beautiful or hot, and our goal is to showcase as many types as we can. While we can't undo the erasure of queer identities we all experience, we hope to in our own way bring the amazing beauty and hotness of our community to the front and - most importantly - make people feel like babes just by being who they are. 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is not raising enough money to complete all of our shoots. Once principle photography is completed, we have the resources to change plans if necessary and ensure that some form of this product gets out into the world.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can still help us spread the word about this project. We are on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, and you can always contact us via email if you have any skills or resources or any desire to contribute, let us know - we can use any and all help.

story:
Meet Lumious

The light bulb has been around for 135 years, and while we have more energy efficient technologies: Lights act the same as they did over a century ago.

Lumilabs is focused on what kind of lighting is good for our biology. We believe that lighting should not only enable us to see, but improve our mood and productivity. 

Lumious is like hanging a window where you can't have one.
Brilliant sky-scapes model a clear sunny day in July, everyday. 

Features

  • A simple minimalist design
  • Premium Materials
    - Machined Aluminum
    - Frosted Glass
  • Easily mounts on any wall
  • Next generation multi-color LED technology

Before Lumious

We offer two tiers for those who want to support, but can't have Lumious yet.

Envious Edison

Donate $25 to help us turn lighting on its head.
We'll send vase made out of a light bulb turned on its head!

Contributor

Donate $10 and we'll proudly emblazon your name on our website for prosperity.
In the future, you'll be able to show your grandkids you helped drive the change for better lighting.

Lighting and Biology

Lumious was designed to take advantage a newly understood biological relationship between brain function and specific wavelengths of light.

We know what type of light makes you more alert, and which light helps you see.
Luckily, the two barely mix.

Blue Light

Scientific: Retinal exposure to light frequencies between 460nm and 480nm decreases melatonin production. This mechanism is triggered by ganglion cells that contain melanopsin.

Plain English: A specific range of blue light can help keep you awake.

This animation shows our sunrise algorithm on the left.
On the right, we've stripped away everything except the energy giving blue light so you can see how the intensity grows throughout the day.


Where's the proof?

These are a few of our favorite blue light studies:

This study showed a decrease in stress with an increase in well being and cognitive performance.

This study shows it goes great with caffeine.

This study shows that even visually blind individuals exhibit an increase in cognitive performance.


Human Centric Lighting

From the Human Centric Lighting Society's Mission:
"We promote Human Centric Lighting, which can also be called human factors in lighting, biophilia or other names, can improve circadian rhythms, mood – preferences, visual acuity, performance and energy savings – sustainability. We firmly believe that existing and upcoming dimming and Kelvin changing products, mostly LED, which are so good for Human Centric Lighting, will become as significant as Edison creating the light bulb."


Manufacturing

We have two plans for manufacturing, that depend on the number of units ordered.
In the long run, it is our goal to create our own micro-factory for machining and assembly.
We are makers after all.

Strategy I

We are fortunate to have great relationships with local manufacturers.
These relationships allow us to produce Lumious in unit counts as small as 20.
If the total number of units accounted for at the end of the campaign are less than 700, we will leverage these existing partners. 

Strategy II

If we find there is an overwhelming interest in Lumious, we are prepared to use the funds we raise to purchase a CNC mill and hire a machinist with over 30 years of experience.

Technical Specs

Dimensions: 23" x 5" x 1"
Power: 5V 10A power supply



About LumiLabs

Ariel and Chris are both graduates of the
Erie Technology Incubator's Technology Business Accelerator. 
They are also current participants in Thrill Mill's 2015 class.

LumiLabs has chosen to participate in the Rust Built movement as a Pennsylvania and New York based start-up.
It is our dream to see innovative products manufactured in the rust belt once again. After all, the people of this region are already expert makers, craftsmen, and manufacturers.

Meet the Team 

Ariel Grace Armstrong - Business

Ariel has her MBA from Chatham University. 
She is currently the Director of Development at Rodef Shalom Congregation. 
She has a passion for small business development and women's entrepreneurial leadership.
Ariel works on seeking grant opportunities, customer service, and sales. 

Christopher Smolinski - Engineering

Chris is a software engineer at M*Modal working on speech recognition software.
He began using multi-color LEDs in 2010 in his senior design project at Gannon University.
Chris has designed the software and hardware behind Lumious.

story:
The Plan to End this War.

For decades we have been fighting a losing battle against the cuddly cutness hordes. We never had a chance against their fluffy. Cats are now dominating our world while our numbers are dwindling. The remaining few have banded together to create a instrument of salvation. The King Mahtusahn will be at the frontline. 

  • We are a small bad of survivors who have combined our welding, programing, and engineering background to build a machine that will not only resist cuddles but also use their weakness against them.

Invest in Cat Bonds Now!

  • We need your help to gathering raw materials. Steel, electrical, LED's and sound and fuel.
  • Help us complete the project to join the frontline in the Black Rock Desert.


Vehicle Features

*Comfortable to transport up to 7 personnel including driver and turret operator

*Cushioned R&R platform 

*Felinoflage 

*Anti-scratch protection armor 

*Motivational RBG light patterns 

*Interactive Team building


Turret Features

*360 degree rotation 

*Pneumatic powered S.N.U.F.F.(Scionic Nuclear Uber Friskies Felocide) Cannons 

*Sound system 

*Feline Raid Siren



Other Ways You Can Help

  • We are in need of more creative people.
  • If you are a Bay Area local and want to learn how to weld, we would love to teach you and use the help.
  • Arduino programmers lend us your knowledge
  • Spay and Neuter

Spay and Neuter

story:
Migrants Matter and the Convention: a Love Story 

Migrants Matter itself was created back in October 2013 with the goal of raising awareness about the situation of migrants in Europe and to put their rights back on the political agendas of EU member states and the EU itself. Our ultimate goal is to protect the rights of migrants and persuade member states to ratify the United Nations Migrant Workers Convention.  We have been working to reach this goal through researching and writing articles, holding events and A LOT of lobbying. 

Our love story with the Convention truly began in February 2015 when Migrants Matter decided to launch the Illustrate Our Rights campaign.  We read, reread, simplified, explained, read, ran 20Km for its ratification (twice!), wrote about, roamed the streets of Venice and lobbied for, defended and read once more the Convention. And now we decided to make an illustrated booklet out of it that is both easy to read and understand! And why, you ask?

Well, we are about 20 individuals from all around the world who share the same passion for migrants rights. What we also share is a love for art.That's when it hit us! Let's create a booklet with illustrations about the different rights of migrant workers in order to provide everyone (migrants, politicians, NGOS, activists and anyone interested) with the necessary knowledge to understand the Convention.

The booklet will explain the Convention in simple, easy to understand language and use works of art to illustrate the rights of migrants.  The completed project is expected to be released on International Migrants Day and in Celebration of the 25th Anniversary of the United Nations Migrant Workers Convention on  December 18, 2015. Its name? You guessed right: Illustrate Our Rights!

This booklet is a unique project, a combination of wonderful art pieces by talented artists and easy to understand explanations of migrants' rights.  We welcome you to be part of it, follow the process of its development, and be among the first that will hold the result in your hands (or have it in the screen of your laptop!).

You can do this by donating and helping us create the first-ever booklet about migrants rights! We will keep you updated about the process until the very end. 


How we use the money we collect?


With the money we collect through this campaign we want to bring the Illustrate Our Rights booklet to life. This means printing, printing and some more printing. We also plan to promote it by making leaflets, brochures, cards, pins and cool t-shirts.

At least 1000 euros will be spent on our main launching event which will take place in Brussels on December 18th to celebrate the 25th Anniversary of the Convention, to which you are all invited. The event is free and open to the public. Coffee, food and beverages are on the house but despite the fact that we have some excellent cooks among us that will bring a sense of multiculturality in your plates, we still need to buy the raw materials. 


Furthermore, your donations will help us create copies of the Illustrate Our Rights Booklet to share with politicians, activists, NGOs that work for the rights of migrants, and of course anyone that is interested in learning more about this important human rights instrument.


The Perks of Being a Migrants Rights Supporter


Are you excited yet? 

Wait until you hear about our unique perks! By donating you can get an e-booklet of Illustrate Our Rights, a cool Illustrate Our Rights t-shirt, a copy of the booklet delivered to your address or even be part of our event in Brussels to celebrate with us the 25th Anniversary of the Convention and the launching of our booklet!


In case we do not reach our 3000 euros goal we are going to use the funds we raised either way to organise our event and make as many copies of Illustrate our Rights as possible. We are already grateful for every penny!


PLEASE NOTE: You can pledge multiple times to receive multiple perks!


The Impact


Your contribution would mean the world to us! Not only because we will be able to create the first booklet about migrant workers' right and to organise the launching event but also because it will contribute to the promotion of these rights in Europe and worldwide. 


Risks & Challenges


Ok, we have to admit it. Fighting for migrant workers' rights has not been a piece of cake and we know that there are still many challenges to face, starting with finalising our booklet and the organisation of the event (do you know how hard it is to book a venue in Brussels or persuade artists to participate in your project?)  Until the 18th of December a lot of things can go wrong but we are going to deal with them as a team like we have always done. And if we have your support.. well, that's even better!


Other Ways You Can Help


In case you cannot contribute but still believe in our campaign, share this page with the (internet) world and help us make the Illustrate Our Rights project widely known.

Help us make this happen!

Fighting for migrant workers' rights has not been a piece of cake and we know that there are still many challenges to face, starting with finalising our booklet and the organisation of the event (do you know how hard it is to book a venue in Brussels or persuade artists to participate in your project?)  Until the 18th of December a lot of things can go wrong but we are going to deal with them as a team like we have always done. And if we have your support.. well, that's even better!


Other Ways You Can Help

In case you cannot contribute but still believe in our campaign, share this page with the (internet) world and help us make the Illustrate Our Rights project widely known.

Help us make this happen!

story:
“Reclamation” -Public Sculpture Show to empower, transform, Inspire, contribute to revitalization of a City and cultivate local talent all through recycling scrap metal and fabricating into a large scale public art sculpture.  

My Name is Stacie R Laskin A.K.A “Queen of Steel” and founder of Global Recycling Inc. It is a goal of Global Recycling Inc to recycle, reclaim and reuse scrap metal in order to benefit the environment, our community, create jobs, and cultivate local talent. As the only certified woman owned and disadvantaged scrap recycling wholesaler in NYS, It is also a goal to empower other women in nontraditional fields.  

Starting from the ground up and being hands on throughout the growth of the company has enabled me to make necessary decisions, develop a team and most importantly inspire and give back to others who need to know they can accomplish their dreams also. Recently the decision to recycle scrap metal into public art was unanimous and Global Recycling Inc put out an all call for artists to submit designs based on scrap metal recycling and our environment. Upon submission review, the chosen artists had to construct a 3D model of their design to be featured in our very successful “Reclamation” Part 1 Gallery showing in the City of Newburgh, NY on January 31, 2015. The artists ranged primarily from high school students to local college students.There was a panel of industry professional judges that chose a winner based on ease of fabrication, material availability and theme. The winning artist received a $500 cash prize and the “Queen of Steel” will now be responsible in creating a large scale sculpture to be positioned for public display in a community in much need of revitalization. We would also like to assist the other students in fabricating their model/designs into a sculpture for our “Reclamation” part 2 outdoor showing in the spring of 2015.

The Winner

" Necessity of Life" by Max Evanega  is the winning model.  

Bio: I am a Dutchess Community College student and have a background in Science, Photography, and various other types of art. I have an interest in sculpture to broaden my art skills. the idea of using recyclable materials is a great way of promoting environmentally friendly concepts in to the arts. 

Concept: This sculpture is based off of the shape of the molecule of water. Water is among the most important thing for life to thrive in this world. This would tie into the environment and how important it is to recycle, just like water is perpetually recycled. We have been drinking the same water the dinosaurs have 65 million years ago."Max Evanega"

Thank You for your support!

We will utilize the money raised to help fund our Reclamation Show and  produce a large scale sculpture of the winning model for public display in a City with much need of love through art! Please help us achieve this goal to empower, inspire, recycle  and foster local talent. Any additional funds raised will be used to fabricate another model of choice from part 1 of our show.  We will continuously update all of our progress on our Global Recycling Inc Facebook page. 

Please contact me with any questions!

All the best,

Stacie R Laskin

"Queen of Steel"

Global Recycling Inc

107 Liberty Street

Newburgh NY 12550

914-213-9290

NYS Certified WBE/DBE

www.queenofsteel.com

Progress Photos are updated on Global Recycling Inc Facebook page.

story:
Thank you for taking the time to learn more about MENTAL ILLUSIONS!

Mental Illusions is  a collection of 45 photographs printed on metal.  There are also a few installation pieces that include: live "human rabbits", clowns and costume.  This is my creative outlet.  I am thankful that my family has always supported artistic ventures.  

Halloween was the one time each year I was allowed to play in my mother’s makeup case; I was always so excited!  My mom made our costumes every year;  Later in life, I began sewing my own; not only for Halloween, but for clubbing and photography.  I studied display and Exhibit Design at FIT and started working at MAC Cosmetics in 1994; this is where my makeup training began.  I’m fascinated with the concept of transformation.  I love that makeup, hair and costuming can completely disguise someone.  It’s a moment to become someone else… even if just in one’s own mind.  I think I picked up my first camera at the age of five.  I always loved taking pictures.  I used to spend hours in the darkroom printing my black and white photos...  and then I discovered Photoshop - OH THE OPPORTUNITY!”

I am  a “one-man show”, when making these images- executing the makeup, wigs, photographs, sets, and sewing my own costumes.  The process of creativity is a relaxing experience and by working alone, I’m not held to any timeframe and can experiment without judgment or expectation. 

My work draws from memories of childhood  imagination.  The images have a dreamlike quality with subject matter inspired by fairy tales seen through a distorted lens. While not the primary theme, some images do have a homo-erotic undertone in a very fantastic way.  This collection includes self-portraits and expands on the idea by using multi-exposure images to capture various manifestations of myself in one image.  I also features my niece, nicknamed Baby-cakes, in many of the photos.  Her old soul continues to inspire me with her free spirit. Pensive and retrospective,  I relate to most characters that I create, although some are simply humorous.


YOUR SUPPORT WILL HELP FUND THE RECEPTION

  • Funding will pay for the venue, rental of installation pieces, sound and the art handler
  • By supporting, you will be invited to the private preview and art reception.
  • Those who provide a donation more than $75 will receive the extended print run of the MENTAL CIRCUS T-shirt!  this is your only chance to buy this one!  it's no longer available and will not be sold at the show.

Your support will affect the scale of this show

The more money I have the bigger this show will be... and perhaps i can then bring it to other cities!

I understand that not everyone can support with funding... 

But your emotional support is still appreciated!  you can also share my fundraising venture and get people to come see the installation... it's being shown for ONE WEEK, November 18-23.

story:
I am going to  project FaceBook posts on buildings and walls next to sidewalks in public places with an intention to express my thoughts in an open environment to make a live connection with the audience. The idea behind projecting a FaceBook interface on a big screen is to get people to "Look Up"

What would we see if we just looked up?

If you just look up and around you - what will you see?

People watching is much more pleasurable than scrolling down a newsfeed - sometimes if you listen to the chirping of the birds, you don’t have to Tweet.

Many people spend large amount of time online.  Over the past few weeks and months our updates and responses on social media has revolved around the troubled situation of our country Nepal. I use the internet almost every day, and I would never argue against responsible use and the many wonderful outcomes that come from it.  But many people are using it thoughtlessly making negative, inflammatory posts. These depressing posts on social media have gone viral spreading rumors and hatred.  Damaging our relationships with each other. 

This Project is designed to use the social media platform in a constructive way, bringing the community together again.  It is easy for some people to sit behind the computer screen, anonymously, and type nasty things. We could come together, listen to each other, spread constructive messages and create positive dreams in response to our challenges.  

By connecting the virtual space with the physical space I want to send this message to a large cross-section of people beyond geographical boundaries reaching out to both online audience and passers-by in an attempt to bring us all together in a more meaningful dialogue.



 The Qumi Q7  pocket projector (Image shown) and battery backup is needed for this project.

Just simple.

story:
Background

Since 2014 I have been drawing insects. I discovered that I can group my bugs together to form amazing patterns and designs. Last year I started using these designs as wallpapers and playing with the idea of manufacturing them on a larger scale.

This year I continued to pursue my Bug Wallpapers, printing prototypes and learning about the printing process. At the same time, the bugs I draw started getting larger and more intricate,  sizes A2 and larger showing off the amazing colors and forms of these beautiful creatures.

 

 My Work

Earlier this year I was invited to show my work at ARTSOUK 2016 - a well-known, alternative art fair and auction that will be held this year at the Turnhalle in Bern, Switzerland. And this is where you come in. I am looking to raise €3,000 to go to the cost of framing my work for Artsouk, making quality, professional prints, producing wallpaper full scale and in color and printing t-shirts to promote my brand and work.

 My Project

As a single mother of two it's a challenge to finance our every day life, let alone a project like this, but taking my artwork to the next level is incredibly important to me. With the money I raise I plan on:

 printing my own bookmarks, posters, cards, t-shirts, fake tattoos and wallpaper

stocking up on paper and ink, in order to be able to keep going

 

Sharing is Caring

Bankdetails for direct donations: IBAN CH3509000000306785296. If you do donate directly, please send an email to frances_morrissey(at)hotmail.com with your address so I can send you your perks.

You can support BugLady by liking and sharing the campaign, telling anyone you think might be interested about it and sending some words of love and support my way - every little bit helps!

Perks

Perks include lots of different packages including things like buttons, bags and t-shirts, but also doodles and custom drawn bugs. I have added the busy bee print and feel free to message me with anything you are interested in purchasing.

I've also added one big perk: This amazing, larger than life monarch butterfly is 70x100cm in diameter. It can be purchased as a framed original for 1'000.-.

story:
This is for women all around the world who live in an unbalanced society.

The women who create boys that grow into men who forget their worth.

This is for every woman whose sexuality was fearlessly forgotten. 

For every fight for feminine freedom, or feminist philosophy that went unheard. 


Hello My Loves <3

  • Have you ever wonder why a woman's sexuality is so taboo and a man's sexuality is "Human Nature"? Ever wonder why a young girl is shunned for being sexually active before the age of 30, yet a man is applauded for being sexually ahead of the game at 13? Ever wonderwhy the women who embrace their sexuality are constantly criticized and labeled whores, hoes and harlots, but the world is secretly enticed by said women? I wonder! ALL OF THE TIME, so it is my honor to ask you support me in my exploration of the answer through art.
  •  My name is Summer Keiona and I am a freedom fighter and a dream believer! I currently am finishing up my MFA in Acting for Film at New York Film Academy and boy am I excited to dedicate my life to this beautiful craft and exploration of the human experience.
  • This Campaign was created to help fund the first short film from The Stray  Production Group [TSPG] written, and funded solely by little ole me :) This film will encourage its audience to seek freedom from the labels of society and embrace the fullness and beauty of self love, regardless of the stigmas alive in the status quo.
  • With your help, I know a magnificently meaningful piece of art will be produced that aims to free the minds of many, and I am so very grateful for any and all contributions made!

What "The Stray Production Group" Needs & What You Get When You Donate.

  • As of now the goal is to raise $6,000 in order to pay the cast of 8 people and crew of at least 10 people for their handwork and determination. A couple of grand will be used to book a visually stunning location that tells a story in itself and the remainder of the funds will be used to submit the short film to film festivals.
  • The people who support me the most will definitely see their names in lights ( well maybe not lights, but I definitely will dedicate this film to you and give credit of your contribution) I also would love to interview and feature you on my YouTube Chanel to let my subscribers know how awesome you are. If we meet the goal of $6,000 my top supporter will receive a GoPro Hero 4 Silver ) I personally want to thank you for helping me make my dreams into a reality and give you one of my favorite tools used in making great films.
  • If we do not make goal... Let's just focus on making the goal. Dreams come true so together if we focus on manifesting a grade A film, the funds will come!

Risks & Challenges

  • In this business of being an Actress today simply having talent is NOT ENOUGH. Producers and Directors are seeking people with "Big Names" because "Big Names" equal "Big Money" and Hollywood is a "Big Money Business". If one doesn't have a "Big Name" they must have a "Big Social Media Following" and little ole me has neither. So, with that being said, it is imperative for artist like myself to create content!
  • Also many Actresses of color are not given as many opportunities or non-stereotypical parts to play, so nowadays it is easier to stay true to the art and not sell out and play  in yet  another slave movie by writing roles with more dimension and depth.
  • I plan to start my own production company that solely produces films with depth and meaning, rather than producing films with solely business in mind. This project is the first of many movies made with a strong message in mind.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • By simply sharing the word and shedding light on the project on your personal social media platforms will help this dream come into fruition.
  • Of course money matters, so if you have it to donate, please do :)
  • Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools to get this campaign out to the world!

Thank you so much for everything!


With Love,


-Summer

story:
On July 7th I will be having a solo photography show at Fotoeffect Gallery in the Pearl District in Portland, Oregon. This is my first ever solo exhibition on the first Thursday art walk in Portland. It's big opportunity for me, and I'm very excited about it.

I've been doing photography for most of my life, but the last few years have been a period of intense creativity and renewed focus. I've been pushing myself in many ways, both creatively, and technically - deliberately throwing myself into new situations and new experiences with camera in tow. Connected to this renewed exploration of photography is a renewed passion for exploring the amazing places and landscapes that surround me in this place I am lucky to call home. For this reason this show focuses on the grand landscapes of Oregon and Washington.

The idea of a show has been in the back of my mind for a few years, but until now I've chosen to focus on the adventures, and the images, and on honing my craft. Now, this opportunity has come my way, and I've chosen take full advantage of it. This is a dream come true, but my work is truly cut out for me. I have to fill the entire gallery and every print has to be perfect, and I'm determined to do it right. Printing and framing are very expensive, and I have just over a month to pull it all together.

For this reason, I'm asking for your help. In the past I've had amazing support from fans and friends who have encouraged me, expressed admiration for my work, and bought my prints. Now I'm asking for a little more generosity so I can take full advantage of this very important opportunity to advance my artistic practice. Every penny raised in this campaign will go towards printing, framing and other production costs. Thank you for all of your generous support. I hope to see you all at the show on July 7th!

story:
Resumen

 

Juego de Niños es una serie que aborda los valores de la familia actual costarricense a partir de la comedia.

 
     
  • En esta serie buscamos se aborda la familia lejos del modelo convencional que se tiene de la misma, ya que parte de la realidad de muchas familias a nivel nacional, donde el núcleo central no está formado a partir del lazo matrimonial. Andrés, el personaje protagónico, busca romper con los miedos de sus padres al entablar una relación convencional de pareja debido a situaciones vividas por ambos a lo largo de sus vivencias familiares.
    •  
  • Con esta campaña queremos desarrollar un modelo televisivo con un contenido agradable y apropiado para la gente que ha dejado de ver la televisión nacional por la falta de una programación que satisfaga las necesidades del público que sintoniza las frecuencias televisivas "públicas".
    •  
  • Si logramos desarrollar esta campaña no solo estaremos aportando para la creación de televisión con contenido, sino también le estaremos diciendo a las cadenas televisivas costarricenses que no queremos más formatos extranjeros que no aportan nada a nuestra sociedad.
  • Una vez recaudados los fondos se utilizaran para el pago del crew, el elenco, gastos de producción y para pagar el espacio televisivo correspondiente para su difusión, En el caso de no lograr vender la idea en la televisión nacional también se están considerando la utilización de plataformas online para así llegar a una mayor cantidad de público.
 
 
 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

 

El apoyo de todos para este proyecto es importantísimo, ya sea desde la ayuda económica hasta compartiendo este enlace para que lleguemos a muchas más personas.

     
  • Para llevar a cabo este proyecto necesitamos $50 000 para poder salir con los gastos de la producción y poder pagarle tanto al crew como al elenco el monto justo por su trabajo.
    •  
  • A los que nos apoyen económicamente les estaremos recompensando con la aparición de sus nombres como uno de nuestros productores hasta la aparición en la misma serie, a lo largo de los 30 episodios que buscamos desarrollar.
    •  
  • Los fondos van con miras a desarrollar la serie, ya sea que logremos o no la meta, el dinero que recibamos podrá darnos el empujón que necesitamos para arrancar con este proyecto.
    •  
 
 
 

El impacto

 

Además del hecho de demostrar que no necesitamos de la programación enlatada que nos venden día con día a nivel nacional, también estaremos dando el paso para la creación de más programas de calidad dentro de la franja televisiva costarricense ¿Por qué?

 
     
  • Con el éxito de este proyecto mucha gente se arriesgará, al igual que nosotros a desarrollar sus ideas para mejorar la televisión costarricense.
    •  
  • Desplazaríamos los formatos extranjeros con ideas propias, que parten de gente común como lo somos nosotros.
    •  
  • Generaríamos más y mejores contenidos, adecuados a los valores que queremos ver en la televisión.
    •  
 
 
 

Riesgos y desafíos

 

No va a ser sencillo, vamos a estar nadando contra corriente al enfrentarnos a las televisoras que han invadido sus horarios de contenidos con el único fin de lograr dinero.

 
     
  • Hay que batallar contra los formatos que han abarrotado la franja de programación estelar y que presentan un contenido únicamente apoyado por los patrocinadores, que buscan generar alcance a sus productos sin pensar en el contenido que financian.
    •  
  • La única forma para desafiarlos es presentando un producto más atractivo para llamar la atención del público y, así, desviar ese poderío a las ideas que tenemos los costarricenses para una mejor televisión,
    •  
 
 
 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Además del aporte económico puede apoyarnos compartiendo este proyecto para poder sacar adelante nuestro objetivo.

Mil gracias por sacar el ratito para ver nuestra propuesta.
story_txt:

story:
Summary

Hello! I’m Mary Elizabeth Cantu, Founder of Spare Parts—San Antonio’s only creative reuse initiative. In 2011, I founded Spare Parts to support & sustain arts education & creativity in our classrooms. We rely on donations of materials & volunteers to support our annual Fine Arts Fair. Since 2011 we have delivered tons of perfectly usable supplies from our landfills & made these materials available to our education, non-profit & artistic community. Do you remember our first Fine Arts Fair? Thanks to ArtGives.Org we can stroll down memory lane with this video.

It’s time to make Spare Parts a full-time effort in San Antonio & we need your financial support TODAY. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is to raise $6,000 by December 31, 2016 to kick off a campaign to create a community retail & education center that serves teachers, artists, creative families & supporters of reuse year round. 
  • This campaign brings you special thank-you gifts from a hand-crafted note to your name  emblazoned on one of our Spare Parts workshop tables we'll use to educate & inspire others to reuse through the arts. Check out our perks!
  • What if we don't raise $6,000? We will continue to fundraise for 6 months rent & expenses to open a permanent space ($40,000 total).

story:
From July 8-23, 2016, Natalie White For Equal Rights will be leading a march from New York City to Washington, DC in protest of the lack of ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment.

Help us cover the expenses for the March to DC.  Independently, we have raised $20,000 towards the total budget of $45,000. Now we are asking you, our friends, to help us close the gap and make this march possible and an unforgettable milestone for women in the United States!

Feminists of all genders, age, religion and race are invited to participate for whatever stretch of time they are able. There will be two stops a day in various cities and towns along the way. The concluding stop of each day of the March For ERA will feature festive speeches, a concert and collaborative art installations. Participants will stay and rest at community centers, rock & roll tour buses and campgrounds. Once the March reaches DC, there will be a final protest asking Congress to pass the E.R.A and send it to the states for ratification.

Some history:

What is the ERA?

The Equal Rights Amendment (ERA) is a proposed amendment to the United States Constitution that would expressly prohibit discrimination against girls and women on the basis of sex. The Constitution does not guarantee equal rights for women. As Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia has stated: “Certainly the Constitution does not require discrimination on the basis of sex. The only issue is whether it prohibits it. It doesn’t.”

The ERA was passed by Congress in 1972: “Equality of rights under the law shall not be denied or abridged by the United States of by any state on account of sex.” By the time the deadline for state ratification ended in 1982, 35 states had ratified the amendment, just three states short of the number needed to put the ERA into the Constitution. Since then, the ERA has been reintroduced in Congress every session. Although polls indicate that more than 90% of Americans support the ERA, Congress has not once voted on it over the past thirty years.

Why do we need the ERA?

The ERA is an important statement of principle. The Constitution embodies the nation’s core values. Equality between women and men is a fundamental human right that should be guaranteed in the Constitution.

Sex discrimination continues to limit equal opportunity and justice for women.Economic inequality, pregnancy discrimination, violence against women, and other forms of discrimination against women and girls are pervasive and leave women without effective legal recourse. State laws are not uniform and federal laws are not comprehensive. Moreover, these laws can be, and in some cases have been, rolled back anytime.

The Equal Protection Clause of the Constitution does not protect women from sex discrimination. The Fourteenth Amendment provides equal protection of the law, but it has been interpreted to require state action and the intent to discriminate. Much discrimination occurs through private action and is not intentional, making intent hard to prove. The Supreme Court reviews sex discrimination claims using intermediate rather than strict scrutiny, a lower standard of review than for racial and religious discrimination claims.

MARCH WITH US: Register Here.

Press

Whitehot Magazine, Kicking off Natalie White For Equal Rights March to DC

Jezebel Interview, Natalie White Talks to Jezebel About Her March to Washington D.C.

Join the March at any of these points:

JULY 8

8:30 am Departing from WhiteBox, 329 Broome St, NYC

10:00 am Press Conference at Liberty State Park, Freedom Way, Jersey City, NJ

JULY 9

6:00 pm Community event at Hidden Grounds Coffee, 106 Easton Ave, New Brunswick, NJ

JULY 11 

4:00 pm Press Conference at NJ State Capitol, 125 W State St, Trenton, NJ

JULY 12

 6:00 pm Community event at Alice Paul Institute, 128 Hooton Rd, Mt Laurel, NJ

JULY 13 

12:30 pm Press Conference at the Liberty Bell, 6th St & Market St, Philadelphia, PA

6:00 pm Activist Forum & Live Music at Wooden Shoe Books, Philadelphia, PA

JULY 14 

1:00 pm  Stop in Solidarity at Rosenwald-Wolf Gallery, 333 S Broad St, Philadelphia, PA

 JULY 16 

6:00 pm Community event at Home Grown Cafe, 126 E Main St, Newark, DE 

JULY 19 

6:00 pm 2640 Space @2640 St.Paul Street, Baltimore, MD 21218

JULY 22 

6:00 pm Arts in Activism Forum & Live music event at Busboys & Poets, 5331 Baltimore Ave, Hyattsville, MD

JULY 23

11:00 am March into DC departing from College Park Metro 4931 Calvert Rd, College Park, MD

2:00 pm Rally at the US Capitol, East Capitol St NE & First St SE, Washington, DC

For more information, visit nataliewhiteforequalrights.org

story:
Front view of David Normal's '69 Citroen D-Special, "Citroedelic".

Citroedelic (2.0)  - David Normal's Citroen Art Car Project

Those of you who know me are aware that I have been a die-hard Citroen enthusiast for many years.  The car pictured above is a 1969 D Special that I purchased in 2005.  Through thick and thin, I have kept this car running as daily transportation.  I put the paint job on in 2012, and transformed the car into "Citroedelic", my Citroen 'artcar'.  It garners a lot of attention on the road and even received a write up in Autoweek.

Here are some photos of Citroedelic shortly after it was painted in 2012:

https://www.facebook.com/davidnormal/media_set?set=a.10200296067058704.1073741826.1064594051&type=3

After 90,000 miles and two engines this beautiful car has been gradually succumbing to rust, and then, finally, just the other day, its camshaft broke while I was driving down the 580 in Oakland!  It's time to lay this car to rest.  However, I do NOT want to stop driving Citroens!  My goal is to get a 'new' Citroen (this time a station wagon such as this one for sale on Craigslist) and transform it into a more elaborately beautiful art car.  

I intend to take a Citroen D Station wagon and paint it with fantastic designs, and detail the interior with embroidery, and intricate decoration throughout.  Having driven an imaginatively painted Citroen for several years I know that people really enjoy it.  Often people come along and tell me that seeing my car 'made their day'. At other times it can be quite startling - though flattering -  to have people yelling and honking their horns at me with wild enthusiasm, and very often I return to my parked car to find it ringed with people taking photos.  Its always a conversation starter and I meet a lot of people with the car.  I feel that the car is a rolling piece of public art that people connect with strongly and such radical self-expression is a real contribution to society. 


Vintage Citroen advertisement showing mid '60s model.

 I need (at least) $4500. to buy a Citroen D Station Wagon.

I will need at least $4.5k (and probably more like $10k) to purchase a Citroen D Station Wagon.  The funds are really just for the purchase of the car.  The expense of painting and decorative work, as well as mechanical refurbishment and maintenance, I will handle myself.  I have done the majority of the work on my Citroen for over 10 years, and, of course; the painting I will do myself.

Due to terminal rust and a broken camshaft my current Citroen is going to be parted out.  The painted body parts will be perks for large contributors to the campaign.  I will also be providing prints of a Citroen themed painting, "Suspension of Disbelief", for small contributions.  Medium level contributors can opt to have me chauffeur them around in the Citroen Station Wagon after it is all painted up (this can be a fun night out - the Citroen Wagon can seat up to eight with the added space in the back end - a perfect party car!).



Uh . . . never mind the t-shirt!  Here I am in full shade-tree mechanic mode changing a steering control arm on my Citroen.

David Normal and Citroedelic

As an artist, the Citroen has become a part of my 'aesthetic universe'.  It is part of my identity, an element of my 'brand'.   The highly decorated Citroen art car will be literally a 'promotional vehicle' that as rolling work of art advances my reputation and public awareness of my work.   In supporting Citroedelic you are supporting my work as an artist in general.

I plan to keep the paint open - I won't be clear coating it.  Rather I want it to be a dynamic work in progress.  Over time I will change the paint job 

I've been driving Citroens since 2001 (my first car was a '67 ID19).  I've owned my current car since 2005, and have done most of the repairs myself (with plenty of generous advice from the Citroen enthusiast community!).  I have the knowledge and experience to maintain the car myself, and of course I have the artistic skills to decorate it exquisitely.  A Citroen coming in to my hands today will be on the road for years to come - not garaged as a collector car - but maintained as a daily driver so that all who cross paths may enjoy its presence.


Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps you cannot contribute financially , but that doesn't mean you can't help in another way:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.  You can do this by using the Indiegogo Share tools.
  • If you are a mechanic, and especially a Citroen mechanic, I can always use help working on the car.
  • Artistic collaboration is always welcome.  Perhaps there is a contribution you can make to decorating "Citroedelic"!

If you've made it this far:  Thank so much for reading!!!  Thanks for the time and consideration!

David Normal
3/22/16

story:
Summary

My name is Rhiannon Jorgensen, granddaughter of Justus Jorgensen, founder of Montsalvat, Australia's oldest Artist Colony! Throughout three generations the barn at Black Barn Farm in Christmas Hills has been a part of community and the arts. The contributions made will help greatly to continue the heritage of the space and help keep the connection going onto the next generation of artists and community, restoring the foundations but also building an suitable dance practice so that more artists can enjoy the space and its surroundings.

What We Need & What You Get

A Break down for folks in more detail:

The original goal was $12,000 but because there is a surcharge of 8% in running the campaign itself the goal is now $15,000

  • The quote for the repair to the foundations is around $1700 per day.
  • The quote for the floor was between $7,000 and $10,000.
  • I will be providing the original quotes by following a link...
  • The perks for pledgers on offer vary from hot air balloon rides, wine packages, massage vouchers, artwork, music CD's, crafts, cards, clothing designed by Tindle Clothing and more!
  • if we do not reach our intended financial goal- we will still give the prizes pledged for and build and restore as much as we can with what we can come up with and continue our fundraising/working bee efforts until we reach our goal.

The Impact

  • black barn gallery is surrounded by natural beauty and the sound of birds, its only an hour from the city and centred in the Yarra Valley. The building itself, and surrounding property/area are marked with a rich history, cultural significance and sits on the edge of the green wedge zone. These element are inspiring to artists, the adventurer, and those seeking calm. To further create the space will allow for more people to work and enjoy the space.The dream is to grow the community already, keep on going, sharing and learning our gifts and connecting with another is a goal of the space. Plus we will have an amazing proper dance space to includes dancers, movements lovers, acrobats.
  • Founding Montsalvat collective was a great building block of gathering people together to support each others dreams and creative goals and ideas. We always had sold out shows at Montsalvat and I very much enjoyed working in a group. It wasn't always about the end goal but a sharing of our own creative endeavours and talents upon sharing a meal were also really supportive and uplifting.

Risks & Challenges

  • The risk to me is that i feel like its a tonne of money to ask for and the challenge is i have only two months to fund this campaign. i have gained a lot of prizes and i hope i have given myself enough time to create/get enough to give back and will continue to create and offer more prizes as the campaign goes on.
  • Im sticking to budget and not overspending on things for things like events, and will take time to achieve each goal at a time. Whatever funds are raised will go straight back onto the project with the aim being restoration and flooring.
  • The challenge has been the overhead of toilet hire for campaign building events so Im hoping to work on that and perhaps we might have to use some funds made on the day of the launch event. Plus the space does need a toilet to be open to the public, and now we are at that stage.

Other Ways You Can Help

Other ways to help include:

Be a part of our working bee's, if you go to the website, www.blackbarngallery.com/contact.html and fill in your details, we can add you to our mailing list :) some work needed doing includes: plastering, general clean up, putting rubbish/scrap in trailers, take away, repairs to the barn, digging, helping cook the bbq! we will offer bevvies and food so it will be fun and productive! 

Spreading the word for me would be an amazing help.

Sharing the campaign site.

Invite people to the black barn gallery space, come and check it out and bring your good vibes, A little bit of good energy goes a long way!

We will be open as of 3rd April.

Hours: Thursday - Sunday, 10am-1pm and 2pm-6pm

Share the website www.blackbarngallery.com

Thank you!!!!
story_txt:
Summary
My name is Rhiannon Jorgensen, granddaughter of Justus Jorgensen, founder of Montsalvat, Australia's oldest Artist Colony! Throughout three generations the barn at Black Barn Farm in Christmas Hills has been a part of community and the arts. The contributions made will help greatly to continue the heritage of the space and help keep the connection going onto the next generation of artists and community, restoring the foundations but also building an suitable dance practice so that more artists can enjoy the space and its surroundings.   What We Need & What You Get A Break down for folks in more detail:
The original goal was $12,000 but because there is a surcharge of 8% in running the campaign itself the goal is now $15,000

The quote for the repair to the foundations is around $1700 per day.
The quote for the floor was between $7,000 and $10,000.
I will be providing the original quotes by following a link...
The perks for pledgers on offer vary from hot air balloon rides, wine packages, massage vouchers, artwork, music CD's, crafts, cards, clothing designed by Tindle Clothing and more!
if we do not reach our intended financial goal- we will still give the prizes pledged for and build and restore as much as we can with what we can come up with and continue our fundraising/working bee efforts until we reach our goal.    The Impact

black barn gallery is surrounded by natural beauty and the sound of birds, its only an hour from the city and centred in the Yarra Valley. The building itself, and surrounding property/area are marked with a rich history, cultural significance and sits on the edge of the green wedge zone. These element are inspiring to artists, the adventurer, and those seeking calm. To further create the space will allow for more people to work and enjoy the space.The dream is to grow the community already, keep on going, sharing and learning our gifts and connecting with another is a goal of the space. Plus we will have an amazing proper dance space to includes dancers, movements lovers, acrobats.
Founding Montsalvat collective was a great building block of gathering people together to support each others dreams and creative goals and ideas. We always had sold out shows at Montsalvat and I very much enjoyed working in a group. It wasn't always about the end goal but a sharing of our own creative endeavours and talents upon sharing a meal were also really supportive and uplifting.    Risks & Challenges

The risk to me is that i feel like its a tonne of money to ask for and the challenge is i have only two months to fund this campaign. i have gained a lot of prizes and i hope i have given myself enough time to create/get enough to give back and will continue to create and offer more prizes as the campaign goes on.
Im sticking to budget and not overspending on things for things like events, and will take time to achieve each goal at a time. Whatever funds are raised will go straight back onto the project with the aim being restoration and flooring.
The challenge has been the overhead of toilet hire for campaign building events so Im hoping to work on that and perhaps we might have to use some funds made on the day of the launch event. Plus the space does need a toilet to be open to the public, and now we are at that stage.    Other Ways You Can Help Other ways to help include:

story: .

Short Summary

Centro Latino de Salud has been operating in Columbia, Missouri for 15 years! The mission of Centro Latino is to empower Latinos, Latino families and the general public through provision of services and guidance in navigating the health, education and cultural resources of mid-Missouri. 

Centro Latino is a volunteer-run organization with a general operating budget of $30,000. The only funding that the organization receives is from individuals and our community. We do not receive governmental funding. 


What We Need & What You Get

On April 1st, 2015 our organization is turning 15 years old! We have done, and will continue to do, our best work using donations from the community! Please consider donating $15 for 15 Years of Centro Latino. 

YOU ARE INVITED:

Centro Latino's Quinceañera Fundraiser Dinner

  • April 3, 2015
  • 6:00-8:00 PM
  • Centro Latino's Comedor Popular
  • 609 N. Garth Ave.
  • Columbia, MO 65203

We will be celebrating Centro Latino's Quinceañera with a Fundraiser Dinner at Centro Latino's Comedor Popular on April 3rd, 2015. When you donate at least $15.00 to our $15 for 15 Years fundraiser, you will receive dinner at Centro Latino's Quinceañera Fundraiser Dinner!


The Impact

We are asking our supporters to donate $15 during the month of April to commemorate 15 years of Centro Latino's work. Your $15 will go towards Centro Latino's general operating budget to sustain our free, community-based programming. 
Educational Services
  • After School Tutoring Program
  • Active & Fresh Summer Program
  • Veggie Friendly Kids in the Kitchen 
    • in collaboration with MU Extension
  • Fit-tastic Nutrition and Fitness Program
    • in collaboration with the local health department. 
  • Spanish Classes & English as a Second Language Classes

Health Services

  • Health Literacy
    • Obesity and Diabetes Prevention Program
    • Comedor Popular (The People's Diner)
  • Health Promotion & Illness Prevention
  • Medical Interpreting
  • Promotoras de Salud Program: Health Literacy Project
  • Violence Prevention
    • Engaging Men in the Prevention of Violence Against Women
    • in collaboration with True North
  • Referrals to:
    • Health Care Providers & Specialists
    • Social Work & Mental Health
    • Clinical Refferals & Dental Care
    • Diabetes Testing & Education
    • Family Planning
    • HIV Education & Prevention

Legal Access

  • Immigration & Naturalization Services
  • Local Legal Counseling Refferals
  • Interpreting & Translation

For more information about the services Centro Latino provides, please visit our website: http://centrolatino.missouri.org


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are interested in volunteering at Centro Latino, please contact us at latino.centro@gmail.com.

If you are a college student, you may be able to receive academic credit for your volunteering. MU Students ask for more information at the Office of Service Learning. 

For more information about the services Centro Latino provides, please visit our website: http://centrolatino.missouri.org

For updates on our current projects and upcoming events, please visit our Facebook pages:

Centro Latino: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Centro-Latino/111643288876899

Comedor Popular (People's Diner): https://www.facebook.com/pages/Centro-Latino-Comedor-Popular/265897163449285?fref=ts

Promotoras de Salud: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Centro-Latino-Promotoras-de-Salud/247653758619409?fref=ts

Prevencion de la Violence (Violence Prevention): https://www.facebook.com/pages/Centro-Latino-Prevencion-de-la-Violencia-Violence-Prevention/580569512001788?fref=ts

Clase de Español (Spanish Class): https://www.facebook.com/groups/603859346298038/
