story:
Hello, I'm Heather...

But my friends call me Hat.

And last year, I began writing and illustrating a book called "How Heather got her HAT'ness back"...

Those of you who read my blog regularly, will already be familiar with the story and the journey of how this book came to be. 

The GREAT news is that now, after months of work... I am just a few pages away from finishing the book (woooo-hoooo!)...

The... uh... not-so-great news is that I don't have the kind of money required to PRINT and produce the book!

So... (drumroll)... 

I need help to get this book printed!

My book is a full-colour, 64-page book.  And printing of this kind is not cheap.

We need to raise $5000.  And this is what the money will pay for:

  • The printing of the books.  I will be using a local South African company (Paarl printers) who have a fantastic reputation for printing quality books and magazines (they're also one of the few printing companies who make an effort to be as kind to the environment as possible).
  • Setting up the ISBN number and the barcode.
  • Shipping fees (and packaging) to send copies of the book (and various prezzies) to backers all over the world... (most of my blog readers - and the people who have expressed an interest in this book - live in the US, Canada, Europe, Australia & New Zealand).

Basically - I can't do this without your help.  If I had an extra $5000, I wouldn't hesitate to fund this project myself...  but - I don't - so - now I just kinda need to take a big, fat leap of faith and rely on a couple of generous peeps to help me.

And... as a way of expressing my deep gratitude for your support... I've added a couple of perks and goodies for backers (check out the "Perks" column on the right).

For those who haven't visited my blog... here's the first few pages of my book:

"You need to stop daydreaming!  Work hard at school!"
"You MUST pass your tests and obey all the rules!"
"Study your maths and accountancy,
you'll need them one day in a job, wait and see!"

"Stop playing those games!"  "Stop fooling around!"
"Stop laughing so loudly, you need to calm down!"
"Your art's just a hobby... your jokes are not funny,
you need to pass science if you want to earn money"

"You need to be cultured, refined and mature...
and dutiful, dainty, discreet and demure"
"You'll get a good job and you'll marry one day,
life will work out IF you do what we say"

And Hat started thinking:

And thus on that day, Hat resolved to reform
She would be like the rest and conform-to-the-norm
She tossed out her weird stuff and went on a diet
She banished her dreams and became rather quiet

She even threw out her collection of hats
She stopped writing poems... and she stopped popping rats
Out went her artwork and prized peacock feather
Then "Hat" was abandoned...
She called herself... "Heather".

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Frequently Asked Questions:

So, what's the book about?
It's an illustrated poem - written in the most ME'ish way (messy, raw and as honest as I can possibly be)... about my personal story.

It's about how I misplaced my MUCH'ness (to coin a phrase by the Mad Hatter).  It's about how I tried soooo hard to "fit-in"... and "be normal"... and live up to a whole bunch of burdensome expectations placed upon my life by other people... and, in doing so... I slowly lost touch with The Real Me.

The book delves into how wearing masks and inauthentic living can have a terribly damaging affect on our emotions and self-esteem.

And the story follows my (slow) journey... full-circle... and celebrates my return to my "HAT'ness"... and why I think it's so vital for folk to just *BE* themselves!

Is it a children's book?
No. 
I guess the obvious assumption would be that it's a children's book (since most children's books are illustrated).  But originally, I intended this book for adults...  people a bit like me... creative creatures... those who had always struggled to *fit* in with "normal" life and "normal" ways and "normal" aspirations. 

While I wrote and drew, I was thinking of folk who have always felt a bit strange... as though they are outliers... those who are prone to think of themselves as "broken" or "abnormal"... simply because they're NOT like everyone else.

The book opens with an almost child-like feel (which I intended - because I wanted to introduce readers to the messy, colourful world of "Hat")... but after that, it turns a bit dark and serious for a while... and there's a couple of themes in there that may not be appropriate for young children or tweens.

My story covers things like depression, eating disorders, self-abuse and infidelity.

There's nothing TOO hectic (ie:  there's no nudity, violence, gore or f-words)... but I would definitely suggest parental guidance for those with younger kids.

One of the darkest verses (if not *the* darkest verse) goes like this:

"And she tumbled down into a pit of despair
and binged on cheese pizzas and plucked out her hair
and piled on the kilos - and tried not to care
and punished herself for her husband's affair"

But in the end - it all ends VERY happily, of course!  :-)

(As a side note, my children are 9 and 7 and we've read it a couple of times and they LOVE it... but then again - it is *my* story... and they really wanted to read "Mommy's Story").

Will there be a children's version of this book in the future?

Yes!!!
After the feedback I received from blog readers, I QUICKLY realised that there's a massive need for a story like this for children! 

There are still WAY too many young "Hat's" in the world who are feeling bullied and pressured to change... and diminish... and *fix* themselves... and be something that they're NOT meant to be.

So - as soon as this book has been printed... I'm going to throw myself straight into creating the *lite*, kid-friendly version! 

I see that a $25 contribution to your Indiegogo campaign will get me one book as a reward.  Does this mean that you'll be selling your books to the general public for $25?

No.  Because this is a crowdfunding campaign, the whole idea is that backers and contributors are INVESTORS into my project.  It's not just a basic book-sale-thing.  People invest the extra cash because they believe in my project... they resonate with the story of Hat... and the WANT to see this book published and distributed.

It's a deeper level of contribution than - say - a "normal" pre-ordering campaign.  That's why I usually refer to this as a "crowd-funding / pre-ordering campaign" - because the the funding and the investing is probably the most important element.

So what will backers of this campaign get that the general public WON'T get?

  • Backers of the campaign will be the first people on the planet to receive copies of the book.  I will not distribute or sell the book to anyone else - until my very-treasured-and-appreciated backers all have their copies (wherever in the world they may be).
  • Backers get signed, first-edition copies.
  • Backers get extra perks... Hat-Art packs... and extra little thank-you prezzies from me.
  • Backers who support this FIRST book... will get special privileges when the children's version is released.
  • Sponsors or Patron backers will be mentioned on the special "thank-you" page of the book.
  • Joburg-based backers will be invited as guests-of-honour at my launch event.
  • And - of course - all backers have my enormous gratitude for INVESTING into this Hat project.  Because... I can't do it without them!

Have you completely finished the book?  When will it go to print?  When will I get my copy?

I am 6 pages from finished (the poem is finished... the illustrations are not).

 Since this fundraising campaign is a 40-day campaign, I'm giving myself 40 days to finish off those last pages, scan everything in, create the artwork and what-not.

If the required $5000 is raised by the end of this campaign - the book will go to print within the week (of this campaign ending).

If the required amount is NOT raised by the end of this campaign... we'll need to regroup and figure out a Plan-B.

But - if everything DOES go according to plan... and if everything prints on time... we should be shipping out goodies and books by August.

Once the book has been printed, how will you sell and distribute copies?

Firstly - we'll be launching a website - and will sell the book online (and ship it world-wide too).   I'll also be selling high-res PDF versions of the book from our website.

Oh, and I'll sell copies at my "Hat Happenings" (events, talks, creative workshops, songs & stories evenings that I host all over the place)... 

We're also considering using Amazon's Createspace... (although it will change the size and paper quality of the original book - so I'm still weighing up the pros and cons with that).

Finally - I am *MORE* than open to ship boxes of books to independent, interested bookstores and distributors from around the world.   I'm very open to all kinds of possibilities.  :-)

Will there be a book launch?
YES!!  This is a huge milestone for me.  I've been wanting to publish a book for as long as I can remember.  "Young-Hat" dreamed of writing and illustrating stories (I still have my yellowing, dog-eared typed-out-tales from when I was 10 years old).

We'll have a Joburg launch (coffee... couches... cake... stories... songs... poetry... goodies & gifts... slides & photos.... DEFINITELY not yawn-worthy speeches behind podiums).  An even bigger dream is to do a Hat-Tour and visit the homes and coffee shops of people who resonate with this story... (around the country and the world).

(But that happy dream is still peculating.   Right now, the main focus is just getting this book OUT there!)

And finally?


I totally *get* that everyone is not financially flush... and truly - there is no OBLIGATION or EXPECTATION for you to support this campaign.

I have already been so incredibly encouraged by all the e-mail, feedback, stories, photos (and even poetry!!!) that people have sent me.

And - to be honest - connecting... and building relationships... with like-minded people will always be far more important to me than this whole fund-raising thing. 

Money-Sch'money.  It's necessary - yes!  It pays the bills - yes!  It makes life a HECK of a lot easier... but still... it's not (and never has been) my primary motivator.

My biggest hope (with this book)... is that the people reading it... will be truly moved, encouraged and inspired to embrace their beautiful unique'ness and have the courage to be *SEEN* for who they truly *ARE*...!

As always - my door is open.  My e-mail is not a secret.  If you want to get in touch with me personally?  My e-mail is:  heather@themadhat.co.za  X

Be the best YOU!!!  (and I'll be the best *me*)... X

Joburg-based backers will be invited as guests-of-honour at my launch event.
And - of course - all backers have my enormous gratitude for INVESTING into this Hat project.  Because... I can't do it without them!

Have you completely finished the book?  When will it go to print?  When will I get my copy?I am 6 pages from finished (the poem is finished... the illustrations are not). Since this fundraising campaign is a 40-day campaign, I'm giving myself 40 days to finish off those last pages, scan everything in, create the artwork and what-not.If the required $5000 is raised by the end of this campaign - the book will go to print within the week (of this campaign ending).If the required amount is NOT raised by the end of this campaign... we'll need to regroup and figure out a Plan-B.But - if everything DOES go according to plan... and if everything prints on time... we should be shipping out goodies and books by August.Once the book has been printed, how will you sell and distribute copies?Firstly - we'll be launching a website - and will sell the book online (and ship it world-wide too).   I'll also be selling high-res PDF versions of the book from our website.Oh, and I'll sell copies at my "Hat Happenings" (events, talks, creative workshops, songs & stories evenings that I host all over the place)...  We're also considering using Amazon's Createspace... (although it will change the size and paper quality of the original book - so I'm still weighing up the pros and cons with that).Finally - I am *MORE* than open to ship boxes of books to independent, interested bookstores and distributors from around the world.   I'm very open to all kinds of possibilities.  :-)Will there be a book launch?YES!!  This is a huge milestone for me.  I've been wanting to publish a book for as long as I can remember.  "Young-Hat" dreamed of writing and illustrating stories (I still have my yellowing, dog-eared typed-out-tales from when I was 10 years old).We'll have a Joburg launch (coffee... couches... cake... stories... songs... poetry... goodies & gifts... slides & photos.... DEFINITELY not yawn-worthy speeches behind podiums).  An even bigger dream is to do a Hat-Tour and visit the homes and coffee shops of people who resonate with this story... (around the country and the world).(But that happy dream is still peculating.   Right now, the main focus is just getting this book OUT there!)
  And finally?
I totally *get* that everyone is not financially flush... and truly - there is no OBLIGATION or EXPECTATION for you to support this campaign.I have already been so incredibly encouraged by all the e-mail, feedback, stories, photos (and even poetry!!!) that people have sent me.And - to be honest - connecting... and building relationships... with like-minded people will always be far more important to me than this whole fund-raising thing.  Money-Sch'money.  It's necessary - yes!  It pays the bills - yes!  It makes life a HECK of a lot easier... but still... it's not (and never has been) my primary motivator.My biggest hope (with this book)... is that the people reading it... will be truly moved, encouraged and inspired to embrace their beautiful unique'ness and have the courage to be *SEEN* for who they truly *ARE*...!As always - my door is open.  My e-mail is not a secret.  If you want to get in touch with me personally?  My e-mail is:  heather@themadhat.co.za  XBe the best YOU!!!  (and I'll be the best *me*)... X

story:
We did it!  Thanks to you, we made it to the Playa for Burning Man 2014!!!

It was truly an amazing journey, one that the entire team will never forget!

It was a definitely intense and now that XUZA is built we are now ready to take her to a whole new level. 

We were ahead of schedule on the build up to a week ago when we found out that we are now over budget as one of the suppliers misquoted the costs for materials!  on our last funding campaign we needed to reach at least 65% of the total goal, this was our safety net. Everything above that was extra bells and whistles.

We are now scrambling to come up with the extra funds to get XUZA Finished in time.  $2,000 is what will get it done!


Last Year the items that caused us the most headaches were:
  1. Transportation / Trailer
    The rig was too big for the trailer that was rented to us, which delayed us 3.5 days. A good friend and fellow burner and Art Car builder reached out with a professional hauler who hooked us up and helped us get to the Playa. We were determined to get her there even though it cost us in the wallet and five days late.
  2. The Mask
    This was just too bulky and heavy.  It took a team of us to get her positioned and mounted. 
  3. The Driver controls
    The Driver had very limited visibility which was a major safety concern.


    These items have no been corrected and it made XUZA safer and more enjoyable for all!

DESIGN and CONCEPT
I met with my good friend and amazing Artist Gear Duran over the Christmas Holiday and he expressed 100% interest in creating a whole new look for XUZA!
XUZA is being hand sculpted out of foam core material and will be airbrushed in UV reactive colors,  this will truly be an ART car!

We are now looking for you to be a part of this amazing Project!  When XUZA appears out of the dust in front of you, I want you to have the satisfaction of knowing that you helped build this masterpiece!  Wave us down, and jump on board, we have a full size Refrigerator / Freezer on board stocked full of refreshing cold beverages and frozen treats to help cool you down from the heat of the day.  Then Party with us as our DJ's lay down some sic beats which will be the soundtrack to our journey together!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help: Please share this campaign through your social networks, email lists, etc. 

You can use the Indiegogo share tools! 

Every Dollar counts... if all 60,000 residents of Black Rock City contributed just $0.20 we would easily hit our goal!!!


Your contribution will go to the following key expenses:
  • Building Materials: 
    Foam Blocks:
    Ten 8' x 4' Foam blocks which will be hand carved by Gear Duran.  everything needed to successfully create this foam core masterpiece
  • Mechanical:
    We are moving the driver controls to the front of the rig, suspended from the top deck... Much safer, more visibility for the driver and it looks absolutely BAD ASS!

  • Steel: 
    To build the skeleton structure to support the foam core

  • Lighting:
    UV reactive Lighting to enhance the UV reactive paint scheme
    Full Spectrum LED's  to complete the 8' x 26' LED ceiling

  • Transportation Costs
    We are looking to have our own Trailer and Hauler so we don't have to rely on outside companies anymore.  Fuel, both transporting her and while on the playa. 
  • Bells and Buzzers:
    This we can't disclose, I know, I know... but there are some many amazing features that were adding to XUZA this year that we want you to be surprised when you get to experience her in person!

In Hindu Numerology, XUZA :

TEACHER, will expand healing qualities and to serve as a reflection of cosmic truth to all.

 

 Amazing Perks!!!!

XUZA LED WRISTBANDS
Don't be a Darktard
Oh yeah we're talking quality anti-darktard lighting here!



This year our T-shirts, Tanks and Leggings are
XUZA Inspired designs by Gear Duran. 
 XUZA Limited Edition T-Shirts!The shirts are printed using a dye sublimation process which allows all over printing.

XUZA Limited Edition Leggings:you know you want a pair ;-)

Amazing quality products by:
http://digitalartwear.com/


Your Own Custom Burn Barrels!
We offered the Custom Burn Barrels last year with much success!!! 
Just send us your camp logo or whatever name you would like and we will customize the barrel and bring it to the Playa with us where you can pick it up from our camp or you can pick it up locally in Las Vegas!

story:
I am currently working on a painting/installation project called “constructing dreams”.  I’ve been developing this idea over the last 6 months, starting with 3 paintings which will be showing in at Olivart Gallery, Barcelona in September; two of which are in the photos above.  I often paint patterns from items my grandmother and mother or other women used to decorate their homes or the wall patterns, couch patterns etc. of places I've lived and frequented.  I can picture these patterns, colors and textures sometimes more clearly than the faces of people from my past.  I am very interested in the things that we use daily that outlive us, the things we use to actualize our dreams, yet the things that are discarded when we are gone or they are outdated.  These objects that outlive our experiences in them.  The shadow/light like forms in these paintings represent for me the impermanent nature of our shadow as we pass through the world.  I have started to incorporate fabric pieces alongside the painted ones to contrast the actual object and the shadow of the object.  Now I would like to construct my own fabrics, patterns and utilize them as installations alongside my painted pieces.  

In September I will study at Escola Massana’s Art and Textile program to learn to weave, embroider, make lace and rugs, dye and print fabric and study the history of textiles (in Spanish and Catalan ;)  I will be incorporating cloth installations into my work.  Contrasting the actual “thing” with a painted shadow of that thing.  I will be painting, working and studying and continuing to learn Spanish.  This money is just to be used as a kickstarter to help with the visa fees, school fees, plane ticket, health insurance etc. while i settle into a new life of making art, working, learning and living in Spain.   I also would like to clear a little room in the storage space at my parents also  so I will be offering bags and art.  I will be posting different bags/art each day as well as all the photos on this page.  If you want to request something specific just write me a note and i’ll get it to you if it’s still available ;)  I will cover shipping within the United States.  Thank you thank you!

story:
Short Summary

The public know about MPs expenses, hygiene failures by restaurants and thousands of other issues thanks to Freedom of Information (FoI). People and communities are better informed about big issues in their lives and government is more open and accountable. However FoI is under attack: less information is accessible as bodies not covered by FoI laws are increasingly delivering public services in Scotland, and new restrictions to the UK FoI Act are being considered. We need to react to these threats, and campaign for FoI rights to be extended to more organisations.  For example at least 15,000 council house tenants have lost their FoI rights when their homes moved over to housing association management in Scotland.  We need your donations to fund our 4 month campaign to save and extend our FoI rights on devolved and reserved issues across Scotland.

What We Need & What You Get

Our campaign will target current government initiatives which fail to protect and extend our FoI rights in Scotland.  Our 4 point strategy will:
1.Campaign for FoI law to be extended to cover all public services and those of a public nature in Scotland. 2.Raise awareness of the UK and Scottish Government FoI consultations with the public and key organisations to highlight their impact. 3. Persuade the Scottish Government to extend the scope of Scotland's FoI Act beyond its current limited proposals eg  brief MSPs on a more substantial approach and encourage them to raise their concerns in the Scottish Parliament.·  4.Draft a response to the consultations highlighting where they fall short, setting out how FoI law in Scotland should operate, and encourage key organisations and individuals to endorse them. 

The Impact

Your contribution will enable our campaign to be launched and delivered. We expect to demonstrate to the Scottish and UK governments just how unpopular their failure to expand FoI rights actually is.

 Risks & Challenges

We have over 31 years of experience on FoI rights and we have learned about practice in other countries. We know that more transparency delivers better and more accountable government.  The challenge is to get people involved in these consultations to ensure politicians understand that FoI rights matter to us all.  

Other Ways You Can Help

You can contact your MSP and ask them to support extending FoI Law in Scotland eg to housing associations, arms length external organisations and umbrella bodies such as COSLA.  For more information go to  http://www.gov.scot/About/Information/FOI/Coverage

You can help by writing to your MP to protest about the UK Government proposals which will make Government less accountable and transparent,  For more information go to https://www.cfoi.org.uk/campaigns/stop-foi-restrictions/

story:
What We Do

Lady Dye Yarns, LLC is an eco-friendly indie-dye yarn business started in June 2010 that creates vibrant and colorful hand-painted yarns and accessories that are inspired by street art and city living. Demands for LDY has gone up since the year the company started. In 2011, LDY was in two stores. After attending their first trade show in  2014, The National NeedleArts Association, LDY is now in 30 stores across the nation (14 states). LDY expects to be in 60 stores by the end of 2015. 

The Beginning...

Back in 2010, I took an amazing yarn dyeing workshop in Cambridge, MA and fell in love with hand-painted yarns! Back then, I was solely dyeing yarn for myself and I still remember the day I sat down with my local knitting group at Doyle's Cafe in Jamaica Plain, MA, and started knitting with my own hand-dyed yarn. Then someone suggested I should start selling my hand-painted yarns.

It never crossed my mind before to sell hand-dyed yarn as I was working a full-time job in the non-profit sector. I took that advice and I thought it would be great to make a "little money on the side." I became a member in a local artisan group. I participated in my first craft-show, SOWA, in the South End. I received great admiration of my yarn and from there, I decided to start my own fiber arts company. I left my full-time job in April of 2011 to focus my attention on finding part-time work in the arts community while spending the other time growing my business.

In 2013, I was one of the finalist selected in the Merrimack Valley Sandbox Accelerator program (now known as Entrepreneurship for All). I received a business mentor, I laid out a business model that would work for my company, and I received many resources and opportunities through EforAll. At the time, we were only in two stores  and we were selling our yarn on consignment. I knew this was not good enough for Lady Dye Yarns to just be in two stores and I wanted more for my company. I did my first crowdfunding campaign with Indiegogo to attend our first trade show, The National NeedleArts Association (TNNA), and we raised enough money to go! We had huge success at TNNA! We went from being in two stores in 2014 to our present number of 30 stores nationally and we continue to grow thanks to all of you!

We are entering a new chapter in the company where we are ready to move into space, employ a Business Manager, increase raw material, expand our marketing and branding, and build our working capital. We need your help again to make this happen. We are raising $40,200 to expand the company. 

What Will Lady Dye Accomplish

  • To be a leading manufacturer in one-of-a-kind yarns focusing on street art.

  • To become a major source for urban inspired knitwear designs

  • To be come a leader on urban knitting and crafting.

The focus of our sales reps have been to get LDY yarns into retail/boutique stores. They all receive 15% commission on all orders and reorders. In addition, LDY aims to have three designers (Boston, San Francisco, New York) create urban inspired knitwear for our target audience. As a company, LDY understands that 89% of knitters go online to find yarns, social groups, patterns, etc. Therefore, creating a vibrant website and social media presence, is important to Lady Dye Yarns growth. 

What We Need: $40,200

  • Office Space for a year: $10,800

    • $900/m for a year in Boston. Rental cost for work space in Boston is higher than the national average. The cost that we are looking for to rent office and dyeing space is on the lowest end of the rental spectrum.

  • Raw Materials/Equipment: $10,000

    • The cost for additional raw materials to be spent for:

      • Knitting machine parts (we received a donation of two knitting machines that require some old parts)

      • 2 washers

      • Drying rack room materials

      • Undyed yarn

      • Conferences and trade show display items

      • To build our knitwear collection

  • Stitches West Conference (Santa Clara, CA): $5,400

    • Booth fees (two booth spaces $2,000)

    • 2 round-trip tickets- $1,100

    • Hotel accommodations- $1,500

    • Cost of shipping materials (15 boxes at 20 x 20 x 20 weight: 35lbs each) $800

  • Marketing/Branding: $9,000

    • $5,000 will be spent for web developer to create a new website. IN ADDITION, to build a database/inventory system on the “back-end” of our website along with other online features for our customers to access.

    • $1,000 will go towards advertisement 

    • $3,000 hiring a part-time social media coordinator for the rest of the fiscal year 2015 (September thru December 2015).

  • Working Capital: $5,000

    • To be used for other business expenses that will arise and needed in the growth and marketing of Lady Dye Yarns.

What You Will Get As A Contributor

So much: yarn, tote bag, t-shirt, patterns, buttons, custom yarn,and personal social media "shout outs" to you from Lady Dye herself!

The Impact

Through your generous contribution, Lady Dye Yarns will be able to move the business to a office/dye room space that will allow the company to grow more efficiently and effectively. 

These contributions will increase Lady Dye Yarns market and production into more stores by the end of 2016 and will continue to build the brand. We understand that in order to grow, I will need the support from all of you! 

Additional information about our target market:

  • 53 million people in the United States, either knit or crochet.

  • The target audience of the 18-34 year old is the fastest growing segment among knitters.

  • Furthermore, 89% of knitters go online to purchase yarn, patterns, and seek social knitting groups.

The target market navigates the online world, where they can find yarn, patterns, social knitting groups and so much more. LDY’s target population cite “creativity” as the number one reason they knit. This is where Lady Dye Yarns comes in. Our yarn colors and patterns are inspired by the urban environment around us; pattern designs that are simple and quick to knit. Lady Dye Yarns is a company geared towards them.


Other Ways To Help

  • Tell your friends and family about our campaign
  • Do you design knitwear? Do you know any yarn stores that Lady Dye Yarns should be at? EMAIL US! diane@ladydyeyarns.com
  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram: ladydyeyarns 
  • Join our mailing list: ladydyeyarns.com

To be used for other business expenses that will arise and needed in the growth and marketing of Lady Dye Yarns.

What You Will Get As A Contributor

So much: yarn, tote bag, t-shirt, patterns, buttons, custom yarn,and personal social media "shout outs" to you from Lady Dye herself!
The Impact
Through your generous contribution, Lady Dye Yarns will be able to move the business to a office/dye room space that will allow the company to grow more efficiently and effectively. 
These contributions will increase Lady Dye Yarns market and production into more stores by the end of 2016 and will continue to build the brand. We understand that in order to grow, I will need the support from all of you! 
Additional information about our target market:


53 million people in the United States, either knit or crochet.
The target audience of the 18-34 year old is the fastest growing segment among knitters.
Furthermore, 89% of knitters go online to purchase yarn, patterns, and seek social knitting groups. 

The target market navigates the online world, where they can find yarn, patterns, social knitting groups and so much more. LDY’s target population cite “creativity” as the number one reason they knit. This is where Lady Dye Yarns comes in. Our yarn colors and patterns are inspired by the urban environment around us; pattern designs that are simple and quick to knit. Lady Dye Yarns is a company geared towards them.
   

Other Ways To Help



Tell your friends and family about our campaign
Do you design knitwear? Do you know any yarn stores that Lady Dye Yarns should be at? EMAIL US! diane@ladydyeyarns.com
Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram: ladydyeyarns 
Join our mailing list: ladydyeyarns.com

story: Prizm is a cutting-edge art fair that is multidisciplinary in scope. Our goal is to expand the spectrum of exhibiting international artists from the global African Diaspora and Emerging Markets. Our mission is to promote the work of artists of color, who reflect global trends in contemporary art, through a series of cultural events which culminate in our annual curated fair held during Miami Art Week.

Our goal is to expand the spectrum of exhibiting international artists from the global African Diaspora and Emerging Markets. Our mission is to promote the work of artists of color, who reflect global trends in contemporary art, through a series of cultural events which culminate in our annual curated fair held during Miami Art Week.

story:
Our team are a bunch of young film makers under 19 that are extremely passionate about the world of art. We come from many different backgrounds and have been able to blend well together to produce something that supports a community. This campaign is to raise more for an ad for "Superact" an not for profit organisation that uses music and the arts to develop and deliver a wide range of social impact projects. Everyone has a passion for art, and by doing your part in this advert, that can come alive for many individuals.

This advert will bring to life Superacts philosophy and belief: the idea that anyone can be an artist and that it is through art that people can reconnect with society and re-discover themselves. This advert will enable us young filmmakers to challenge ourselves as well as make a difference!

In order for this to be even more successful we need your help. We need to raise a certain amount of money for various different things so that it can be beneficial for us and everyone involved. Various things such a travel, art supplies, actors etc would not be possible without that bit of funding from you!

As a team we have made a numerous amount of projects. Recently we teamed up with the British Film Academy to produce a short film "Afterlife."

Here is a clip from the film:


Together this team makes amazing things, so please help us become a higher level of amazing!

Other Ways You Can Help

You not only can fund, but spread the word that the most creative advert you will ever see will be on their way very soon! Share it with everyone that you see in order to send us on our way. 
Use the Indiegogo share tools to make your life a whole lot easier!

Thank you very much!

story:
*Versión en español después de la versión en inglés. 

Resume

  • Intro and personal story.
  •  Hi, my name is Jorge Katthain and I´m a visual artist dedicated to sculpture and bespoke limited edition jewelry.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and explain why is it important for you
  • The main purpose of my Project is to pursue a collective understandment of the importance of living in harmony with nature and animal species. I strongly believe that by doing so we can reach a type of knowledge that is key for our evolution as ¨HumAnimal¨ species.

  • Describe the magnitude of what the collaborators help will achieve.

  • With the support of each and every of the contributors not only will the exhibition be possible but the message  of respect and love towards our spiritual teachers (the animal species) will be spread and shared creating a powerfull acknowledgement of the importance of having an harmonic relationship with nature and every living form of life within it.

 

What we need and what you get

Explain how much funding you need and where is it going. Be specific and honest, people need to trust you so they want to fund your project.

 
  • The necessary fund is $18,500 USD which will be used for purchasing the basic materials for the sculptures production, labour costs to achieve my vision and all of the required elements for promotion, montage and exhibition curatorship.
  • The materials to be used for the sculptures production in bronze and resin are as follow:
  • Rubber, Fiber Glass, Resin,Catalyzing Chemical, Fabric Cloth and Brushes for the  production of molds which will be used for wax or resin casting in order to make the sculptures in bronze or in resin for the 22 inch high sculpture. The process behind  bronze sculpture production is known as lost wax casting and it is performed at a specialized foundry of sculpture production.
  • Iron and Bronze to physically materialize the pieces. Bronze is used for the sculptures creation and for the supporting base Iron. Labour costs are considered within the essential elements to reach the sculpture´s totallity.
  • Resin, Catalyzing Chemical, Fiber Glass and Iron for the 220 Inch Tall Sculpture.

Describe the funding destination in case of not achieving the main goal.

  • In case of not achieving the main goal, the funds will be destined to the production of sculptures that can be made with the collected ammount as, formaly speaking, the commitment that I have with my work has given me besides many other things, discipline, patience and persistance recognition as necessary values in any growth form wether it might be personal or professional.

The Impact

Explain your campaign in a more detailed way and tell the people the difference that their contribution will make.

  • In my career path I have sculpted forms that somehow represent esotericism or mystical space. Every time that I do, the idea of the reptile, the feline, some insects or the skull have started to acquire a dominant focus in my work. Perhaps it has to do with the fact that of all animals, the archetype of the reptile, the feline, the beetle or the cricket carry that symbol of esotericism or mysticism. Mythologically speaking, they maintain their place in human imagery and tales or stories that involve that sence of mistery or esotericism.
  • In my work, the tales of this understandment carry a sense of shamanic story which seek to reach the physical and spiritual presence of animal form and of beings that may resemble a ¨human¨form but to my understanding they are beings or guardians of a higher level or collective consciousness. With the combination of both elements, I consider it to carry in one way, that sence of mistery in the understandment of (that intermediary space) our HumAnimal mision.

Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and everyone else.

  • Connecting with people or nature gives life a deeper sence of meaning. To amplify the universal language of love and respect  through life recognition could be a way of rising our vibration with a clear sence of continuity and evolution. This is why I consider my project to be valuable because not only raises awareness on the importance of having a harmonious relationship with nature and animal species but also encourages us to briefly meditate on our own mortality in order to value any life form. Furthermore, my project presents collectors and contributors a phenomenal option of investment in the art market instead of  investing in bonds or stocks.

Building trust

  • I trully value your support so in order to show my respect, I will be uploading and updating my campaign with images or videos of the production process so you can witness the advance of my campaign through Indiegogo (katthainsculpture), Facebook (HumAnimal) and Instagram (jkatthain).  

 Risks and Challenges

People value transparency. Be open and highlight the risk and challenge perspective that you might face on your way to achieving your goal.

  • My honesty, unbreakable conviction and persistance on achieving the main goal is definitely a solid value that makes me reliable and trustworthy to count with your support.  
  • One of the challenges that I might face is not being on schedule for the sculptures production so it is essential to have your support as often as possible. I will trully appreciate you spreading the word out on contributing my campaign.
  • Time is crucial for the sculptures and exhibition production. This is why your financial support will give me serenity enough to focus on the creative process.
  • To be part of the solution, I will engage with people through social media by personally taking time to answer their questions or any other doubt that might surface.

Other ways of helping

  • It is to my understanding that not everyone may be able to financially contribute so I only ask  if you could be so kind to share my campaign with your friends, family or any other group of people that could help me reach my goal.  
  • Instagram: jkatthain
  • Facebook page : HumAnimal

THANK YOU FOR BEING PART OF THIS CREATIVE JOURNEY!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Resumen

  • Preséntate y cuenta tu historia.
  • Hola, soy Jorge Katthain artista plástico dedicado a la escultura y creador de piezas edición limitada de joyería. 
  • Describe brevemente tu campaña y explica por qué es importante para ti.
  • El propósito principal de mi proyecto es buscar un entendimiento colectivo de la importancia de vivir en armonía con la naturaleza y la especie animal. Creo firmemente que al hacerlo, podremos alcanzar un tipo de conocimiento clave para nuestra evolución como especie ¨HumAnimal.
  • Expresa la magnitud de lo que logrará la ayuda de los colaboradores.
  • Con el apoyo de cada uno de los contribuidores, no solo la exposición será posible sino el mensaje de amor y respeto hacia nuestros maestros espirituales (la especie animal) será expandido y compartido creando un poderoso reconocimiento de la importancia de tener una relación armónica con la naturaleza y toda forma de vida en ella.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

  • explica cuánto financiamiento necesitas y a dónde va. Sé transparente y específico, la gente necesita confiar en ti para que quiera financiarte.
  • El fondeo necesario es de $325,000 MXN los cuales serán utilizados para comprar los materiales básicos para la producción de las esculturas, la mano de obra empleada para lograr mi visión y todos los elementos requeridos para la promoción, montaje y curaduría de la exposición.
  • Los materiales a utilizar para la producción de las esculturas en bronce y resina son los siguientes:
  • Silicón, Fibra de Vidrio, Resina, Catalizador, Manta de Cielo, Estopa y Brochas para la producción de los moldes; los cuales servirán para vaciar cera o resina en su interior y poder realizar las piezas de bronce ó, en el caso de la escultura de 3 mts de altura, resina. Al proceso de producción de esculturas en bronce se le conoce como Vaciado de Bronce a la Cera Perdida y se realiza en una Fundición especializada en la creación de esculturas de cualquier formato.
  • Bronce y Fierro para materializar las piezas físicamente. El bronce se utiliza para la creación de la escultura y el Fierro para la base sobre la cual será montada. La mano de obra requerida está considerada dentro de los elementos indispensables para lograr la totalidad de la pieza.
  • Resina, Catalizador, Fibra de Vidrio y Fierro para la producción de la escultura de 3 mts de altura. ​

Describe a dónde van los fondos si no logras la meta total.

  • En caso de no lograr la meta total, los fondos serán destinados a la producción de esculturas que se puedan lograr con el monto recaudado ya que formalmente hablando, el compromiso con mi trabajo me ha dado a demás de muchas otras cosas, el reconocimiento de la disciplina, la paciencia y persistencia como valores necesarios en cualquier formación personal o profesional. 

El impacto

 

Explica tu campaña en mayor detalle y cuéntale a la gente la diferencia que hará su contribución:

  • En mi carrera profesional he esculpido formas que de alguna manera representan esoterismo o espacio místico.Cada vez que lo hago, la idea del reptil, el felino, algunos insectos ó el cráneo, han comenzado a adquirir un enfoque dominante en mi obra.Tal vez tenga que ver con el hecho que, de todos los animales, para mí, el arquetipo del reptil, del felino, de los escarabajos o los grillos  llevan ese símbolo de esoterismo o misticismo. Mitológicamente hablando, mantienen su lugar en la imaginación humana y relatos o historias que involucran un sentido de misterio o esoterismo.
  • En mi obra los relatos de este entendimiento llevan un sentido o historia  chamánica la cual procura alcanzar la presencia física y espiritual de la forma animal y de seres que si bien asemejan una forma ¨humana¨ son a mi entendimiento seres superiores o vigilantes de un orden mayor o consciencia colectiva. Con la combinación de ambos elementos, considero  que de alguna manera acarrea este sentido de misterio en el entendimiento de (ese espacio intermediario) nuestra misión HumAnimal.

Explica porqué tu campaña es valiosa para los contribuidores y para todo el mundo.

  • Conectar con la gente o la naturaleza nos da un sentido más profundo del sentido de la vida. Amplificar el lenguaje universal del amor y el respeto a través del reconocimiento hacia la vida puede ser una manera de elevar nuestra vibración con un sentido claro de dontinuidad y evolución. Por esto, considero que mi proyecto es valioso no sólo porque eleva nuestra conciencia de la importancia de tener una relación armónica con la naturaleza y la especie animal pero también brevemente nos alenta a meditar sobre nuestra propia mortalidad con el fin de valorar cualquier forma existente de vida. Por otra parte, mi proyecto ofrece una opción fenomenal de inversión en el mercado del arte a coleccionistas y contribuidores en lugar de invertir en bonos o acciones.

Generando Confianza

  • Verdaderamente valoro tu apoyo así que para mostrar mi respeto, estaré subiendo y actualizando mi campaña con imágenes o videos del proceso de producción para que puedas presenciar el avance de la campaña a través de Indiegogo (katthainsculpture) Facebook (HumAnimal) e Instagram (jkatthain).

Riesgos y desafíos

 

Las personas valoran la transparencia. Sé abierto y destácate al ofrecer perspectivas sobre los riesgos y obstáculos que puedes enfrentar en el camino hacia lograr tu meta.

  • Mi honestidad, inquebrantable convicción y persistencia en lograr la meta final son definitivamente sólidos valores que me hacen fiable y confiable para poder contar con tu apoyo.  
  • Uno de los retos que pudieran presentarse es el no estar a tiempo en la producción así que es esencial tener tu apoyo lo más frecuentemente posible. En verdad te agradeceré mucho el compartir mi campaña  para la contribución en la misma.
  • El tiempo es crucial para la producción de las esculturas y la exposición. Por esta razón, tu apoyo financiero me dará la tranquilidad suficiente para enfocarme en el proceso creativo.
  • Para ser parte de la solución, interactuaré con las peronas a través de las redes sociales para responder personalmente las dudas o cualquier otra incertidumbre que pueda surgir. 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:
 

Comprendo que no todos podrán contribuir de manera financiera así que tan sólo te pido si fueras tan amable de compartir mi campaña con amigos, familiares o cualquier otro grupo de personas que pudieran ayudarme a alcanzar la meta. 

  • Instagram: jkatthain
  • Página de Facebook : HumAnimal

GRACIAS POR SER PARTE DE ESTE CREATIVO RECORRIDO!

story:
Designed by a mother of two, these cloth Pixie dolls are intended to be your child's tiny companion. But they are more than that – with the addition of a little pocket on the back, the doll becomes a portal through which 'Pixie Messages' can be left, offering encouragement and support for the child to believe in themselves and make their own wishes come true. 

You see, the Wish Pixies believe in YOU. 

Former Fashion Designer and award winning doll maker, Dainy Sawatzky, designed The Wish Pixies because she wanted to create unique and whimsical dolls that enhance a child's imagination, while helping them overcome challenges by encouraging them to focus on their goal or 'wish'. We want children's wishes to come true, which is why a portion of the profit from every doll sold is donated to the Make-A-Wish Foundation (a charity helping grant wishes to seriously ill kids).

 

 

There are ten different 18cm dolls in our first Wish Pixie collection and four Limited Edition Christmas dolls. Every doll is designed with a wish or 'theme' in mind. For example, Nimue, the Mermaid Pixie, is particularly good at helping the common childhood fear of water, or 'Nightling' helps overcome a fear of the dark. Meet all of our Wish Pixies below...

 

Make-A-Wish grants wishes to children between the ages of 3 and 18, who have been diagnosed with a life threatening illness. Examples of actual wishes that have changed the lives of these children so far include making unicorns fly, to making children into superheroes.

The real life dreams that the Make-A-Wish Foundation make come true and the impact they have on children's lives are truly inspiring – read Sadie's Christmas Wish below:

Hope can be a rare commodity for children battling a life-threatening illness. Kids miss just being kids. Their hope starts to fade. We know Make-A-Wish wish can bring their hope back and so can you.

Research has shown that children who experienced a wish showed a significant reduction in general distress, depression and anxiety symptoms. What’s more, these feelings were replaced with a greater general sense of hope for their future and positive emotions. On the physical side, the children who experience a wish also demonstrate greater health-related quality of life, including a significant reduction in their perceptions of their own physical limitations.

 

Each tiny cloth doll has a little pocket on it's back, which contains a hidden, secret spell. Start by reading the spell with the child. The 'magic' of saying the spell out load, awakens the child's 'Inner Pixie' or 'self awareness'. Now the child cuddles the doll tight and whispers the wish (challenge to overcome) in the Pixies ear and the goal is set.

Every day, the parent or carer leaves little messages of encouragement in the Pixie's pocket, rewarding the positive behaviour and thought patterns that the child is demonstrating to achieve their goal. This sets up a new pattern of thinking in the child – Set a goal, commit to it, think differently, act differently, get rewarded.

 

The design is first drawn out as a sketch of the finished doll. Then the illustration is translated to a watercolour and ink print design, which Dainy hand paints and draws. This artwork gets converted to a print file and the doll designs are printed, using non toxic water based inks, onto the durable cotton/linen cloth.



Each doll shape is then cut out by hand, as well as miniature features like ears, unicorn horns and wings. The pieces get assembled into dolls by our sewers, then stuffed with eco-friendly stuffing made from recycled water bottles. The legs, made of soft cotton jersey, get stitched on next. The doll is completed with cute accessories such as hand knitted scarves and faux fur wings.

 

We have begun our magical journey already, hand crafting a small production run of The Wish Pixies. So far, the positive feedback has been overwhelming and they are in demand. We need your help to set up and produce the next collection of dolls.

Our hand made approach requires specialist crafts people to produce the dolls and to make them ethically in natural fabrics and recycled filling. This process is much more expensive than having them mass produced off shore in fabrics made from plastic (ie: polyester).

To ensure we can continue selling them at a very affordable price, whilst also supporting the kids at Make-A-Wish Foundation, we need to be able to increase the volume of dolls being produced. This will lower the production costs and at the same time, make more dolls available to help more children worldwide! Please help our wish come true...

 

We are so proud of how far we have come and are excited for what's in store for the future! This fairytale timeline details our journey from the beginning up until now, as well as what is to be expected once the campaign ends...


 

Do you ship worldwide?
Yes, we ship all over the world. Our international shipping charge is $25AUD.
We charge $10AUD for shipping within Australia.

Are the dolls suitable for babies?
No, unfortunately due to small parts our Wish Pixie dolls are not suitable for babies.
We recommend that The Wish Pixies dolls are suitable for children aged 3+ years.

Will my doll arrive in time for Christmas?
Our Current Collection Wish Pixies and Christmas Pixies are both ready to be shipped right away. To determine whether these will reach you in time for Christmas, please take into consideration the following shipping times indicated by Australia Post:
Australian Regular Shipping: Allow 2-6 Days.
Overseas Shipping: Please allow up to 3 weeks.
Note: Shipping times are taken from the Australia Post website. These Little Treasures takes no responsibility for shipping time once an item has been dispatched.

The New Collection Wish Pixies are to be ready for dispatch in March/April 2018.

What if the funding isn't reached, will I still receive my new season doll?
Absolutely! No matter what we raise, we will be going ahead with production on our new collection of The Wish Pixies. Raising more funds just means that we are able to make the dolls more accessible, support local industry and raise more for the Make-A-Wish Foundation.

What if I would like my crowd funding perk to ship with an order through your website?
If you would like to place an order both through our website and our crowd funding page, to be shipped together - please let us know and we will ensure that you receive a refund so that you are only paying one shipping charge.

When can we see a sneak peek of the new collection Wish Pixies?
A little fairy told us that there is a sneak peek expected in mid-November.

story:
San Francisco Women Artists

Now more than ever, we are in need of the unique power of art to create unifying bonds among all people by imagining, reflecting, and expanding shared human experience. To continue its work of providing art as an inspiring force in San Francisco and the Bay Area, San Francisco Women Artists (SFWA) seeks your support of our historic nonprofit arts organization. A presence in the San Francisco arts community since 1887, SFWA remains committed to the impact of art by increasing the representation of women in the arts and the encouragement of aspiring young artists.

Your tax-deductible gift will help secure the continuation of our living legacy as we support regional artists and provide a welcoming gallery space in which the wider community may experience the vivifying and humanizing influence of art created by women. To maintain this commitment requires a sustained vision, personal sacrifice, and ongoing financial support. Therefore, we are asking you to consider an investment in SFWA now to support San Francisco Women Artists in its first-ever public fundraising campaign and assist us in meeting our fundraising goal of $25,000. 

Why Donations

SFWA is supported in part by our member artists, gallery sales, outreach programs, individual donations and by various grants from the San Francisco Arts Commission: SF Grants for the Arts, Neighborhood Arts Collaborative, and the Voluntary Arts Contribution Fund. SFWA actively researches and applies for such grants, and has been awarded three grants this past year. Despite this recognition and support, the future of SFWA—like the future of many other San Francisco based arts organizations—is at risk.

Once a thriving mecca for aspiring artists, affordable spaces for artists to exhibit their work in San Francisco have rapidly disappeared, and many galleries have been forced to shutter their doors due to surging operating costs. In the bustling Inner Sunset, SFWA is one of a handful of community-based galleries remaining in the City; however, SFWA is also faced with the very real possibility that our historic nonprofit organization will not survive if we are unable to gain philanthropic support.

Your support will help ensure SFWA continues:

  • Hosting monthly juried exhibits and regional art competitions
  • Providing affordable space rental opportunities for Bay Area artists
  • Mentoring interns through the Mayor’s Youth Education & Employment Program (MYEEP)
  • Featuring youth art exhibits in the gallery’s Artist Salon
  • Providing a welcoming venue for the community to actively engage with local artists

 

More About Us

SFWA is proud of its heritage and its many former members, including prominent artists Ruth Asawa, Imogen Cunningham, Emmy Lou Packard, and Ruth Bernhard. Having previously maintained galleries in San Francisco’s Hayes Valley and Presidio Heights, SFWA relocated 2 years ago to San Francisco’s vibrant Inner Sunset neighborhood, where we are becoming an anchor in its evolving arts community. Including special events and open studios, we exhibit over 300 local women artists and artisans each year, featuring contemporary art, jewelry, ceramics, and sculpture. Despite some positive advances in gender equality in the arts, the reality today is as it has been historically—women artists remain seriously under-represented in museum collections and galleries worldwide. SFWA’s work is devoted to helping shift this paradigm.

Thank You

We thank you for taking the time to read our story and hope you will consider sharing this campaign on social media, or more personally, with your friends and colleagues through email. Your investment today in SFWA will be an investment in the future of art in San Francisco and in the careers of established and emerging Bay Area women artists. SFWA will be extremely grateful for your donation and deeply appreciative of your support.

Learn more about SFWA at www.sfwomenartists.org   

SFWA wishes to thank those who have helped create this campaign:

  • Pam Borrelli                  SFWA Artist and Board Member
  • Marilyn Bridon             SFWA Artist and Board Member
  • Jean Davis                     SFWA Artist
  • Hunter Hadfield          Videographer
  • Angela Han                   SFWA Artist and Board Member
  • Terri Miller                    TLM Consulting
  • Janice Rumbaugh       SFWA Artist and Gallery Director

story:
What is Flint Magazine?
Flint is an art magazine about rocks. The first and second issues bring together works from artists and writers spanning the globe. The Magazine is built on creative collaboration - many of these beautiful works live alongside one another in an archival box, while others are available online through Sensate [www.sensatejournal.com].

Why Rocks?
Rocks are a natural archive and the main point of inspiration for Flint Magazine. They record history as layers of sediment and are the oldest examples of visual symbolism and material technology. We explored the rock as a medium for art, mysticism, place, and history.

Rocks preserve time, space, and artifacts in the same way the internet accumulates information - always collecting and storing without editing itself. Rocks compact history, yet still maintain a beautiful and unique form.

Who's behind Flint Magazine?
Ben Gaydos, [goodgood, UM-Flint], and Maia Asshaq, [DittoDitto Books] began working on the magazine in 2015. They were joined by artist Joe Reinsel later that year to assist in audio and sound curation, and Julia Yezbick, from Sensate Journal in 2016, to help develop an online platform.

Ben and Maia spent a large chunk of this time researching interesting voices that shared their passion and mild obsession with rocks. These contributors span the globe from Brazil to Zimbabwe. They include artists, writers, scientists, filmmakers, and designers like Francisco López, Paul Elliman, Warren Defever, Olayami Dabls, Ana Vaz, and Pauline Oliveros.

 

When can I get Flint Magazine?
Flint Magazine has been in development for nearly three years. The research and pre-production phase has been generously supported by the University of Michigan – Flint, although it’s still not finished.

This is where you come in. We need your help to complete the final stages of the project. With your help, we hope to ship out the first issue of Flint magazine in February 2018.

** Please note a portion of the proceeds of Flint Magazine will go towards two organizations working in Flint; The Flint Public Art Project's after school art education program and the Flint Child Health and Development Fund.**
 

Once complete, you can find it at the following places;

Online at www.dittoditto.org, other fine / art bookstores.

story:
The Florida Museum of Photographic Arts, a Tampa based non profit arts organization dedicated to exhibiting important photographic art as central to contemporary life and culture launches this campaign  to bring to Tampa the exhibition VAIVEN: Six visual journeys back and forth between Spain and the US to celebrate the Hispanic heritage month this October 2015.  


Your contributions will help reaching the remaining funds needed to bring the exhibition to Tampa for almost three months and organize additional activities such as gallery talks and workshops with the artist. 


About the exhibition
With the goal of serving the museum's diverse audience through enriching works by a wide array of domestic and international photographers
the exhibition is an open dialogue about multicultural identities and heritage, migration, and cultural assimilation though the eyes of six Spanish-American photographers. The dichotomy of belonging to two places and the constant play between the influence of cultural background versus the setting, remains the core of this exhibition. Memories, popular culture, identity, the every day life, nature and urban spaces function as starting points to analyze the motivations and expectations that lie behind each photographic series.

The diverse backgrounds of all the artists meet on the common grounds of their intersecting perspectives of both countries. 

Considering Tampa's multicultural diversity and its strong Spanish heritage, many Tampanians, with or without Spanish background, will identify of the topics addressed  with the visual journeys proposed by  contributing artists Ana Hayes-Pérez,  Raúl Urbina,  Xavier Nuez, Javier Corso, Monica Lek, & Carla Tramullas. 

Meet the artists and its works by clicking on their names or watching the following video (in English and Spanish) 


Thank you for helping us bring new and diverse voices to the museum through thought-provoking exhibits like 

Vaiven: Six visual journey's back and forth between Spain &  the US


What We Need & What You Get

The $2,850 dollars will help covering part of the expenses of installing, uninstalling  and maintaining the exhibit in FMOPA for three months as well as organizing parallel exhibits such as gallery talks and workshops. 

The exhibit already receives support from  Spain Arts & Culture, the Spanish official cultural program in the U.S. that aims to create multiple links between the creative sectors of Spain and the US to cover production and transportation costs, but we still need additional  funds to make the project come to live in Tampa. 

In addition to showing  your name in our THANK YOU wall at the exhibit, you will receive THANK YOU gifts for your contributions such as photobooks,  museum memberships, photography workshops, photo sessions and personal photography lessons with luxusphotography.com  & award winning photographer & FMOPA's instructor Jeremy Scott. Check the perks section for details. 

Do you want to see more? Check the exhibition's catalog

For questions or additional information contact Agueda Sanfiz, exhibition coordinator at agueda.sanfiz@gmail.com
