story:
(Scroller vers le bas pour le texte en français)

Let’s send this tractor to Senegal before the rain !

In the countryside in Senegal, in a small village of Touba Djigane in the region of Kaolack, there’s a small agriculture project where 11 young men, aged 25-40, are working and cultivating land.

In March 2015, before Heidi travelled to Senegal to plan her fashion project, she was having Senegalese tea at Alioune & Anne’s place in Geneva. The discussion on happiness, travelling, cultural differences and realising one’s dreams inspired us to create this project.

Heidi: “Alioune told me about these young men in Touba Djigane, they have their families in big cities but are determined to make their life the hard way and cultivate the land. I wanted to go there, find out why, and see this project myself. Alioune has spent himself some time working there, by hand, and it’s his long time dream to be able to send them a tractor. At Touba Djigane I met good-hearted, motivated men, who are passionate about agriculture and happy to work under the hot sun and live simple life.”

Many people in Senegal still imagine money grows on trees in Europe, and life is easy. They do everything to get here, because it’s difficult to make life in Senegal. Our motivation is to help people who don’t run after illusions, but are ready to work to make their lives. In Senegal it’s difficult to have the material needed for working.

The Agriculture Project

The land in this area is very rich and can provide lot of vegetables and fruits. The young men have 14 hectares of land, but because this land has never been prepared for agriculture, the first steps are difficult. Despite of that, in the previous years they have already prepared one part of the area (2 hectares) by hand, with help of a horse and a donkey. Currently they continue doing their best with what they have.

In Senegal there’s 3 months of the rainy season, during which everything turns green and people can cultivate their lands, and if they work well they can gain enough to live the next 9 months before the next cultivating season. A tractor in Touba Djigane would make a big difference on people’s lives. They could turn over much more land and cultivate it all this year. With the products that they can sell, they could also buy animals. People who live in the villages in this area are passionate about agriculture, and only thing slowing down making their life by cultivating their lands is the lack of equipment. They need a tractor, and eventually also a watering system to be able to cultivate all year round, but for now the tractor would make a big step for advancing, if they get it before the rainy season starts.

The Tractor

The price for a new tractor is 12 000 - 15 000 €. We have found this second hand tractor in Spain for 3700 € (= 4150 dollars) and we’d like to buy and send it to Touba Djigane before the rainy season. The tractor is suitable for the use in Senegal. The tractor has now been reserved for us until the end of this campaign, and if this project will be successfully financed, the owner of the tractor will send it to Senegal in a container.  There are no custom fees for importing agriculture equipment to Senegal. It will take 10 days to get to Senegal, and Abdou and Ibrahim will go and receive the tractor, and bring it to the village. Also Alioune will arrive from Switzerland in the beginning of July with his family and they’ll confirm everything goes smoothly. They will also update us all with photos from Touba Djigane when our friends can start working with the tractor!

All money you send goes directly to the tractor and the costs it takes to send it to Senegal. Sending costs about 1000 € and this website platform keeps also a small percentage of the payments, so the budget is really only on the tractor. In case we'd receive more money than our goal is, we could buy other equipment to go with the tractor. Even a small contribution makes a difference! 10 dollars is about 9 euros at the moment. 

Plan B : If we won't have enough money by the end of the campaign, you can still be sure the money goes to the tractor. We will then organize musical evenings to fundraise to complete the project. In this case it might take more time before we get the tractor to Touba Djigane, so we really hope to reach our goal.

Planning

4. June  End of the campaign: if we have the money, we confirm buying the tractor

11. June   The tractor will leave from Spain in a container (10 days of voyage)

21. June  The tractor arrives in Senegal and is driven to Touba Djigane, and our friends can  start working with it

July - August - September   The rainy season in Senegal, during which all agriculture work is done, and with the results people can live for the rest of the year.

Why We Want To Help

  • They work hard and show results. These young men have during 6 years showed that they can plan things, work and make it happen. If they have the means they can cultivate all the land they have and produce a lot this year, as well as help the people in the villages nearby.
  • Small thing for us, big for them. With a small contribution we can make a big difference. We believe in supporting hardworking, good hearted people who show they are capable of using well the resources they have at hand.
  • Good example for other young people. We want more people to stay motivated and work, instead of trying to take boats to Europe in hopes of a better life. Many die on these trips, many are sent back as soon as they reach Spain, and those who get to Europe don’t really find jobs and the dream of the better life proves to be an illusion. We want to raise awareness on this and help people realise there are better options, and support those who are working to make their life in a good and constructive way.

Alioune: “It's my friends in Touba Djigane. I was there in 2009 when the project started, and I spent there one month and helped them to cut the bushes and prepare the 2 hectares of land that they're using now. I return there every year to see my friends, and they are very determined to do good work, despite the challenging circumstances. The project is advancing all the time, and I'd really like to help them.”

Anne: “I've lived 2 years in Senegal in a small village with similar conditions as Touba Djigane. I've seen the farmers sweat under the hot sun working with only a donkey, a horse, even without any help, just with the tools they had. The life is hard and how their families will live by the rest of the year depends completely on what they manage to cultivate during these three months. Would a farmer here work without a tractor? It's such a small investment compared to what an enormous change it can make in people's daily life. It is really worth joining our forces to support these people, and together we can do it."

Heidi: “I went to Touba Djigane in April 2015 and got to know the people there. They have understood that the good life and happiness does not come with easily gained wealth, but believe in working and constructing, and having peace of mind and heart. I find that very admirable and I really want to help them realize their dream. They make a good example for all of us, and really need and deserve this tractor.”

Please Join Us !

Let’s make this happen. Let’s show these and other young people that when you are ready to work for it to happen, dreams do come true. Thank you!  

Anne, Alioune & Heidi - in Geneva, Switzerland

Abdou, Ibrahim, Khadim, Fallou, Beugue Fallou, Ali Ndao, Bouba, Ousseinou, Nganel, Abdou Karim & Mame Cheikh - in Touba Djigane, Senegal


Envoyons ce tracteur au Sénégal avant les pluies !

Dans le village de brousse de Touba Djigane, dans la région de Kaolack, un petit projet agricole mobilise 11 jeunes hommes entre 25 et 40 ans qui ont décidé de rester et ont préféré cultiver leur terre plutôt que d'embarquer sur d'incertaines pirogues.

En mars 2015, avant que Heidi ne parte au Sénégal pour planifier son projet de mode, elle est venue boire le thé sénégalais chez Alioune et Anne à Genève. Le discussion sur le bonheur, les voyages, les différences culturelles et la réalisation de nos rêves a inspiré monter ce projet pour Touba Djigane.

Heidi : « Alioune m'a parlé de ces jeunes gens de Touba Djigane ; leurs familles sont loin dans des grandes villes mais ils ont choisi de cultiver la terre, un choix difficile. J'ai voulu aller là-bas pour comprendre ce choix et voir le projet par moi-même. Alioune a lui-même passé du temps à Touba Djigane pour aider à défricher à la main et il rêve depuis longtemps de leur envoyer un tracteur. A Touba Djigane, j'ai rencontré des hommes de coeur, motivés, passionnés par le travail de la terre et heureux de travailler, même dur, sous le soleil et de mener une vie simple. »

Au Sénégal, beaucoup de gens pensent encore qu'en Europe l'argent pousse sur des arbres et que la vie y est facile. Ils font tout pour tenter la traversée parce que la vie au Sénégal est difficile. Notre motivation est d'aider des gens qui ne courent pas après des illusions mais sont prêts à travailler pour gagner leur vie. Une des difficultés qui se présente à eux au Sénégal est le manque de matériel et d'équipement adéquat.

Le projet agricole

La terre de Touba Djigane est très fertile et peut produire beaucoup de céréales, fruits et légumes. Les jeunes qui travaillent dans ce projet ont 14 hectares à disposition, mais seules leurs mains et leur force pour travailler. Les premiers pas sont donc difficiles. S'ils ont tout défriché, ils ne sont pourtant en mesure de cultiver que deux hectares, puisqu'ils ont pour seule aide un cheval que la charrue épuise rapidement. Au quotidien, ils font de leur mieux avec les moyens à disposition.
Or, le rendement dépend de la surface cultivée.

En effet, au Sénégal, la saison des pluies ne dure que 3 mois, de juillet à septembre. Tout verdit alors et c'est exclusivement durant cette période que les paysans produisent la récolte des 9 mois les séparant de la prochaine saisons des pluies. 2 hectares exploitable, c'est donc très peu. Un tracteur serait un énorme plus pour ces jeunes cultivateurs et les paysans des villages alentours; ils pourraient labourer et cultiver toute la surface disponible et obtenir ainsi une récolte plus abondante pour la population locale et pour la vente. Les bénéfices permettraient également d'acheter des vaches et des moutons.

Les gens des villages aiment leur terre, mais le manque d'équipement performant rend leur travail et leur vie terriblement difficiles. Ils ont réellement besoin d'un tracteur et même à terme d'un système d'irrigation pour cultiver au-delà de la saison des pluies, mais pour l'heure, au seuil de la saison des pluies, un tracteur ferait déjà toute la différence.

Le tracteur

Un tracteur neuf coûte entre 12 000 - 15 000 €. Nous avons trouvé un tracteur d'occasion en Espagne pour 3700 € (= 4150 $) et nous souhaiterions vivement pouvoir l'acheter et l'envoyer au Sénégal. Ce tracteur convient parfaitement à une utilisation au Sénégal. Il est réservé pour nous jusqu'à la fin de cette campagne et, si le projet rassemble le financement nécessaire, l'actuel propriétaire du tracteur pourra le faire transporter au Sénégal par container. Afin de favoriser des initiatives comme celles des jeunes de Touba Djigane, le gouvernement sénégalais a décidé d'exempter de frais de douane tout le matériel agricole importé au Sénégal. Le transport durera 10 jours et Abdou et Ibrahim viendront réceptionner le tracteur à Dakar et le transporter jusqu'au village. Alioune et sa famille arriveront aussi au Sénégal début juillet et ils pourront confirmer la bonne marche des opérations. Ils pourront faire parvenir des photos des premières utilisations du tracteur.

Tout l'argent envoyé ira directement à l'achat du tracteur et aux frais de transport de ce dernier. Les frais de transport s'élèvent environ à 1000€ et le site par lequel nous menons la campagne garde aussi un petit pourcentage des versements effectués. 10$ valent actuellement environ 9€.

Plan B : Si nous ne parvenons pas à réunir la somme prévue au terme de la campagne, nous vous assurons néanmoins que le montant atteint ira intégralement à l'achat du tracteur et nous organiserons des événements musicaux pour lever des fonds supplémentaires. Cela aura pour conséquence de reporter l'envoi du tracteur et de « gaspiller » une nouvelle saison des pluies ; nous espérons donc vivement atteindre notre objectif.

Calendrier

4 juin :     Fin de la campagne, si nous avons la somme, nous confirmons l'achat du tracteur

11 juin :     Le tracteur quittera l'Espagne dans un container (10 jours de voyage)

21 juin :     Arrivée du tracteur au Sénégal et transport vers Touba Djigane, nos amis pourront commencer à travailler avec

Juillet - Août - Septembre :     Saison des pluies au Sénégal, qui est la seule saison durant laquelle on cultive et dont le produit fait vivre le reste de l'année.

3 raisons pour les aider

  • Ils travaillent dur et obtiennent des résultats. Pendant les 6 dernières années, ces jeunes gens ont démontré qu'ils pouvaient faire des projets, travailler et les réaliser. Avec des moyens adéquats, ils pourront cultiver toute la terre, augmenter considérablement leur production et aider les populations des villages voisins.
  •  Une petite chose pour nous en est une grande pour eux. Avec une petite contribution, nous pouvons faire une grande différence. Nous croyons en le fait de soutenir des gens de bonne volonté qui travaillent dur et sont capables d'utiliser les ressources dont ils disposent.
  •  Un bon exemple pour les jeunes au Sénégal. Nous souhaitons que plus de gens puissent être motivés à rester et à travailler au lieu d'embarquer sur des bateaux avec le rêve d'une vie meilleure. Beaucoup meurent en route, beaucoup sont renvoyés au pays dès leur arrivée en Espagne et, pour ceux qui atteignent l'Europe, le rêve devient vite une illusion. Nous souhaitons contribuer à faire prendre conscience de cela, aider les jeunes à réaliser qu'il existe d'autres options et soutenir ceux qui travaillent pour gagner leur vie d'une façon positive et constructive.

Alioune : “C'est mes amis à Touba Djigane. J'étais là-bas en 2009 quand ils ont commencé le projet, je suis resté un mois et j'ai aidé à défricher la brousse et à préparer les 2 hectares de terre qu'ils utilisent maintenant. J'y retourne chaque année pour voir mes amis, ils sont déterminés à travailler durement dans les champs. Malgré les conditions pénibles, je vois qu'ils évoluent bien et j'aimerais vraiment leur donner un coup de pouce et les soutenir dans leur effort.”

Anne : "J'ai vécu 2 ans au Sénégal dans un village de brousse aux conditions similaires à celles de Touba Djigane. J'ai vu travailler les paysans et peiner sous le soleil avec un âne, un cheval ou rien d'autres que leurs outils. La vie est rude et la subsistance de leur famille pour une année entière dépend de cette seule récolte annuelle. Quel paysan travaillerait ici sans tracteur ? C'est un minuscule investissement pour un énorme changement dans le quotidien de ces gens. Nous mettre ensemble pour les soutenir en vaut la peine et nous pouvons le faire. "

Heidi : "Je suis allée à Touba Djigane en avril 2015 et j'ai rencontré les gens là-bas. Ils ont compris que le bonheur ne vient pas d'argent gagné facilement, mais croient en le travail et la paix d'âme et d'esprit. J'ai trouvé cela très admirable et j'ai vraiment envie de les aider à réaliser leur rêve. Ils sont un bon exemple pour nous tous ; ils ont besoin de ce tracteur et le méritent."

Rejoignez-nous !

Réalisons ce projet et montrons à ces jeunes gens et aux autres que les rêves peuvent devenir réalité lorsqu'on y croit fort. Merci !

Anne, Alioune & Heidi - à Genève, Suisse

Abdou, Ibrahim, Khadim, Fallou, Beugue Fallou, Ali Ndao, Bouba, Ousseinou, Nganel, Abdou Karim & Mame Cheikh - à Touba Djigane, Sénégal
story_txt:
(Scroller vers le bas pour le texte en français)Let’s send this tractor to Senegal before the rain !
In the countryside in Senegal, in a small village of Touba Djigane in the region
of Kaolack, there’s a small agriculture project where 11 young men, aged 25-40,
are working and cultivating land.
In March 2015, before Heidi travelled to Senegal to plan her fashion
project, she was having Senegalese tea at Alioune & Anne’s place in Geneva. The
discussion on happiness, travelling, cultural differences and realising one’s
dreams inspired us to create this project.
Heidi: “Alioune told me about these young men in Touba Djigane, they have
their families in big cities but are determined to make their life the hard way
and cultivate the land. I wanted to go there, find out why, and see this project
myself. Alioune has spent himself some time working there, by hand, and it’s
his long time dream to be able to send them a tractor. At Touba Djigane I met
good-hearted, motivated men, who are passionate about agriculture and happy to
work under the hot sun and live simple life.” 

Many people in Senegal still imagine money grows on trees in Europe, and
life is easy. They do everything to get here, because it’s difficult to make
life in Senegal. Our motivation is to help people who don’t run after
illusions, but are ready to work to make their lives. In Senegal it’s difficult
to have the material needed for working.
The Agriculture Project
The land in this area is very rich and can provide lot of vegetables and
fruits. The young men have 14 hectares of land, but because this land has never
been prepared for agriculture, the first steps are difficult. Despite of that,
in the previous years they have already prepared one part of the area (2 hectares)
by hand, with help of a horse and a donkey. Currently they continue doing their
best with what they have. 
In Senegal there’s 3 months of the rainy season, during which everything
turns green and people can cultivate their lands, and if they work well they
can gain enough to live the next 9 months before the next cultivating season. A
tractor in Touba Djigane would make a big difference on people’s lives. They
could turn over much more land and cultivate it all this year. With the
products that they can sell, they could also buy animals. People who live in
the villages in this area are passionate about agriculture, and only thing
slowing down making their life by cultivating their lands is the lack of
equipment. They need a tractor, and eventually also a watering system to be
able to cultivate all year round, but for now the tractor would make a big step
for advancing, if they get it before the rainy season starts.
The Tractor 
The price for a new tractor is 12 000 - 15 000 €. We have found this
second hand tractor in Spain for 3700 € (= 4150 dollars) and we’d like to buy and send it to Touba
Djigane before the rainy season. The tractor is suitable for the use in
Senegal. The tractor has now been reserved for us until the end of this
campaign, and if this project will be successfully financed, the owner of the
tractor will send it to Senegal in a container. 
There are no custom fees for importing agriculture equipment to Senegal.
It will take 10 days to get to Senegal, and Abdou and Ibrahim will go and
receive the tractor, and bring it to the village. Also Alioune will arrive from
Switzerland in the beginning of July with his family and they’ll confirm everything
goes smoothly. They will also update us all with photos from Touba Djigane when
our friends can start working with the tractor! 
All money you send goes directly to the tractor and the costs
it takes to send it to Senegal. Sending costs about 1000 € and this website platform keeps also a small percentage of the payments, so the budget is really only on the tractor. In case we'd receive more money than our goal is, we could buy other equipment to go with the tractor. Even a small contribution makes a difference! 10 dollars is about 9 euros at the moment.  Plan B : If we won't have enough money by the end of the 
campaign, you can still be sure the money goes to the tractor. We will 
then organize musical evenings to fundraise to complete the project. In this case it might take 
more time before we get the tractor to Touba Djigane, so we really hope 
to reach our goal. 
Planning
4. June  End of the campaign: if we have the money, we
confirm buying the tractor
11. June   The tractor will leave from Spain in a
container (10 days of voyage)
21. June  The tractor
arrives in Senegal and is driven to Touba Djigane, and our friends can  start working with it
July - August - September   The
rainy season in Senegal, during which all agriculture work is done, and with the results people can live for the rest of
the year.Why We Want To Help 



They work hard and show results. These young men have during 6 years
showed that they can plan things, work and make it happen. If they have the
means they can cultivate all the land they have and produce a lot this year, as
well as help the people in the villages nearby.

Small thing for us, big for them. With a small contribution we can make
a big difference. We believe in supporting hardworking, good hearted people who
show they are capable of using well the resources they have at hand.

Good example for other young people. We want more people to stay
motivated and work, instead of trying to take boats to Europe in hopes of a better
life. Many die on these trips, many are sent back as soon as they reach Spain,
and those who get to Europe don’t really find jobs and the dream of the better
life proves to be an illusion. We want to raise awareness on this and help
people realise there are better options, and support those who are working to
make their life in a good and constructive way.
Alioune: “It's my friends in Touba Djigane. I was there in 2009 when the project started, and I spent there one month and helped them to cut the bushes and prepare the 2 hectares of land that they're using now. I return there every year to see my friends, and they are very determined to do good work, despite the challenging circumstances. The project is advancing all the time, and I'd really like to help them.”
Anne: “I've lived 2 years in Senegal in a small village with similar conditions as Touba Djigane. I've seen the farmers sweat under the hot sun working with only a donkey, a horse, even without any help, just with the tools they had. The life is hard and how their families will live by the rest of the year depends completely on what they manage to cultivate during these three months. Would a farmer here work without a tractor? It's such a small investment compared to what an enormous change it can make in people's daily life. It is really worth joining our forces to support these people, and together we can do it." 
Heidi: “I went to Touba Djigane in April 2015 and got to know the people
there. They have understood that the good life and happiness does not come with
easily gained wealth, but believe in working and constructing, and having peace
of mind and heart. I find that very admirable and I really want to help them
realize their dream. They make a good example for all of us, and really need
and deserve this tractor.”
Please Join Us !Let’s make this happen. Let’s show these and other young people that when
you are ready to work for it to happen, dreams do come true. Thank you!  Anne, Alioune & Heidi - in Geneva, SwitzerlandAbdou, Ibrahim, Khadim, Fallou, Beugue Fallou, Ali Ndao, Bouba, Ousseinou,
Nganel, Abdou Karim & Mame Cheikh - in Touba Djigane, Senegal

Ils ont compris que le bonheur ne vient pas d'argent gagné facilement, mais croient en le travail et la paix d'âme et d'esprit. J'ai trouvé cela très admirable et j'ai vraiment envie de les aider à réaliser leur rêve. Ils sont un bon exemple pour nous tous ; ils ont besoin de ce tracteur et le méritent."
Rejoignez-nous !

Réalisons ce projet et montrons à ces jeunes gens et aux autres que les rêves peuvent devenir réalité lorsqu'on y croit fort. Merci !
Anne, Alioune & Heidi - à Genève, Suisse
Abdou, Ibrahim, Khadim, Fallou, Beugue Fallou, Ali Ndao, Bouba, Ousseinou,
Nganel, Abdou Karim & Mame Cheikh - à Touba Djigane, Sénégal

story:
With your help we will transform our art website into the biggest and powerful online gallery of contemporary art and you will help thousands of creative people to express their talents in art and share their artwork with the whole world !!!


 Hello everyone. My name is Ilya. I'm a founder of project ARTWORK Online Gallery (www.artwork-gallery.ru).

  It is strange how much one trip changes you. I have long lived in Siberia, in Omsk and probably never would have thought about creating an online gallery, if not a nice trip to St. Petersburg. Beauty works in museums and galleries in the city has been able to move  me deeply,and ever since I love art and all that it involves. At that moment, when I first touched this wonderful creative world, I was very surprised that my attempts to find some big free internet portal, which would cover the different directions in art, have been unsuccessful. Most part of internet resources offer only to buy or sell the paintings . Well, if we are not talking about selling, we can observe only a very highly specialized portals. Pottery, painters, masters of computer graphics and other creative people… All of them work on their own as separated tribes living in one state, but under different laws and customs.

  I was very surprised about this state of affairs and decided that it would be just fine to combine all of these people in a single project. To be able to cover the different types and styles to create a real support of contemporary art. I wanted it to be a place where any beginner or an experienced artist could present their work, show it to the people to express his gift, his talent.

  The “ARTWORK Online Gallery” project has come to life. Starting work on a small website, I realized that more and more artists want to express themselves, and among them were many young talents who have just started to take their first steps in the incredible world of art. And each of them works in a different direction. At this point, it became obvious that I can not manage alone, and I got my friends to work on ”Artwork Online Gallery” as well. So we started adding more and more new sections where everyone could find a place in the cozy halls of our virtual online gallery. Later I went to live in Bulgaria, where I told about my “Online Gallery” to new friends and as a result, our team has enlarged, and there also has been new artists who really wanted to show their creativity to the world.

  More and more artists from different countries began to join our project and continue to make our gallery even more attractive for those who appreciate art. The next step was to work with social networks and then it became obvious that there are true connoisseurs of beauty , because our communities in social networks is supported by thousands of people and now we know that the work is not in vain and that people are very interested in our project.

  But with the big popularity problems began to appear . It turned out that we simply cannot withstand the load on the website, and we just need more powerful servers, and will be a lot of work on innovations for our “Online Gallery”. It was then that we realize where to look for help! Of course, here, in a place where people care about other people's ideas and where we can see with our desire to bring beauty and art to everyone who wants it.

  Art - is the thing that has no nationality and language, it is one for all, it is now a world heritage of humanity, which should be available to everyone. That is why we are eager to expand our project worldwide. This is why  we created this campaign to raise funds. Our goal is not only to help people  enjoy the beautiful works of art of the world, but also give an opportunity to everyone who is talented in art  to find their own creative way and even get into museums and exhibitions together with the originals of their works. And it's not just our desire. It is the desire of all those who love art and our project. With your support we can show the wonderful world of creative people which is filled with miracles and beauty.

  We also want to create a bridge between those who create and those who are already working in the field of art. We want to help young talents  reach out to those people who are happy to take their work to exhibitions, galleries and museums. There are so many fine artists among the young people who cannot find their way due to the fact that there are many obstacles in the art world. And against the backdrop of the global chaos that reigns various military and political wars, we want to create a real home for all those who see a bright future in the arts, in its beauty and purity. And that artists and other creators will be able to show us the beautiful world and can once again regain faith in a better future.

  Our team looks forward to your support, because all raised funds will help our resource to develop  further. We will be able to help all those who can create works of incredible beauty and it is with your support we will be able to show the best works in the world to a  huge number of people from different countries and regions of our planet!

  There is nothing better than to give people the light and joy through art in our difficult times. And if we can expand with your help, we will be very glad to see you in our virtual gallery of contemporary art, both as an artist and as a visitor, because “ARTWORK Online Gallery” – it is a real stronghold of art.

After all this we can conclude that the main goal of our updated Online Gallery is a full cooperation of those who create works of art and art lovers from all over the world on one site.  And the most important thing is that our website is not online store. All creative people can show their works even if they are not going to sell them. Thanks to a new approach of the project development and a new system of interaction with the site, artists will be able to get acquainted with art dealers, gain fame, show their work to the whole world and get admirers of their works. And users of the portal will be able to communicate freely with the people of art, enjoy beautiful works of art, as well as demonstrate their own talents and learn something new . And the live communication without language barriers with people from different countries and new experience will help everyone to touch the beautiful, to the very heart of our wonderful Online Gallery.


That's why we need your help with fundraising.

  Because we want to create the biggest, most informative and useful online gallery of contemporary art, we need to spend a huge amount of work. That's why we suggest you get familiar with the diagram of budget planning. We have identified six of the most important points:

1. Development and programming 

2. Seo & PR

3. Purchase of international domain in the  .com zone (new site adress will be:  www.artwork-gallery.com).

4. Gifts and rewards for anyone who has decided to support our project.

5. Multilanguage (also improve existing translation).

6. Rent of powerful servers.

                 BUDGET DISTRIBUTION DIAGRAM:

The first paragraph "Development and Programming" also includes at least fifteen subparagraphs (language on pictures - Russian):

1. Add support for hashtags and improve the search engine for works of art.


2. Develop and add a personal user account with an extended set of features (4 types of membership will be available).


3. Add a graphics editor to our online gallery. Each user will have the opportunity to feel like an artist. There will be a special section for users under the title "I am learning to draw ...". In this section, users can upload their creations. Planned support for graphics tablets.


4. Blogs for each artist. Each artist will be able to run their own blog.


5. Function «Follow me» to the user. Every registered user will be able to monitor the work of his favourite master fromthe account or receive the latest news on e-mail.


6. Add the function "Albums" for artists. Each artist will be able to add not only the individual works, but also create albums of a series of works, or add a photo of the creative process.


7.  Finalize the feedback form. Now, if the visitoris are interested in someone's work of art they can contact the artistdirectly, bypassing the site administration.

8. Improving commenting of the works. It is planned to make comment form not only through social networking plugins but also by adding comments on the site.


9. Add a visit counter. Will take into account the number of visits to the page of the author and browsing with works of art. On this basis, new sections will be added: Work of the day, work of the week and work of the month. The popularity of the artist will also be taken into account based on the counter.

visit counter

work of the week(day, month)


10. Add filters in each category to simplify searching. Now the filters are not available for all categories of the site. Once finalized this task, visitors can apply filters to all categories.


11. Simplify the site navigation and implementation of a large number of tips starting with the registration process, and ending with the viewing and adding the artwork.

better site navigation

useful tips


12. Support for the English language forum.


13. Additional functions for the artist's page.


14. Improve artist's personal account.


15. Add a search bar with an expanded set of features.


And of course, this is not the full list of additions to the website, and only a small part of what we are going to do on our portal.


Rewards for your support:

Any contribution is a huge help! Your contributions will help not only to develop the project. You will help all creative people to express their talents in art and share their artwork with the whole world. We will be glad of any support and certainly will show our gratitude with a gift associated with art. For all who support us, we have prepared a lot of pleasant surprises.

$1 - Many thanks for your support. 

We are very glad that you have supported development of our online gallery!!! Your contribution is very important to us!!!

$5 - Many many thanks for your support + your name on the website. 

Your contribution is very important to us!!!  We are really happy that you supported our online gallery. All those who funded this amount for the project will be in a special section of the site under the name of "Thanks for".

$15 - Many many many thanks for your support + your name on the website + early access to  most new functions of our online gallery (6 month of free membership). 

We are very glad that people are not indifferent to the development of art. Your contribution is very important to us!!! All those who funded this amount for the project will be in a special section of the site under the name of "Thanks for" + you will get an early access to the most new functions of our online gallery. 

$30 + shipping - "ARTWORK Online Gallery" Poster + Early access to most new functions of our online gallery + your name on the website (6 month of free membership). .

!!!non-standard shipping methods are discussed separately

All those who funded this amount for the project will get an excellent poster with the image of one of the paintings from our online gallery + your name will be in a special section of the site under the name of "Thanks for" + you will get an early access to the most new functions of our online gallery. 


$50 + shipping - "ARTWORK Online Gallery" Logo T-shirt + Early access to most new functions of our online gallery (6 month of free membership).  (English and Russian Logo available)+ your name on the website.

!!!non-standard shipping methods are discussed separately

Your name will be in a special section of the site under the name of "Thanks for".




$75 + shipping - "ARTWORK Online Gallery" Logo T-Shirt + "ARTWORK Online Gallery" Logo Cap + Early access to most new functions of our online gallery (6 month of free membership). .
!!!!!!non-standard shipping methods are discussed separately

$150 + shipping - Canvas Print Painting + your name on the website + early access to  most new functions of our online gallery(6 month of free membership). 
!!! frame and non-standard shipping methods are discussed separately
You will get an excellent canvas printed painting from our online gallery. Size 30x40 cm or 40x30 cm.  Your name will be in a special section of the site under the name of "Thanks for".
Canvas Print 40x30 cm. (This is an example of one of the dozens of pictures available for printing).

Canvas Print 30x40 cm. (This is an example of one of the dozens of pictures available for printing).

$350 + shipping - Canvas Print Painting + your name on the website + early access to  most new functions of our online gallery + graphics tablet (6 month of free membership). 
!!! frame and non-standard shipping methods are discussed separately
You will get an excellent canvas printed painting from our online gallery (Size 30x40 cm or 40x30 cm) + graphics tablet to use all new functions of our website. Your name will be in a special section of the site under the name of "Thanks for".
Canvas Print 30x40 cm (This is an example of one of the dozens of pictures available for printing) + graphics tablet.

                                                                         or 

Canvas Print 40x30 cm (This is an example of one of the dozens of pictures available for printing) + graphics tablet.


$750 + shipping - Original Artwork from our online gallery + graphics tablet + your name on the website + early access to  most new functions of our online gallery(6 month of free membership). 
!!! !!! frame and non-standard shipping methods are discussed separately
We want to thank you for this contribution and make you a gift from our online gallery. Our team is pleased to present you an original watercolor or pastel paintings. You will be asked dozens of different pastel or watercolor paintings to choose from. (Size up to 30x40 cm or 40x30 cm.). Your name will be in a special section of the site under the name of "Thanks for".
It can be:
Pastel painting + graphics tablet

                                                                          or
Watercolor painting + graphics tablet

And of course, all works of art made by wonderful artists registered in "ARTWORK Online Gallery".

$1500 + shipping - Original Oil Painting (size from 30x40 (or 40x30) up to 50x70 (or 70x50 cm)) + graphics tablet + your name on the website + early access to  most new functions of our online gallery (1 year of free membership). 
!!! frame and non-standard shipping methods are discussed separately
You will  get an excellent oil painting made by our wonderful artists and of course graphics tablet to use all new functions of the website. Your name will be in a special section of the site under the name of "Thanks for".
Original oil painting + graphics tablet (dozens of paintings are available to chose from). 



$5500 + shipping - Original Oil Painting (size from 55x70 (70x55) up to 100x120 or 120x100 cm) + graphics tablet + your name on the website + early access to  most new functions of our online gallery(1 year of free membership). 
!!! frame and non-standard shipping methods are discussed separately
Beautiful gift from ARTWORK Online Gallery - large original oil painting made by our wonderful artist + graphics tablet to use all new functions of the website. Your name will be in a special section of the site under the name of "Thanks for".

Oil painintg + graphics tablet:


$15000 + shipping - "ARTWORK Online Gallery" set + your name on the website + early access to  most new functions of our online gallery(2 years of free membership). 
!!! frame and non-standard shipping methods are discussed separately
For this great contribution you will get a full "ARTWORK Online Gallery" set which includes: 
- large original oil painting (size up to 100x120 cm) made by our wonderful artist
- professional graphics tablet to use all new functions of the website  
- "ARTWORK Online Gallery" Logo T-Shirt 
- "ARTWORK Online Gallery" Logo Cap 
Your name will be in a special section of the site under the name of "Thanks for".

ARTWORK Online Gallery set:


Risks and challenges:

In spite of our desire to send our gifts to everyone who has supported us as quickly as possible, we can face a number of difficulties, which do not depend on us.

We cannot give exact delivery times, as they may vary depending on:

- Type of transportation

- The conditions of delivery of postal companies

- Your country of residence.

Of course we pointed that Estimated Delivery date of your gifts if February 2016.  But this date is only possible if :

1). Your gift is:

- “ARTWORK Online Gallery” Poster.

-  Canvas Print Painting

- “ARTWORK Online Gallery” Logo T-shirt

- “ARTWORK Online Gallery”  Logo Cap

2). If the original works of art are at the artist and don’t need to make a copy.

3). If the work is not cultural value and don’t need to make special documents for sending.

If the painting selected as a gift is out of stock, it may take time to create this work of art. Production time of the painting copy depends on the artists themselves. We would also like  to warn you that the standard shipping method does not include insurance for works of art and, unfortunately, it applies to all types of work, whether it is a copy or the original.



OUR TEAM:

 


  Ilya Dyachenko (Russia) - Founder of the project. 

It was he who had the idea to create ARTWORK Online Gallery. And his team from distant Siberia was pleased to support this idea.


 Ivan Zarenkov (Russia) - Design & Programming

Took responsibility for the appearance and the technical part of the project. Experience gained by him for 7 years as head of web-studio allows to solve all tasks at the proper level.


 Egor Krutskiy (Russia) : Content

"Write, search and create" - this is his motto.                                                                  Takes any amount of work and does it quickly and efficiently.


  Konstantin Kutsevalov (Russia) : Programming

His mind is always full of fresh ideas. Knows everything and even more about programming .... 


  Elena Karadjova (Bulgaria) : Support & Translation

She loves to talk and is able to do it in a number of leanguages. She will help all this connect.


 Martin Lacabanne (Argentina): Independent artist 



                       FAQ:

                               Q: How old is your website ??? 

A: Our site is very young. The domain was registered in 2012, but the work on the website began in 2014. First we made a small website for some Russian artists to show their works. But later we saw that artists from other countries want to show their artwork. They began to ask us questions how they can upload works of art to our website. And we started develop ARTWORK Online Gallery.

            Q: How much I have to pay for registration in your project?

A: Our project is free for all .

                          Q: How many works can I upload for free?

A: You can upload an infinite number of your works of art. But we have a limit on the file size - not more than 2 megabytes. Later we are going to remove the limit on the file size.

   Q: You have a Russian domain now.  Are you going to purchase               international  domain name?

A: Sure!!! We are going to purchase ".com" domain. New domain name will be www.artwork-gallery.com . But the cost of this domain name is  $3896.20 (https://who.is/whois/artwork-gallery.com - link  to check the price). That's why we made this IndieGoGo Campaign.
                     

          Q: Are you going to improve personal account for users?

A: Of course. Our team is going to develop and add a personal user account with an extended set of features.
                     

      Q: I'm not from Russia. Can I upload my works to your website?

A: No matter what is your country. Everyone can show their talents in art on our website.

                     Q: Can I sale my paintings from your website? 

A: Yes. If someone will show interest to one of your paintings or other works, our administrators will let you know about it. Upon receiving the order the administration of the site conveys the artist’s contact details to the buyer (or vice versa - the buyer transfers the data to the artist), without taking further part in the transaction. Thus, the artist is able to negotiate with the buyer directly, without intermediaries, increasing the chances to sell his work. (In case of a successful deal the website's commission is just 10%. This amount helps to maintain the website).


Other ways to help:

If you can't make a contribution, do not worry.  We'll be very grateful if you tell about project "ARTWORK Online Gallery" to your friends and share our campaign in social networks such as facebook, twitter, google+ , LinkedIn and others.

- "ARTWORK Online Gallery" Logo Cap

Risks and challenges:
In spite of our desire to send our gifts to everyone who has supported us as quickly as possible, we can face a number of difficulties, which do not depend on us.
We cannot give exact delivery times, as they may vary depending on:
- Type of transportation
- The conditions of delivery of postal companies
- Your country of residence.
Of course we pointed that Estimated Delivery date of your gifts if February 2016.  But this date is only possible if :
1). Your gift is:
- “ARTWORK Online Gallery” Poster.
-  Canvas Print Painting
- “ARTWORK Online Gallery” Logo T-shirt
- “ARTWORK Online Gallery”  Logo Cap
2). If the original works of art are at the artist and don’t need to make a copy.
3). If the work is not cultural value and don’t need to make special documents for sending.
If the painting selected as a gift is out of stock, it may take time to create this work of art. Production time of the painting copy depends on the artists themselves. We would also like  to warn you that the standard shipping method does not include insurance for works of art and, unfortunately, it applies to all types of work, whether it is a copy or the original.



OUR TEAM:

 



  Ilya Dyachenko (Russia) - Founder of the project. 

It was he who had the idea to create ARTWORK Online Gallery. And his team from distant Siberia was pleased to support this idea.


 Ivan Zarenkov (Russia) - Design & Programming
Took responsibility for the appearance and the technical part of the project. Experience gained by him for 7 years as head of web-studio allows to solve all tasks at the proper level.


 Egor Krutskiy (Russia) : Content
"Write, search and create" - this is his motto.                                                                  Takes any amount of work and does it quickly and efficiently.


  Konstantin Kutsevalov (Russia) : Programming

His mind is always full of fresh ideas. Knows everything and even more about programming .... 

  Elena Karadjova (Bulgaria) : Support & Translation

She loves to talk and is able to do it in a number of leanguages. She will help all this connect.


 Martin Lacabanne (Argentina): Independent artist 



                       FAQ:

                               Q: How old is your website ??? 
A: Our site is very young. The domain was registered in 2012, but the work on the website began in 2014. First we made a small website for some Russian artists to show their works. But later we saw that artists from other countries want to show their artwork. They began to ask us questions how they can upload works of art to our website. And we started develop ARTWORK Online Gallery.

            Q: How much I have to pay for registration in your project?

A: Our project is free for all .

                          Q: How many works can I upload for free?

A: You can upload an infinite number of your works of art. But we have a limit on the file size - not more than 2 megabytes. Later we are going to remove the limit on the file size.

   Q: You have a Russian domain now.  Are you going to purchase               international  domain name?

A: Sure!!! We are going to purchase ".com" domain. New domain name will be www.artwork-gallery.com . But the cost of this domain name is  $3896.20 (https://who.is/whois/artwork-gallery.com - link  to check the price). That's why we made this IndieGoGo Campaign.
                     
          Q: Are you going to improve personal account for users?

A: Of course. Our team is going to develop and add a personal user account with an extended set of features.
                     
      Q: I'm not from Russia. Can I upload my works to your website?

A: No matter what is your country. Everyone can show their talents in art on our website.

                     Q: Can I sale my paintings from your website? 

A: Yes. If someone will show interest to one of your paintings or other works, our administrators will let you know about it. Upon receiving the order the administration of the site conveys the artist’s contact details to the buyer (or vice versa - the buyer transfers the data to the artist), without taking further part in the transaction. Thus, the artist is able to negotiate with the buyer directly, without intermediaries, increasing the chances to sell his work. (In case of a successful deal the website's commission is just 10%. This amount helps to maintain the website).





Other ways to help:
If you can't make a contribution, do not worry.  We'll be very grateful if you tell about project "ARTWORK Online Gallery" to your friends and share our campaign in social networks such as facebook, twitter, google+ , LinkedIn and others.

story:
Summary

    Hey folks, my name is Brenda Ray and I've been performing in front of audiences since I was four years old. In spite of graduating college and being accepted to some great master programs for writing, I've decided to do the scariest thing I’ve ever done…. drop everything and pursue poetry and music on my own.

      The album is a mash up of all the best pieces I’ve produced over the past five years. In it I explore grief, love, loss, family, The Kardashians, house parties, and several other things. The Music is a mixture of folk, R&B, rock… a little tough to label but then again so am I.

          This is a big step for me, so your contribution would mean the world. As much as I would’ve liked to be an MFA graduate, there was something much more pure about pursuing my art, sticking with my audience, and having a little more faith in my fans. In short, I am following my heart. Your support would help me take that long overdue step of recording a professional album. It will also provide me with a quality piece of merchandise that I can offer audiences as I perform shows this year.


What We Need & What You Get

      It costs about $125 to record a song and with ten tracks, that quickly adds up to about $1,250. Additionally I am also working with CD baby, to package and distribute my music to places such as itunes, Amazon, and Spotify. This price is quoted at about $431.30. Finally, I am also recording with two brilliant musicians and because I believe in paying artists for their work, I will need an additional $150 to compensate for their time and talents. Overall, this adds up to a total goal of $1,831.30

      In short, all of the funds will go directly towards producing the art itself.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

        If you’re unable to contribute financially you can also help by....

1.) Liking my fanpage, booking agents research artists regularly and the more likes I have, the more likely they'll be willing to consider me. You can like me at www.facebook.com/BrendaRayPoetry.

2.) Spreading the word. Feel free to share the campaign with friends, family, or anyone who is interested in supporting the arts and particularly my art.

And finally, if you're unsure of whether or not to donate please feel free to check out my fanpage for good reads and good music at: www.facebook.com/BrendaRayPoetry


Thank You

     Every penny brings us closer to our goal. Thank you so much for your efforts, encouragement, and support!  I can't tell you how much your contribution means to me.

story:
Short Summary

We are an independent, artist run school based in Geelong, Australia, and we established our classes for the community in 1988. Since then, we have been able to kickstart hundreds of students from all walks of life into careers in the arts throughout Australia and overseas. For those 28 years, we have been unfunded, and of late we've had to move from our long term venue into new premises. We have to build a new and suitable art room for our students, and we need financial assistance with the installation of a ceiling, lights and with plasterboard walls. During our 28 years, many people regard our work as integral to Geelong's cultural life.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding required will enable us to have a professional ceiling installed ( quote received - $ 2,770.00 ) , and the extra eight hundred dollars required will enable us to buy plasterboard to cover the 10 x 6 metre art room, plus will help us cover financially any other hidden costs in this process.

Any person donating ten dollars or more will receive one free ticket to our opening celebration organised for late September.


Any person donating $1,000.00 or more will receive two original signed artworks on paper by Robert Drummond plus two original signed artworks on paper by Patricia Semmler. 

 

The Impact

This campaign is important as we are financially exhausted and any or all funds required in this campaign will be the only way possible for us to complete our new art room.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please support and help us by SHARING this campaign. (You can use the Indiegogo share tools too.)

story:
Centro de Creación Artística TET (Taller Experimental de Teatro) presents "the river under the river" (evening and tasting), a play that includes the chronicles of Alicia Jiménez de Sánchez, anecdotes, stories, poems, songs and flavours from Venezuelan. This is a collective creation, a performance with two interpreters: Joe Justiniano and Lya Bonilla Jiménez (Alicia's niece). They worked together with Guillermo Díaz Yuma, Jariana Armas, Areani Rondón, Dixon Dacosta, Manuel Chourio, Sonia González and Carlos Sánchez Torrealba, collaborating in the configuration of the staging. They are also accompanied by Boris Paredes, Andrés Cartaya and other professional musicians who enrich the experience with their proposals and interpretations.

The chronicles tell us about Alicia's childhood, and her relationship with her father, grandmother and siblings, stories from several towns in Venezuela’s savannah, where her family lived between 1930 and 1960. These amusing anecdotes are accompanied by legends and traditional tales, texts by Aquiles Nazoa, Eugenio Montejo, Ramón Palomares, Enriqueta Arvelo Larriva, folk songs and compositions by Simón Díaz, Henry Martínez and Guillermo Jiménez Leal (brother of the writer of the chronicles). This material display a significant content of the popular imaginary. Besides, the public can enjoy an small tasting of salty and sweet venezuelan dishes. All the guests can feel part of an stimulating and suggestive experience.

The stage is a circle surrounded by chairs, furniture and armchairs, a space that becomes the living room of the house, the garden where treasures are buried, the library where extraordinary books are found, the kitchen of the grandmother, the main street of the village, the courtyard of the school where the children recite, dance and act in theatrical performances. The play ends with a great party where the venezuelan rhythms invite to stand up and meet those around you.

Anyone who listens to these stories, somehow, recovers something lost. Anyone who reads into the details of these tales, awakes an ancestral memory, the root of our desires and impulses. Stories speak about our relationship with love, our home and humour, even our own way of relating with nature. Our sounds, our colours and flavours, make us Venezuelans and Latin Americans. This performance will offer to its audience the opportunity to rediscover the small and simple things of  everyday life, through the beauty of each tale and the poetic images, they will get to perceive the current that moves under the river.
_________________________________

El Centro de Creación Artística TET (Taller Experimental de Teatro) presenta "el río bajo el río" (velada y degustación), una obra de teatro que incluye las crónicas de Alicia Jiménez de Sánchez, anécdotas, cuentos, poemas, cantos y sabor venezolano. Esta es una creación colectiva donde participan como intérpretes Joe Justiniano y Lya Bonilla Jiménez (sobrina de Alicia Jiménez), quienes trabajan junto a Guillermo Díaz Yuma, Jariana Armas, Areani Rondón, Dixon Dacosta, Manuel Chourio, Sonia Gonzalez y Carlos Sánchez Torrealba, colaborando en la configuración de la puesta en escena. También los acompañan Boris Paredes, Andrés Cartaya y otros músicos profesionales quienes enriquecen la experiencia con sus propuestas e interpretaciones.

Este viaje se emprende a partir de las crónicas sobre la infancia de Alicia, relatos de los pueblos de venezuela donde vivió su familia entre 1930 y 1960. Estas graciosas anécdotas están acompañadas por leyendas y cuentos tradición oral, textos de Aquiles Nazoa, poemas de Eugenio Montejo, Ramón Palomares, Enriqueta Arvelo Larriva, cantos de trabajo y canciones de Simón Díaz, Henry Martínez y Guillermo Jiménez Leal (hermano de la escritora de las crónicas), para recrear un rico imaginario popular que, junto a una pequeña degustación de platos salados y dulces venezolanos harán de esta velada una experiencia sensorial, estimulante y sugestiva.

El escenario es un círculo rodeado de sillas, muebles y poltronas, un espacio que se convierte en la sala de la casa, en la habitación de los niños, en el jardín donde se entierran tesoros, en la biblioteca donde se encuentran libros extraordinarios, en la cocina de la abuela, en la calle principal del pueblo, en el patio de la escuela donde se recita, se baila y se hacen representaciones teatrales. La obra termina con una gran fiesta donde los ritmos del llano logran levantar a todos de sus puestos para ir al encuentro con el otro.

Quien escucha estas historias, de alguna manera, recupera algo perdido. Quien recrea los detalles de un relato está despertando una memoria ancestral, los orígenes de nuestros deseos e impulsos. Los sonidos, colores y sabores nuestros, aquello que nos constituye como venezolanos y latinoamericanos, hablan de la relación con el hogar, con el amor, de un particular humor y sensibilidad que nos caracteriza, e incluso de nuestra relación con la naturaleza y lo salvaje. Este trabajo ofrecerá al público la posibilidad de reencontrarse con los pequeños y sencillos detalles cotidianos, con la belleza del relato y la imagen poética, para percibir la corriente que se mueve bajo el río que somos.

 

What we need to develop the project

The amount reached will allow us to cover the expenses of press, promotion, work team, interpreters and musicians. Part of what we obtain will also be invested in the maintenance of the Luis Peraza Theater, a space that allows us to rehearse the piece for more than six months, where we will present the play, scheduling a month of season (eight functions). However, our biggest investment will be in the acquisition of products for tasting and Venezuelan food that we want to offer in each function.

Being an intimate evening there will be a few attendees per night, a maximum of 50 people, for a season of four weekends (only saturdays and sundays) during the month of March. What would be a total of eight functions in Caracas and is likely to be programmed a presentation in Barinas.

We need your contribution to make this play come true and this can be in several ways:
* Providing this way economically.
* Sharing this collective sponsorship campaign with friends, family and potential sponsors.
* Inviting your contacts to attend the evening, once we are promoting the season of THE RIVER UNDER THE RIVER.
Thank you for help us and being part of this wonderful experience.

_______________________________
El monto alcanzado nos permitirá cubrir los gastos de prensa, promoción, equipo de trabajo, intérpretes y músicos. Parte de lo que obtengamos se invertirá también en matenimiento del Teatro Luis Peraza, espacio que nos permite ensayar la pieza por más de seis meses, programar varias muestras y un mes de temporada (ocho funciones durante cuatro fines de semana). Sin embargo, nuestra mayor inversión será en la adquisición de productos para la degustación, y así brindar al público la comida, bebida y dulces venezolanos que deseamos ofrecer en cada función.

Siendo una velada íntima serán pocos asistentes por noche, un máximo de 50 personas, para una temporada de 4 fines de semana los días sábados y domingos, durante el mes de marzo. Haremos un total de 8 funciones en Caracas y es probable que se programe una presentación en Barinas.

Necesitamos de tú aporte para hacer realidad esta velada y ésto puede ser de varias formas:
* Aportando económicamente por esta vía
* Compartiendo esta campaña de patrocinio colectivo con amigos, familiares y conocidos que puedan aportar.
* Invitando a tus contactos a asistir a la velada, una vez que estemos en la promoción  de la temporada de EL RÍO BAJO EL RÍO. 
Gracias por colaborar y ser parte de este proyecto

Being an intimate evening there will be a few attendees per night, a maximum of 50 people, for a season of four weekends (only saturdays and sundays) during the month of March. What would be a total of eight functions in Caracas and is likely to be programmed a presentation in Barinas.
We need your contribution to make this play come true and this can be in several ways:* Providing this way economically.* Sharing this collective sponsorship campaign with friends, family and potential sponsors.* Inviting your contacts to attend the evening, once we are promoting the season of THE RIVER UNDER THE RIVER.Thank you for help us and being part of this wonderful experience.
_______________________________El monto alcanzado nos permitirá cubrir los gastos de prensa, promoción, equipo de trabajo, intérpretes y músicos. Parte de lo que obtengamos se invertirá también en matenimiento del Teatro Luis Peraza, espacio que nos permite ensayar la pieza por más de seis meses, programar varias muestras y un mes de temporada (ocho funciones durante cuatro fines de semana). Sin embargo, nuestra mayor inversión será en la adquisición de productos para la degustación, y así brindar al público la comida, bebida y dulces venezolanos que deseamos ofrecer en cada función.
Siendo una velada íntima serán pocos asistentes por noche, un máximo de 50 personas, para una temporada de 4 fines de semana los días sábados y domingos, durante el mes de marzo. Haremos un total de 8 funciones en Caracas y es probable que se programe una presentación en Barinas.
Necesitamos de tú aporte para hacer realidad esta velada y ésto puede ser de varias formas:* Aportando económicamente por esta vía* Compartiendo esta campaña de patrocinio colectivo con amigos, familiares y conocidos que puedan aportar.* Invitando a tus contactos a asistir a la velada, una vez que estemos en la promoción  de la temporada de EL RÍO BAJO EL RÍO. Gracias por colaborar y ser parte de este proyecto

story:
OUR NEW CAMPAIGN IS HERE: https://igg.me/at/afftravel

History & Vision

2017 will be my 20th consecutive year attending Burning Man, and somewhat arbitrarily, it's high time I let go of my action figure collection. I've always wanted to do something artistic with their exit from my life. Oddly enough, unbeknownst to me, my father (a skilled wooden toy maker) spent the last couple of decades going to garage sales and picking up hundreds of Happy Meal toys. So when he died last year (almost simultaneously with Burning Man 2016) and I found trunks full of these little items (I will never know why he bought them), it felt like a calling to combine these collections into something greater than their parts. Does this speak to my — and my father's — hoarding tendencies? Perhaps. Like father, like son, but more accurately, we both have very youthful spirits (still wishing to think of Dad in the present tense). We’re tricksters (my name on the playa is Whee-zel, for good reason). We joke. We laugh hard. We find the curiosity in how things work, and then recreate them on a more manageable scale. We are endlessly fascinated how art can reflect the world in a distorted manner, like a doll house, perfect in every detail, but still a fragile imitation.

Of course, the worship and hypocrisy of so called “family values,” not to mention the commercial exploitation of iconography of heroes and villains — these themes will show up in the art piece as well. Try as I might to make art out of my history, these lil’ critters are nothing more than glorified children's fantasies of violence, and as colorful as the designs may be, they really just come down to simplistic interpretations of “bad vs. good.” After all, nothing reflects the commodification of pop culture Americana like children's toys. These various ideas come crashing and melting together in this art piece. Like the Batman and Joker battling it out…while neither of them are aware that their conflict simply makes up an elbow joint on a much larger creation. Sounds a lot like life to me. Who knows what we might accomplish if we could stop fighting each other and see the amazing miracle we all encompass?.

Too deep? Maybe. It’s mostly gonna be fun and interactive and playful — and here are some ways I want to make your involvement fun too.

What We Need & What You Get

T-shirts, Medallions, and Schwag, Oh My!
Let’s start with the cool stuff! Of course, you receive the deep gratitude of myself and the crew for helping us fund our project. You also can get stickers, T-shirts, and (my personal favorite) a metal medallion especially designed with our logo on the front and a personal message of thanks on the back! (Check out the photo of past medallions I have designed which have turned out pretty neat!)

For 19 years, I have taken Photos at Burning Man to record my memories, and it’s an honor and a pleasure to share them with you! You’ll receive a thumb drive or a Dropbox folder of hundreds of beautiful photos to explore and enjoy! 

As we are prepping the mannequins for their transformation, each one is already taking on a personality and special powers to share on the playa. As their unique characters emerge, we will be creating a "trading card" for each one. By giving at the "Psychic Powers" level, you will know all there is to know about our Super Powered Mannequins by receiving 4 Giant-sized Collectable Cards (5"x7") featuring dossiers, signed and numbered by the artist.

Did you know I’m a sexologist? Yeah! It’s a crazy wonderful life. I teach grad students, weekend workshops, and I maintain a private practice in Palm Springs as well as on line. I’d so enjoy supporting you in your sexual health as well. You will receive a 2-hour Sexual Health Assessment with tips and strategies to take your sexuality to the next level. I’m proud to have facilitated client’s transformation out of paralyzing shame and fear and into the kind of sexual health they’ve always wanted to enjoy. More info here: http://www.doctorrix.com/perscons.html

Finally, for the person who really wants to support the project financially, I will create a special workshop/discussion experience on a sexuality topic of your choosing, to be facilitated in North America at your event: dinner party, Burning Man Camp, or corporate event. Want to see just how effective I can be in front of a group? Check out my latest performance piece: http://cometrueproductions.com/stake/

Funding
With an honorarium of $5,000 from Burning Man, we’re still about $10,000 short of funds to make this a reality. This will cover the cost of the mannequins, mounting materials (both of action figures to the mannequins and the mannequins to the playa), transportation of the whole project to and from Black Rock City, and a little bit of a cushion for unexpected expenses, like life vests should Lake Lahontan not drain in time - wink!

Risks & Challenges

This ain't my first rodeo. Back in 2005, I created "Reflective Shade" (pictured) with my collection of 250 laserdiscs (more hoarding!). Still, to be honest, I've never affixed action figures to mannequins before! So I don't know how long it is going to take and what hurdles we will have to surmount. But, with my crew of friends who are also veteran Burners, we are experimenting with various modes of attachment to keep the action figures firmly connected (sounds more like couples therapy than art). We have a hunch that some will be best glued, while others will be screwed, and still others will be zip-tied, and so on. And we will be building these critters ALREADY in the desert weather of Palm Springs (windy, dry, and hot). Therefore, we will have weather proofed them well before we ever get to Black Rock City (Burning Man).  For the most part, they will be completed and ready to go, and we'll just have to set them up once we hit the playa. One way or another, we will make this project blossom, and it's gonna be beautiful, interactive, and fun — damn it!  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please take a few minutes to spread the word:

- Tell your friends about the project
- Post the campaign video on Facebook, Twitter and Tumblr
- Like our Facebook page: Action Figure Family at Burning Man 2017

We will be building the AFF in Palm Springs California all summer, and we would so enjoy having you stop by and glue a few figures on our mannequins. Stay connected with us on Facebook for updates and images. aGet on our special local "work/play" list to be notified when we'll be working on the project. https://www.facebook.com/actionfigurefamilyatburningman2017/

Thanks you so much!

story:
The Filid Chapbook is a mixed medium periodical. We print short fiction, poetry, photography, painting, and essays.  

We started out in 2012, printing Volume One, which featured work from friends and folks we'd met on the road with the broader Filid project. Since 2012, we've printed a volume each year, growing in scope and awesomeness. (2013, Volume Two: On the Self-Portrait; 2014, Volume Three: On Children's Stories.)  We can't believe the work we've been fortunate enough to print. The Chapbook project has developed into a hub for a loose collective of artists, with the aims of providing input on work, connection and formation for artists, and publicity for really fabulous work . 

One of the things that sets us apart is our editorial process. Pre-publication, our contributors receive intensive feedback from both Chapbook staff and fellow contributors (in their genre). We work back and forth on drafts of each piece or image that gets printed, for up to a year. In this way, each edition becomes a hamlet of collaboration. We believe that what many artists want and need, from publication, is a test kitchen of sorts, rather than a bulletin board. 

Over the past year, we've collaborated on a new volume, on the theme of BLUE. It's been simmering, getting bolder and better, and as of this month, we're ready to print. We're aiming to raise $3,000 to cover printing and mailing expenses.

We've put together funding for each edition of The Filid Chapbook via creative and spontaneous means. We insist on keeping the chapbook not for sale, partially because we don't think traditional buy-sell models work for a publication of this size. But moreso, because we feel that we're on the scent of a more genuine funding model. The Chapbook works, to date, because it operates in a different sort of economy-- all the art, editing, design, layout and logistics are done by volunteers.  Contributors aren't paid for their work (though of course they deserve to be), but they continue to be involved, because they are receiving (we hope) something from our unique and earnest process that's worth more than the traditional, token cheque. 

Buying and selling the Chapbook would mess with everything we love most about it. In this sorry climate for art, where profit manages creativity and pushes down the truest, most needed voices, shouldn't we turn away from broken models and experiment with other ways to sneak life through the cracks?

So (and this may be an arbitrary slip of a knot, but bear with our intentions) you can donate enough to print and mail a copy (or two or ten) for strangers, but you can't buy one for yourself. 

If you'd like to find a copy of volume 4 and future editions in your mailbox, please sign up here. If you don't want to donate  but would like to receive a copy, that's ok, too. Really!

If we can raise a little more than $3,000 (let's say if we can get to $3500 or $4000) we'd love to be able to offer an annual prize--funds to send a contributor for a weekend or week alone at a cabin, to work on a project. (Another experiment in  supporting and valuing the artists we're so damn lucky to work with.)

If you like the sounds of this project, or have been affected by work in previous editions, or have seen artists that you love being positively affected by the project, please consider donating. Any amount moves us forward. 

Sincere help for your time and help. Let's get this beautiful whale off the beach! 


With gratitude, 


Katie Gorrie

Editor, The Filid Chapbook

                                                                                                                Malcolm Myers, 'All  Blues'    (Sneak preview from Volume Four: On Blue, Spring 2015)

story:
Who we are

The Peggy’s Cove Area Festival of the Arts provides the opportunity for people of all ages to engage in and celebrate the arts.

The beauty of Peggy’s Cove and its surrounding areas is a source of inspiration to many local artists and artisans such as painters, potters, sculptors, and woodworkers. Because many of these artists use their homes—or even the great outdoors—as their studios, there aren't always opportunities to share their work with the public. The purpose of the festival is to share these hidden gems, and to bring the art that flourishes in our communities to you. The Peggy’s Cove Festival of the Arts provides a welcoming opportunity to meet these artists, view and purchase their wonderful work, and celebrate the arts.

Since its launch in 2011, the Peggy’s Cove Area Festival of the Arts has grown quickly from a dream into a full-fledged not-for-profit celebration of the arts. In 2014 the Festival attracted over 4000 local, national and international visitors. In 2015, with the addition of the new Arts Fair, even more are expected.

Detailed information about what’s planned for Festival 2015 is available on our website:  peggyscoveareafestivalofthearts.com  Highlights will include a gala reception, plein air painting events in two locations, a new arts fair and the popular studio tour.

Advertisements, sponsorships and grant supports have been tremendously important, but they can’t provide enough to sustain this vibrant arts festival. With your support, we can make all this happen!

Our Goals

We’ve set our goal in this campaign for $3000. If we’re successful in raising the full amount, we’ll be able to provide free workshops, demonstrations, performances, and entry to the Arts Fair, which will open the event to a wider community and truly embody the welcoming atmosphere the festival strives to create. Funds will also be used towards the cost of the Yurt in Peggy’s Cove, where selected works created onsite and from the artist’s collections will be displayed and available for sale. 

It’s also important that we promote the event widely and with compelling marketing material. We hope to do so with new banners and flags that will enliven our communities and enhance the spirit of this summer arts celebration. While we hope to reach our goal of $3000, any funds raised will be integral to making this festival more engaging, memorable, and celebratory.

Other ways you can help

While a little goes a long way in terms of monetary donations, there are other important ways that you can help us make this festival a success. You can help us make some waves by spreading the word about our festival and the community of artists that we celebrate. Become a part of our community by visiting our website and interacting with us on Twitter and Facebook. You can share our news with others who may be interested in supporting us, or who would simply like to attend some of the festival’s events.

However you may like to contribute, you can help us in our effort to bring arts to the community, and our community of artists to a larger audience.
