story:
Short Summary

Hello there! I'm Hannah, a Western Mass native currently living in Easthampton, MA. I'm an area childcare provider, student, and doula who is passionate about the arts.

This is why I am so excited to have the opportunity to curate this group exhibition, Mother(ing). Mother(ing) opens in early August, 2015 and continues in the Mill Arts Project space in Easthampton for the entire month. What we wanted to explore in this exhibition was the rawness of motherhood—those feelings and experiences that are glazed over in our general dialogue on motherhood. 

We have an incredible assortment of artists—including Jennifer Long, Erin Faith Allen, Esther S White, Jennifer Linton and Dara Herman Zierlein. In addition to some incredible art, we are also working to bring several speakers/events to the show, including Avital Norman Nathman, Pioneer Valley resident and author/editor of "The Good Mother Myth."

There will also be an interactive area the show. Participants are invited to write, draw, share images, or use any other medium to answer the question: "How has mothering shaped your life?" While we're not so sure what its future will look like after the exhibition, we have a few ideas up our sleeves...

We also feel that an exhibition that raises the voices of mothers in its content also needs to do so in practice. On opening night (August 8th), we're offering free, on-site childcare for our patrons. Additionally, we'll also be offering a private space inside the gallery for breastfeeding, diaper changing, or simply taking a short break on your visit to the Eastworks Building. This space will be available to everyone during Gallery Hours, throughout the week.

So now, the question is: how does this all happen?

Between me, some incredible mentors, supportive sponsors, and committed volunteers, we are confident that this will shape up to be an incredible event this August. All we need is your help to make it happen!

What We Need & What You Get

In total, we're asking for $2,500. Broken down, this number goes into:

Print Materials (Posters, Outdoor Signage): $75
Art Supplies (Hanging Materials, Other Works-Specific Materials for presentation): $175
Childcare For The Opening Exhibition: $150
Wall Decals (Exhibition Name, Artist names/works/statements): $275
Speaker Compensation: $750 (~2 speakers)
Miscellaneous Print Expenses (gallery check-in sheets, show comments): $25
Curator Honorarium: $250
Intern Honorarium: $150
Participatory Component Expenses (cork board, paint, additional materials): $265.00
Estimated Indiegogo/Paypal Fees: $400

We know our number for Indiegogo and Paypal fees is a little high. If we reach the end of the campaign and we end up with a surplus of funds in that area, the additional money will go to art supplies, speaker compensation, or, depending on the amount, towards budgeting for childcare at one of our in-gallery events.

The Perks

If you contribute, we have a few perks up our sleeves!

Everyone who contributes at the $20 level will be listed as a "contributor" near our Gallery Statement. This list of contributors will also be visible at our exhibition counter. You will have our eternal gratefulness for your contribution!

If you contribute at the $50 level, Hannah will watch your kids for an evening of your choice. That's right, free childcare—and Hannah is good, too! She has experience with infants through early adolescents but especially loves early childhood. You will also get your name on the contributor list.

If you contribute at the $100 level, we will arrange a private gallery viewing for you, complete with a tasty home-cooked meal. There's nothing better than art and tasty food! You will also get your name on the contributor list.

If you contribute at the $250 level, you may use the gallery for an event of your choosing, pending some limitations. Some ideas include: a work gathering, host your morning/afternoon/evening workshop, a birthday party, etc. We will have a volunteer on-site to open and close the space. You will also get your name on the contributor list.

If you contribute at the $500 level,  you get all the perks listed above: Hannah will watch your kids, we'll arrange a nice private viewing with a home-cooked meal, AND we will let you use the gallery for an event of your choice. And, of course, you will also get your name on the contributor list.

If We Fall Short

If we don't meet our goal, we have a few alternative plans in mind. We've also constructed alternative budgets that cut out our curator and intern honorariums; while these would be very nice to have and make our lives a little easier for the month of August, the honorarium isn't our priority; the show is. We are also actively working on pursuing sponsorships with area organizations, so we hope that even if we don't make our entire budget on Indiegogo, we may be able to make up for some of the gaps with local business partnerships! 

Hannah will also be presenting at EAT in Easthampton, an in-person crowdfunding event. If you live in Western Mass and want to hear more information about this event (and how you can support us!) then visit the ECA+ Website for more details!

The Impact

We are incredibly fortunate to live in a community that strongly supports and empowers the voices of mothers. Area organizations like MotherWoman, Grow, Women's Voices Worldwide and others are doing very important work in the Pioneer Valley and beyond to lift the voices of mothers and create a community that values mothers and families and the often complicated, yet important lives they lead. As a doula, I have also had the privilege to observe the respectful nature of several of our area hospitals towards the bodily and personal autonomy of our mothers. 

What I intend to do with this exhibition is bridge this rhetoric of valuing mothers in social and community contexts with the expansive creative community we have in Easthampton and the greater Pioneer Valley. I want to create a platform outside of the internet and mothers' groups and circles for everyone to see—and understand—how motherhood shifts our identities and how it connects, on some level, to all of us. And in keeping with the experimental nature with the MAP space, I want to use this space as an opportunity to reflect on how we can make the gallery space as family-friendly—and by association, community-friendly—as possible. This will have implications for me, as someone who enjoys curating shows in my community, as well as other art makers, curators, and creatives in the Pioneer Valley, whom I will be more than happy to share my experiences with. Let's open up the gallery and make it inviting and accessible to everyone!

Risks & Challenges

This is my first Indiegogo campaign, so this all feels very new to me. As I balance curating/managing this show, plus work, plus school, I recognize that there may be moments where this feels like a lot. I'm trying to do my due diligence right now by embracing my 8-hour nights of sleep and budgeting my time now, recognizing that I will likely lose out on that full-night's sleep and any level of free time come August. I feel most comfortable when I am multitasking; I thrive off of having multiple projects and events happening at once. So, this August is a welcome challenge for me, and one that I am familiar with having to balance. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand if you are unable to donate at this time! If you are social media-savvy, we would be so grateful for you to share this campaign with your friends, or anyone you think may be touched by the exhibition!

We also have a list of things for the show that we hope to receive as in-kind donations or personal loans—including a projector, fans (the space gets hot in August!), children's toys, and furniture. If you think you might be able to help in this area, please be in touch! And thank you so much for taking the time to read this. We so appreciate it!
story_txt:
Short SummaryHello there! I'm Hannah, a Western Mass native currently living in Easthampton, MA. I'm an area childcare provider, student, and doula who is passionate about the arts.This is why I am so excited to have the opportunity to curate this group exhibition, Mother(ing). Mother(ing) opens in early August, 2015 and continues in the Mill Arts Project space in Easthampton for the entire month. What we wanted to explore in this exhibition was the rawness of motherhood—those feelings and experiences that are glazed over in our general dialogue on motherhood. We have an incredible assortment of artists—including Jennifer Long, Erin Faith Allen, Esther S White, Jennifer Linton and Dara Herman Zierlein. In addition to some incredible art, we are also working to bring several speakers/events to the show, including Avital Norman Nathman, Pioneer Valley resident and author/editor of "The Good Mother Myth."There will also be an interactive area the show. Participants are invited to write, draw, share images, or use any other medium to answer the question: "How has mothering shaped your life?" While we're not so sure what its future will look like after the exhibition, we have a few ideas up our sleeves...We also feel that an exhibition that raises the voices of mothers in its content also needs to do so in practice. On opening night (August 8th), we're offering free, on-site childcare for our patrons. Additionally, we'll also be offering a private space inside the gallery for breastfeeding, diaper changing, or simply taking a short break on your visit to the Eastworks Building. This space will be available to everyone during Gallery Hours, throughout the week.So now, the question is: how does this all happen?Between me, some incredible mentors, supportive sponsors, and committed volunteers, we are confident that this will shape up to be an incredible event this August. All we need is your help to make it happen!What We Need & What You GetIn total, we're asking for $2,500. Broken down, this number goes into:Print Materials (Posters, Outdoor Signage): $75Art Supplies (Hanging Materials, Other Works-Specific Materials for presentation): $175Childcare For The Opening Exhibition: $150Wall Decals (Exhibition Name, Artist names/works/statements): $275Speaker Compensation: $750 (~2 speakers)Miscellaneous Print Expenses (gallery check-in sheets, show comments): $25Curator Honorarium: $250Intern Honorarium: $150Participatory Component Expenses (cork board, paint, additional materials): $265.00Estimated Indiegogo/Paypal Fees: $400We know our number for Indiegogo and Paypal fees is a little high. If we reach the end of the campaign and we end up with a surplus of funds in that area, the additional money will go to art supplies, speaker compensation, or, depending on the amount, towards budgeting for childcare at one of our in-gallery events.The PerksIf you contribute, we have a few perks up our sleeves!
Everyone who contributes at the $20 level will be listed as a "contributor" near our Gallery Statement. This list of contributors will also be visible at our exhibition counter. You will also get your name on the contributor list.

story:
Our project

yoyo tinz is a group of young cosmopolitan and dynamic people who share the love of hip hop and aim to promote, develop and archive the Ghanaian hip-hop culture. The idea is to create a unique space for Ghanaian hip-hop in all its diversity and on various mediums: twitter, facebook, tumblr, youtube, etc.

3 members of the team have been officially invited to the Paris Hip hop Festival. We wish to take part in the festival from 25th June to 6th July 2015. We will meet the organisers, as well as other professionals. it will also be an opportunity to present some aspects of the Ghanaian hip hop culture.

yoyo tinz is 100% auto financed, therefore we can only take part in the festival if we get sponsorship/partnership. 

What We Need 

We have estimated our needs to 5 000 dollars.

- 3 flight tickets Accra-Paris-Accra : 2100 dollars

- 2 visas: 140 dollars

- travel insurance: 160 dollars

- Per diem (3 people - 12 days - 30 dollars/pers./day): 1 080 dollars

- Accomodation (3 people - 12 days - 40 dollars/pers./day): 1 440 dollars

- Miscellaneous: 80 dollars

If we do not reach our goal, we will use the money to organise events to support the Ghanaian hip hop artists. We could also acquire more equipment (laptop, lenses).

The Impact

Many hip hop artists from Ghana suffer from the absence of platform as well as a lack of opportunities to present their work abroad. yoyo tinz intend to broadcast the hip hop culture made in Ghana to the whole world.

Taking part in the Paris hip hop festival would allow us to:

- Meet the organizers of the festival

- Document the festival and produce a short documentary to be presented in Ghana

- Meet the hip hop industry professionals in France

- Make people discover Ghanaian artists

- Discover or rediscover the French hip hop artists we would like to invite in Accra

- Establish a French catalog of hip hop artists to suggest to the organizers of major Ghanaian festivals

- Establish partnerships French structures similar to yoyo tinz 

- Meet French artists interested in collaborations with Ghanaian artists

Risks & Challenges

We are very close to the date, but we still hope we can gather enough funds to start all the administrative work as soon as possible:

- visa appointment

- Buying the flight ticket

Other Ways You Can Help

yoyo tinz and Ghanaian hip hop artists need support kindly watch, like, share and comment on our videos. Check out our youtube channel here:

36"x36"(not including frame)

Perk Works #4

Untitled

48"x48"

Latex Paint on Canvas

2013


Perk Works #5

Untitled

48"x48"

Mixed Media on Canvas

2013

A Little About Me...

My name is Kayla Jenkins, and my life's goal is to sustain and support myself through my passion, Art.

www.kaylaajenkinsportfolio.wordpress.com 

I recently finished my undergraduate studies in December 2014, earning Bachelor's degrees in Fine Arts, as well as Philosophy with a minor in Mathematics from McKendree University in Lebanon, Il.

The purpose of this campaign is to help supplement the costs that it takes to get my career started, specifically participating in Art fairs and shows across the country.

The Game Plan

You may be interested to know how exactly this funding is going to help my goal. Everybody has to start small, right? -so your donations are truly vital to my success and have the potential to be the financial structure for which I base my entire career. The idea is to start small, by applying to smaller, less expensive shows in the hopes of selling my work, subsequently funding the costs for future shows and fairs. The fees for these can vary drastically.

In early May 2015 I applied and was accepted to The Midwest Salute to the Arts ( www.midwestsalute.com ) in Fairview, Il. The booth fees for this show, depending on size and location range from $250 to $450, and that is relatively cheap compared to most. I hope that with the help of some generous individuals and this innovative site, I will be able to raise funding to procure the costs of the booth fee and costs for walls inside my booth which I estimate will cost around $500 and will be used for any art fair in the future.

All of this is necessary to prepare me for successful art fair, and in turn helping me sell more works to fund more shows in the near future.

Here is an idea of other show's I would like to apply for soon...

  • Ocala Arts Festival 2015; $35 Application Fee, $250 Booth Fee
  • The Great Gulf Coast Arts Festival; $40 Application Fee, $300-$600 Booth Fee
  • Fall Festival on Ponce; $25 Application Fee, $425 Booth Fee

What I've Done to Ensure Success

(So you know that your money won't go to waste)

For the past 5 years or so I have been developing myself an artist, and attempting to involve myself as much in the art world as I can.

Aside from shows I've done affiliated with my University, I was invited to show at the Varsity Art Show in 2014 hosted by Art St Louis- a showcasing that involved the top two students at each of 16 major institutions in the St. Louis Area. Also, in 2012 I applied and was accepted to partake in program called the Emerging Artists as Entrepreneurs program hosted by the cultural festivals of St Louis, who just happens to be the directors of the St Louis Art Fair in Clayton, Mo, one of the top annual fair in the country. This program prepared me more than I ever could have imagined. The requirements consisted of a year of workshops including assisting mentoring artists at the 2013 St Louis Art Fair. Our reward for this was an opportunity to by pass the jurying process into the 2014 St Louis Art Fair. This program taught us everything from marketing aspects, like pricing and how to communicate with  potential buyers to the do's and dont's of submitting a quality application that will impress jurors. Thanks to this program I have complete knowledge of what to expect and what I will need in order to succesful.

Other Ways You Can Help

As a starving artist and recent college graduate, I know all to well that even though you may want to contribute- sometimes you just cant. That' totally understandable. but thank you so  much for viewing my page and being interest about what I'm doing- and please, tell your friends!

To visit my website and see more of works, more about me you can go to www.kaylaajenkinsportfolio.wordpress.com

story:
THE RING OF FIRE ART PROJECT @ AFRIKABURN 2016

Our aim is to create something mesmerizing, something head turning. A person’s view is about 160 degrees. At almost 360 degrees, The Ring of Fire is an absolute head twister.

In a large circle around the ’Binnenkring’ or town square, we will place huge fire poles that can be seen from every part of Tankwa City. At night, the burning poles will create fire-base street lights for our temporary city.  The flames will be controlled electronically from our camp  and can also be used to send fire-based signals to the city.

We received a 10.000 Rand grant from AfrikaBurn, but it’s not enough to get the Ring of Fire burning! It’s expensive to move light poles, purchase the fuel and set up desert-proof electronics.  Your support will help buy materials and transport them from Capetown to the event in Tankwa Karoo National Park. 

WHO WE ARE

We, Ronald Duikersloot and Mike Wessling, are professional artists based in the Netherlands who work on all kinds of (international)projects. Our work and shows can be seen at festivals and events and our free work is to be found in exhibitions and galleries.

Check out our websites:
www.deWildLasser.nl  
www.spray-art.nl
www.atelierRD.nl

At AfrikaBurn 2016,  we will be part of the Walhalla theme camp which is a mixed group of around 30 people from The Netherlands and US. The youngest is 12 years old, the oldest…a bit older. Some are virgin burners and some have been going to Burning Man and AfrikaBurn for over a decade.

WHAT ELSE IS HAPPENING AT WALHALLA?

What's happening at Walhalla, the hall of the slain....

-Boutique; dress to be brave
-Messageboard; tell the Valkyrie what you think
-Shooting Gallery; are you ready for Walhalla
-Oracle; the elements decide your faith

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

Every Euro, Dollar and Rand donated will be spent on The Ring of Fire. Most of it will be for materials like the gas bottles and pipes of the fire poles, electronics for the operating system but also for the transport of 20+ gas bottles to the Tankwa desert. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Do you like our project but not able to contribute financially? There are other ways you can help! Mention us on your social media, tell your family, friends, neighbors or any random strangers on the street. We are happy with all the publicity we can find to help us fund our project!

story:
The Antiparos International Photo Festival is probably the smallest international photography festival in the world. We operate on the tiny but beautiful Greek island of Antiparos. Every year since 2013 we have been exhibiting work by well-known professional photographers but also local photographers, with a special focus on young, up-and-coming talent.

The Antiparos International Photo Festival always devotes its proceeds to supporting the local primary school. So although not yet an official non-profit organisation, we have been operating as such since we started.

This year we are in the process of registering as an official non-profit association under Greek law, which will hopefully enable us to secure permanent funding. However, industrial unrest in Greece has meant that this process has been seriously delayed. This year, we need your donations!

The Antiparos International Photo Festival is firmly embedded in the community. What we do, we do for the island of Antiparos.

For more images of the Festival, see 'Gallery'.

For more information about the Festival, click here.

story:
About me:

Hello! My name is Cristina Rivas. I’m a visual artist. Painting and photography are the way by which I communicate at the moment. Although, I flirt with some others slopes.

I was born in Maracaibo, Venezuela; Where I live nowadays. I have participated in some different collectives in Venezuela and in a small individual one. I feel it’s time to make an individual as the viewer truly deserves it, an exposition where the visitor would have the opportunity of being introduced into the proposed world and create a more effective visual speech.

I’m organizing something I call “a true individual exposition”. I’ve been working on this project for 3 years, from the conceptualization to the creation. It has not been easy, especially when you got limited resources, but I didn’t take this as a barrier, on the contrary, this has been a huge pushing to search for alternative solutions and to bury all the problems, and so I found Indiegogo, a solution where if you like my work and contribute with something, it will be a great help for the project, so in gratitude you will receive different presents, which are described on the reward headland. Your contribution will cover location, promotion, printed works, mounting, catalogues, among other expenses related to the event organization.

There is something very important about the exposition’s opening, it’s an action art that will be accomplished, for that reason I need the resources, in order to fund the required actors, makeup and costume design.

I’ll be honest. I used all my financial resources on this project, which can only be possible with your contribution, with it and using photography to leave a different perception about hope, I’ll offer the viewer a direct approximation to the surreal world I’m presenting though art transformed into action.

This story, that wants so much the opportunity of being shown, is my gain. I would love you to be part of this project!

 

My Art : 

Artistic proposal “Hope is not always white”

The proposal’s intention is to show, through several photographs and action-art, a different concept about hope, very distant from the accepted one inside the western civilization, which I have been developing for a few years based on my own experiences and dreams; turning this into a crucial element in my visual language.

Sometimes we make decisions that apparently bring us closer to our goals but unconsciously those decisions are, in fact, impediments to achieve them.  Christian religion teaches hope is a synonym of waiting; this definition is static and passive. It communicates all circumstances can just ameliorate through a divine intervention and also having strong faith on that will be possible. We can find some examples on the Bible very frequently.

“You are my hiding place and my shield, I hope in your word.” Psalm 119:114- The Bible.

When someone is found inside an emotional chaos or in a psychological disorder usually believes and feels abandoned by God; is there where the problem arises, because this definition of hope forged by society won’t bring satisfying answers to the individual.

“And now Lord, for what do I wait? My hope is in you” Psalm 39:7 – The Bible

Propuesta artística " La Esperanza no siempre es Blanca" 

La intención de esta propuesta  es mostrar mediante una serie de fotografías y arte-accion, un concepto de esperanza diferente al mayormente aceptado dentro de la civilización occidental,el cual he venido desarrollando desde hace algunos años  en base a mis propias experiencias, vivencias y sueños, convirtiéndose este un elemento fundamental en mi lenguaje visual.

En ocasiones tomamos decisiones que en apariencia nos acercan a nuestros objetivos, pero sin estar conscientes, son en realidad impedimentos para alcanzarlos.La religión cristiana enseña que la esperanza es un sinónimo de esperar, esta definición es estática y pasiva, comunica que las circunstancias solo mejoran  por medio de la intervención divina y la fe de que esta ocurrirá. Podemos encontrar ejemplos de esto con frecuencia en la biblia.

“Tú eres mi escondite, y mi escudo; en tu palabra he puesto mi esperanza” Salmo 119:114

Cuando la persona está en un caos emocional, en un desorden psicológico, cree y siente que ese Dios lo ha abandonado, es allí cuando nace el problema, ya que la definición de la esperanza que ha sembrado la sociedad, no traerá respuestas satisfactorias al individuo.

"Y ahora, Señor, ¿qué esperaré? Mi esperanza está en ti." Salmos 39:7 – La Biblia

-----------------------------------------------------------------

The Impact

I consider the definition of hope planted by my proposal more productive and effective because leads to more honest results. In fact, it is more suitable for nowadays paradigms.

The exposition will allow the visitor the opportunity of being transported to a story from another reality, a world full of spiritual, psychological and physical phases immersed in chaos; and this will be possible through photographs and performance. So, is there where a different vision of hope reborn; where the individual’s reality can just be transformed through conscious action addressed to such purpose. This leaves a fluid message to the viewer; to act, continue and work for what he or she wish for. This way of perceiving hope will help the individual to understand not all that we want is always possible, but there will always be other alternatives routes.

Only with your contribution will be possible to materialize these ideas.

If you would like to see others of my pictorial artistic proposals and photographs, you can enter using the following links:

@cristinarivasart

https://www.facebook.com/CristinaRivasArt/

https://cristinarivasarte.wordpress.com/

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Where are the funds going?

To make the exposition and action-art possible is essential to have the following resources:

  • Printing pictures.
  • Assembly works.
  • Exhibition room.
  • Graphic design expenses. Special panels.
  • Catalogues printing, posters, invitations, among others.
  • Publicity and promotion.
  • Music equipment rental.
  • Actress ballerina. (action-art)
  • Girl actresses. (action-art)
  • Costume design.(action-art)
  • Makeup. (action-art)
  • Hairstyle. (action-art)
  • Required accessories.
  • (Action-art).
  • Photography and video coverage during the event.
  • Production rewards.

Budget

Timeline 

Rewards:

  • The Great work- Chrysopoeia

This unique work called “Transmutor System” has 15 pieces building all the system based on the alchemy; where the silver in transmuted passing through several states to finally achieve the precious gold, this process is presented from an emotional perspective. Each photograph is framed and ready to hang.(Original art work-230cm x 260cm)

Transmutor System - 2016  - single edition - 230cm x 260cm

 

  • Faces of pain

It’s a piece with surrealistic inks, where the importance of the most painful phases to reach what we want the most is emphasized, without forgetting that there is always a watching eye above us. Every opus magnum or masterpiece needs enough time; steps must be taken to reach the spiritual transmuting. Suffering is an essential aspect in this chapter and time an inescapable element.

Numbered and limited collection edition of only 5 copies, each one with its own authenticate certificate.

Faces of pain - Los Rostros del Dolor - 2016 - ( 70cm x 180cm - Limited edition 1/5)

  •  Artwork

A piece from the photo series “Hope is not always white” which counts to 24 printed photographs on canvas with high quality inks, signed and also with authenticate certificate. 105cm x 70cm. (Signed-Limited edition 1/5)

Inicio- Fotografía Digital, 2016.

Trazos del mal- Fotografía Digital, 2016.

Líneas de verdad, Fotografía Digital, 2016.

Dios al parecer me había abandonado -Fotografía Digital, 2016.

Tierras agrietadas - Fotografía Digital, 2016

Me volqué al vacío de su mirada y contemple el dolor eterno - Fotografía Digital, 2016.

Alicia, entrégate - Fotografía Digital, 2016.

¿Dónde está el seno que me daba de beber? - Fotografía Digital, 2016.

Procesos- Fotografías Digitales, 2016.

Ahora obsérvame, no soy de nadie mi dueño es el aire- Fotografía Digital, 2016

Mi Hogar - Fotografía Digital, 2016

Para ver el resto de la serie fotográfica puedes entrar a :

@cristinarivasart

https://cristinarivasarte.wordpress.com/lenseb/

https://www.facebook.com/pg/CristinaRivasArt/ph... 

 

 

Challenges

I have a few days to achieve the financial goal this project needs, I know, this is crazy! But I believe in this project, I believe in this dream, it’s a challenge to make this dream come true, but here we are willing to make this exposition possible.

There will always be risks and obstacles in everything we decide to start, these are truly necessary to value the path, and when we finally reach the goal we’ll enjoy it with an honest victory.

I always keep on my mind that being a visual artist is not an easy job, not at all, but despite of the fact it exists so many things that uncatalog us nowadays, it also exists that type of platforms which make wishes laded of utility turn into tangible facts.

My plan to solve any challenge presented on my way is to continue knocking doors and keep looking for new alternatives and solutions.

I want to thank you to take your time and read about this project. Thanks for believe in this, for being part of this path so we can enjoy the result together.

Other ways you can help

We have a very short period of time to collect all the funds we need for this exposition. Please help us to spread the voice about this campaign to your friends and relatives, using social media and using Indiegogo’s action tools. If you do some echo on this project more people will receive it and that will be very useful for us to make possible this huge goal together.

Credits Artistic proposal :

Model- Daniela Osuna @ppssspstench

Hairstyle- Keila Avila. @keitrenzas

Lighting Support - Alex D. @drumsalexd 

Assistant - Karolys Romero. 

Realization of clothing and implements - Blanca Olivo y Maritza Rodriguez.

Credits Indiegogo:

Voice over-  Karolys Romero - Karolysromero@gmail.com

Video Production - Maykel Jimenez. 

My right hand ♥  - Alex D. 

 

Thank you!

story:
What is Smash?

Smash Gallery is a brand new art gallery in San Francisco, California. We are a gallery that is committed to experiencing the present fully through promoting bold, visionary artists with unique visual perspectives. Smash seeks out artists who explore the limits of perception, and who revel in redefining what is possible with their work. We started the gallery with a vision, a plan, and a big dream. Since opening our doors, Smash has consistently shown and sold work by artists that we truly believe in, and successfully sustained itself over the course of the past six months.


The Gallery launched July 2015, with our first show, Familiar Deconstructed, opening July 25th. Over the course of 2015, we have been growing into our new space, showing group exhibitions, and hosting a series of events to introduce ourselves to the neighborhood and to San Francisco. It is our goal to move beyond the role of a traditional art gallery, and become a space that is responsive, collaborative, and community based. As we enter 2016, we are excited to start the year off with a gorgeous group show, along with a booth at the

Los Angeles International Art Festival!

While we have been a success in our first critical six months, we are driven by the conviction that we can do more! We had a great opportunity presented to us to secure a booth at the LA Art Show this year, and jumped at it! This internationally recognized and acclaimed art show is a chance for Smash Gallery to share our artists and our vision with huge audience. We know that the work that we show here is going to be incredibly well received, and it is our intention and goal to not only sell work for our artists, but to help make them make an entrance into the international art community.


While we have successfully financed most of our booth fee, we need to raise the funds to cover the rest of the associated costs. We’ve jumped on this opportunity and put as much money and time into making it a reality as we have been able, and just need one final push to get us there, so that we can get our artists and their work the attention that they deserve! Your contribution will go directly towards funding our presence at LA Art Show, and helping to launch the careers of some amazingly talented artists!

We have some fantastic perks for our contributors, and we hope that you will look at our gallery and artists, and see what we see!

The Perks!

We are seeking $3,500.00 in funding to cover the cost of our trip to Los Angeles, and participation in the LA Art Show, from January 26 - February 1. This money will go towards the following:

-transportation of art (renting a large vehicle, gas)

-lodging and modest meals while at the event.

-Event venue costs (electrical outlets, incidentals)

-Promotional materials: postcards, flyers.


Our Goals


By reaching our goal of $3,500.00, we will ensure that the gallery is able to attend the entire art fair. If we don’t reach out entire goal, whatever portion we raise will go towards the exact same thing: making LA Art Show a reality for Smash Gallery, and covering as much of our costs as possible. Any costs that we are unable to cover will come from the owners.


We are offering some fantastic perks for people who contribute to this campaign, and to the careers of our artists. We have perks at every level of contribution; every gift is one step closer to our success at LA Art Show, and we appreciate every level of support!

With this project, we are seeking to bring attention and acclaim to artists that we truly believe in, and believe have a style, message, and voice that makes them unique and unforgettable in today’s art world. Your help and contribution will allow us to share our artists and their work with a much wider audience. As a gallery, we have already had great success in showing and selling their work, and we want to take this success to a new level.


Can’t Contribute?

If you can’t contribute to our goal financially, it would be a huge help to us if you could help spread the word about what we are trying to accomplish, and share this campaign! With only 14 days until the show, we are pushing hard to make our goal so that we can focus on making the event a huge success for our artists and for Smash Gallery. Please share, if you feel a connection with what we’re doing and want to support! Thank you for taking the time to learn about us; please visit SmashGallery.com to learn more about the gallery, our artists, and our mission! You can also follow us on Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter!

story:
Fighting for Crumbs 

Art in The Shadow of Neoliberal Britain

Fighting For Crumbs (Art in the Shadow of Neoliberal Britain) is an examination of a group of artists from Yorkshire dealing with/making art amidst the after-effects of Austerity Britain 2.0.

Inspired by the powerful and timely 2015 documentary Invisible Britain, which featured the group Sleaford Mods, our aim is to create a short documentary and exhibition that explores the position of art, and artists, in a period when we are all being pressured to 'strive' for crumbs, where wages are low, and the market dictates creativity. 

It's not so much stories of poverty-stricken artists, and more about artists working within the crumbling remains of Britain's post-settlement optimism.

Five MORE Years... (John Ledger)
From 8 to 14 August 2016 Fighting for Crumbs (Art in the Shadow of Neoliberal Britain) will be an art event talking place in both Wakefield and Sheffield. The documentary will premiere at the Wakefield Labour Club (aka The Redshed), whilst a showcase of the artists' work will be displayed at Gage Gallery, Sheffield.

We feel this is an important addition to the conversation opened up by Invisible Britain. Fighting for Crumbs (Art in the Shadow of Neoliberal Britain) is a sober and compassionate look at the state of present-day Britain through the eyes of artists who feel a sense of responsibility to deal with issues facing us all.
Our aim is to raise enough funds to make the film and stage the exhibition. Working very closely with DEADIDEA Productions we aim to raise £900. Any additional funds raised would go towards helping the Redshed remain a politically active meeting place for another 50 years.

Some of the artists involved have donated prints and books. (For images of the donated works visit our Facebook page: Fighting For Crumbs - Crowdfunder
We understand that not everybody who would like to support our project can do for financial reasons. But any support is warmly appreciated. We would be grateful if you could spread the word as much as you can!

"At a time when the government is implementing further budget cuts to welfare and public services - which have grave implications for the poor and vulnerable - it's perhaps easy to dismiss funding for artistic expressions as an unnecessary extravagance. Projects such as Fighting for Crumbs are important; they hold up a mirror up to our society and explore a narrative that is seemingly ignored within mainstream arts and media. I'm honoured that the artists involved have been inspired by Invisible Britain and look forward to seeing both the exhibition and forthcoming documentary." Paul Sng, Invisible Britain, 21st March 2016.

From 8 to 14 August 2016 Fighting for Crumbs (Art in the Shadow of Neoliberal Britain) will be an art event talking place in both Wakefield and Sheffield. The documentary will premiere at the Wakefield Labour Club (aka The Redshed), whilst a showcase of the artists' work will be displayed at Gage Gallery, Sheffield.We feel this is an important addition to the conversation opened up by Invisible Britain. Fighting for Crumbs (Art in the Shadow of Neoliberal Britain) is a sober and compassionate look at the state of present-day Britain through the eyes of artists who feel a sense of responsibility to deal with issues facing us all.
Our aim is to raise enough funds to make the film and stage the exhibition. Working very closely with DEADIDEA Productions we aim to raise £900. Any additional funds raised would go towards helping the Redshed remain a politically active meeting place for another 50 years.
Some of the artists involved have donated prints and books. (For images of the donated works visit our Facebook page: Fighting For Crumbs - CrowdfunderWe understand that not everybody who would like to support our project can do for financial reasons. But any support is warmly appreciated. We would be grateful if you could spread the word as much as you can!"At a time when the government is implementing further budget cuts to welfare and public services - which have grave implications for the poor and vulnerable - it's perhaps easy to dismiss funding for artistic expressions as an unnecessary extravagance. Projects such as Fighting for Crumbs are important; they hold up a mirror up to our society and explore a narrative that is seemingly ignored within mainstream arts and media. I'm honoured that the artists involved have been inspired by Invisible Britain and look forward to seeing both the exhibition and forthcoming documentary." Paul Sng, Invisible Britain, 21st March 2016.

story:
Our history

Vasallos de Venezuela is a group dedicated to folk music and dance promotion, consisting mainly of artists with long experience and heritage based on the research and learning of the traditional music and dance knowledge of different Venezuelan local communities and the stage experience acquired during shows in Venezuela and many other countries.

In 2015, we are counting 25 years of passioned work at spreading our culture within and beyond our borders, we are also making our 8th. musical record and we want to finish it and present it as part of the 25th Anniversary celebration we want to held at Teresa Carreño Teather in Caracas, Venezuela.

For Vasallos de Venezuela, this is a huge step, it would be the first time we can make it on our owns, 22 of this beautiful 25 years of music and dance, we were part of Bigott Foundation but now we have the future on our hands.

With your help, you would be making this project come true, a new record and a non precedent concert which let us celebrate with our friends and followers this wonderful carreer.

Everybody wins

  • We need to raise $6.500. That would let us finishing the payments for the new musical record and afford the 25th. Anniversary concert (location, production staff, talent and catering, among others)
  • Your help would give you the opportunity of knowing our work through our 8th. record "Crepúsculo y Aurora" (by mail or by soundcloud)
  • If we couldn't reach the goal ($6.500) we will use the money to help us pay for the musical record. It would be still a huge help for us. We are very determined, we know we are going to make it.

The impact

Vasallos has a pathway of making 7 records, 3 documental videos, different awards and recognitions as well as concert tours and participations at international festivals in Germany, France, Spain, England, Portugal, South Korea, Japan, United States of America, Puerto Rico, Brazil, Colombia, Mexico and Guatemala.
Your contribution will be helping us to complete one of our first goals as an independent group.

Risks and challenges

Our beautiful and loved country, Venezuela, is now in an economic crisis, so the risks are just there. That is why we are making this campaign to try to raise foreign currency. That would reduce them.

No money? You can help us either way!

If you can't donate, spread the message. Help us more people know about our goals through sharing our posts, by mail or simply talking to someone you know can help us.

story:
I am Ells Future. Growing up we played outdoors all day and all night if we could get away with it. Our DNA craved fresh air and space to roam around. Trees, grass, animals, insects, the human scent. Anything you could think of, we did it. Human to human contact was our thing. We shared ideas, talked about family issues, personal issues, planned out our days, laughed and even got angry with one another. There was no thought of separation. Technology has totally shattered the beneficial effects of physical social interaction. Now we push buttons to speak and smile at screens. We smile and talk to screens projecting images and words. Human robots. I want you to mindfully ponder the phrase “social interaction”. Obesity, stress, depression and just simply responding to actual humans standing next to you using your natural voice box has become oblivious to daily living. Just look around, everyone has a phone, tablet, video game, mega pixel television. It’s crazy. Even when I observe gatherings, 90% of the attention goes into technology. Look around. I bet most of you are texting right now. Is this the collapse of the human attention span or created diversions to drive the rate of insanity through the cosmos?

About this project

What is the Cans Game?

Throwing a ball toward a target is the oldest game known to man, and it just got better. Cans is a modified version of tops and continues to be played throughout many parts of the world. It is typically played on custom courts, sidewalks, or playgrounds. Cans on the other hand, allows you to play on any hard smooth surface you like. The game playing area is designed to roll up for easy transportation and enhanced storage capabilities. The custom mats are designed to support skill, If you love CANS, friendly competition and can stand your ground, we highly recommend you back CANS today with a simple pledge.








New Patented Cans Gameplay Mat:

After testing out several combinations of fabrics and materials, we’ve come up with a new quality mat perfect for playing Cans on the street and indoors on any smooth surface anywhere in the world.

 Paterson, New Jersey Common Field Park - PACKED!

   Newly Designed Cans Game Mats - HS Gym

The three main highlights:

·  Durability: Our Premium Rubber/Latex Free material gives the mat up a 7x longer life than vinyl material.
·  Design: Sometimes less is more. After hearing from you at parks, events, and via email messages, we’ve decided to go with just 6 colors (pink, blue, green, red, purple, orange). Each color features a theme promoting healing and growth.
·  CANS: Cans are 100% recycled and custom crushed so they maintain their shape during each game. Collect them from anywhere. 


How do you play?

The following is a brief overview of the setup, scoring, and how to adapt your CANS mat for even more personalized experience.

Setup: Place two CANS gameplay mats 7 feet apart depending on skill level. Divide players into groups of two. Each group chooses 1 ball and 2 cans per mat. To start, 1 player of opposing sides stand behind 10 point slot of each can and face each other.

Goal of the Game: The objective of Cans is for each player to strike or hit their opponents Cans by throwing or tossing a ball at the designated Can target. Players are awarded points based on their ability to accurately hit their opponents Cans until they reach 100 points

Players: Two players, ages 7 and above.

Version1: 2 players, 1 vs. 1

Game:

1. Player 1 throwing the ball from behind the Cans towards/ onto the other Cans cross mat.

2. Scoring consists of targeted point lines, each ranging from 10,20,30,40 points as marked on the ICAN7 gameplay mat.

3. Point range for scoring is determined by each player’s discretion throughout the course of the game.

For example: a player might choose to score points at the 10 point line mark and later in the game choose to score points at the 40 point line mark in attempt to reach a total score of 100 points before their opponent.

Scoring:

·  40 points= line mark furthest from the can

·  30 points= third furthest

·  20 points= second furthest

·  10 points= closest

Winning: First player to 100 points, plays again until someone out thinks her.

Cheating: Change the rules to highlight your particular skillset instead. Rules are meant to be broken, and so  we encourage The Cans Game enthusiast to adapt and play however they want to play.

ENJOY LIFE! Put down the smart phones, tablets, and computers. Turn off the television and video games. Get out of the house, apt, dwelling and have a great time with friends and family in nature. We know we have!

Why cans? It’s for the children. The children who have nothing. The children who have no voice to speak. The children whose imagination have been            hi-jacked. The children who hurt internally. The children who, when their minds open up can create new worlds for the future. The children who enjoy being outdoors living, breathing and exploring themselves without hindrance. The children who reflect loving kindness and compassion.

It’s for the mothers and fathers who may not be together, but can come together, laugh, eat good foods and enjoy each others company through friendly play. It’s for mothers and fathers who want to rebuild their relationship and strengthen their bonds with their children. It for families who want to bond again and share commonalities that exist in all of us. Cans establishes on-going relationships with brothers and sisters of all.

For the bullies who have been tormented and abused throughout their lives. For the lonely who society decided to exclude from the world for their hair color, shoe construction, skin hue, body type, etc..

Cans is for everyone, the entire world CAN PLAY! If you support this game and our mission to bring excitement back to the community, you will help create and build the minds of the future. This will mean so much to humanity. Isn’t this what life is about. Isn’t this what you want? Support us and support the world.

Cans is integrative and can transform any expanded area into an energetic gameplay setting. Cans will restore amazing needs to build better communities. Cans will become a sacred energy site for all to love. When compassion is restored, the world heals. Cans will accelerate the planetary energy of compassion as a counterbalance to traditional sports and division.


BENEFITS OF PLAYING CANS: ANYONE CAN PLAY!

-The Cans game as a tool for positive self-talk to build confidence

-The Cans Game is a Gateway for humanity to express themselves willingly and without shame.

-The Cans Game is a form of movement meditation. It gives the body a sense of calmness, focus and stillness while stimulating the brain.

-The Cans Game get's everyone involved through individual and team play.

**The Cans Game is super fun. Once you play, you play all night. You'll forget to eat, check in with moms, cook, you will even neglect sleep.**


We challenge you to get a better photo! Post to @weplaycans & #weplaycans

Saturday Milwaukee Sherman Park Tournament 2015

About us

Who are we?

We are friends and family who love to travel, eat natural foods, and enjoy the energy of life. We all grew up playing Cans with one another on sidewalks and in nearby playgrounds. We enjoyed team competition like basketball and football, but cans was our time to relax from the fast moving ultra competitive world and laugh with each other. Now because we’ve matured, we’ve decided it was time to take the Cans game we’ve always played to another level. Traditional cans simply wouldn’t work in a parking lot. After tweaking and testing, we have finally come up with our Cans game prototype that we want to share with you.

This is the first of many products ICAN7 is planning to develop, with your support and contributions,  that enhance our lives utilizing the exciting new science of outdoor play. 


How are the Gameplay Mats made?
We are proud to say that our Mats are custom made in a facility in Aurora, Ill. Although we don’t have the resources to manufacture the custom Cans Mats, we’ve worked with a manufacturer on our design and have supplies ready to ship.



WELL IF YOU WANT TO HELP, LISTEN TO THIS!
It is our dream to create the first "WE PLAY CANS"  tournament right here in sunny Florida and expand it throughout the world.  Beautiful foods, music and interaction that helps the planet grow. We know this will catch on quick. The more tournaments we create, the more we expose The Cans Game to the children, families, and communities throughout the world.

What are the funds for?
ALL pledge funds go directly into manufacturing costs, including supplies, and packaging, etc.

To keep us working on securing an environment to bring the tournament to life so we can fulfill our original vision.

Funds Breakdown:

20 Mats = $4500

Indoor/Outdoor Venue= $2000

Foods/Snacks = $1500

(Marketing)Flyers/Banners/Health Books/Cards = $1200

50 T-shirts = $400

Miscellaneous = $600


We know we can make quality Gameplay Mats, but we need your help getting the game up to scale. We are very thankful to be the first to recreate this classic game for humanity and even more thankful to have found a way of sharing it with you. Help us get the supplies necessary to meet The Cans Game demand. We would be forever grateful and owe every single one of you a favor. Any big donations and you'll get top priority when we choose our next tournament city and help us with the creative process. Thank you and we look forward to seeing you play The Cans Game in your neighborhood! Stay healthy!

REWARDS and Summary:

$1- Who's Amazing? You're Amazing!

$10-Heartfelt thank you email (priceless)

$20-A Heart felt thank you email, Health E-Book, Shoutout on Social Media

$30- 1 We Play Cans T-shirt, E-Book, Shout Out on Social Media


$50 - We Play Cans T-shirt, The Magical Element children's book.

$100 - Get all of the above plus your name in the credits of  The Cans Game Documentary.

$300 - Get all of the above plus We Play Cans mini mat for the youth.

$700 - All of the above plus one Cans Game set with ICAN7 Banner to hang inside your home, outside in the driveway or at an event.

$1000 - Get all of the above plus our team will hand deliver  to you 1 Cans Game Set at an event of your choice to share with your family or community. Offer is limited to events in one of the following cities: Jacksonville, Miami, Orlando, Tampa, Atlanta. Test your skills against us in a best of 3.

$2000 - All of the above.Our Team will deliver 2 "We Play Cans" sets to an event of your choice.  Offer is limited to events in one of the following cities: Jacksonville, Miami, Orlando, Tampa, Atlanta. Test your skills against us in a best of 3. We'll also give the tools necessary to help you organize a "We Play Cans" event in your city.

Choose between the following 6 options or customize using your own theme and logo.



Risks and Challenges
We’ve spent several months working with our suppliers and designers refining our process to mitigate as many risks as possible, however, we know there can still be hurdles along the way. We’ll always share updates with our community about the challenges such as:

Ship date: We’ve built in extra time for the production and are confident we’ll ship by the estimated dates or before, but there is always a chance that things will take longer than planned and we will keep you informed every step of the way.

Product: As we refine the CANS game, slight changes may be made. We will be diligent in making sure that everything is done to the highest quality standard.

Supplier coordination: We work with a small supplier to source the best materials for CANS sets and ensure the product is created correctly, which may affect us as a result.


If You Can't Contribute You Can Still Help!

If you love The Cans Game and what we're doing, please spread the word

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about The Cans Game.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your family and friends about The Cans Game.

story:
The Idea: Photo to Painting

The Canvas Talk is an online platform where you can upload your favorite photographs, choose the medium of art (Ex: Oil painting) and we will create a 100% handmade painting for you and send it across! It has been established by two art enthusiasts with a clear objective of creating high quality personalized artwork for individuals who want to treasure memories in the most beautiful and unique way. 

How did we come into being? Well, let's say our old fashioned views played a huge part! We realized that social media has made this world a very visual place, people take hundreds of photographs trying to capture special moments and upload them on platforms like Facebook, Instagram, store them online on G+ and iCloud or offline on laptops and iPads. Then, they are forgotten. Nobody bothers to browse through digital galleries containing thousands of photographs ranging back 10 years or more. Slowly, they fade away from our memory.

We want to capture your precious moments in a way that they are always in front of you, reminding you about the wonderful people in your life. Just like it was done before the technology boom! by way of a painting. Be it your child's first step, a beautiful family moment, your favorite pet or a loved one who is not with you anymore; a painting is an exquisite souvenir, don't you think?

About The Campaign:

This campaign is extremely important to us as it will help us get the word out and fund our growth requirements. We believe, this is a different idea to genuinely amaze your loved one by a single thoughtful gesture.

Journey Till Date:
  • We have completed the research, design and testing phase of the online platform www.thecanvastalk.com
  • We have identified and hired the best artists who can capture every small detail in a photograph. All the artist have a minimum of 7-10 year industry experience and are professionally qualified portrait artists.
  • Our logistics are in place and we are almost ready to go

What We Need & What You Get:

Till date, we have self funded the project, but now we need your help for the following:

  • To add more forms of art like watercolors, pencil sketch and mixed media
  • To rent a bigger studio space, where all our artists can work under one roof and we can have more control over the entire process 
  • To finance the online and offline marketing strategies. SEO, Google Adsense, Blogger Outreach, PR, Advertisements in newspapers, magazines and other Promotions
  • To hire more artists on a permanent basis rather than on a contractual basis

Perks:
This is the exciting part, we have some amazing perks for you and your loved ones. Have a look at the right side of this page for a detailed view. We plan to surprise you with high quality prints of world famous paintings. We are also giving you the opportunity to  pre-order your painting at a discount of 20-30% from the selling price. You can ask us to customize it, combine two or more photographs, change the background or add an element. Create a masterpeice of your own choosing!
Once your painting/sketch is completed, we will share the artwork online for you to review. You can request for changes if required and we will make sure you are satisfied. Only after your approval, we will ship it.
Have a look at the consolidated table below:

How Big Will My Painting Look On The Wall?

Framed Vs Rolled


What if we don't reach our goal?

  • If we cannot reach our goal of USD 7500, we will scale down our marketing budget proportionally and utilize the amount raised for renting and promotion. 
Examples of our artist's work:
Oil Paintings:

Acrylic Paintings:

Charcoal Sketch:


Timeline:

Risks:

There are always risks that can delay the process of getting your painting to you on time. We thought it might be good to share some of them so you have a clear picture.

Framed Paintings: Big framed paintings are always tricky to ship. Sometimes, the frame may be damaged due to long transit time. We only use TNT and UPS for our deliveries, pack the paintings extremely well so that they are insulated well. If you receive a damaged frame, please ship it back to us and we will replace it for you.

Shipping and customs: When we start shipping there's always a risk of the product getting stuck in customs. We have prepared as well as we can and hopefully there won't be any delays.

Drying Time: Oil paintings require a reasonable amount of drying time before it can be shipped. Depending on the weather (Rainy, Humid), it may require additional time. This may cause slight delays in the delivery date. 

We will keep you well informed throughout the entire project.

FAQs:

What if my photograph is damaged or not of the highest quality?

You can email us the photograph; one of our artists will review it and let you know if it is suitable.

How do I select the right photograph?

For paintings it is enough if the quality of the photo allows the artist to clearly see the details of your photo - but here are a few tips on what you should look for:

1. Try to send photos with the highest resolution. If your photo is less than 100 KB size, its resolution may be too low and our artists may have difficulties in making a good painting from a photo which doesn't clearly show details.

2. Pay attention to the background. You have a beautiful photo of your little boy for example, but the background is filled with details that will detract from the painted portrait. In such a case, you can tell our artists to use a one color background of any color you choose or simply let the artist decide. Just mention it in the comments box, right after you upload the image.

Can I make special requests for editing?

Yes, you can! Just let us know when you are sending your photos. We can combine figures from different photos into one painting, change the background, eliminate or add figures and objects and create color paintings from black and white photos.

Please provide as much details as possible (like: "The dress should be Pink and the eyes should be Blue").

Can you combine images from more than photograph into a painting?

Yes, we can! You can send several photographs via email and have subjects from each photo placed together into a single painting. Simply give us detailed instructions.

Can I preview my order before receiving it?

Yes. Once the painting from your photo is ready, we will contact you to review it. If you feel that any modifications should be made, we receive your feedback, make the requested modifications and send it back to you for confirmation. The painting will be shipped to you only after you approve it.

What's the status of my order?

We will keep you updated on this via email.

Is my private information protected?

Yes it is. All the information and photographs gathered through our secure server will be used solely to process your orders. We will never sell or share your private information with any 3rd party.

Are your artists classically trained?

Yes. All of our artist were traditionally trained at top art universities and are active artists.

My question isn't answered here, what should I do?

Please email us at info@thecanvastalk.com and we will get back to you shortly.

Where do I send my photo?

We will contact you shortly after the Indiegogo campaign ends and give you the instructions.

Can I choose a background for my painting?

Yes! We do it at no extra cost. We offer two options. If you would like us to pick a suitable background, we are happy to do so or alternatively you can send in another photo as background. Just let us know of any changes you wish to have done to your photo including the background. 

You show the size as 12x16 inches, I would like a 16x12 inch. What should I do?

When we write 12"x16" we refer both to 16"x12" and 12"x16". If you send us a horizontal image, the item you'll receive will be horizontal. If you send a vertical photo, it will be vertical. If you prefer your vertical photo to be horizontally or the other way round please inform us about it.

Do you charge extra for modifications?

No, we don't charge extra. All modifications are free of charge.

How will you ship my painting?

We primarily ship through TNT, however in some instances we ship via USPS or UPS. 

Do you ship internationally?

Yes, we do.

Can I have the artwork delivered as a gift to someone else?

You sure can! While sending your photograph, include the address you want the artwork to be shipped.

If you would like a gift note included in any of your orders, please email us with the short message you would like included and we will ship the artwork with the note.

Can I track my package once it is shipped?

You will receive an email when your package is shipped that will include all tracking information. If there is a problem with your shipment, please contact us at info@thecanvastalk.com or call us on 0044 772 151 5192.

I received my artwork and it is damaged. What do I do?

If your artwork is damaged during shipping, just give us a call and we will be happy to replace your damaged artwork. We do not require damaged items to be returned, however we ask that you provide photos of the damage so that our shipping department can handle the claim process with our carrier.

How should I take care of my artwork?

We would recommend the following suggestions to prolong the life of your artwork:

  • Avoid touching the canvas surface.
  • Do not hang your artwork in direct sunlight to avoid fading over prolonged exposure.
  • Do not hang your artwork in a hot or humid area, such as above an active fireplace or in a bathroom.
  • Feather dusting is recommended. Do not use water or cleaning agents on your artwork

Team Behind The Canvas Talk:

  • Siddharth Nahar, Co-founder: I'm a qualified Chartered Accountant (ACA), currently working with an Asset Management company in London. While working across different entities and countries including London, Singapore, India, Malaysia, Vietnam and South Africa, the entrepreneurial bug bit me. I've always had an interest in paintings and admired artists for their talent. Many don't receive the recognition they deserve and are grossly underpaid. I want to create a community for them and promote this idea at a commercial level. Hence, after spending almost 6 months researching, designing and testing, The Canvas Talk was created.

  • Pooja Jain, Co-founder: I'm a PR professional and a lifestyle blogger. Writing has always been my passion, so after moving to London in 2014 I started blogging and creating content for others. Simultaneously, Siddharth and myself conceptualized the idea of creating an online platform which can connect art lovers to art creators. We aim to create realistic portrait paintings of the highest quality by referencing your photographs.

Other Ways To Help:

If you think this is a special idea and deserves your support, here is what else you can do:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, G+ and all other platforms. If you love what you've seen, please tell every friend you have. Help us make this a successfully funded campaign. 

Thank you ever so much!!

Siddharth & Pooja

Note - If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to get in touch with us or visit the FAQ section of our website www.thecanvastalk.com
story_txt:
The Idea: Photo to Painting
 The Canvas Talk is an online platform where you can upload your favorite photographs, choose the medium of art (Ex: Oil painting) and we will create a 100% handmade painting for you and send it across! It has been established by two art enthusiasts with a clear objective of creating high quality personalized artwork for individuals who want to treasure memories in the most beautiful and unique way. 

How did we come into being? Well, let's say our old fashioned views played a huge part! We realized that social media has made this world a very visual place, people take hundreds of photographs trying to capture special moments and upload them on platforms like Facebook, Instagram, store them online on G+ and iCloud or offline on laptops and iPads. Then, they are forgotten. Nobody bothers to browse through digital galleries containing thousands of photographs ranging back 10 years or more. Slowly, they fade away from our memory.
We want to capture your precious moments in a way that they are always in front of you, reminding you about the wonderful people in your life. Just like it was done before the technology boom! by way of a painting. Be it your child's first step, a beautiful family moment, your favorite pet or a loved one who is not with you anymore; a painting is an exquisite souvenir, don't you think?
About The Campaign:
This campaign is extremely important to us as it will help us get the word out and fund our growth requirements. We believe, this is a different idea to genuinely amaze your loved one by a single thoughtful gesture.
Journey Till Date:

We have completed the research, design and testing phase of the online platform www.thecanvastalk.com

We have identified and hired the best artists who can capture every small detail in a photograph. All the artist have a minimum of 7-10 year industry experience and are professionally qualified portrait artists.
Our logistics are in place and we are almost ready to go
 What We Need & What You Get:
Till date, we have self funded the project, but now we need your help for the following:


To add more forms of art like watercolors, pencil sketch and mixed media
To rent a bigger studio space, where all our artists can work under one roof and we can have more control over the entire process 
To finance the online and offline marketing strategies. SEO, Google Adsense, Blogger Outreach, PR, Advertisements in newspapers, magazines and other Promotions
To hire more artists on a permanent basis rather than on a contractual basis



Perks:
This is the exciting part, we have some amazing perks for you and your loved ones. Have a look at the right side of this page for a detailed view. We plan to surprise you with high quality prints of world famous paintings. We are also giving you the opportunity to  pre-order your painting at a discount of 20-30% from the selling price. You can ask us to customize it, combine two or more photographs, change the background or add an element. Create a masterpeice of your own choosing!
Once your painting/sketch is completed, we will share the artwork online for you to review. You can request for changes if required and we will make sure you are satisfied. Only after your approval, we will ship it.

story:
My aim is to raise funds to reprint my book 'Species of Trees'. This book was the result of over 18 months of drawing trees and a collaboration with Arts Writer and Curator Ciara Healy and Poet Tamar Yoseloff who contributed an essay and poem respectively.

My drawings of particular trees are rendered in a manner reminiscent of screenprints, engravings and woodblock prints. The purpose of my book is to showcase my work and of the other contributors and highlight engaging connections between poetry, archaeology, graphic art and the environment.

My aim is to raise funds to reprint my artist book titled 'Species of Trees'.
The book is 24 printed pages and contains 7 illustrations of trees, a poem by Tamar Yoseloff, an essay by Ciara Healy on the symbolism of trees to ancient societies and my own thoughts on my drawing project.

The book is printed on Canaletto Liscio 160gsm archival paper, which is a beautifully subtly textured paper used in book publication.  The print is black and white and text in Courier New font reminiscent of typewriter text.

My book is both a showcase of my drawing project and that of the work of the other contributors but also a reflection on trees as an extremely diverse part of the environment. In the book I have aimed to bring together the responses to my drawings of a writer and a poet as well as highlighting the influences which have shaped the drawings. 'Species of Trees' will also be an important reference for my future workshops and collaborative projects.

story:
Short Summary

Ash Showler is a genetics lab technician and artist located in New York, NY. This is her first IndieGoGo fund launch in which she hopes to raise money for the New York Art Exhibit in the coming year (April 23-26 2020). 

Ashen Art is a collection of multimedia art pieces and science, especially focused on human anatomy. Each piece reflects emotion, creation, and destruction within everyday bodily processes, typically taken for granted. 

It would be impossible to repay the gratitude and happiness Ash will feel with your contribution! However, there are a few perks that may interest you instead. Your contribution is a personal statement for body positivity and spiritual positivity.. Some of our perks include, patches, handwritten postcards of gratitude, artwork, and tickets to the New York Art Exhibit. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding required for the NYC art exhibits is roughly $5000; however, Ash Showler is footing half of the bill herself (while paying off student debt -eeek!). Thus, the goal for this IndieGoGo campaign is $3000 which will pay for the entry and installation fees associated with the NYC exhibit. Rewards for your charitable contributions will be based on tier level, with each one combining into the next. Some of these include a colorful poster of one of the pieces in the art exhibit, a guest pass to the NYC art exhibit, hand-written cards full of eternal gratitude, stickers, an Ashen Art embroidered sew-on patch, or a published, hardcover book of all the artists, including yours truly, shown at either of the Art Exhibits! Since this campaign is based on a flexible funding goal, all funds, regardless if the goal is reached, will go to the installation, etc of the paintings at both art shows. Ash will cover the remaining portion of fees.

The Impact

The funds for this campaign are for the installation and space necessary for the New York City Art Exhibit. The purpose of this application is to encourage individuals to listen to their bodies and spirits through artwork. 

Ash was the director of IMAGinE: Festival Campaign (see link below), in which she promoted and helped fund the short film project. 

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/imagine-fest...

All proceeds resulting from this campaign will go directly to finishing the paintings accepted in the NYC Art Expo as well as the space necessary. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, it's completely understandable! We are all on tight budgets and support can just be a friendly email to us or a social media post supporting our goal! If you have any further questions, comments or concerns please contact Ashen Art via the email link below. Also, feel free to check out Ash's website for updates, blog posts, and videos on daily artwork and her cute cat, Peeps! 

ashenart15@gmail.com 

www.ashshowler.com

story:
Killadelphia: Operation XerofuX 

A Top Secret Black Ops Project that will Make Burns Great Again! 

We at Killadelphia love you for 'Hating' us, and now we want to give you a reason you'd be proud of.

After a year of total BULLSHIT, its time to jump start things. In an effort to “Make Burns Great Again,” we want to bring more giant metal art to life. Killadelphia is engaging in a Top Secret Black Ops Project that needs immediate budget appropriations: Operation XerofuX.

What is it?  Unfortunately, this project is Top Secret and on a need-to-know basis. What we can tell you is that it is old-school burner-inspired and it's gonna blow your tits off! It will be big, heavy, metal, and loud; it will gulp down gallons of propane, and breathe fire!  It'll be raw, petro-chemical guzzling, volatile organic chaos that is guaranteed to inspire anyone that experiences it, and YOUR funding will fuel that inspiration ! 

Killadelphia, the doppelgänger to the cookie-cutter burner camps, has been to over a dozen events, including two tours in the desert. You love the raw, low-tech, brutalist, and extra heavy-duty industrial art we bring, built to last the abuse of multiple tours - an interactive art collection that demands to be acknowledged. We are the Yang to your Yin. You bring the peace and love; we bring the 'hate!'

We are a Kamp of old-school burners made up of artists, builders, machinists, makers, mechanics, Rangers, renegades, and scientists. We are highly-educated and refined individuals. As a mostly "40-something" group, we are influenced and inspired by the older generation of burners that did drive-by shootings with live ammo at filled propane tanks from vehicles going 60+ miles per hour.

As long-term, active members of the community, we are extremely safety-oriented and we use engineering and years of expertise to safely bring you the most extreme playa art east of the Mississippi.

Dust off your checkbook and authorize some spending that will shape history.  Thats right; you heard correctly. We want you to have blind faith and give your money to something that you don’t even know what the fuck it is. And sure, we got a bunch of dumb stickers and tee shirts and crap as rewards, But if you donate $250 or more, you will be given Top Secret Clearance and receive a classified dossier showing all the details of the project including diagrams, blueprints, schematics, and regular technological and timeline progress reports.

Our Mission:

Create large-scale art that inspires participants to up their own artistic game,
push their own boundaries, create bigger/stronger/better. Nothing is impossible.
If you aren't inspired by Killadelphia, then you're already dead inside.

Our Sworn Duty:

Question Authority  --  Push Boundaries
Take "Burning" Back to its Roots  --  Love 'Til it Hurts!
