story:
(Latviski zemāk)

4 2 7

427 gallery (or Four To Seven) was found in April 2014 by artists Kaspars Groševs and Ieva Kraule to bring new ideas, great artists and new shift to the landscape of Latvian contemporary art. Since then over 30 exhibitions, events, readings and internet projects have been organized by many wonderful artists, including Tore Wallert, Mirak Jamal, F5, Vytenis Burokas, Carl Palm, GolfClayderman, Daria Melnikova and Agata Melnikova, the Ocean Academy of Arts, Evita Vasiļjeva, Vicente Mollestad, Raids Kalniņš, Gili Tal, Matthew Lutz-Kinoy, Henning Lundkvist, Marianne Vierø, Līva Rutmane, Marija Olšauskaitė, Monika Lipšic, Vivienne Griffin, Gaile Pranckunaite and many others.


Group show Joy and Mirror. Port City (January 2016)

Over the time 427 gallery has been a restaurant, a horoscope reading session, a strip bar cast in concrete, a ritual spot, an empty night club with the biggest disco ball in the Baltics, a graveyard, a dance floor from the Education Ministry of Lithuania, a fashion runway, a beauty salon, a dating game, a lip-sync contest, a traveling box and other things. And for a month the whole floor of the gallery was covered in latex.

We want to continue what we've started in 2018 and we have exciting plans! Unfortunately at the moment we can no longer pay the rent, pay the artists (something we have always tried to do even in the toughest of times), transport the works of art and, most importantly, organize exhibitions to provide an alternative to the Latvian art scene. And that is why we ask for Your help to continue to exist in our current physical form, bring people together and search for new adventures in contemporary art.


Carl Palm 15.12. - 26.01.

 

The Money

We are hoping to get 9000 euros to cover the following:

  • Pay for the rent and heating (6000 euros for a year)
  • Transport of works (1000 euros)
  • Artist fees (2000 euros)

(For some reason Indiegogo allows us only to raise money in dollars, therefore the total amount is 11 000 $ which is roughly 9000 euros)

 

The Future

427 gallery will continue to exist in 2018 no matter what, but we'd love to keep our space that we've grown to love - so many wonderful evenings have happened here, people from all around the world has come with an open mind and curious to talk about the things visible and things invisible. We believe it's important for every city to have spaces run by artists, free of institutional bounds and interested in alternatives to big museums and commercial spaces.

We will search for additional funding for our projects in 2018, but paying the rent is just crucial at this point. We have plans for 6 shows this year and with Your help we can make it happen!

And even if we don't raise enough money to last through the long winter, 427 gallery will continue to exist, perhaps in a cloud or a basement of some strip bar, or in the parks and woods, who knows. But 427 gallery will live on!

 

Big Thank You! to everyone who has come to 427 gallery, even if standing outside the closed doors and peaking inside, everyone who has followed us online, everyone who has shared our images, everyone who has written about us and to people who plan to do one of these things in the future!

 

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

 

4 2 7

22. decembrī, nedēļu pirms jaunā gada, 427 galerija saņēma skumju ziņu no VKKF par atbalsta nepiešķiršanu 2018. gadam, kas faktiski nozīmē to, ka esošās telpas Stabu ielā 70 drīzumā jāslēdz, jaatceļ visas šogad ieplānotās izstādes un jāatstāj robs pilsētas mākslas dzīvē.

427 galeriju 2014. gada aprīlī dibināja mākslinieki Ieva Kraule un Kaspars Groševs ar mērķi ienest jaunas idejas, izstādīt lieliskus māksliniekus un meklēt piedzīvojumus laikmetīgajā mākslā. Kopš tā laika uzrīkotas vairāk kā 30 izstādes, pasākumi, lasījumi un tiešsaistes projekti, kuros piedalījušies daudzi burvīgi mākslinieki, piemēram, Tore Wallert, Mirak Jamal, F5, Vytenis Burokas, Carl Palm, GolfClayderman, Daria Melnikova un Agata Melnikova, the Ocean Academy of Arts, Evita Vasiļjeva, Vicente Mollestad, Raids Kalniņš, Gili Tal, Matthew Lutz-Kinoy, Henning Lundkvist, Marianne Vierø, Līva Rutmane, Marija Olšauskaitė, Monika Lipšic, Vivienne Griffin, Gaile Pranckunaite un daudzi citi.

Laika gaitā 427 galerija ir bijusi restorāns, horoskopu lasīšanas sesija, striptīza bārs, izliets betonā, rituālu norises vieta, tukšs naktsklubs ar Baltijā lielāko disko bumbu, kapenes, deju grīda no Lietuvas Izglītības ministrijas, modes mēle, skaistumkopšanas salons, iepazīšanās spēle, popiela, ceļojoša kaste un daudz kas cits.

Arī 2018. gadā mēs gribam turpināt iesākot, un mums ir aizraujoši plāni! Diemžēl šobrīd mēs vairs nespējam samaksāt īri, samaksāt māksliniekiem (ko vienmēr esam centušies darīt pat drūmākajos brīžos), transportēt mākslas darbus un, vissvarīgāk, rīkot izstādes, lai nodrošinātu alternatīvu Latvijas mākslas ainā. Tieši tādēļ mēs lūdzam Jūsu palīdzību, lai mums izdotos eksistēt mūsu patreizējā fiziskajā formā, savākt cilvēkus vienkopus un ienest vairāk mākslas pilsētā!

 

€

Mēs ceram savākt 9000 euro, kas tiks izmantoti, lai:

  • samaksātu īri (6000 euro gadā)
  • transportētu mākslas darbus uz un no Rīgas (1000 euro)
  • samaksātu atlīdzības māksliniekiem (2000 euro)

(Kaut kādu iemeslu dēļ Indiegogo ļauj ziedot tikai dollārus, tāpēc kopējā summa ir 11 000 $, kas arī ir aptuveni 9000 euro)

 

Nākotne

Neskatoties uz iznākumu, 427 galerija turpinās eksistēt arī 2018. gadā, tomēr mēs esam iemīļojuši savas telpas Stabu ielā 70 - te notikuši tik daudz burvīgi vakari, cilvēki ieradušies ciemos no visas pasaules, lai runātu par to, kas redzams un neredzams. Mēs ticam, ka jebkuras pilsētas dzīvīgumu daļēji rada tieši mākslinieku vadītas iniciatīvas, kas piedāvā alternatīvu muzejiem un lielajām institūcijām, mēģinot uztaustīt jaunus nervus un iepazīstinot cilvēkus ar pārsteidzošiem atklājumiem.

Mēs turpināsim meklēt papildus atbalstiem galerijas projektiem 2018. gadā, tomēr šobrīd svarīgākais ir spēt samaksāt īri, lai vispār turpinātu kaut ko darīt, tāpēc ceram uz Jūsu palīdzību! Pie tam, ziedojot Jums ir iespēja iegūt savā īpašumā unikālus mākslas darbus no galerijas draugiem!

story:
What is Bubble Pop Gallery? 

We are a pop-up pop culture inspired gallery based in Bakersfield, CA. Bubble Pop provides a unique gallery opportunity for artists who might not otherwise fit shows at more traditional venues. Currently in our second year, our gallery features pieces from not only local artists, but from artists around the world!

As we head into the future we are asking the community to invest in the arts by helping us improve our Art Show experiences by making Bubble Pop Gallery even better!

What's in it for you? Art, of course! Our artists have generously donated items from stickers to framed originals to help us achieve our goal. With each goal we hit, our community will be treated to more and more art as Bubble Pop Gallery heads into an epic third year.  

What We Need & What You Get

After two full years of shows, working with our pop-up set up, it is time for an upgrade:

  • Lighting to brighten up our showcases.
  • Ambience & Decor to enhance the themed art experience.
  • Signage and Colored Lighting to let others know we are open and ready to party!

The Impact

This gallery was started by Ashleymarie Sey Lively of Sey Studios, and with the collective effort and response from artists near and far, Bubble Pop Gallery is a community. This campaign is to help our gallery glow and community grow.

  • We feature local creative talent and artists from all over the globe under one roof!
  • Over 20 gallery shows put on in less than 2 years!
  • Free for audiences to attend.
  • Artwork for sale, benefitting most to the artist!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share this campaign so more love can continue to pop up!

story:
Hello!

I'm MaryAnn, and I'm a visual artist and dreamer, and I believe everyone has a dream.

I believe our dreams and aspirations reveal to us who we really are, and are the signs of the journey we've been called to make in this life.

And it's when we take that first step that we begin the process of discovering what our lives are truly an expression of.

Six years ago, I ran a campaign here to fulfill my lifelong dream of becoming an artist, by organizing my first solo exhibition in just two months. With no formal training in art or events management, I created 30 new paintings, rented a venue, raised $2,000, and invited friends and family to attend. During the week of the exhibition, more than 200 people saw my work, 17 paintings were sold, and I even received a contract to illustrate 3 children's books!

From this experience, I learnt that dreams can become reality when we have the courage to take that leap of faith and make it happen! It's easier said than done, but with inspiration and a little push from someone who's on that path, I believe more people will begin on that journey too.

So now my dream is to bring my creative abilities (art, music and coaching) all around the world, and create experiences for people to connect to their dreams, to discover what truly matters to them, and take action to make it happen.

This takes the form of an on-going, long-term project to create 100 Dream Tree murals or installations with the participation of various communities around the world, where everyone gets an opportunity to believe in their dreams again, through the experience of co-creating in a collective work of art.

<3 <3 <3

“A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.” - Lao Tzu

In the same way, a journey of 100 Dream Trees begins with... well, the first few Dream Trees! :D

And having only done one Dream Tree mural at an artist residency in Spain last year (pictured above), and not much of a Dream-Tree-mural portfolio to show, my current strategy to kick-start this huge project is to apply for artist residencies.

So I’m excited to share that I’ve been accepted into THREE art residency programs this summer to create 3 Dream Tree installations in Latvia, Lithuania, and Bulgaria!

I'll spend a month in each location, interact with the community and get to know the area, and then facilitate workshops for members of the community to connect to their dreams, and paint them out.

These painted dreams will then be incorporated into a Dream Tree installation, as a symbol of their collective dreams and aspirations, with the message that by believing in our dreams once again, we can create a whole new world.

This clearly is no easy feat. Travel, art materials, and day to day expenses can add up to quite a bit. And there's jet lag, adjusting to different climates, food, lifestyle, etc.

And to embark on this long-term project of creating 100 Dream Trees around the world, and connecting hundreds, maybe thousands, of people to their dreams again, it's such a huge dream that I can't do it alone.

So join me and support me in this journey and co-create this with me.

Because this is really about all of us believing in our dreams again - like that song from the movie "The Greatest Showman":

A million dreams is all it's gonna take.

A million dreams for the world we're gonna make.

 

Bring My Dream Project to Life!

In order to bring my dream project to life, I will need to raise a total of $8,590 USD.

(For my friends in Singapore, it's around $11,612 SGD.)

 

Here's a breakdown of my expenses (in USD):

  • Flights, trains, buses: $2,300
  • Residency participation fees: $1,190
  • Art materials & equipment: $1,300
  • Food, water and necessary expenses for 3 months: $2,900
  • Global travel insurance: $900

 

 

What I need the funds for:

Apr 15 - May 20: Residency #1 - Rucka Residency (Cesis, Latvia)

  • What I'll create: "The Forgotten Dream Tree" (temporary installation in a gallery space)

May 21-Jun 20: Residency #2 - Kintai Arts Residency (Kintai, Lithuania)

  • What I'll create: "The Kintai Dream Tree" (permanent mural)

Jul 1-31: Residency #3 - Balkan Residency (Sofia, Bulgaria)

  • What I'll create: "The (to-be-named) Dream Tree" (permanent mural)

 

In return for your participation...

You'll receive some cool perks, mostly original art by myself... inspired by your dreams and your stories, and the dreams of your loved ones.

As an artist, creative coach, and vocal coach, I'm offering 3 types of unique perks that allow you to participate in the experience of connecting to your dreams!

 

A) Illustrated Whimsical Portraits (Various Sizes):

As an artist, I live my dreams, I paint images inspired by my dreams and my experiences...

So I want to create something inspired by your dreams, and made just for you.

There will only be one such artwork like this in the entire world and in the entire history and future of the world, because your dream is unique to you.

Let me paint your dreams, so you can connect to it every single day when you see it in your home!

 

1. Illustrated Postcard: You and Your Dream

For $45 USD, you'll get an illustrated postcard of a cartoon You, and your dream / doing something you love!

  • To be delivered in Sep or Oct 2019, but let me know if you need it done ASAP
  • Add $4 for shipping outside of Singapore

   

 

2. TWO-Person Cute Portrait (A5): You + 1 Other, & Your Dreams

For $100 USD, you’ll get an A5 illustration of you + 1 partner/family/friend/pet living both your dreams / or doing what you love!

  • I can draw you as people or as animals, you decide :)
  • Choose between a whimsical scene or a more classic portrait look
  • Perfect gift for couples who are getting married, celebrating anniversary, etc.
  • To be delivered in Sep or Oct 2019, but let me know if you need it done ASAP
  • Add $6 for shipping outside of Singapore

 

3. FIVE-Person Family Portrait (A4): Up to 5 Persons and Your Dreams

For $195 USD, you’ll get an A4 illustration of your family (up to 5 people/pets) all living your dreams / or doing what you love!

  • I can draw you as people or as animals, you decide :)
  • Choose between a whimsical scene or a more classic portrait look
  • Perfect gift for your family, or your cousin's family, or your friend's family... any family! :D
  • To be delivered in Sep or Oct 2019, but let me know if you need it done ASAP
  • Add $12 for shipping outside of Singapore

(this was a children's book illustration I did but you get the idea :D)

(this one was an A3-sized commission for 2 siblings, and includes 4 characters - girl, boy, rabbit, mouse. Also another idea of what's possible :D)

 

4. TEN-Person Family Portrait (A4): Up to 10 Persons and Your Dreams

For $305 USD, you’ll get an A4 illustration of your family (up to 10 people/pets) all living your dreams / or doing what you love!

  • I can draw you as people or as animals, you decide :)
  • Choose between a whimsical scene or a more classic portrait look
  • Perfect gift for your family, or your cousin's family, or your friend's family... any family! :D
  • Includes a visit to my home studio in Singapore
  • To be delivered in Sep or Oct 2019, but let me know if you need it done ASAP
  • Add $12 for shipping outside of Singapore

(this one is a more classic portrait, with some whimsical elements)

 

5. Your Family Tree... in Portraits! (A3)

For $475 USD, you’ll get an A3 illustration of your family tree, made of cute portraits of up to 25 family members over up to 4 generations!

  • I can draw you as people or as animals, you decide :)
  • Choose between a whimsical scene or a more classic portrait look
  • Perfect gift for your family, or your cousin's family, or your friend's family... any family! :D
  • Includes a visit to my home studio in Singapore
  • To be delivered in Sep or Oct 2019, but let me know if you need it done ASAP
  • Add $12 for shipping outside of Singapore

 

Alternatively, for each of these, you can also opt for a surprise illustration inspired by moments of my journey in Europe, which you get to choose when they are finished.

Illustrated postcard created in Phu Quoc Island, Vietnam, 2015:

A5 illustration created in Salzburg, Austria, August 2017:

A4 illustration created in La Garriga, Spain, June 2018:

And there's more...

Let's take it a step further and co-create in a unique experience for you and your loved ones!

 

B. The Family Dreaming + Art Workshop Experience

1. Your Family Dream Tree Painting

For $795 USD, I'll facilitate a unique and fun doodle workshop with you and your family about your dreams (in-person or over video chat), and then I'll create a large canvas painting of a whimsical Dream Tree or dream-scape inspired by your family and each of your dreams!

  • I can paint you as people or as animals, you decide :)
  • Note that it will take about a week to complete this painting
  • Includes a visit to my home studio in Singapore
  • Add $35 for shipping outside of Singapore

A Dream Tree painting on canvas:

A dream-scape painting commissioned in 2015 (that happen to have trees also haha):

 

2. Your Family Dream Tree Mural

For $1,650 USD, I'll facilitate a unique and fun workshop for your family in your home, where you'll paint a symbol of your dreams on the wall, and then watch me create a Dream Tree or dream-scape mural to tie it all together!

(If you don't want to paint your wall, this activity can also be done on a 2m x 2m stretched canvas.)

  • Note that it will take about 2-3 full days to complete the mural (around 2.5x2.5m)
  • Includes a visit to my home studio in Singapore

And we can get started as soon as you’ve claimed these perks! :D

Have questions? Feel free to chat with me at artist@maryannloo.com or Whatsapp +65 84270456

<3 <3 <3

C) Take Action on Your Dreams!

Support me with my dream, and I'll support you with yours!

I successfully organized my first solo exhibition in 2013 in just 2 months, largely because I worked with a life coach for the first 30 days.

The funny thing about our dreams is that they are somehow always the most difficult to make come true. We procrastinate, put it off, decide we’re not ready, we have no time… etc., when really, what’s underneath are our fears. Fear of being not good enough, fear of failure, fear of success (this is a funny one that I have lols), fear of being judged, and so on…

The biggest barriers that stop us are never our external circumstances, but the internal ones that we unconsciously allow to hold us back. This is where working with a coach can help bring these fears to light, so you can learn to manage them and get them out of your way!

Imagine a month from now, and you’ve managed to achieve your most important creative goal - how will your life change? What kind of opportunities may have opened up for you? And if you kept going at it, imagine a year from now… how much closer would you be to your dream?

But if we don’t take action, if we don’t step into our own power and conquer the fears that hold us back from our dreams, nothing in our life will change.

As a creative for almost all my life, a professional visual artist for the past 6 years, and a trained life coach since 2014, I want to support you in getting clarity on your creative dream, crafting a feasible plan, and taking action towards that goal.

Whether it’s to have your first art exhibition, your first concert of your music, to write your book, or as simple as finishing your first oil painting, writing your first song, learning an instrument, cooking… etc.

Let’s get you started on making one of these dreams come true!

 

1. ONE Private Coaching Session

For $115 USD, you’ll get one 60-minute session (in-person or video/voice chat), where you will:

  • Get clarity about your dreams and goals
  • Overcome obstacles to manifesting your goals
  • Create a plan so you can take action!

 

2. FIVE Private Coaching Sessions to complete a 30-Day Project

For $750 USD, you’ll get coached through a 30-day project to manifest your dream:

  • We’ll meet over 5 weekly 60-minute sessions (in-person or video/voice chat)
  • And you’ll get clarity about your goal and create a project plan
  • Then I’ll coach you through weekly obstacles and to find ways to tackle them
  • And support you to accomplish your goal by the end of one month

 

We can get started as soon as you’ve claimed these perks! :D

Have questions? Feel free to chat with me at artist@maryannloo.com or Whatsapp +65 84270456

<3 <3 <3

D) Singing Lessons / Voice Coaching

Before I became an artist in 2013, my dream for more than 10 years was to be a singer-songwriter. I’ve participated in many singing groups and performances in university and in various music ministries, trained with a renowned vocal instructor in Singapore, and even performed in musicals, including one with the Singapore Repertory Theatre in 2006.

In the past 6 months, I’ve invested more than 60 hours with a vocal coach into learning about the voice, vocal training, and how to be a vocal coach, and this, combined with 15 years of classical music training in piano, 10+ years of singing experience, and my training as a life coach since 2014, allows me to not only improve your singing and develop your vocal ability, but also help you express yourself more authentically and confidently.

Most commercial singing lessons teach generic techniques, or teach you “the right way” to sing a song. But really, your voice is unique from everyone else’s, and you are different from everyone else, so when you work with me, you’ll get specific coaching meant just for you, which allows you to instantly improve your vocals and your self-expression, and get the result you didn’t even know you were looking for.

 

1. ONE Private Singing Lesson / Vocal Coaching Session

For $60 USD, you’ll get 1 private singing lesson and instantly level up your vocal expression

 

2. FOUR Private Singing Lessons / Vocal Coaching Sessions

For $220 USD, you’ll get 4 60-minute singing lessons over 4-6 weeks

  • We’ll meet weekly, and when you consistently practice what I recommend for you, you’ll see (and hear!) an outstanding development in your voice and ability to express yourself in just a few weeks!
  • Alternatively, you can also choose to gather 3 other friends and have 1 3-hour group session (in-person only).

 

We can get started as soon as you’ve claimed these perks! :D

Have questions? Feel free to chat with me at artist@maryannloo.com or Whatsapp +65 84270456

 

All perks includes:

Weekly Email Updates

You’ll be added to a mailing list just for this campaign, and

Receive an email update each week about my journey in Europe, which includes:

  • on-going events and stories
  • behind-the-scenes photos and video clips
  • personal sharing and insights
  • work-in-progress photos
  • other things I haven't thought of yet :D

Exclusive stuff just for you Indiegogo dreamers, which will not be shared on my Instagram or Facebook profiles.

 

 

The Journey of Living Your Dreams

"Dreams are illustrations from the book your soul is writing about you." - Marsha Norman

So what’s your dream?

If there were no limits and nothing holding you back, what is it that you truly desire?

What do you really want to create with your life?

I believe everyone has a dream. I believe our dreams reveal to us who we really are, and they're the signs of the journey we've been called to make in this life. And it's when we take that first step that we begin the process of discovering what our lives are truly an expression of.

Whether it's to manifest that creative ambition or project, to start a family, to backpack around the world, to make a difference in an industry you're passionate about... our dreams may seem impossible and daunting at times, but to me, it's one of the most fulfilling and worthwhile journeys in this life.

When you join me in this journey, you’re encouraging me to keep rising to the challenge of my dreams. You’re letting me know that it’s okay for me to struggle and find my way, that you believe in my stepping into this bigger role - bigger art projects, unfamiliar places, bigger mission.

When you join me in this, you'll also make a difference to the communities I'll be working with, because they get a chance to connect to their dreams through my work. You'll be part of that installation that gets them to dream again, the mural that beautifies their neighborhood, the journey they will embark on to live their dreams.

But most importantly, you’ll make a difference for yourself.

By saying YES to your dream again, even if you’re not sure what it might be.

By allowing yourself to imagine again how you'd like to create your life, and have a one-of-a-kind original artwork to keep you connected to that.

By allowing yourself to express your voice freely and authentically, through singing or taking up a project to fulfill one of your dreams.

By joining me, you'd have given me a chance to focus on the impact I want to create, to create my very best work, and bring my best self to the people I will meet, which also includes you <3

Make my dream come true by making your dream come true.

Take me up on supporting you to fulfill your lifelong creative dream. Take me up on the opportunity to create something meaningful together with your loved ones. Take me up on connecting to your real voice again.

Come join me in this journey, because this is what I’m committed to making my life about, and when you make that journey toward your goals and aspirations, I’m right there with you!

A million dreams is all it's gonna take.

A million dreams for the world we're gonna make.

 

Other Ways You Can Join Me

If you’ve read this far and decided that this campaign isn’t for you (Thank you for reading all the way through!), you can still make a difference by sharing this with a friend, loved one, or colleague who could benefit from this.

Specifically, those who have had a dream for a long time and haven’t taken action on it, or they have had a difficult time on their journey.

Or they want to be able to express themselves more confidently and authentically.

Or they would love to have a beautiful personal work of art in their home that represents themselves, their loved ones and their dreams.

You can make a difference to them simply by sharing this campaign with them by sending them the link to this page, or sharing this on your Facebook.

I’m also looking for more communities to collaborate with for future Dream Tree murals - in your neighborhood, your workplace, or organizations you believe could benefit from such a project. So do send them my way, and let’s get closer to the goal of 100 Dream Trees!

Eleanor Roosevelt once said, "The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams."

I believe that future is ours.

 

Love,

MaryAnn

 

P.S. Follow me for the latest updates in my art journey <3

Instagram: @penguingirl_art

Facebook: www.facebook.com/maryannloo.art

Website: www.maryannloo.com

 

P.P.S. Here are my letters of participation from the 3 residencies:
story_txt:
Hello!I'm MaryAnn, and I'm a visual artist and dreamer, and I believe everyone has a dream.I believe our dreams and aspirations reveal to us who we really are, and are the signs of the journey we've been called to make in this life.And it's when we take that first step that we begin the process of discovering what our lives are truly an expression of.Six years ago, I ran a campaign here to fulfill my lifelong dream of becoming an artist, by organizing my first solo exhibition in just two months. With no formal training in art or events management, I created 30 new paintings, rented a venue, raised $2,000, and invited friends and family to attend. During the week of the exhibition, more than 200 people saw my work, 17 paintings were sold, and I even received a contract to illustrate 3 children's books!From this experience, I learnt that dreams can become reality when we have the courage to take that leap of faith and make it happen! It's easier said than done, but with inspiration and a little push from someone who's on that path, I believe more people will begin on that journey too.So now my dream is to bring my creative abilities (art, music and coaching) all around the world, and create experiences for people to connect to their dreams, to discover what truly matters to them, and take action to make it happen.This takes the form of an on-going, long-term project to create 100 Dream Tree murals or installations with the participation of various communities around the world, where everyone gets an opportunity to believe in their dreams again, through the experience of co-creating in a collective work of art.<3 <3 <3“A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.” - Lao TzuIn the same way, a journey of 100 Dream Trees begins with... well, the first few Dream Trees! :DAnd having only done one Dream Tree mural at an artist residency in Spain last year (pictured above), and not much of a Dream-Tree-mural portfolio to show, my current strategy to kick-start this huge project is to apply for artist residencies.So I’m excited to share that I’ve been accepted into THREE art residency programs this summer to create 3 Dream Tree installations in Latvia, Lithuania, and Bulgaria!I'll spend a month in each location, interact with the community and get to know the area, and then facilitate workshops for members of the community to connect to their dreams, and paint them out.These painted dreams will then be incorporated into a Dream Tree installation, as a symbol of their collective dreams and aspirations, with the message that by believing in our dreams once again, we can create a whole new world.This clearly is no easy feat. Travel, art materials, and day to day expenses can add up to quite a bit. And there's jet lag, adjusting to different climates, food, lifestyle, etc.And to embark on this long-term project of creating 100 Dream Trees around the world, and connecting hundreds, maybe thousands, of people to their dreams again, it's such a huge dream that I can't do it alone.So join me and support me in this journey and co-create this with me.Because this is really about all of us believing in our dreams again - like that song from the movie "The Greatest Showman":A million dreams is all it's gonna take. A million dreams for the world we're gonna make. Bring My Dream Project to Life!In order to bring my dream project to life, I will need to raise a total of $8,590 USD.(For my friends in Singapore, it's around $11,612 SGD.) Here's a breakdown of my expenses (in USD):
Flights, trains, buses: $2,300
Residency participation fees: $1,190
Art materials & equipment: $1,300
Food, water and necessary expenses for 3 months: $2,900
Global travel insurance: $900

story:
Bonjour, and welcome to the fundraiser to save hangars liquides VR, the world's largest and longest running cyberpunk city :

(The Guardian - 2014)

(Isabelle Cheren - Machinima - 2019)

 

By donating you will help hangars liquides, the avant-garde collective, to sustain their pioneering and ongoing efforts to create new forms of electronic arts, since 1998.

In this very case, the largest and longest running cyberpunk city in the world.

 

(Suspended Gardens and Temple at cell simulator - hangars liquides east)

 

Hangars Liquides started to create the city of the same name on the virtual world called Second Life in 2007, the entire visual content is crafted in 3D, by artist Djehan Kidd, all the textures are handpainted. The sound design has been entirely created for the city by Laurent Mialon, composer and founder of Hangars Liquides. We proudly represent the community of the Original Content Creators for we have built the sole original content cyberpunk city on the grid.

(Panoramic view of a part of hangars liquides' downtown)

(Inside the Space Cocoons conapts of hangars liquides)

(Wireframe image of vertex manipulation work for the creation of Original Content at hangars liquides)

Since 1998, our work has been internationaly acknowledged by curators, museums, institutions, PhDs, art critics, researchers, universities including the MIT, we gave a conference at the Apple headquarters in Paris in front of the core developers. Oprah Winfrey posed in front of the city on the cover art of the movie LIFE 2.0 (Directed by MIT Knight Jason Spingarn Koff) of which rights she acquired for her network, and lately William Gibson relayed the information that the city was closing soon https://nwn.blogs.com/nwn/2019/07/hangars-liqui..., we thank them all greatly.

 

(Inside one of the immersive cyberpunk appartments at hangars liquides - 2015)

 

- THE MEANING OF THE ART WORK -

Hangars Liquides is a work evolving around our dystopian reality.

Throughout the city you will find illustrations and reminders of our dystopian reality. Historical facts that led us to where we stand now. 911, Tien An Men, Slavery, WW2 memorials, and so on, everything that highlights how humans are able to hate one another, can be displayed in the city. I want to push people so they have no choice but remember these things, for we all live in a consumerist environment, both online and offline : Pier Paolo Pasolini said that "consumerism spreads faster than fascism, so much we didn't see it come", indeed, what are we able to see of this world when we are too self absorbed about ourselves only, what happened to Narcissus. I think that this is what consumerism does to us, like a sedative drug, if we are blinded so much we wont see anything come. This is why I am part of a non profit organization, as an artist, because I intend to use online platforms to spread a message to the people, through art, in this case, the message is to open our eyes on our present oppressive dystopia, and even if we feel unable to act or do anything to change the world, at least we can try to come up clean in the act of intellectual honesty that consists into looking at ourselves for what we are, the city is a mirror of this.

Djehan Kidd

Gallery

(view on central tower from hangars liquides north conapts - 2019)

(view on hangars liquides north from central simulator - 2019)

(hangars liquides south and cell-hangars liquides west simulators - 2019)

(China - Hangars Liquides East - Chungking Mansions inspired aerial architecture - 2019)

(hangars liquides boulevard - snowcrash incorporated - 2019)

(hangars liquides south - brutalism - 2019)

(aerial - communication tower inspired by Trbovlje in Slovenia - 2019)

(hangars liquides boulevard - snowcrash incorporated - central tower arrivals - 2019)

(hangars liquides south - 2019)

________________________________________________________________________________

The composer of the city's sound design of the city is currently exhibiting Sound art at the Royal College of Arts in London for the exhibition celebrating the 50th birthday of the pioneering Cybernetic Serendipity Exhibition.

Our Augmented Reality works have been selected by world reknown curator Massimiliano Gioni at the 55th Venice Biennale as official collateral event in 2013.

We are also preparing the Venice Biennale in 2021 to present our Virtual Reality art.

As part of our educationnal non profit effort, for 8 years Hangars Liquides on SL collaborated through the prestigious China Art Academy in Hangzhou with Chinese New Media artist Ligong Shen.

We wrote the Flashcore Manifesto, when Hangars Liquides brought Flashcore, a new genre of music to life, recognized worldwide by the audio-community and the public.

We have collaborated with countless artists, we have always offered free space at hangars liquides for content creators all of kind.

The city was used by legendary techno producers such as Cari Lekebusch, Robert Leiner or The Advent, to promote their work.

(Cari Lekebusch for Hybrid Production - Music by the Advent - 2012)

In the past , hangars liquides' founder who has entirely sound designed the city, has been commissioned by The International Olympic Commitee, The NBA, the State of Canada, Samsung, JVC, KIA, le Futuroscope, Singapore Airlines, Nestlé and much more

In 2016 we were offered to exhibit the virtual city of Hangars Liquides at the Fluxus Museum, Malpartida de Caceres, in Spain.Unfortunately due to the fact that the art work is centralized on Linden Lab's servers and not on independant servers, according to the curator's request, it was made impossible.

 

- THE COST OF THE SERVERS -

 

Hangars Liquides is a work of art that's deployed on the AGNI grid, this grid is hosted on servers owned by Linden Lab, the groundbreaking company that invented Second Life.It is currently impossible for the artists to get a private copy of the entire composition forming Hangars Liquides VR city to preserve it, due to the immense scale of the work and many other factors, the only way to save our artwork from destruction is to pay for the servers to keep running, our next due payment is on august 1st 2019.

If not paid, the art work will be destroyed.

One year of hosting on the servers for the entire city, which is 5 regions, will costs €6000.

 

Keep in mind that we are a French officialy recognized Cultural Non Profit Organization (501 C), and that depending on your country's legislation, it may be legally possible to deduct your donations from your taxes by informing your local tax office of your donation.

The legal status of our non profit organisation is to "Create, promote and diffuse any type of art".

 

Please donate and come immerse yourself in hangars liquides here https://maps.secondlife.com/secondlife/Hangars%20Liquides/126/131/2227

 

Thank you for supporting the avant-garde, electronic arts and culture.

 

Djehan Kidd - Mixed Reality Artist - builder of the city of Hangars Liquides

On behalf of hangars liquides - avant-garde collective 

 

Association Loi 1901 (France) - Identification R.N.A. : W642000508
story_txt: Bonjour, and welcome to the fundraiser to save hangars liquides VR, the world's largest and longest running cyberpunk city :(The Guardian - 2014)(Isabelle Cheren - Machinima - 2019) By donating you will help hangars liquides, the avant-garde collective, to sustain their pioneering and ongoing efforts to create new forms of electronic arts, since 1998.In this very case, the largest and longest running cyberpunk city in the world. (Suspended Gardens and Temple at cell simulator - hangars liquides east) Hangars Liquides started to create the city of the same name on the virtual world called Second Life in 2007, the entire visual content is crafted in 3D, by artist Djehan Kidd, all the textures are handpainted. The sound design has been entirely created for the city by Laurent Mialon, composer and founder of Hangars Liquides. We proudly represent the community of the Original Content Creators for we have built the sole original content cyberpunk city on the grid.(Panoramic view of a part of hangars liquides' downtown)(Inside the Space Cocoons conapts of hangars liquides)(Wireframe image of vertex manipulation work for the creation of Original Content at hangars liquides)Since 1998, our work has been internationaly acknowledged by curators, museums, institutions, PhDs, art critics, researchers, universities including the MIT, we gave a conference at the Apple headquarters in Paris in front of the core developers. Oprah Winfrey posed in front of the city on the cover art of the movie LIFE 2.0 (Directed by MIT Knight Jason Spingarn Koff) of which rights she acquired for her network, and lately William Gibson relayed the information that the city was closing soon https://nwn.blogs.com/nwn/2019/07/hangars-liqui..., we thank them all greatly. (Inside one of the immersive cyberpunk appartments at hangars liquides - 2015) - THE MEANING OF THE ART WORK -Hangars Liquides is a work evolving around our dystopian reality.Throughout the city you will find illustrations and reminders of our dystopian reality. Historical facts that led us to where we stand now. 911, Tien An Men, Slavery, WW2 memorials, and so on, everything that highlights how humans are able to hate one another, can be displayed in the city. I want to push people so they have no choice but remember these things, for we all live in a consumerist environment, both online and offline : Pier Paolo Pasolini said that "consumerism spreads faster than fascism, so much we didn't see it come", indeed, what are we able to see of this world when we are too self absorbed about ourselves only, what happened to Narcissus. I think that this is what consumerism does to us, like a sedative drug, if we are blinded so much we wont see anything come. This is why I am part of a non profit organization, as an artist, because I intend to use online platforms to spread a message to the people, through art, in this case, the message is to open our eyes on our present oppressive dystopia, and even if we feel unable to act or do anything to change the world, at least we can try to come up clean in the act of intellectual honesty that consists into looking at ourselves for what we are, the city is a mirror of this.Djehan KiddGallery(view on central tower from hangars liquides north conapts - 2019)(view on hangars liquides north from central simulator - 2019)(hangars liquides south and cell-hangars liquides west simulators - 2019)(China - Hangars Liquides East - Chungking Mansions inspired aerial architecture - 2019)(hangars liquides boulevard - snowcrash incorporated - 2019)(hangars liquides south - brutalism - 2019)(aerial - communication tower inspired by Trbovlje in Slovenia - 2019)(hangars liquides boulevard - snowcrash incorporated - central tower arrivals - 2019)(hangars liquides south - 2019)________________________________________________________________________________The composer of the city's sound design of the city is currently exhibiting Sound art at the Royal College of Arts in London for the exhibition celebrating the 50th birthday of the pioneering Cybernetic Serendipity Exhibition.Our Augmented Reality works have been selected by world reknown curator Massimiliano Gioni at the 55th Venice Biennale as official collateral event in 2013.We are also preparing the Venice Biennale in 2021 to present our Virtual Reality art.As part of our educationnal non profit effort, for 8 years Hangars Liquides on SL collaborated through the prestigious China Art Academy in Hangzhou with Chinese New Media artist Ligong Shen.We wrote the Flashcore Manifesto, when Hangars Liquides brought Flashcore, a new genre of music to life, recognized worldwide by the audio-community and the public.We have collaborated with countless artists, we have always offered free space at hangars liquides for content creators all of kind.The city was used by legendary techno producers such as Cari Lekebusch, Robert Leiner or The Advent, to promote their work.(Cari Lekebusch for Hybrid Production - Music by the Advent - 2012)In the past , hangars liquides' founder who has entirely sound designed the city, has been commissioned by The International Olympic Commitee, The NBA, the State of Canada, Samsung, JVC, KIA, le Futuroscope, Singapore Airlines, Nestlé and much moreIn 2016 we were offered to exhibit the virtual city of Hangars Liquides at the Fluxus Museum, Malpartida de Caceres, in Spain.Unfortunately due to the fact that the art work is centralized on Linden Lab's servers and not on independant servers, according to the curator's request, it was made impossible. - THE COST OF THE SERVERS - Hangars Liquides is a work of art that's deployed on the AGNI grid, this grid is hosted on servers owned by Linden Lab, the groundbreaking company that invented Second Life.It is currently impossible for the artists to get a private copy of the entire composition forming Hangars Liquides VR city to preserve it, due to the immense scale of the work and many other factors, the only way to save our artwork from destruction is to pay for the servers to keep running, our next due payment is on august 1st 2019.If not paid, the art work will be destroyed.One year of hosting on the servers for the entire city, which is 5 regions, will costs €6000. Keep in mind that we are a French officialy recognized Cultural Non Profit Organization (501 C), and that depending on your country's legislation, it may be legally possible to deduct your donations from your taxes by informing your local tax office of your donation.The legal status of our non profit organisation is to "Create, promote and diffuse any type of art". Please donate and come immerse yourself in hangars liquides here https://maps.secondlife.com/secondlife/Hangars%20Liquides/126/131/2227 Thank you for supporting the avant-garde, electronic arts and culture. Djehan Kidd - Mixed Reality Artist - builder of the city of Hangars LiquidesOn behalf of hangars liquides - avant-garde collective  Association Loi 1901 (France) - Identification R.N.A. : W642000508

story:
THIS.  IS.  IT.

       The rare opportunity that takes a brand to the next level. The opportune moment that opens the gates for a brand to drive through and take its place among exceptional peers. However, to drive through this gate requires $20K immediately! A contract must be signed within 3 weeks!

       An unexpected phone call came in one morning, a yet-to-be-announced luxury automotive brand inviting me to co-brand my art jewelry with them . . . to align my art, my name, my brand with theirs. They have selected my art jewelry to be featured in their corporate publication for collectors and at a major event this summer. Though until a contract is signed, I cannot legally reveal who it is. 

The Gatekeeper has opened the gates . . .
I am asking you to drive through the gates with me.

       I am asking you to support my brand's focused vision of innovative design and creativity. A brand whose drive is to leave the trends behind creating extraordinary art jewelry to be seen in, and modern exceptional paintings to live with. Jewelry that transforms and supports a woman on her quest for strength of self and individual beauty. Paintings that inspire compassion, thoughtfulness, and a sense of belonging in the Mysteries of life.

       I am asking you to be more than a Patron of the Arts. I'm asking you to share the experience of this thrill ride with me!

       In sharing the experience with me, you will be receiving artwork, one-on-one events, or in-person consultation for custom designed and created pieces at various levels of your participation . . . and an immense amount of gratitude!

 

Introducing Valerie Ostenak,
the Artist as Metalsmith 

"I am drawn to movement and flow . . . vines and tendrils reaching out changing the ordinary into the beautiful; water carving glorious curves in canyons, wind changing the shape of clouds. Each a record of transformation, telling a story of adventure. I like playing with the movement that can be created with metal. In that movement, I, too, am creating an adventure and a story for each piece to tell."

       Valerie Ostenak studied painting, jewelry and metalsmithing at Northern Arizona University in Flagstaff AZ, and continued at California State University Long Beach, CA. She has worked with private clients, interior designers, and architects designing and creating paintings, art jewelry, and sculpture, including a decorative railing at the Grand Canyon.

• Accolades, Select Exhibitions, & Publications •

       Internationally awarded, Ostenak is the recipient of the:
•  2017 Saul Bell Jewelry Design Award in Alternative Materials
•  2011 Centurion Emerging Designer Award: one of six from an international field.
•  2009 Halstead Jewelry Design and Business Development Grant

       National Geographic interviewed her for their online Education series (http://goo.gl/qaZIbE).

       Valerie has presented her sculptural jewelry on the fashion runways of Phoenix Fashion Week in 2009 & 2012 in Phoenix AZ, and LA Style Week in 2012 in Los Angeles CA.

      Ostenak was invited to present her art jewelry at globalDESIGN at Baltimore during the ACC (American Crafts Council) show event in 2017. The Maria Elena Kravetz Gallery presented Ostenak's sculptural jewelry at the esteemed SOFA Chicago (Sculptural Objects & Functional Art) in 2013 & 2016; and she has been invited for four consecutive years, 2015-2018, to be an exhibitor at the internationally acclaimed Artistar Jewels Art Jewelry Exhibition, in Milan, Italy.

       Valerie’s work has been published in numerous books, magazines, and blogs. Selected titles include: Secret Life of Jewelry; Art Jewelry Magazine, Artistar Jewels Exhibition Catalog 2015-2017, Wearable Expressions 7th International Wearable Art Exhibition Catalog 2017, Art Jewelry Today, Art Jewelry Today 2, Trend and Colours CIJ International, Watch & Jewelry Review, Showcase 500 Art Necklaces, ArtBusinessNews.com, British Vogue, British Harper’s Bazaar, Tatler, and Contemporary Art of the Southwest.

       She has conducted her own workshops on forging silver, as well as being an invited lecturer at the Art Institute of Phoenix, and demonstrator/lecturer at the Northern Arizona University and the Arizona State University metals departments.

 

Driving Through the Gate 

       In order for me to drive through this gate, I need $20,000 . . . a standard number for business development costs at this level of engagement. Participation in the high end luxury jewelry trade shows can run anywhere from $10,000 to over $20,000 to get you in front of the gatekeepers. That's the show only, no flights, hotel, materials' cost for jewelry to show/sell, and the displays and marketing materials for it all. All told, it could easily run over to $40,000.   

       Beyond the participation fee, funds raised will go toward materials: 23K gold leaf, steel, sterling silver, pearls, precious stones, and time making the exclusive art pieces for the in-person exhibition; flight, hotel, expenses for the four days in attendance; and for the design and creation of the artworks you will be receiving for your investment with me. 

       For your participation of financial support, I have an array of creative offerings from which you can choose. For a truly custom experience, a personal visit from me to your home or office for consultation on three custom paintings at 3'x3' (or paintings measuring the equivalent in square inches). I will fly in, book a hotel, meet with you for the next day or two for consultation to design and create the perfect pieces for your space. Upon their completion, I will ship them and return to your home or office to install them! This would be soooo fun!

       The opportunity to co-brand has a very short time deadline on it . . . they need a commitment before the end of May so they can set me up with an interview and interior designer for the event space. The exhibition event includes a select set of luxury-level creative, technically innovative, and unique purveyors with whom they are working. I have planned my schedule, started working on the sculptural jewelry designs for the exclusive display case, and I have beautiful photography of pieces for the pages in the publication.

       The only thing missing is the financial support to sign the contract. If the financial support to sign the contract isn't forthcoming in the next few weeks, I won't be able to drive through the gate.

       If I can't drive through this gate, there are other gates on the road for me to drive towards. I have those planned as well. Contingency planning means a flexible and mobile forward path to success! The money raised in this campaign would then be used to get me through those other gates.

This one is the créme-de-la-créme!  I want to race through this one!

 

The Value of Art

       The value of my project is most simply about the value of Art in ones' life. Art enhances, enriches, and visually stimulates our senses. It awakens us to emotional response with the curve of a smile or the rush of our breath. It makes statements on the value we place in ourselves and the spaces in which we live. Art is the luxurious tangible object in our lives that feeds our hearts and souls, reminding us that we are in the presence of grace. 

       I have had women who wear my one of a kind neckpieces state that they feel a transformation happen, that they become More. Each one has a different definition of what More is to her, but in each case, they are extremely happy, content, and vibrant. It makes me smile to hear their joy!

       I have had people viewing my paintings who tell me my work brings them to a heightened sense of awareness, of connection. They feel a calm come over them, a feeling of knowing that all is possible. Some of my paintings are vast in their cosmic feeling, some are intimate in their atmospheric coloring, but all are accessible to that part of us that longs for reassuring quiet and love. I've been told my paintings are healing agents. And that makes me smile too.

      To make a positive difference in the world, to create joy and healing in each person who wears and views it . . . this is what I want for my art.

It is the gift I was given to work with. 

 

Track Record as Project Manager 

       It takes more than creative ability to successfully manage a project, and more so with one on the magnitude of this opportunity. I am responsible for more than my brand, I also have a responsibility to my co-branding entity and to you, my co-drivers. The following are personal attributes at the core of my being. They have led me to the successes I've experienced with every show, exhibition, commission, and event on which I've worked. 

• Highly organized with a penchant for order.
• Plan and develop realistic schedule to reach the desired goal.
• Problem-solver: flexible and strategic
• Dedicated to the deadline

       When the contract is signed, I will develop a weekly schedule according to their milestone deadlines for the collectors' publication and for the exclusive event. Everything I do will be based on their needs. Contributing to maintaining a smoothly running process is paramount. 

 

Risks & Challenges

       There are risks & challenges with everything. The biggest risk to this particular co-branding opportunity is not raising enough money to sign the contract. Should that risk happen, Plan B will commence, I will use the funds raised to prepare for another high level exhibition opportunity. Major trade industry events for Fall and Winter are opening their applications for exhibitor selection. These will require similar amounts of financing. Though this particular opportunity is unparalleled for the exclusivity of its luxury product and clientele, a few of the other events are high quality and also command a selective participation that would work very well for my brand. 

One last plea . . .

       I ask for your help in getting the word out, to share my  story so that others can drive through the gate with me!

Let's create a whole concours driven to excellence in Art!

      For your ease, use the Indiegogo share tools. 

Thank you for your support!

story:
What It Is

The piece is primarily intended as a Burning Man Mutant Vehicle, a stationary sculpture, an observation platform and a performance space with integral lighting and sound equipment. It will find similar uses over the course of the year as well as being a parade float and party venue.

Motivation

Bison and pickup trucks. We live with both here in Jackson Hole. We have our own herd of about 400 animals that live within a few miles, many more up in Yellowstone.  150 years ago the whole middle of the country used to be grassland from horizon to horizon, home to millions of these magnificent wild creatures. It's not anymore. Almost an entire species was eradicated from this nation, along with the native populations that depended on this resource for just about everything in their lives. A symbiosis disrupted, a human rights travesty initiated.  By our own government, and the business interests that ran it.

This piece is directed at those who don't think about these things in their daily lives, though the analogies with our nation today are striking. We saw just a tiny bit of respect for Native Americans during the recent Dakota Access  Pipeline debate, and I'd like to nudge our nation's consciousness in that direction as well in some small way.

The message, I hope, is clear...you're invited to think. Think about the Bison, think about the pickup truck masquerading as a farm-crustacean, think about absence. Perhaps thinking about these things will open the door to other thoughts. Perhaps thoughts about Why. Or thoughts about the situation with Bison today. The goal of this piece is to get that process started. 

And maybe have some fun.

Who We Are

Basically, we're me. My name is Paul Duncker. I'm an architect, a cabinetmaker, a steel fabricator, and I restore old cars with carburetors. Pretty much everything this project needs under one hat. We expect to be plural in the near future, but we've got to start somewhere. We've already got the base vehicle, the design, and I've gone and bought myself a brand new  welder. We're ready to roll...as soon as we've got the cash.

What We Want

In a word, your money.

We've set a goal of $40,000. for this endeavor, which includes everything from overdue truck repairs to all the materials and equipment needed - steel, wood, fabric,  generator, lighting, sound equipment, specialty subcontractors etc. We've even included funds to actually PAY the people involved in the fabrication efforts. We've got a short window to get all this done, and relying on volunteers just isn't going to cut it.

If you're motivated to contribute to this project,  you will be helping to raise awareness about the issues described above, and create a unique piece of rolling art along the way. You can read  more about the project on it's own website: https://www.skull-on-wheels.com
 
The project scope is somewhat flexible, and if we don't raise enough money to construct the full scope of work we've got planned, we can build a downsized version for this year and revisit the project again next year. If we wind up with MORE than we're aiming for, we'll be able to add enhancements like photovoltaic power generation instead of using a gasoline generator. Again, check out the website for more information on this possibility.

    What if I'm Broke?

    If your pockets are empty and you still want to contribute, you can help spread the word about this project through social media, give us your rusty farm equipment, or get in touch! You might just have a skill set we didn't even know we needed!

We have our own herd of about 400 animals that live within a few miles, many more up in Yellowstone.  150 years ago the whole middle of the country used to be grassland from horizon to horizon, home to millions of these magnificent wild creatures. It's not anymore. Almost an entire species was eradicated from this nation, along with the native populations that depended on this resource for just about everything in their lives. A symbiosis disrupted, a human rights travesty initiated.  By our own government, and the business interests that ran it.
This piece is directed at those who don't think about these things in their daily lives, though the analogies with our nation today are striking. We saw just a tiny bit of respect for Native Americans during the recent Dakota Access  Pipeline debate, and I'd like to nudge our nation's consciousness in that direction as well in some small way.
The message, I hope, is clear...you're invited to think. Think about the Bison, think about the pickup truck masquerading as a farm-crustacean, think about absence. Perhaps thinking about these things will open the door to other thoughts. Perhaps thoughts about Why. Or thoughts about the situation with Bison today. The goal of this piece is to get that process started. 
And maybe have some fun.

Who We Are
Basically, we're me. My name is Paul Duncker. I'm an architect, a cabinetmaker, a steel fabricator, and I restore old cars with carburetors. Pretty much everything this project needs under one hat. We expect to be plural in the near future, but we've got to start somewhere. We've already got the base vehicle, the design, and I've gone and bought myself a brand new  welder. We're ready to roll...as soon as we've got the cash.

What We Want
In a word, your money.
We've set a goal of $40,000. for this endeavor, which includes everything from overdue truck repairs to all the materials and equipment needed - steel, wood, fabric,  generator, lighting, sound equipment, specialty subcontractors etc. We've even included funds to actually PAY the people involved in the fabrication efforts. We've got a short window to get all this done, and relying on volunteers just isn't going to cut it.
If you're motivated to contribute to this project,  you will be helping to raise awareness about the issues described above, and create a unique piece of rolling art along the way. You can read  more about the project on it's own website: https://www.skull-on-wheels.com

 
The project scope is somewhat flexible, and if we don't raise enough money to construct the full scope of work we've got planned, we can build a downsized version for this year and revisit the project again next year. If we wind up with MORE than we're aiming for, we'll be able to add enhancements like photovoltaic power generation instead of using a gasoline generator. Again, check out the website for more information on this possibility.


What if I'm Broke?
If your pockets are empty and you still want to contribute, you can help spread the word about this project through social media, give us your rusty farm equipment, or get in touch! You might just have a skill set we didn't even know we needed!

story:
Monument for the "Martyrs of Thiaroye" in Bamako (Mali)

 

SHORT SUMMARY

 

Artists:

Nathalie Mba Bikoro, Mansour Ciss Kanakassy, Pierre Marie Ciss, Jean Marie Claude Bruce, Djime Diakite, Claude Gomis, Tita Mbaye, Cool Diabang Mory, Hassan Sar

 

 

The exhibition "Guis Sou Me Le Mbao" in Thiaroye (Senegal) - a project by Claude Gomis and Saskia Köbschall - is one of apexart's four selected Franchise Exhibitions for 2016-17.  It will invite contemporary African artists to commemorate the massacre of Tirailleurs Sénégalais, African soldiers conscripted for the French army, in the Thiaroye military camp in 1944.

The exhibition and the accompanying educational program for youth aim to shed light on a silenced chapter of colonial history: the story of the Tirailleurs Sénégalais, who fought and died for the French army in countless colonial wars and both World Wars from 1857 - 1964.
 

Their story has long been close to our hearts and we finally got the chance to work on it by winning the apexart program, which will help us cover the costs for the exhibition itself (rent, production costs, art work transports etc.).

 

With the support of this Indiegogo campaign we will be able to:

  • cover the travel costs of the artists based outside of Senegal, so they can engage with the Thiaroye community and create site specific installations
  • create an accompanying program of lectures, music and performances
  • organize workshops with youth and children from surrounding school
_____________________________________________________________________________

 

THE EXHIBITION

The title of the exhibition draws on the Wolof phrase I do not see you at Mbao that was coined in the aftermath of the massacre as the soldiers' families rushed to the village of Mbao where the survivors had found refuge, hoping to see their loved ones. Guis sou me le mbao entered the Wolof language as an expression that is used to warn someone that he or she is in great danger. It is one of the traces that reveal the deep trauma caused by the massacre, whose brutality sent shock waves throughout French West Africa and was a wake up call to many, that despite the sacrifices West Africans had made for France in both World Wars and countless military interventions on three continents, they had come home to the same colonial brutality, racial injustice and discrimination.

 

The title of the exhibition literally issues a warning of the danger of non-remembrance of the colonial past and the invisibility but severeness of it's repercussions in our present through the persistence of colonial epistemologies, social and economic structures. The project will invite the artists to engage with the community of Thiaroye in order to create site specific works that will reflect on modes of resistance and means of challenging (post)colonial politics of memory.

 

The exhibition “GUIS SOU ME LE MBAO” is part of the apexart franshise exhibition program. Founded in 1994, apexart is a non-profit arts  organization in NYC that offers opportunities to independent curators and emerging and established artists, and challenges ideas about art, its practice, and its curation.

The franchise program encourages curators to explore unusual exhibition places. “Guis Sou Me Le Mbao” will take place in Thiaroye (Senegal), a suburb of the capital Dakar, and aims to engage the community of Thiroye in an arts event that speaks directly to the history of the place and engages the community in the circuit of internationally renown artists.

 

                      Tirailleurs Sénégalais at the Thiaroye military camp

_____________________________________________________________________________

EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM

 

The exhibition will be accompanied by an educational program designed for children and youth in the Thiaroye and greater Dakar area. In coorperation with local schools,
children and youth will be invited to the exhibition space in order to participate in exhibition tours and arts and historical workshops. The project “Guis Sou Me Le Mbao”places a great emphasis on giving something back to the comunity of Thiaroye and teaching the younger generation about this much silenced  chapter of colonial history that has an impact on their lives today.
